1112111122212111122212212122211221222222.content:
With the swallowing of the rod the redheaded farm girl had ensured that no one would ever be able to recapture it and its power would be sealed away forever. But the rod’s power wasn’t sealed away instead its divinity fueled Malon’s planetary form.

Hunger was an afterthought, as was drinking of any liquids; breathing came easy even if all she saw was more of her spread out far into the distance. Due to her tremendous size and the rod’s power Malon truly was a living planet now…

Time passed with Link at long last finding his way out of the ranch girl’s immense blubber while she was so glad to see him again a part of her wondered if Link would in fact try to take back the rod? The young hero did no such thing instead stating how while it seems everyone was readjusting to leaving on the new fat-filled planet. People, countries, nations, were all starting anew due to the fact that they could in fact live just as they had prior to the redhead covering the world with herself.

It was rather strange to think about but Malon found comfort in the fact that at least no one was hurt and while the landscape had changed greatly, she couldn’t actually feel the numerous lives that now lived on her flesh, life was beginning to return to normal…well about as normal as living on a living breathing planet.

In the end life was good. Planet Malon was perfectly healthy despite her grand size, her speech and eyesight still as good as it ever was even with all the fat around her head. Link would come by from time to time (having to warp around obviously) at times even bring his childhood BFF Saria with him, the younger-in appearance only-girl putting on a bit more pudge each time she came along. Malon smiled when Saria would state that she liked the idea of her body at long last having some well-deserved curves. She was on her way the redhead thought amusingly.

As for Zelda and Nabooru, with the Great Fairy’s input Ruto was able to restore the desert woman back to standard size something Nabooru was very grateful for. The Skull Kid assisting Zelda was eventually found and defeated by Link with Saria’s assistance, The Song of Fattening lost forever with his death.

Zelda however for her greed and arrogance was sealed away much like the Great Fairies and Ganondorf had been in the past. Speaking of the former Gerudo King it was ironic that Zelda swore she’d break free at some point in the future, find the rod, and claim the destiny that was hers!

It sadden Link to see how hard the mighty had fallen guess the saying that absolute power corrupts completely was true…he just wished that Zelda hadn’t befallen that same path just as Ganondorf had a good deal ago…

In any case the former Princess was gone and Link after some time doing a bit of soul-searching and completing your average heroic-type dealings was able to move onward with his life thanks to the help from those close to him, most of all Malon.

Planet Malon was his home now but more important then that she was also a wonderful friend, even at the size of a planet a beautiful woman, and maybe if he continued to play his cards right a possible lover…of course he prayed that any potential love-making would involve him being “on top” because Goddesses help him if Malon “took priority”!

He chuckled at that rather dangerous thought Malon asking what was so amusing he didn’t answer directly instead planted a quick pick on her plumped cheeks, nearly causing the entire world to shake with happiness.
1112111122212111122212212122211221222222.title: Epilogue

1112111122212111122212212122211221222222.content:
As Malon started to grow, Link was swallowed by her fat. He wouldn't be the only one swallowed by Malon's fat. As Malon grew within Nabooru's fat, she lost the grip she had on the Rod of Fattening. The Rod was quickly swallowed by Malon's fat. Malon shrugged. She wasn't going to need the Rod anymore, so why worry about it? Within 5 minutes, Malon emerged from Nabooru's fat, ending up near Nabooru's vast belly button. Malon continued to grow and grow until she reached the size of the other two ladies....and stopped growing. Now there were three countries of fat: Zelda, Nabooru and Malon.


"Uh-oh" said Malon. "why did I stop growing? hmmm...maybe the Rod of Fattening has a limit"

Malon could feel her vast self against both Zelda and Nabooru, but couldn't see either of them. All that she could see was her own fat going to the horizon. Malon sighed, sending several ripples of fat through her country-sized self. Zelda, Nabooru and herself now covered three countries...since Malon didn't knew the lands that surrounded Hyrule. Just how many countries of fat does it take to cover the world. Malon chuckled at the idea.

[Fat Ones, hear us]

The voices came from nowhere. The voices were female.

[We are the Golden Goddesses that created the world] said the three goddesses. [due to your greed, jealously, and reckless thinking...you now cover three countries with your girth. We shall not punish you for doing this...however, since all three of you have attained the size of a country, we bestow all three of you a mighty gift]

Zelda, Nabooru and Malon looked at thier massive bellies to discover there were three triangles on them; the symbol of the Triforce!

[Behold] said the three goddesses. [The Triforce of Fat. With its power, you can shrink down to your normal sizes...or continue to expand until you've become a Goddess of Fat. We leave the decision to you]


"Oh yeah" said Malon. "that'll be an easy choice....."
1112111122212111122212212122211221222222.title: The Triforce of Fat

choices: Zelda makes her move to capture the Triforce pieces

1112111122212111122212212122211221222222.content:
Malon had already come to a decision, Nabooru assumed that the new country of fat was Malon and like the ranch girl easily came to a decision as to what to do with the Triforce of Fat.

Zelda on the other hand...was not ready to relinquish her titanic weight and was but a moment away from casting her wish when the Skull Kid, who rested near her face, surprisingly stopped her.

"Stop milady." Zelda shot a bit of a heavy glare silently questioning his intentions.

"Did you not hear the Goddesses, with this newly created Triforce you have the potential to become a Goddess of Fat"

"That's exactly what I intended to accomplish, why did you stop me just to state the obvious?" she asked him.

"Because Lady Zelda the other two won't allow you to do so. I can feel their emotions they wish to return to their normal weight, it's two against one milady and your desire will be canceled due to their favor."

"Go on..." intrigue Zelda urged him onward.

"So why not do this, play along with them for now. Return to your original weight, which was already quite grand, and when they least expect it...take the Triforce pieces from them! Your Sage abilities should make that an relatively easy task, and once you have all three make your grand desire a reality, by becoming a true Goddess of Fat."

Zelda smiled rather confidentially at the forest creature's brilliant plan.

"And you know you have my help if need be." The Skull Kid laughed in glee as he pointed at himself and his flute.

"Yes a fine idea, little one." Zelda smirked as she decided to match Malon and Nabooru's wish upon the Triforce of Fat...

Several minutes later Link awoke on the ground, his head slightly pounding away. The young hero remembered snatching The Rod of Fattening while he was buried within Malon's girth he assumed she must have lost her grip on it. Since he didn't hear the voices of the Goddesses he was surprised when Malon's flab began to thin out and he found himself falling downward in a rather unpleasant manner.

In any case he first caught sight of Malon who was by his side checking on him for any injuries, he noticed she was back to her usual half ton self. Just as he was going to thank her, ask her what happen, and explain how he had gotten back the magical rod Link spotted Nabooru and Zelda nearby.

Each one appeared to be back to their original weight. Zelda just like Malon was at half a ton where Nabooru was her thin well-tone self.

1121111211212222112.content:
"Hey Link!" yelled out Saria with childish happiness as she waved at him, waves rippling in her mass blubbery form from the simple action.

"S..Saria?! Is this all you?" Link asked while gently poking at the ground below him, which surprised him when his finger once again sunk deep into Saria's flab but his feet were doing the same as his finger!

Lucky for him Saria took this moment to lift him off the ground with one of her fat-filled arms.

"Yup! I'm a big girl now, Link!" Saria stated with a giggle. She then brought Link close to her.

Link was somewhat speechless not only of the view he was catching sight of but of the massive Saria that held him within her hand.

"I missed you, Link, I'm so glad we can spend sometime together again!"

Saria surprised Link once more as she engulfed him in a squishy but loving hug.

Link would have stated something about Saria's sudden action if it wasn't for the fact that he was being buried deep into her small-home-sized breasts and a portion of her vast belly thus Link found himself enjoying the embrace from Saria.

Saria laughs for a moment as she feels Link moving around within her girth.
1121111211212222112.title: Saria welcomes Link with a very squishy hug

11211112112122221121.author_name: This site is dead.I wana leave
choices: She teleports to Lake Hyrule
Other
11211112112122221121.content:
"What do you think of the new me, Link?"
Link gave a muffled reply. It was quite cosy, but he was a little overwhelmed.
Suddenly the ground seemed to rise and shake violently. Link instinctively struggled to hold on, but their was no need. The area he was in continued shaking and he heard a loud pounding noise. It was like being in an earthquake.
Link momentarily panicked, then realised that the "earthquake" was just Saria moving.
"Don't worry Link, I'm just going to get a bit bigger" she giggled
Link was in shock, wasn't she huge already?
Saria reached down for some trees and started cramming them into her mouth. As she did, she started growing, both outwards and upwards, and Link was further engulfed in her soft flab.
This went on for a bit, with Saria getting bigger and bigger, but after a little while she stopped.
“Wait, I know a better way of doing this”
11211112112122221121.title: Saria grows with Link inside her

112111121121222211211.author_name: This site is dead.I wana leave
choices: Saria drinks a small portion of the lake, growing signficantly
Saria drinks the whole lake, growing to epic proportions
112111121121222211211.content:
Link felt a strange sensation, as he whooshed up, then suddenly came down with a jolt.
Saria had teleported in front of Lake Hyrule, landing with a jolt that shook the area. O course Link couldn’t see that, but he could hear the tremendous sound Saria made when she landed.
“Saria , be careful!” Link cried out. But he wasn’t sure if Saria could hear him.
Saria looked at the lake in front of her
“This should be fun!” She boomed out. She leaned over, and started drinking from the lake.
Her body started swelling up, as though she were drinking the water from the temple. Apparently the magic still affected her and she started growing very large
112111121121222211211.title: Drink

choices: Saria starts to eat everything in her path
Something else happens
1121111211212222112112.content:
All the water in the lake and all the fish in Lake Hylia went straight toward Saria's mouth. As Saria drank, she swelled even biogger and bigger. Link was getting buried under Saria's new fat, and showed no signs of stopping! Saria continued to drink, sending water and fish down to her hungry belly. There were a total of 10 Zoras in the lake that ended up going down Saria's throat. Saria grew and grew as she drank the lake dry. When the lake was completely dry, Saria took up the entire area around Lake Hylia. She was the size of Death Mountain itself, or even a little bit bigger! Saria could see all of Hyrule before her...even the castle! Saria was the biggest person in Hyrule next only to Biggorn. She was also the fattest person in all of Hyrule, her weight being at least 50 figures. Saria belched, which echoed across the land.
"Welcome to the big time, Saria" said Saria to herself. "but I'm not done yet. I'm still hungry!"
It was amazing, even to Saria herself, that she could still be hungry after drinking all of Lake Hylia.
Link was deep in the flab of Saria, with no hope of getting out of the flab. At least it was comfy for the former Hero of Time.
1121111211212222112112.title: Big as Death Mountain

choices: Zelda heads over to the lake area hoping to have a word with Saria
Check back with Saria and Link who was still buried in her fat
11211112112122221121122.content:
Meanwhile over at Hyrule Castle several moments before Saria's country-echoing belch. Princess Zelda, who had been left in charge while her father was away on political affairs, was busy looking over several documents that would require either her or her father's signature.

Just as she dipped a lovely white feather that doubled as pen in a small bottle of ink Zelda was surprised when Impa suddenly appeared before her!

"Impa?! Is there a problem?" asked Zelda while tilting her head a bit to one side.

"It would seem so, Zelda..."

But before the older woman could speak any further on the matter an enormous sound wave traveled across the land of Hyrule, one that strangely sounded very similar to an everyday belch.

"What in the Goddesses' names was that?" questioned Zelda as she noticed several of the windows had been cracked slightly from the resounding belch.

"That...is our problem..." Impa stated rather dryly much to annoyance of Zelda who was busy checking to see if her hearing was still in working order.

"What ever do you mean, Impa. Nothing short of Big Goron could have caused such a phenomena and we've always known him to be a gentle and polite soul."

"It's not Big Goron, Princess." corrected Impa before lifting a finger and pointing it out to the window and the distance beyond.

Following Impa's movements Zelda stared out far into the distance...then she spotted a sight that made her tremble in pure shock.

"That's...that's...Saria! But how in Hyrule's name did she become...so FAT!"

The princess' right eye twitched slightly before she continued, "My word...she's the size of Death Mountain! No perhaps she's even larger then the mountain itself if such a thing were possible!"

Zelda was on the verge of collapsing right then and there, hoping that she had dozed off signing papers and it had all been a dream, but instead did her best to compose herself.

"I know not of how she became so ridiculously large but I do know that she has already drank the lake dry, flatten the Forest Temple to rubble, and is currently the size of a mountain if not larger."

Zelda did not like where any of this was going.

"Let me guess...(sigh) and she's still hungry for more."

"So it would seem." confirmed Impa.

Zelda sighed again, "Fine I'll handle this while I leave you in charge of watching over the townspeople. You're free to bring the people from Kakariko over to the Castle Town if need be."

Impa nodded and left Zelda to the business of dealing with the mountain of fat known as Saria.
11211112112122221121122.title: Zelda gets wind of Saria

choices: Zelda shows up and gives Saria a talking she won't forget
Stay with Saria and Link
112111121121222211211222.content:
Saria could now see all of Hyrule thanks to her mountainous girth. She could see Epona feeding in Lon Lon Ranch, and she could see Hyrule Castle and the town that surrounded it. Unlike most Kokiri, Saria could leave the forest and didn't die. As she grew in height, she also grew in power. Saria was the weakest of the Hyrule sages and Zelda was the most powerful Sage. Now, Saria's Sage powers dwarfed even Zelda's power....or so Saria thought. A deep rumbling came from her titanic belly, reminding Saria that she was hungry. No matter how much she ate, it never seemed to be enough for her. Saria could hardly move.
The empty lake bed was slowly being filled again by the waterfall on one side of the lake. Saria took no notice.

Deep within the flab of Saria, Link was still alive. Saria's fat was hugging him on around him, and he had the Zora tunic on. He had no clear idea on which way was up, as it was pitch black within the sea of flab. It was also comfortable and warm in the flab of Saria. He also heard Saria's stomach rumbling.

'Just how much could she eat?' asked Link to himself.

[Do you really want to find out?] giggled a girlish voice from within Link's head.

'Who are you?' asked Link.

[That's for me to know and you to find out] said the voice. [Ty'razasaran bansarg bi'nar'dda!]

'Huh?'

[Oh sorry...I slipped into Old Hylia for a moment there] said the voice.

Old Hylia?!


Hylia is the language of Hyrule. Old Hylia was an older language dating back to 10,000 years ago!
112111121121222211211222.title: The Mysterious Voice

choices: Stay with Zelda and hear Saria's decision
Check up on Link and the mystery voice
1121111211212222112112221.content:
While Link was busy conversing with the mysterious voice outside Zelda finally appeared before the mountainous Saria,

"Sage of the Forest, Saria. I demand you listen to me right now!"

Zelda wasn't exactly sure if the immense girl could hear words though, after all Saria's head was perched a top of countless tons of pure fat.

"Saria are listening to me. I've come to speak to you personally! I don't know what has caused you to grow so vast but you must stop this silliness before you blanket our beloved Hyrule with your girth!"

Again Zelda wasn't sure if Saria had heard her much less see her standing before the Kokiri blob.

"I can hear you...but it's a little difficult to see you, Zelda." responded Saria honestly.

"Well regardless if you can or can not see me I'm asking you once more to put an end to this so you can be returned to your normal size." stated Zelda with a firm stance.

"Sorry but I like being big and I mean BIG. All my life I've been small in size and power now that's all changed now I'm big and strong, sorry but I'm not ready to give that all up."

Zelda grunted in frustration she really didn't want to bring down Saria by force but if she had to...

"Saria I understand what you mean but I will ask just once more stop now and do not force my hand."

Zelda even with all her power wasn't sure if she had anything that could outright stop Saria but was willing to give it her all if it came to that. Silently she hoped Saria would see the error of her ways.
1121111211212222112112221.title: Zelda appears before Mount Saria

choices: Saria decides that she's big enough
Saria decides she isn't fat enough
11211112112122221121122212.content:
Link was still somewhere deep in Saria's flab. Link had started to "swim" in the layers of Saria's fat in hope of getting out of her flab. The mystery voice hadn't yet revealed her name to Link, and Link was getting annoyed.

[Does it matter who i am?] asked the voice.

"Maybe it does" said Link.

[I gave you a hint when I spoke in Old Hylian] said the voice. [I couldn't possibly speak Old Hylian because I'd have to be dead]

"So...you're a Poe" said Link.

[I'm a Poe Sister, actually] said the voice. [the forgotten fifth Poe Sister named Amber. When I was alive, I had a daughter that loved to stuff herself silly with the food I cooked for her. She was the fattest woman in Hyrule at the time. Sadly, my daughter was killed by an unknown Gerudo witch. I vowed that one day, I would revenge my daughter's death...and then, Saria came along. Saria looks so much like my daughter, you know. So I decided to get Saria as fat--if not, fatter--than my daughter was before she died. I've reached my goal, by the way]

"How did you daughter get to become that fat?" asked Link. "and....was that Gerudo witch related to Ganondorf?"

[She went to the Great Fairy of Fat and asked if she could become as fat as she wanted] said Amber. [the Great Fairy granted my daughter with an endless hunger. As for your second question, I don't really know]

"Great Fairy of Fat....?" asked Link.

[Oh yes] said Amber.

"But...that doesn't explain how Saria got to be this fat" said Link.

[I was able to channel my daughter's great hunger when Saria started to eat at the temple] said Amber.

"I see...." said Link. "and where is this Great Fairy of Fat?"

[Who knows?] asked Amber. [I don't even know how my daughter found that Fairy, by the way...]
11211112112122221121122212.title: The Fifth Poe Sister

choices: Saria regains her mobility and begins to devour more of the land
Saria regains her mobility and drinks the lake dry again
112111121121222211211222122.content:
Back with Saria and Zelda, the green-attired mountain of a girl had taken in Zelda's words...and as she had said before Saria was not ready to let go of her epic stature and go back to being tiny and weak (compared to the other sages).

No she was living the big life now and with her ever present hunger Saria was determined to become even bigger! Yes at first she was confused by the fact that even after downing an entire lake and in turn growing to the size of a mountain how she could still be hungry but now instead Saria had come to embrace her hunger.

Perhaps her stomach was working off her desire to be more then just a "child" now she had the power to become something much more and she was going to use it for all it's worth.

Mount Saria? No that wasn't enough perhaps Hyrule would be better off renamed as "Saria"? But what if she wanted her empire of blubber to expand further? Planet Saria didn't seem to bad either...but she decided to put that amusing thought aside and concentrate on the here and now. Namely Zelda's demand.

"Sorry..." Saria started off with, "but it's like I said. I love being big, massive, larger then life and I only wish to become even bigger."

With a minor flick of her fatty finger Saria levitated a portion of the grass-tipped land clear off the ground and straight toward and into her open mouth.

Zelda was shocked at the showcase of power. Was Saria really powerful enough now to forcefully rip the land apart? Zelda cringed as she heard more of the land around her take to the air and fly toward Saria's open maw and with each patch of greenery Saria grew larger.

Instinctively Zelda ducked as the iron made fence that lead to Lake Hylia was ripped from the ground and floated over toward Saria. Apparently the girl was having her daily dosage of iron.

In any case this was certainly getting out of hand and Zelda knew she had to find a way to stop the eating rampage before it could get any worse. But before she could do that Zelda dodged yet again as more land was devoured.

Then to her horror Zelda began to notice that Saria seem to be regaining feeling in her beyond massive self. Could she stand? If she did she could eat Hyrule for lunch...or perhaps even worse as a snack! thought the princess racking her brain with thoughts of what was to come.
112111121121222211211222122.title: Mount Saria isn't big enough

choices: Saria eats Lon Lon Ranch
Check up on Link....or Zelda
1121111211212222112112221222.content:
While Saria was thinking over Zelda's words, Lake Hylia had filled up again. It was a big lake but it seemed to take a much shorter time to fill back up again. It seemed that Saria had regained her mobility as she got up to her feet...which had grown thick in fat too, otherwise the mountain of a girl wouldn't have been able too stand up, much less move. Saria looked to the lake and smiled, and started to drink the lake dry again. Zelda was running as fast as she could to avoid being swallowed up by Saria's blubber. Saria swelled even bigger with every gulp of water she took, Soon, she was far more bigger than Death Mountain itself and still she grew. Zelda managed to get away, and try to think of something to do with the growing problem. Meanwhile, Saria had finished up the lake again. Now she took up the entire area of Lake Hylia. Her blubber almost reached Lon Lon Ranch and was partially in Gerudo Valley. Still, Saria wasn't yet big enough. With the lake drained again, Saria caught her sight on Lon Lon Ranch and licked her massive lips and started to walk towards it, making the ground shake under her great weight.

Malon was out in the ranch and feeding the horses when she noticed a shadow come over the entire ranch complex. She looked up to see a green-clad wall coming towards the ranch. "What the heck is that?!" yelled Malon.
1121111211212222112112221222.title: Mt. Saria gets bigger

choices: At the last moment Malon is saved! But by whom?
Oh no, Malon's been eaten along with the ranch!
11211112112122221121122212221.content:
Malon stared wide-eyed for a moment that the monstrous wall...blob, whatever it was that had made it's way over surprisingly rather quickly and now hovered over the ranch area blocking out the sun's rays with it's immense size.

"It's tiny but I suppose it will do." Malon heard a voice call out. Her eyes darted from place to place but couldn't spot a single soul, the animals had gone into a state of panic and rushed toward the safety of the barn, looking upward she wondered did the voice come from the sky? From this immense object before her?

Suddenly as if to answer her question. Malon watched in a mixture of horror and surprise as two large as all hell arms reached for the ranch's sides!

"EEK!" the ranch girl squealed as she was certain now that some sort of gigantic monster was not only about to eat her out of house and home but swallow her as a snack as well!

"This can't be happening...this can't be happening...." she muttered to herself desperate to move her body but her legs refused to acknowledge her mental commands. Weighted down by fear Malon closed her clear blue eyes. Silently calling out to her "fairy boy" she prepared for the worse...
11211112112122221121122212221.title: Will Malon be saved?

choices: Link and Malon teleport to The Temple of Time
Link and Malon teleport to the graveyard in Kakariko Village
112111121121222211211222122211.content:
Malon felt this was it, this was how her youthful life was going to unfortunately come to a close, being devoured by a mountain-sized (if not more!) monster who clearly saw her and her home as nothing more but a snack.

"Fairy boy..." she whimpered, "Where are you..." the monstrous figure now seconds from having it's quick meal.

"MALON!"

The ranch girl's blue eyes blinked in utter surprise just before she felt herself be lifted off the ground...but not by the "monster blob" but instead by her Fairy Boy, Link!

Malon squealed in a mixture of happiness and surprise as she held on to Link, the blonde hero had somehow found his way out of Saria's immense girth was currently using the Longshot has a makeshift rope.

Content with his successful rescue Link instructed Malon to hold on to him tightly, with a nod she did as told. Altering their direction slightly, just enough to avoid colliding with Saria's gargantuan belly Link released the chain on the Longshot.

Malon panicked for a moment since the two of them were still very well in mid-air but Link reassure her he had everything under control. As the pummeled downward Malon once again closed her eyes and could only make out the howl of the wind around them.

A few moments later she heard the Longshot's chain lock back into place then another second or two passed...and she heard the sound of an ocarina being played then everything went black...
112111121121222211211222122211.title: At the last moment Malon is saved! But by whom?

choices: Find and kill the Poe Sister within Saria
go with the other option
1121111211212222112112221222112.content:
When the light returned, Malon looked around to see they were at the entrance to the Temple of Shadows in the graveyard in Kakariko Village. Malon could also see the huge green blob that was now eating the entire Lon Lon Ranch. Link looked around and sighed.
"What's that thing!" yelled Malon.
"That's Saria" said Link. "I have no idea how she got that huge...but she has Hyrule on the menu it looks like"
"Saria?" asked Malon. "that little Sage of the forest?"
"She said she hated being the smallest of the Sages" said Link. "I wish I knew how to stop her"
"Maybe I can offer some help" said a voice.
Link and Malon looked around until they spotted a man leaning over a grave site. The name on the tombstone read Tobias Dalker, Beloved Son.
"Dalker?" asked the man. "what kind of a name is that...?"
"Who are you?" asked Link.
"My name is Sohahn" said the man. He was a well-built man in his early thirties. His skin was very pale..and transparent. It was easy to tell that Sohahn was a ghost.
"You're a ghost" said Malon. "how can you possibly help us?"
"A Poe Sister is the cause of all this" said Sohahn. "a Poe Sister that you didn't run into while in the temple, Hero of Time"
"How do you know...?" started Link.
"I don't have time for 20 questions, boy" said Sohahn. "I've been allowed to tell you how to put an end to Saria's binge before she devours Hyrule. A Poe Sister is the cause of all this...a Poe Sister that had her daughter taken away from her. The Poe Sister coaxed Saria into eating until she was the size of her daughter....the daughter was a pig, you see...but right now, the Poe Sister wants Saria to be the fattest person ever by eating all of Hyrule. In a way, the Poe Sister is controlling Saria's actions from within. In order to stop Saria from devouring everything, the Poe Sister must be dealt with"
"You mean...we have to fight the Poe in Saria?!" asked Link.
"Yes" said Sohahn. "you must enter Saria, find the Poe and kill it. That ought to stop Saria's gluttony"
"Lord Jabu-Jabu all over again..." muttered Link.
"Isn't there another way?" asked Malon.
"Well...yes" said Sohahn. "grow as big as Saria to fight her"
"Tough choices" said Malon.
1121111211212222112112221222112.title: The Mysterious Sohahn

choices: Time to put Zelda's plan into action!
Uh oh! Saria has already spotted Link and the girls!
11211112112122221121122212221121.content:
"I don't think Hyrule would be able to withstand that sort of fight...so we go with Option A then." commented Link with a bit of sigh.

"How do we get in though?" asked Malon rubbing her chin slightly, obviously deep in thought.

"We? No...I'll go in take care of the Poe and be out before..."

Link gasped as he felt himself being tugged over to where Malon stood, the ranchgirl surprising him not only with her strength but her quickness (must be getting rusty he thought silently).

"Oh no! I don't care if she's our friend or not but she just ate me out of house and employment! I'm going just so I can punch that ghost in the face and show it what for!"

At that moment Link wanted to comment on how Malon wouldn't actually be able to "physically" hurt the spirit but he decided he wasn't too keen on seeing the afterlife so soon and or becoming a wandering spirit himself so instead kept his mouth shut.

Afterwards he turned over to Sohahn and asked if the ghost had sure-fire way of getting into Saria without well being eaten alive. Unfortunately the spirit's answer wasn't a positive one, for it seem in his current form he was a messenger rather then a fighter.

"Then perhaps I can be the one to help you, Link."

Surprised Link, along with Malon, turned over to spot Zelda walking up to the duo (and spirit) with a quiver full of arrows strapped across her back.

"Zelda?" "Princess?"

Zelda politely nodded before turning over toward the ghost.

"My dear Sohahn you did well delivering our message. It seems Impa choose well and you have mine and her thanks for that."

"I appreciate the compliment, my lady. Nice to see even in death a former knight can still serve his country."

Zelda smiled at the spirit's words before bidding him farewell.

"Now then...Link I believe I can use these arrows, which I will infuse with my power, to stun lock Saria in place for precisely five maybe seven seconds tops." explained Zelda.

"That's not a lot of time, Zelda."

"I understand that but it should still be enough to allow me to transport the two of you (Link once again wanted to disagree but was met with a glare from both women that once again shot down his disapproval) to at the very least her enlarged belly-button, enter from there and proceed to track down the Poe Sister behind all of this."

After taking it all in Link had to admit Zelda's plan was rather sound, and at least it didn't involve him being eaten again like with Jabu-Jabu but something still concerned the young hero.

"What about you, Zelda?" asked Link.

"That's right while we're in there giving that ghost a good one-two Hyrule is still in danger and so are you, Princess." added in Malon.

For a moment Zelda stood silent, had she not thought of that? No Zelda carried Wisdom with her for a reason there was little doubt that the blonde royal didn't have an answer to the question from Link and the worry from Malon.

"If push comes to shove..." Zelda paused a slight tease-worthy smile playing on her lips, "Then remember what Sohahn said?" Link and Malon both nodded.

"...I'll buy you the time you need, that's all you need to know." stated Zelda while retaining her smile her tone was that of pure seriousness.

Exchanging looks with one another Link and Malon realized how far Zelda was willing to go to stop Saria...

"Alright we understand, Zelda, let's do this." stated Link, Malon nodding agreement.

"Good...because she's here."

Looking far ahead of them, while Zelda turned on heel, Link and Malon did in fact spot Saria mere inches from reaching Kakariko. Her immense shadow already beginning to engulf the village in utter darkness.
11211112112122221121122212221121.title: Find and kill the Poe Sister within Saria

choices: They enter the temple; The Poe Sister is in there!
They enter the temple; the Poe Sister isn't in the temple
112111121121222211211222122211212.content:
Saria's head was almost lost in her own blubber, but her head was just visible to the three in the graveyard. It was plain to see that Saria had spotted Link and the two women. Saria was probably a good mile away from the village, but her shadow engulfed the town in darkness. The ground started to shake as Saria made a step. While she was just outside of the village, Saria leaned far forward in order to see Link and the others better. This shifting resulted in Saria's bulk landing on top of the village, squishing everything under her girth. Saria's fattened face ended up a few inches away from Link and the others. Sohahn had vanished from sight some 40 seconds earlier.

"Well, what do we have here?" asked Saria. "you three are all here. It feels so good to finally meet you all here.....you plan to stop me, huh?"

Zelda readied one of her arrows, but Saria blew on the group, which made them fall to the ground. Saria giggled.

"Saria, you must stop this" said Malon, getting back on her feet.

"Weren't you at that ranch?" asked Saria.

"You ate me out of house and employment, you fat bitch" said Malon.

"And now...I'm gonna eat you" said Saria. Saria started to suck air into her mouth, forcing the three into her mouth. She quickly swallowed the three.
"Yummy" said Saria, getting back to her feet unsteadily. She had completely flattened the village and everything in it. Saria eyed Death Mountain and licked her lips and wondered what the Gorgons would taste like.



"Here we go again" said Link.
Deep in the depths of Saria's stomach, Link had found himself alone. The two girls must've landed somewhere else in the vast stomach of Saria. The sights looked much like Lord Jabu-Jabu's innards as well. The light came from Link's latern which he happened to have. The 'floor' was slick with moisture and was very slippery to walk on. There were pits spotted here and there...pits of stomach acid, Link soon found out. The pits all varied in size.
"Zelda! Malon!" Link called out.
There was no reply.
Link made his way passed a sizable pit of stomach acid before he saw what looked like the Forest Temple. It was basically the same, but the floor of the temple was the 'floor' of Saria's stomach.
"Link!" came the cry of Malon from somewhere near by. Link looked around and saw that Malon was running towards him, followed by Zelda.
"The Forest Temple..." said Zelda, looking at the temple.
"Must be where Amber is" said Link.
112111121121222211211222122211212.title: Inside Saria's Belly

choices: Stick with Link and the girls
Check up on Saria's continuous eating
1121111211212222112112221222112121.content:
Raising and extending an arm outward Zelda's eyes came to a close as she began to focus.

"...Yes I can see a haunting presence within the walls of the temple." stated Zelda.

"Well at least we know for sure that ghost in there now!" exclaimed Malon.

Suddenly Link gasped as he watched Malon pull out a pitchfork from seemingly out of nowhere!

"Malon?"

"Hmm?" Link pointed cautiously at the farming object in her hands.

"Oh this is for protection. Remember that green-clad mountain of blubber ate my home but luckily I was still able to find this among the wreckage." Malon explained with a bit of a cheery grin.

Link with a single raised eyebrow made a mental note to never get on the redhead's bad side. Edging over Zelda leaned in slightly in Link's direction.

"She certainly is quite a fire-cracker isn't she?" stated Zelda with a bit of a dry giggle to which Link only nodded.

"In any case we should get going. The longer we spend in here the more time Saria has to devour more Hyrule." Zelda nodded to Link's words and soon the three were off toward the temple...

After a bit of magical tinkering Zelda was able to pick the magical seal to the temple doors. With Saria gone and focusing solely on her seemingly endless gluttony the Poe Sister was able to spread her influence over the temple sealing it away from any trespassers.

Luckily for the heroic trio Zelda's power outclassed practically everyone in Hyrule outside of the sealed away tyrant Ganondorf and the now immense Saria so the power of a Poe's magic was nothing to the royal princess.

Sneaking in Link signaled for the ladies to stay behind him. The temple was quiet...too quiet, Link had truthfully expected some sort of resistance especially if Amber had picked up on Zelda undoing the door seal.

Zelda as well had something on her mind, if Saria had overtaken the temple with her growing girth then how was it able to be reconstructed so easily much less perfectly...?

"Something isn't right here, Link..."

Before Link could respond an eerie crackle resounded through the hollow halls.

Steadying his blade, Link watched for any sign of life as Zelda and Malon covered his rear and sides.

"It seems today is a day full of guests. First the cute little sage and now you three."

"Amber show yourself! We know you're the one who made Saria into the terror she is now!" growled Link.

"You speak of her as if she is a monster."

"Currently she sure as hell is. Wrecking people's lives and devouring the land like a snack!" piped in Malon with a look of anger that mirrored Link's.

"Tell me spirit, is this truly the temple?"

Zelda's question actually surprised all for moment.

"It seems you princess are the only rational one in the group. As for this place, it is my area of dominance. Changeling a portion of wondrous Saria's new found power this space is mine to command as I see fit. In fact "It" should be taking hold right about now..."

With a shock both Malon and Zelda gasped in union. The two ladies clutching their stomachs before being pulled below by a pair of floor-masters. The hands striking before either woman could react and Link soon found himself alone.

"What did you do with them?!"

"They are now each locked away somewhere in the temple or should I say my temple. If I were you Hero of Time I'd concern myself with finding them both before coming after me after all if you take too long in rescuing either woman well...I'll let you see for yourself."

Link cursed under his breath as the voice of Amber faded away. Time was short now and he had to find both Zelda and Malon before whatever surprise the Poe had in store for them could occur.
1121111211212222112112221222112121.title: The Poe awaits within the temple

choices: The Key to Door 2  is there
The Key to Door 1 is in the chest
11211112112122221121122212221121211.content:
The temple was virtually the same as Link remembered it. There were slight changes to it however...like the addition of pits of stomach acid dotted around the place. Link spent 15 minutes looking for Malon and Zelda with no luck. There were the same monsters in the temple as before; some of them had slipped into pits of stomach acid, leaving their skeletons behind. Link then came to a room with four locked doors within it. In front of each door were small chests. There was a note on each door.

1) The Way to Zelda lies behind me, while my neighbor leads elsewhere

2) If you take my advice, the fourth leads to death

3) Number 2 and Number 4 are the same

4) Malon isn't here


Shrugging, Link opened the chest that was in front of Door 1....only to find a key within it with a "3" on it. Link tried to open the other three chests, but he had no luck. Sighing, Link opened Door 3. The door led to a long and twisted hallway,which led to a wide-open room. Link went down the twisted hallway and entered the room at the end of it.

The room was a big circle with a pit in it. Hanging over the pit on a rope was Malon. Malon was alive and well....and utterly still. Link approached the pit with caution. When he got within two feet of the pit, a skeleton popped out from the pit and started to attack Link. Link quickly dispatched the skeleton. With the skeleton defeated, the pit of stomach acid vanished and Malon was released from the rope. Malon and Link rushed to each other and hugged.....and the pair returned to the room with 4 doors.

"Do you know where Zelda is?" asked Link.

"No" said Malon.

Since the key to Door 3 was in the chest in front of the 1st door, Link went to the chest in front of the 3rd door and opened it.
11211112112122221121122212221121211.title: Stick with Link and the girls

choices: Looks like Zelda's okay, nothing to worry about.
That's not Zelda! It's a monster in disguse!
112111121121222211211222122211212112.content:
Within the chest lay a key with a 1 written on a tag attached to it!

Silently Link urged Malon to follow him to the door a moment later he had unlocked it the hero and ranch girl then proceeded through. Although Malon found it odd how the note left on the door had blatantly told them where to go but before she think any more about the strange clue Link piped in with a question.

"Hey I didn't have a chance to ask you but are you okay, Malon? I mean you and Zelda killed over in pain before those wall-masters grabbed you both."

"Oh that...yeah I'm fine at the time though it felt like my entire body had gone numb starting from stomach and spreading outward..."

"A paralysis then? Yeah I guess that would be the best way for the Poe to take Zelda hostage considering their power difference and you were a bonus as well."

"Yeah..." Malon grunted in anger, "Now I'm really going to tear that ghost apart once we find it!"

Link smiled slightly it was nice to see that despite the ordeal Malon was still full of vigor. Pushing forward for a few more minutes the hallway the two were currently in came to an end as they approached a pair of double doors.

Link steadied himself while Malon took his side, her old pitchfork gone but was lucky enough to pick up the spear from the fallen skeleton Link had battle with prior to her rescue.

Entering the room slowly the pair noticed Zelda out as a light and chained to stone wall on the opposite end of the large chamber but she wasn't alone! Four Stalfos stood in front of the princess guarding her...and perhaps wanting to kill her upon Amber's request...regardless the bony warriors turn to face the trespassers.

The monsters then growled in rage before rushing at Link and Malon.

While she wasn't as skilled as Link was Malon was at least able to content with a single skeleton while Link took care of the other three. Together the duo finished off the final monster.

Now turning their attention over to Zelda the two of them paused as they watched the chains wrapped around her bust free allowing the princess to crumble to the ground seemingly and luckily unhurt.

Rushing over to help Zelda up that particular feeling that Malon had experienced before about the clue on the door being too helpful came back.

Had it been too easy? Too obvious? Just as she was going to comment about the bothersome feeling Link had already reached Zelda and slowly assisted her up to her feet.
112111121121222211211222122211212112.title: Is Zelda's rescued?

choices: The monsters are defeated; Zelda is indeed in the cage
The monsters are defeated; Zelda isn't in the cage!
1121111211212222112112221222112121122.content:
When Link got over to Zelda, he stopped short as he saw that it wasn't Zelda after all! It was a huge Like-Like dressed as the princess! Link had come across several Like-Likes in his adventures, but none so big as this one. It was a head taller than Link and Malon, and the clothes it had been wearing were absorbed by the Like-Like. Link swung at it with his sword, and the Like-Like was easily killed in three or four hits. It left behind Zelda's clothes. The thought about Zelda being naked made Link's nose bleed.

"I knew it was too easy" said Malon. "hey, your nose is bleeding, Link"

"Erm....let's look elsewhere" said Link.

So, Malon and Link returned to the room with the two remaining doors in it. Doors 2 and 4 were the same it sounded like..and it sounded by the notes that the doors led to death.

Malon went over and opened the chest in front of Door 4, and found the key to Door 2 within it. She showed Link the key.

"Might as well try it" said Link. He look the key from Malon and opened Door 2, which led right into a pit of stomach acid. In the middle of the pit was a small island. On the island were two Stalfos and two wolfos, protecting a cage that was hanging by a chain attached to the ceiling. The cage was too high to see in it, but Zelda's voice came from the cage.

"Link?! Is that you?" came the voice of Zelda.

The way to the island was a very thin bridge that would allow only one person on it. The island itself wasn't very big at all; just big enough for 4 monsters to stand upon it.

"Oh boy" said Link. "this should be fun"

Instead, it was the one person he had never expected to encounter again. It was Samus Aran, the person who helped him along with zelda destroy the creature known as Phazos and save Hyrule from being corrupted by Phazon. Link was both confused and curious as to how she had ended up here. "What are you doing here Samus?" She replied "I should be asking you the same question."
And so Link recounted the details of what had brought him here and mentioned that he was searching for zelda. "Funny you should mention that. before i was locked in that cage, i saw zelda in the poe sister's chambers. my guess is that she is stuffing zelda with fattening food as we speak and will turn her loose on the outside world once she's big enough." Link gasped.
"That poe is the reason why i'm here. Her influence is what's causing my friend Saria to keep gaining weight. unless she is stopped, all of Hyrule, no the entire world is at risk!"

The young hero sighed before even stating a word.

"I know one of you is going to approve and the other will disagree but what's happen to Saria is...pardon the pun bigger then all of us. So..."

The ladies nodded and awaited his decision.

"It's all you Malon." Link stated pointing directly at his redheaded friend.

"Really?" Malon asked a smile on her lips.

"Yeah. There's a poe inside Saria and only someone like Zelda can find it and extract it because of her sage powers. There's no way she'd be able to find it if she was busy fighting off Saria from devouring the rest of Hyrule." Link explained as best he could.

"Wait so I'm a distraction then?" Malon asked curious of Link's plan for them all. The redhead looking over at the blonde royal who merely shrugged her shoulders slightly.

"Uh...well yeah. But that's not to say your job isn't important we need you to hold off Saria while we look for the poe."

The ranch girl gasped a streak of pink flushing on her cheeks as Link placed his hands firmly on her shoulders.

"In the end you're still doing something heroic. But please don't hurt Saria too much she isn't in control of her actions."

With Zelda watching Malon refrained from hugging her fairy boy instead she just nodded. Malon understood what Link meant and while Saria was currently a massive menace she knew this wasn't like her and that Link still cared so much for his oldest longest friend.

"Alright Fairy Boy I understand what you're saying. I'll stop her I'll keep her from eating anything else. The two of you just do what you have to do."

"If everything is as it should be then princess I believe we should begin." Sohahn stated.

Zelda stared over in Malon's direction a bright power beginning to gather in her gloved hands.

"Heh I survived during that monster Ganondorf's reign of evil. I think I can handle this." Malon stated with confidence.

"Yes quite." Zelda smiled having gathered with Sohahn's help what she needed for the spell.

"Let's get started then."

Link quickly stepped to one side just before Zelda activated the spell it's magic flowing within and all around the redheaded ranch girl. She could feel it's power however her body already beginning to rumble...

choices: What about Link?
Zelda comes up with a plan to stop Saria's hunger
112111121121222211211222122212.content:
Malon then felt a lifting sensation and opened her eyes to discover that the entire ranch complex was in the hands of this unknown monster. She only saw a gigantic mouth...although she did caught a glimpse of a face, but Malon wasn't sure as she and her ranch were brought into the cavernous mouth! The ranch stood on the gigantic tongue for a minute or two, when the monster swallowed the ranch--and Malon--along with it. She fell into deep darkness for a time and entered a large chamber. Lon Lon Ranch landed in the stomach with a soft squishy sound and Malon closed her eyes again--surely this was the end! After several long moments, Malon realized that she wasn't being digested. She opened her blue eyes to discover that several Zora had entered the ranch.
"Greetings" said one of the Zora. "I don't suppose you know who or what just ate you?"
"No I don't" said Malon. The light was coming from the Zora's skin; it was really dim, although it shone brightly in the otherwise pitch-black stomach.
"We don't know either" said the Zora. "we were swimming in Lake Hylia when the lake was drank dry"
"Who or what could be that big?!" asked Malon.
"We don't know" said the other Zora. "all we know is this monster has a ravenous appetite"


"Ah...not even a mouthful" said Saria, patting her immense belly. "but that did taste good" Saria looked and saw Zora's Domain was only a short distance away (to her). Saria smiled and headed for the domain of the Zoras...time for some shushi.
112111121121222211211222122212.title: Ranch Swallowed

choices: Stay with Zelda
Check up on Saria
1121111211212222112112221222122.content:
Through her art of teleportion Zelda closely followed the gigantic Saria who was now just a short distance away from Zora's Domain. Silently she cursed at her inability to save Malon from Saria's hungry maw. Zelda wasn't aware of Malon's current fate but hoped that by some miracle the ranch girl was still alive.

Knowing that Saria now wouldn't be against eating other individuals Zelda figured she had even more of a reason to stop the green-clad mountain of blubber.

But how? Zelda wasn't exactly sure if she had something within her magical arsenal to reverse Saria to her original height and weight...but perhaps there was something she could use to stop her eating rampage...

'Oh of course! The sacred light arrows. They won't kill her but should be able to paralyze her devouring anymore of Hyrule."

With a flash Zelda was then off toward the castle...

A short time later after looking through the armory Zelda came across a handful of arrows (five in total). There weren't much but with her power she'd be able to convert them into arrows of light.

'With any luck these should stop her long enough to come up with a way to reverse that growth and hunger of hers.'

With the arrows ready Zelda set out to hopefully stop Mount Saria from getting any larger.
1121111211212222112112221222122.title: Zelda's plan to stop Saria's hunger

choices: Saria eats Link
Saria suddenly gets paralyzed
11211112112122221121122212221222.content:
Mount Saria slurped up Lord Jabu-Jabu and belched richly, making the entire Zora's Domain tremble. She had eaten about 20 Zora and the bean seller. Ruto was able to escape from becoming Saria's snack by teleporting elsewhere. Saria hadn't noticed this and kept right on eating. Saria could feel the faint struggles within her immense tummy. Link had eventually made it out from Saria's flab and looked at what the ranch-girl was doing. Link had exited from the flab near her ear, which towered over him. Link shouted; "Saria, you must stop this!"

This made Saria stop eating and looked over at Link.

"Why should I stop?" asked Saria. "I like being large. And you can't make me quit eating" With that, Saria continued on with her eating.

"Saria!" yelled Link. "stop this"

"Or what?" asked Saria, looking over at Link. "you look tasty"
11211112112122221121122212221222.title: Link out of the flab

choices: With the Gordons deep inside Death Mountain
Inside the water halls of Zora's Domain
11211112112122221121122212222.content:
Blast it all! Now the green-wearing titaness was nearly the half the size of Hyrule and worse yet she was hungry for more!

Zelda wasn't sure what had caused this insanity and unfortunately Saria wasn't to willing to hear her out, much less provide any sort of answers to any question the princess may have due to the inhuman gluttony Saria was currently experiencing...and where in blazes was Link during all this?

Zelda sighed in frustration she certainly hadn't send him off in any sort of adventure hell Impa had seen him earlier in the day so where was that man when she actually needed him?!

Her anger subsided however when she felt the ground tremble beneath her nearly knocking her unsuspecting self to the grassy field below. It was easy to see that Saria was on the move again and her next target was a defenseless farm!

Impa had her hands filled with taking care of her own and Link was strangely MIA so Zelda was left with only one course of action...

Having fallen on her rear due to a quaking footfall Malon clearly panic-stricken began to crawl in reverse desperately trying to make as far a space as she could between her and the green clad beast that had descended upon her helpless home.

Now Malon had seen and experienced a few terrors during Ganondorf's dark reign but nothing could prepare her for this her ranch home was actually being ripped apart and devoured by a monster of massive proportions. The surrounding fence, buildings, the poor animals! She was thankful Epona was out somewhere else practically wishing she had joined the lucky horse.

"AHHH!"

The redhead yelled out in pure terror as the sky-eclipsing hand began to lower in her general area.

"No, no, no...please no!" she whimpered skin nearly as white as a her familiar dress.

"Fairy boy where are you?!"

Closing her teary eyes she felt her end all but a certainly as the area grew darker and the mammoth hand at last made contact with the ground...

Eyes shut Malon instinctively yelled out as she felt her body be whisked away her overwhelming fear telling her it was all over.

"Open your eyes, Malon."

A voice...no it couldn't be she should be dead. Yet something told her otherwise. That voice it was familiar in fact it sounded just like...

Malon gasped as she looked over her rescuer and it wasn't exactly who she first expected! If she had to be rescued she had hoped and expected Link but the voice she heard earlier matched that of Princess Zelda's but this wasn't Zelda or rather wasn't how she normally came to expect the royal woman to look like.

Thinking back deep in her memories she had seen "this" Zelda before. The blue skin-tight suit the Sheikah symbol on the white clothing material across her chest the long braided ponytail was new and seem to replace the mask she had previously worn. However in her mind there was no doubt about it even if they hadn't spoken a word to one another back then Zelda was that mysterious stranger that had come to her aid once when Ingo came home a little too tipsy and far too eager.

"Are you alright?" Zelda asked as she stood directly in front of the downed farm girl.

"Um...yeah." Malon muttered softly yet loud enough for Zelda to at least hear.

Everything was happening so fast for the poor girl to keep up with. First that monster, then the destruction of her home, and now Zelda reveals herself to be that silent protector from long ago!

She coughed however after staring a bit too long at the back of the battle-ready princess. She knew Zelda was beautifully shaped but her current attire really showed off her defined curves and surprising muscles. Malon thanked the three goddesses that Zelda was unable to spot her rather visible blush. Afterwards she took in a breath in hopes of cooling down her emotions...and strangely that feeling she usually got whenever Link was around...

"What in Hyrule's name just happened?" she asked, at the moment just wanting to put everything behind her and start anew.

"You're safe for now but I'm afraid your home"

"Yeah I know...still thank you...Princess."

Zelda stared on over in her direction flashing a brief understanding smile Malon almost felt her blush reappear at the princess' soft expression.

"Um where are we?" the farm girl asked again attempting to shift things away from her emotional reactions.
11211112112122221121122212222.title: Malon's surprising savior!

choices: Suddenly a Zora guard appears stating that Saria is on her way over!
Nabooru suddenly contacts Zelda, she and her tribe are under attack by Saria!
112111121121222211211222122222.content:
"We are currently in the domain belonging to the Zora." Zelda stated as she helped Malon back up to her feet.

As she dusted herself off Malon recalled her father in the past had made one or two dealings with the fish folk although she couldn't exactly say she was familiar with them in the same way that Zelda was.

"By chance do you know of them?"

"I do...my father dealt with them when I was still a kid." the redhead explained to which Zelda simply nodded.

Now in a much more gathered state Malon had a few questions she wanted to ask of the blonde royal especially when it came to the princess' current attire.

"I apologize if my appearance startled you."

Malon stood wide-eyed for a moment wondering if Zelda could in fact read her very thoughts a few seconds later however she nervously waved off the apology.

"It's been quite a long time since I've had to wear something like this again..."

The farm girl happy that Zelda missed her sudden nervous response. What was up with her today and why was the princess of all people making her act this way, usually it was only around Link her fairy boy when she acted...hold on where was Link anyway?

"You know you could have told me and not kept this from me all this time."

Apparently Malon wasn't going to get a chance to ask seeing as the two of them were suddenly interrupted by Princess Ruto.

Zelda replied with a quick apology stating that why should she have said a thing when she believed her "Sheik" days to be completely over with Ganondorf's defeat.

"I suppose you have a point but seeing as you are back in costume I take it you know of that green behemoth that's ravishing the countryside."

"I do" Zelda going on to explain how it was their fellow sage Saria and how she believed that the once petite girl was being controlled in some fashion. Saria would never willingly cause this much chaos...

*Cough*

"Um sorry to barge in but a perfectly normal ranch girl over here is rather confused." stated Malon chuckling slightly afterwards.

Zelda smiled before she went on to explain everything to Malon the redhead hanging on every word that left the princess' lips eventually being introduced to the Zora's own princess.

With the introductions over Ruto invited the two ladies into her own personal quarters.

"Tell me Zelda since you're in that clothing I take it you haven't run into Link then? Funny you'd think he'd be jumping at the chance to help his oldest friend."

Zelda stood quiet for a moment unlike Ruto Malon was able to spot the rather clinched fist of the princess however she was smart enough to know not to comment on on her observation.

"I don't know where he is." the princess spat out a mixture of anger and frustration clear in her tone.

"I see"

While Ruto at times was rather nosy she like Malon knew when it came to leave enough alone. No need to throw any more wood on the already blazing fire.

"Let us move on then" Ruto stated wanting to clear the room of the sudden awkward moment.
112111121121222211211222122222.title: Inside the water halls of Zora's Domain

Link was completely buried in Saria's fat, with his top half buried in her breasts and his bottom half was buried in her vast belly. When Saria hugged Link to her fattened body, the Hero had sunk into her fat so fast that Saria lost her grip on him. Saria could feel Link's every movement within her fat, and it made her giggle. She then decided to have some fun with her fat while Link was buried in it. She flexed her vast belly, letting it wave like the ocean. Link's movements increased, tickling her. She felt Link try to swim his way out of her fat, but her flexing belly prevented him. Saria stopped flexing her belly, and pushed her house-sized breasts downwards, hoping to entomb Link entirely into her belly. She felt Link going down in her fat, heading towards her belly.

choices: Saria lands right on top of Link!
By luck Saria avoids flattening Link with her new fat
11211112112122222.content:
Saria thought for moment just how she was going to contact Link, considering her ocarina was far too small for her massive self. Suddenly she remembered that her magical abilities had increased above and beyond her normal capacity.

Saria giggled in wonder if her powers had now surpassed even Zelda's, who was said to have no rival now that Ganondorf had been sealed away, but she pushed that playful thought aside and realized she didn't need the ocarina speak with Link. Simply playing her favorite tune within her mind was enough to send the signal outward.

Link meanwhile was stretched out and relaxing by Lake Hylia's shore when he heard Saria's voice inside his head.

[Link? Can you hear me?]

[Oh hey Sar! What's up?] said Link, tossing in his makeshift nickname for his eternal friend.

[Oh...nothing much...] she lied with a short giggle, if there was anything that was "up" it was her.

[Okay...say Saria, listen I'm sorry I haven't been around recently. Been real busy and what not...hey why don't I stop by today since I finally got a free day.]

[Oh you don't have to do that Link, in fact where are you so I can go visit you personally.] she asked him kindly.

[Um I'm at Lake Hylia just relaxing on the coast line and Epona's just eating some nearby grass but just how are you going to come visit me? I mean I know you're a Sage but...]

[Don't worry about it I'll be there in a few seconds] stated Saria cutting off their conversation.

"Huh wonder what she meant by that? Sar what you up to?"

As if the Goddesses meant to give him some sort of response Link blinked in surprise with a green light appeared over the Lake's general area and suddenly the young hero saw himself under a grand-size shadow.

"Funny I don't remember there being a report about an eclipse?" he wondered.

"Wait...that's way too green and cream colored to be a solar eclip....Oh My Goddesses!"

Yes it was then Link came to notice the vast bulk of Saria's that was currently falling in his direction!
11211112112122222.title: Incoming!

choices: Saria gets off of Link
Saria's stomach growls
112111121121222221.content:
Saria hadn't intended to appear above Link. She hadn't planned on appearing right above Lake Hylia. Saria had teleported herself to Lake Hylia, intending to appear in the lake itself and not above it. When she had materialised to her destination, Saria knew something went wrong the instant she appeared. First of all, she had materialised in mid-air...and she had landed right on top of Link! At first, she didn't knew that she had landed right on top of the hero. She just looked around wildly for any sign of Link, but there was no sign of the Hero of Time. That's when Saria felt a slight twitching under her vast belly. It tickled her, causing her to giggle....and then, she realized that she must've landed right on top of Link! The twitching meant that Link was still alive, and not squashed under her amazing weight. Her fat might've saved his life; if something had landed on Link that was solid and hard, he would be squished. But, because of the softness of Saria's fat, Link was still alive.


Link had no time to react, no time to do anything really but stare at the massive bulk that was Saria. Saria had landed right on top of him, causing the ground to shake all around the "impact" point. It was sheer luck that Link had been wearing his Zora Tunic. Link had gone to Lake Hylia to fish, which was quickly becoming his new hobby since evil no longer lived in Hyrule. He had gotten into a splashing fight with a Zora earlier, as a matter of fact. The fight was about who had caught a sizable fish. Clearly, it had been the Zora that had snatched the fish away from Link's fishing rod and had pulled Link right into the lake! The two argued about whose fish it was. The Zora had won the fight by splashing water into Link's face, which blinded him for a minute or two--long enough to get away with the fish.
Link found himself in an expanse of fat and darkness. He was still wearing the Zora Tunic, so he could still breathe.

"Um...sorry Link!" Saria yelled out rather embarrassed that she had just fallen right on top of her best friend! Definitely not the entrance she was hoping to make for the blond hero but at least it felt that he had been spared a literal crushing death but now she had to get off him so they could put this embarrassing moment behind them.

To her surprise Saria realized that not only had her powers and weight multiply but apparently her strength as well. Somehow the muscles in her body had been empowered enough to carry her tremendous weight so it made it easier then expected to lift herself off the ground. She chuckled a drop of sweat sliding down the side of her still adorable face as she noticed the sizable crater her impact had created however try as she might and she had to lean in a bit due to her size she couldn't find Link anywhere...

"Shoot...where did you go, Link?" she wondered out loud puzzled as to where the hero could have ended up?

Suddenly her search was interrupted as she felt her stomach rumble! At first she thought it was sign from Link but unless he was literally bombing her stomach she figured it had to a case of hunger.

"Well I am a bigger girl now...don't worry Link I'll find you..." She paused as her stomach growled again, "After I have a bit of a bite to eat."

Of course it then dawned on her as to what exactly was she going to eat considering her gigantic size?

"Um...Saria..how did you become so...big?" asked Link.

"I found a magical spring within the Forest Temple" said Saria. "I jumped in and,,,voila!" Saria didn't plan on telling Link the whole truth..not yet, anyway. Saria's belly was the biggest part of her, but her breasts were a close second. Saria's breasts were bigger than Link!

"So..." said Saria. "do you like the new me, Link?"

1121111211212222222.content:
"Um...uh..." Link still trying to make sense of what had just happened was unsure how to answer. Saria was his best friend since childhood and he didn't want to hurt her feelings.

"Um sure...Saria...I love it!" he stated with a rather awkward smile followed by a quick thumbs up. It's not that he didn't love Saria's new weight nor did he hate it either rather it was his way of not offending the previous small girl who now towered over him, a part of him wondering if this was how Navi felt when comparing her size to his own.

"Oh you do!"

He heard her squeal in glee and even though everything about her was bigger then he could imagine he still knew of that look in Saria's eyes...before he knew it she had scooped him up laughing adorably with the brightest of smiles on those thick chubby cheeks of hers as she gave him a joyful hug burying the poor hero deep into her blubbery body!

"You've made my day, Link!"

"Link...?" she wondered after she didn't get a response from him.

"Oops! Guess I still have to get more used to this new size of mine. Don't worry Link I'll find you!" Saria stated with a laugh trying her best to sound as heroic as her best friend.

Link says even though Saria can't hear him from being in her beautiful belly, he then decides to try to find a way out although it might be difficult due to literally seeing Saria's green clothed fat being everywhere in his sight, never the less, he then proceeds to do so as he carefully finds a way out.

Saria decided that if she had actually grown that large, she would not be able to go anywhere with Link!

Saria handed the pendant back to the Poe sister saying "She looks very pretty! But, I'm not sure I want to grow that large." "Oh thats fine my dear!" ,said the poe sister, "I must say you do look great at this weight! In fact, I'll let you out of this chair for a bit and we can go weigh you."

Off in the far corner of the room, she spots a ladder going up to the ceiling with sunlight coming down from it. "Well, I'll give it a shot." she thought.

Arching her back and placing one hand behind her she began a pregnant walk to the ladder. Finally, after strenuously holding her belly up, Saria got to the ladder.

choices: Tomorrow's menu: Zoras, Hylians, and a princess!
Tomorrow's menu: More fresh baked pastries and fried fish!
113112111211111112211.content:
Stuffed with about every kind of food imaginable, the Ruto Queen burped and patted her belly softly. The meal had been filling at last, and inside Link was at work removing any parasites that may have snuck in.

On the outside, she was fat and large, at least 200,000 pounds if not more than that. She belched so loud that the ground seemed to shake. A whole slew of servants had to help her to the bathroom cavern so she could do her business.

But inside, Link was in an explorer's heaven. The growing Ruto had made tunnels and ledges similar to those in Jabu-Jabu, but on a larger scale. More importantly, several food packs and fairies had been hidden in the treats given to Ruto so Link would have some snacks for himself. As he set to work slaying the jellies, octorocks, and even a couple of moblins who had somehow gotten in there, he could hear Ruto mmm-ing happily.

Ruto was being massaged from the inside thanks to Link walking about in there, a feeling that was making her sway with delight. But after such a large meal, she could only think of one thing: sleep.

Perhaps tomorrow she would eat even more.
113112111211111112211.title: Fat and happy.

choices: Ruto eats Zelda
Zelda grows to be as big as Ruto to fight her
1131121112111111122111.content:
As Ruto slept off her huge meal, Link was fighting a whole flock of Octoroks. He had finished killing the last one, when he saw a Zora servant!

"What are you doing in here?" asked Link.

"The queen swallowed me by mistake" said the Zora. "I must say, I like it in here!"

"So do I" said Link.


---------

When Ruto woke up, she was just as fat as she was. But now, a new hunger arose from the fat queen of the Zoras. A hunger for people. Since she had swallowed Link, she wanted more people in her belly. So, she got up from her throne and started to eat everyone in sight. The Zoras were only too happy to feed their queen. All of the Zoras went to the same stomach as Link did.
When all of the Zoras were gone, Ruto decided to move eat Hylians. As Ruto walked, the ground shook. Ruto waddled to Lon Lon Ranch, which was small compared to her blubbery belly. She ate all of the horses, cows and the three people that worked at the ranch in two minutes flat! After she had eaten everything at the ranch, Ruto crushed the house and barn with her massive belly. Next, she waddled over to the village and ate everyone there. Who knew that Hylians would taste so good?

Ruto waddled over to Hyrule Castle next.
1131121112111111122111.title: Zora and Hylian feast

choices: Stay with Ruto's eating quest
Check up on Link, Zelda, Malon, and the others
11311211121111111221111.content:
Zelda stood at top of her castle with a look of confusion, horror, and seriousness all rolled into one.

"Ruto what in the Goddesses names are you doing?!"

The Zora Queen finished slurping down the Castle gate just as she heard Zelda's outburst.

"Feeding my hunger is all." Ruto explained with a smile on her enlarged face.

"While I don't mind you growing to the size of your domain, I do mind you feasting on the people of Hyrule!"

Ruto stomped a few feet forward, creating massive craters underneath her as well shaking the entire area of the Castle.

"If you wanted to satisfy your hunger, I would have gladly assisted you in any way possible. But not like this."

Ruto ignored Zelda for a moment as she swallowed more guards, grass, and even the trees. Suddenly the gigantic queen felt a tickle on her mile or two wide belly. Ruto realized Zelda had tried to use her magic on her, but unfortunately for the blonde it had no affect on the vastness that was Ruto.

"So you want to be next, Zelda, okay I'm fine with that." Zelda continued to attack Ruto, as the Zora Queen approached eventually covering Zelda's vision with nothing but blue skin tone.

"Do say hi to Link and the others for me." "No let me go, Ruto!" Zelda screamed as she struggled in Ruto's large fattened hand.

"Don't you mean, down you go, Zelda?" Ruto brought the princess close to her lips. "Bye bye!" she stated playfully before dropping Zelda into her mouth.

With Zelda gone, Ruto began to munch down on the princess' castle. Stone after stone, furniture, everything and anything inside the building eventually when down Ruto's mouth and straight into her stomach which expanded with the rest of her.

When she finished Ruto was now twice as big as the Castle had originally been. Yet even then her hunger was still strong as ever.

'There's still a few places I haven't visited.' Ruto ended her thoughts as she licked her lips, ecstatic with feeding her hunger and growing even larger.
11311211121111111221111.title: Zelda's nothing but a snack to Ruto

choices: ......Salad!! (kokiri forest)
......Pastry!! (Death mountain)
113112111211111112211111.content:
From across the land of hyrule can a massive roar that shook the very foundations of the kingdom. Ruto was still hungry.

She had never known hunger like this before, it was all encompassing. She no longer cared about anyone or anything even Link was starting to fall down her list of priorities while her out of control appetite climbed up the self same list.

with every step she caused a small tremor across the country side. standing in the center of everything (where lon lon ranch used to be) Ruto stood and thought a moment.

"What else can I eat? I'm so hungry and everything's getting too small to be very filling...."

With that Ruto bent down and ripped huge chunks of earth and grass out of the ground and munched it unsatisfied.
" So hungry...mph,mph,...gotta be something that can fill up my poor belly."

She looked to her left and spotted kokiri forest, she then looked to her right and saw death mountain.

MMMMMMMM....

1131121112111111122111111.content:
....Salad! Said Princess Ruto. After all the stones and furniture she was beginning to crave something a little more on the healthy side. She stepped towards the forest and her massive stomache jiggled and shook and roared all the while. When she got there she sat down and began to eat. She tore tree's out of the ground and ate them, she slurped up the grass and all of the animals too. She chomped and gorged and ate and ate and ate. The entire forest was getting leveled at an alarming rate.

Then something happened. Princess Rutp's stomach expanded and engulfed the other half of the forest, crushing links village and engulfing the deku tree. Ruto's belly grew and grew until her arms and legs couldn't touch the ground anymore. Where the forest once stood there was now an ocean of blue flesh with Ruto's head sitting at the very top of the mountain.

"I'm still hungry." Ruto sulked. "after all of that, I'm still not satisfied. and now I can't move!"

This was true, Ruto's mountain body shifted and swayed but she could not lift herself up any more due to her collosal weight.

"How am I ever going to finish my meal like this?"

Then came a little voice. "I will help you princess!"

Ruto looked down (as far down as she could) and standing on the edge of her stomach was a little Zora.

"My name is Gel. I and I alone was able to refuse your requests so as to make sure that your appetite is quenched. I admit it was wrong to refuse your orders but now I can feed you without any interference."

"How will you do that?" asked Ruto...
1131121112111111122111111.title: The end of the kokiri

choices: She grew a second head(it being Link)
She grew two more arms(Consume all of Hyrule)
11311211121111111221111111.content:
"By increasing the muscle mass in your body" said Gel

Gel cast her magic on Ruto and Ruto was able to stand up.

"Thank you" said Ruto with a smile

Gel then got to see a glimpse of Ruto's ass.

It was 100 times the size of her head, it was filled with dimples,dirt and covered in sweat

"Like my butt?" asked Ruto

Gel then got scared and said "NO!"

Ruto's smile grew larger

"Well if you like my butt, I can let you move in"

She then sat on Gel and Gel became trapped in Ruto's butt.

"LET ME OUT" screamed Gel

"No, you are going to help me get even bigger" said Ruto

"Why?"

"Because I always wanted to consume Hyrule with my fat ever since I became the Queen of the Zoras, and it's not like you can get out of there anyways"

Ruto let out a massive fart and destroyed the rest of Kokiri Forest

After arriving in Hyrule Field, she notices Death Mountain

"Ruto, if you eat that, the lava will make you enormous" said Gel

Ruto became exhausted in Kakariko village and sat down, annihilating the village with her enormous butt and farts.
