11511212211.content:
Several weeks passed as Zelda stayed as a guest at the Gerudo fortress. She spent most of this time with Nabooru, mostly just hanging out and talking. At first they spent alot of times walking around and looking around the renovated Temple, or checking in with the other Gerudo. But after a while, Nabooru only wanted to spend more and more time eating. Despite this, Nabooru asked Zelda to extend her stay longer to "continue strenghthening their bonds".

Indeed, as the weeks went by, Nabooru seemed to become lazier and lazier. She rarely could be bothered to pay attention to her royal duties, and left them all to her advisors. The female guards were all getting noticeably out of shape, and were not training very hard, but Nabooru didn't say anything. She was more considered with herself, and keeping herself fed. This took up more and more of her time, and eventually, most of the time she didnt spend sleeping (which had also gone from a normal 8 hours to a languid 12 hours a day sleeping or napping).

More time passed.

On the day before Zelda was supposed to return to Hyrule, Nabooru wanted to have a huge feast to celebrate with her "sister". It was supposed to start in the morning. Zelda got up a bit late and, worried she had offended her host, hurried to the main room. But Nabooru was apparently sleeping in as usual, and didn't wake up until noon. When she finally waddled in, Zelda almost gasped.

The months of over-indulgence had taken a heavy toll on the desert queen. At over 400 pounds, she had nearly doubled in size since Zelda had arrived. Her once pretty face had become swollen, with round cheeks, over-plumped lips, and a triple chin. Her already large breasts had become massive, the size of watermelons, but they had also become quite hefty, and had begun sagging down. They were spilling out of a tank top that had been made for her two weeks ago, but was already inadequate. Her pants weren't faring any better, and had actually begun to split from the size of her gigantic, dimpled ass cheeks. The thighs of her thick legs rubbed together as she walked. But by far, most of the weight had ended up in her enormous belly.

She now sported a truly massive paunch, hanging over the front of her pants, most of the way to her knees, and jutting out two feet in front of her. Her tank top rode up completely, revealing her vast tan gut, which her breasts were currently sloping down off of. Thick love handles spilled over her sides, and forced her meaty arms to rest at a slight angle outward. She moved extremely slowly towards the growing pile of cushions she needed to rest on, sweat glistening on her face and chest. Zelda could hear Nabooru's short, ragged breaths, even though this room was at most 30 feet from her bedroom door.

Once seated, the obese ruler lay there for several moments, trying to catch her breath. "Good morning *hunh* Zelda. Are you.. ready to *pant* celebrate?".

"Um, of course, Nabooru. Uhhh... are you sure you are up to it?" Zelda had put on quite a few pounds herself during this time. But not anywhere near the 200 pounds Nabooru had gained. Princess Zelda was now a fat 210 pounds, with most of the weight continuing to go into her increasingly wide bottom, though she had now grown a noticeable potbelly herself. All of her dresses had to be re-tailored to contain her, and some days she wore some of Nabooru's older clothes (though they were mostly too large in the chest and waist, and a bit tight in the rear). With all the food around, and constant feasting, Zelda might have put on more, but she occasionally continued to take walks herself. She was also a bit put off by the way Nabooru messily over-ate constantly. Zelda didn't think it was a good idea for a ruler to make such a greedy pig of oneself in front of subjects or guests. But Zelda was too polite to say anything to Nabooru.

"Of course I *urp* am..." the redhead replied, licking her overly full lips in anticipation of the coming feast. Then she lazily waved one thick arm, and dozens of servants began bringing food in to the two rulers. Nabooru greedily grabbed the first thing brought to her, a large tray of meat resting in a thick gravy. She grabbed one slice and dangled it above her mouth, causing the dripping gravy to spill on her cushions, top, and cleavage before shoving the whole thing in her mouth and reaching for another. Her other hand grabbed a slice of chocolate cake from a tray that had been set down nearby. She stuffed the whole thing in her mouth, smearing chocolate across her face in the process. "Mmrrf, sho good," she mumbled, then went back to alternating between meat and cake. Occasionally she would take long droughts from a jug of thick, honey tea.

Zelda did her best to ignore the queen's gluttony, and enjoy the food herself. As usual, the plump Hylian was quickly caught up in the delicious food, and ended up eating far more than she intended to.

As the afternoon wore on, Zelda took a break, as she had become more than uncomfortably full. She had eaten more than usual and had to stop. She looked over at the bloated Nabooru, who was still shoveling food in her fat face. She was a complete mess, with food smeared all over her face. Large glops of chocolate had fallen into her bountiful cleavage. Occasionally she would stop to belch loudly, or let a fart rip.

By the evening, she had slowed down a bit, and her breathing had become slow and labored. New dishes continued to be brought in, everything from bacon and sausage, to pies, burritos and whole chickens and turkeys. Zelda got a second wind, but it didn't last long. Mostly she just picked a piece off here and there to nibble on.

"*UUURRRRPPP* ishn't thish .... sho *wheeze* good Zelda?" Nabooru gasped in between bites from a large burito. It was the second plate of 12 she had cleared off. Just then, the lazy Gerudo farted several times. "More!" she shouted.

"Of course," Zelda replied, though she hadnt gotten a chance at any of them. She eyed Nabooru's vast girth, filled to bursting with all the junky foods she had eaten that day, and covered with bits of food. "Maybe I should be leaving now though..."
11511212211.title: Nabooru has put on a lot of weight.

115112122111.content:
"What?" asked Nabooru, food spilling from her mouth in dismay "You're leaving? Already?"

"I have been here awhile, and I really should head back to my own kingdom. But I thank you ever so much for your hospitality, and--"

"Oh, please stay!"

"I mustn't, I simply can't."

"But why? We've had such a wonderful time!"

"I just...can't stay around here."

"Ah! I'm so sorry."

"...I--...what?"

"I understand now how uncomfortable you must have been feeling all this time."

"Oh, well, I wouldn't say uncomfortable..."

"The way I've been gorging, relentlessly."

"I...well, yes. I thank you for your understanding, but I have felt a little--"

"I can only imagine how puny and sickly I've made you feel."

"WHAT?"

"I understand, though. Your people are less...robust. Less hearty. It's fine! I understand that, used as you are to your own, bland recipes, how are cuisine must be too strong for you."

"I can handle it perfectly well--"

"And it must be dreadfully humiliating to see me grow ever more regal and distinguished, while you remain so petite, so seemingly irrelevant..."

"I am not that petite, anymore, I assure you! I--"

"So, I am sorry. I understand completely why you would want to get out from under my shadow, so to speak. I can see why I would make you feel inadequate and self-concious."

Zelda's head throbbed with anger. How could Nabooru be so smug!

"I'll have you know that I am perfectly regal-looking."

"Oh, my dear friend, no need to lie! I can scarcely even see you, thin as you are!"

Zelda's head throbbed. More. Finally, her developed manners breaking beneath her developed ego, she shouted...
115112122111.title: Nabooru's Needling

choices: Look in on Zelda's weight gain process
Stay and watch Nabooru's weight gain
1151121221111.content:
To put it simple there were a few unspoken rules in Hyrule and unless one was ignorant or just looking for trouble one did not break them. Nabooru in this case had failed to treat fellow Royalty with the proper respect they deserve.

Zelda being the victim here was not going to stand by and let this...desert rat (for lack of a better word, she thought) insult her or her people.

Clenching her fist shut, Zelda brought said fist down upon the table with a loud "thack"! The sound of fatty fist meaning wood was apparently loud enough to shut the big gloating mouth of Nabooru.

Zelda then proceeded to pointed directly at the heavy desert queen with her other free hand.

"Fine so be it. I'll show you! I will be the biggest, most regal ruler Hryule has ever seen!"

"Tch..." grumbled Nabooru as she swallowed a portion of chicken.

"Nabooru you don't want to mess with me...you have no idea what I can do when I set my mind to something."

A bit of a smirk played on Zelda's lips as Nabooru tore through the rest of her chicken, spitting out the bones in a very unlady-like way.

"Zelda I eclipse you now. If we go through with this challenge of yours I will still win effortlessly." Nabooru made sure to stress dominance on her final word.

"You can't beat me...but I'll humor you. Four months. That's all the time you have to outweigh me, of course I myself will be gaining more and more as well so if you're really serious I suggest you put a lot of effort into it."

In an almost mocking fashion Nabooru let out a loud uncomfortable belch.

"See you in four months time then, twiggy."

"Yes...see you then."

Nabooru was almost shocked at how calmly Zelda had lifted herself from the table and began to walk away, compared to how angry she had just been just a few minutes ago.

Suddenly the Hylian princess stopped in her tracks before looking back at the beyond bloated desert ruler. The confident smirk from before returning ten-fold.

"By the way...the next time we meet with one another you might want to hold this contest outside. Because there's no way you're getting me through that small a doorway. See you then."

Zelda ended her bold statement with a passing wave of her hand before continuing to walk out of the dinning room. Nabooru stood still watching the doorway, a deep glare in her eyes, not pleased with Zelda's stunning exit.
1151121221111.title: The challenge is laid down

choices: With Malon's help Zelda decides to stuff herself with food and lots of milk!
Saria mentions that the lost woods may have something useful...
11511212211111.content:
"So you basically told her to go to hell?"

"Well I didn't exactly say that." Zelda chuckled slightly as she corrected the redhead ranch girl, Malon.

"I would've..." The smallest of the three the forest sage Saria casually mentioned much to the surprise of the other ladies.

"What?" she wondered out loud puzzled yet slightly amused at their reactions.

"Anyway...I've heard from Link about the type of woman Nabooru is. Doesn't sound like she's the type to go easy on something like this. She'll want to beat you for sure, ya know.?"

The farm girl was correct in that Nabooru wasn't about to allow Zelda to cruise to victory. The woman was no doubt willing to swell herself up to the same massive size as her pride.

"I know and understand that but she insulted me and my people. I will not stand for that."

Malon and Saria simply nodded understanding the reasoning behind Zelda's challenge to Nabooru. Malon being a hylian instantly sided with Zelda and while Saria was from the forest she knew she'd do the same if someone insulted the kokiri.

"So how exactly are you going to do this?" Malon curiously asked afterwards the minds of the three women began to fill with thoughts and possible ideas...
11511212211111.title: Some small talk and a bit of planning

choices: Two days later Saria returns having found something
Meanwhile Nabooru is preparing her own form of gaining
115112122111112.content:
"Well..."

The royal woman and ranch girl turned over in the direction of Saria awaiting from the smaller girl had to say.

"Unless you want to go the conventional route of stuffing yourself silly maybe there's a chance I can find something useful over in The Lost Woods."

"Really?" Zelda questioned, her curiosity peaking.

"All sorts of things go missing in those woods. The Great Deku Tree once told me that legend states they come from all around Hyrule wither that's true or not I have no idea. All I know is that I've seen some stuff in there that's clearly foreign to our village."

"Worth a shot." Malon stated clearly willing to give Saria's plan a chance.

Zelda meanwhile thought it over asking how much time would the green-haired girl need to complete her search?

"Give me a day, two tops. Trust me if there's anything there I'll find it. If I need any help I'll get Link to give me a hand but I should be alright on my own."

After a nod of approval from the princess the forest sage bid her farewell to her two friends promising she'd return with something of value.

"I wonder what she'll find?" Malon thought out loud.

"I haven't the slightest idea yet if anyone can find value in that forest it's her."

Zelda smiled she had all the confidence in the world in Saria.
115112122111112.title: Look within the woods for help

choices: ...a message from Zelda
...something else
11511212211112.content:
Upon Zelda's exit, Nabooru found herself, much to her dismay, intimidated. The Princess had a reputation for a regal air, and she had flexed every commanding inch of it. But Nabooru was no slouch when it came to strength of will or personality...there was only one option. Become a sprawling mountain of flesh, and leave Zelda feeling like an anthill in her shadow.

She immediately called for more food, and her subjects enthusiastically obeyed. And when their shifts were over, they merely traded out with others who would feed the queen. Their ruler would take no breaks from food anymore, it seemed.

Although Nabooru made no efforts to do anything but eat and drink the most decadent and rich food available, word quickly spread the lands of the Gerudo of the challenge. And the citizenry rallied to their queen's cause...it became a matter of national pride.

Many began to request, and were granted, audiences with the queen, simply to see how much she had grown...and some, who sought more than one audience in a single day, would swear she had grown between visits. All that was required to see the queen was a donation of food, or a recipe. The more fattening, the better. And those who came to see her got very creative indeed, with concocting the most syrupy, greasy, fatty foods imaginable.

Nabooru, her gluttony now fueled by and joined with her sense of pride and her fiery temper, was growing fast. Her belly soon began to, more than merely rest on, spill over her thick legs. Her rolls blossomed thicker and fuller, and her folds grew deeper.

Within the first of the four months, she had more than doubled her weight. But then, bad news arrived...
11511212211112.title: Eating, growing, eating, growing...

choices: Nabooru begins to feast at an even faster level
Gerudo are sent to Hyrule Castle to spy on Zelda
115112122111121.content:
A month had passed since the contest had began and Nabooru eating away at the pasta that filled many bowls to the brim. One by one they were brought out and placed by the queen's side and in almost some sort of quick rhythm were all emptied rather easily and quickly.

Closing in at half a ton of weight Nabooru bleached loudly as her servants took away the empty dishes. After her meal the massive Gerudo ruler sank into a more relaxing position on her new reinforced throne.

But before she could doze off and while amusing rubbing her extended belly she was interrupted by voice of a messenger woman asking permission to enter the queen's chamber.

Nabooru allowed her passage into the room, asking news the young woman brought with her in turn the girl responded by saying it was from Princess Zelda.

Mentally the desert ruler laughed to herself, a rather confident smile began to form on her plump lips as the young woman approached with the specially crafted letter.

'That girl has no idea of how big I've become or of how big I will ultimately be. Maybe she realized that it was a fool's dream to try to out weight me and is now throwing in the towel!'

Nabooru's confidence grew with each step the messenger took toward her massive bulk. Taking the letter, after the young woman had scaled a few of the queen's stomach rolls, Nabooru began to reading away silently.

'Now Zelda tell me all about your defeat...'

The messenger girl was just about to excuse herself, her duty now done, when she nearly floored by Nabooru's sudden outburst.

"What the hell? This isn't a letter of defeat!"

Confused the woman asked her queen what was the problem and what exactly it was she meant.

"This...this letter, it was suppose to be about Zelda admitting defeat to me!" outraged Nabooru flung the piece of finely made paper at the ground below.

"Instead she says she's having a blast gaining more weight then ever before! Says she's never felt more alive and is enjoying letting it all hang out! Her gut...her blasted gut she means is already a sphere of so much blubber she broke her own bed less then a week ago.

Her fat ass can't fit through many of doorways, her legs and arms are each the size of a damn redwood...and..." Nabooru teeth seem to cringe and crack as she spat out what was coming next.

"Her breasts are nearly the size of her huge gut, Argh!" Looking down at her already thicker pair of breasts Nabooru growled in frustration.

"In one month Zelda's already bigger then me, apparently is well above the thousand pound mark. I can't I will not believe it!" Nabooru yelled, her rage now reaching a boiling point.

Noticing the letter on the ground the messenger girl made her way over while the queen continued to rattle and rumble on her throne.

Reading where Nabooru had left off the young woman gasped as it appeared that there was more to tell.

"Um milady it seems there's more..." she said rather meekly before once again handing over the dreadful letter.

"Let me see!" yelled Nabooru.

A few minutes passed before she finished reading it completely.

Her previous look of anger seem to give way to a more fearful look and while she hated to admit it Nabooru had once again felt imitation by Zelda.

"It's...impossible...it's been only one month. How? How can she weigh..."

"Yes?" questioned the messenger girl.

"A Ton and a half! Three thousand pounds of pure blubber!" yelled out Nabooru in disbelief that nearly crossed over into hysteria.

"What? But that's..."

"She had to have someone finish this letter for her since she has already taken up the entire space of her room and then some and is awaiting completion of a grander feeding location."

To say Nabooru was shocked would be the understatement of the year, her mind raced with multiple thoughts but none seem to grasp how Zelda had obtain so much weight in so little time especially when she herself had been eating, drinking, and sleeping for the past month.

'How how did she do it?' Nabooru wondered.
115112122111121.title: ...a message from Zelda

choices: ...as big as the letter said.
...even bigger than the letter said.
1151121221111212.content:
After some moments spent swearing up a storm, Nabooru calmed down enough to resume the only two activities she cared about anymore: eating, and plotting.

"It's impossible." she growled, through a mouthful of greasy meat "I'd be impressed if she was even a little bit heavier than me, with the rate (chomp) I've been eating, but this? More than (munch) three times my size? That brat is cheating...she's either lying (slurp) in this letter, or worse, and more likely really, she's using some sort of damn magic. Either way, I need to know. I want you to arrange (gulp) a unit of our best scouts to head to Hyrule, and peek in on the princess, unseen. If she's not as big as she says, great. But if she is? Find out how she (smack) did it, and if the means are something that can be stolen, bring them to me! We cannot let some spoiled little girl eclipse me!"

Within an hour, three Gerudo scouts set out on horseback, galloping under the order of their gluttonous queen. As they neared Hyrule castle, they got off their steeds, and scampered across rooftops, past guards, and into shadows. Eventually, they peered into the throne room, but they found it empty...except for the throne, which looked like it had been crushed under a massive weight. A bad sign, they wagered. Then, they worked their way, along the castle walls, to where they could see the large, beautiful courtyard. And sitting amongst the grass was the princess, naked as sin, and large as hell. She was, by the looks of it...
1151121221111212.title: Supersized Spying

choices: The Gerudo Strike!
Impa surprisingly stops them in time
11511212211112121.content:
Yup sure enough Zelda sat there, well more like lay there considering all her new bulk, taking up a sizable amount of the already vast courtyard. The spies figured it was the only place large enough, for the time being, to house such a massive woman.

"The Queen shall not be pleased with this revelation." whisper one girl to whom appeared to be their leader.

"Indeed, but now that we have confirmed her weight it is time we find out what sort of method she is using to rob our Queen out of victory."

The trio continued to watch silently in hopes they would spot something out of the ordinary but nothing came...until the girl at the right of the leader heard the creaking sound of the metallic gates to the courtyard open up obviously to allow someone passage inside.

Blending into the shadows they stood still watching a figure enter and seemingly approach the hill-sized princess. Admittedly they were all amazed that the person had not been freaked out by such a ridiculous sight, perhaps the individual was somehow accustom to seeing the Princess this thick?

Remaining ever quiet they spied onward as the mystery individual was revealed to be a woman but not just any woman. This particular girl had on a simple white dress, a pair of worn-in brown boots, ocean-blue eyes, and flowing red hair. There was only one woman in all of Hyrule that could match such a description and of course that was the ranch-girl Malon.

Whistling to herself Malon causally strolled up toward Zelda, the princess relaxing in the sun and her bulk. In her hand was a simple sack that seem to be filled to the brim with something. From their vantage point it made guessing what was in the sack a bit of a mystery to the Gerudo spies.

"Enjoying ourselves, Princess?" called out Malon as she looked far into the air in hopes of making out the blubber surrounded face of the noble woman.

For a moment there was silence until a slight giggle was heard, which caused Malon to laugh slightly as she watched the fatty "hill" shake as if it were caught in an earthquake.

"Oh my yes." responded Zelda ever so happily. Malon couldn't quite see what with the sun in her eyes but she was sure Zelda was smiling widely.

"Well that's a relief and here I thought you'd decide to cut your gaining now that you're as big as you are."

"Perish the thought, my friend. This is only the end of the first month there are still three more to go. At the end of it all I may very well be as wide as my castle if not more! There is no way I can lose."

Malon continued smiling, the young woman could practically feel the confidence radiate around Zelda. Glancing over at the sack she remembered why she had come over in the first place and why Zelda had asked for her assistance a day after she returned from the desert.

Rising the sack into the air Malon called out once more, "I brought what you wanted."

"Excellent! Would you be a dear and climb up my girth so I may have an easier time drinking."

That last word brought curiosity to the desert spies.

"Um...yeah about that..." Malon whistled a few times to herself as she turned slightly away blushing a tad crimson.

"No offense Zelda but you're um...how do I put this...nude!" There she had blurted it out even if it was a bit higher pitched that she expected, "I'm all for helping you out and I'm really honored you asked me to...but I'm not sure if I would feel comfortable climbing your um fat."

Once again Malon felt her cheeks flare up from embarrassment.

"Oh...well I suppose I do see your point. Well no matter Impa should be back soon with a specially made dress that will accommodate my ever growing weight so why not stay for a bit."

Malon thought it over and simply shrugged her shoulders, "Sure...why not and thanks for understanding." she added in at the end.

"Of course. You know we've been at each other's throats in the past that it's nice to cooperate every once and while." stated Zelda with childish glee.

"Yeah it's not so bad...pretty cool actually. Plus you're the one gaining not me so that's definitely a plus in my book. I wouldn't mind a few extra pounds but not that Much." Malon stated with a laugh as she placed the sack on the grassy floor beneath her before relaxing onto ground with a slight stretch.

High above the Gerudo figured now would be the best chance to strike and steal what ever was in that sack of Malon's. If it's contents were indeed the source of Zelda's vast and inhuman weight gain then Nabooru would be so proud of their accomplishment and would surely pull Zelda to shame.

Preparing themselves they took one last breath...
11511212211112121.title: The letter wasn't a lie

choices: She looks inside.
Before she can, they notice Impa pursuing them on horseback!
115112122111121211.content:
Leaping out from their vantage point, they darted across the sides of the courtyard walls, and then pounced onto the massive Princess, using the immense royalty as a mere cushion. As Zelda let out an "OOF!" at the sensation of three women landing deep into her softness, Malon let out an even less refined "Guh?" of confusion. And while the three Gerudo scouts lost valuable fractions of a seconds trying to get off of Zelda (the Princess was less bouncy than they had hoped, and more just plain pillowy), they still managed to swipe the sack from the startled farm woman before she really responded. And with that, they bolted for it, deciding to simply leave as quickly as they could through the castle's front gates now that their secrecy was blown anyway. As they fled, every countless inch of Zelda's wobbling, gelatinous body turned beet-red with anger.

"Nabooru..." she hissed through clenched teeth.

"Huh. This isn't good." remarked Malon breezily.

Meanwhile, the scouts whipped through the castle like leaves in a storm. And though ever guard they passed promptly gave chase, they were less naturally nimble, and were weighed down with armor. The Gerudo scouts, however, approached attire of any sort with a "less is more" philosophy.

And, in a shockingly short time, they reached the front gates, and found to their delight that it was open, saving them the hassle of having to climb over it. But their relief dampened when they realized that it was open to let Impa in. It took Impa as much time as it took the scouts to pass her to decide to give chase.

The scouts grimaced, panting, finally reaching their limits as they continued their mad dash through the civilian streets surrounding the castle. They had heard things about Impa, and didn't cherish her catching them.

Eventually, they reached their horses, and mounted and rode off at a breakneck speed.

"Finally!" exhaled Alinah the rookie of the group, a highly skilled but somewhat immature young lady "That was more intense than I was expecting."

"Indeed." replied Khala, the leader, coolly "But the important thing is, we have the sack. Yes?"

"Yes" assured the third woman, Denkaru, who was the one actually carrying the bounty.

"Say, think you can sneak a peek inside while we ride?" pleaded the rookie "It is a long enough way back, and I'm dying to know what goodies are inside!"

"Alright, let's see..."
115112122111121211.title: Stealin' the Goods

choices: Khala decides to toss the sack at him and make a quick getaway
Khala decides to make a quick getaway sack in hand
1151121221111212112.content:
Giddy with anticipation Alinah watched as Denkaru (or Den for short) was a moment away from opening the treasured sack but as most thieves know no crime is ever easy and this time was no different.

Ali and Den shared a simultaneous gasp as they watched a sphere of shadow energy shoot just pass Denkaru's head.

With a near silent growl their leader Khala turned over best she could to get a clearer picture of who she already knew was after them.

Sure enough it was Impa on horseback riding one of Zelda's noble steeds and boy could the horse run.

"No way!" exclaimed a now slightly panicked Alinah. "Leader if she catches us we're done for."

Khala said nothing instead turned over toward Denkaru, extending her right arm in the process.

"Pass it to me. This bounty must reach Lady Nabooru. I shall move ahead the two of you deal with the woman behind us."

Den merely nodded before quickly passing over the sack toward her superior.

"Let's go." With a shared nod Denkaru and Alinah forced their horses to turn around and rushed toward Impa's direction. A move they hoped the woman hadn't planned on...

Continuing onward Khala could hear the sounds of battle behind her but she had no time to look back instead focusing on the mission and putting more distance between them and herself confident she would make it back with her prize.

Suddenly she heard the galloping of a very nearby horse. Khala smiled half-expecting the two women under her command to be rushing back to return to her side after a flawless victory.

Yet she would be surprised once more as an arrow shot through the air and landed a few feet in front of her horse's path forcefully bringing the animal to a startled halt.

"What? Damn you, move!" she yelled at the frighten and recovering animal.

"You' know you're lucky I don't believe in animal cruelty and I'm as good a shot as I am."

The voice wasn't familiar to the desert woman but after she turn her head to her side she came to see her new adversary. The fabled Hero of Time himself, Link, riding his own horse straight in her direction.

"Ah...him..." she mumbled silently, once again urging her horse to move.

"Give it up, lady, and hand over what you stole from Princess Zelda and my friend Malon. I'm warning you...don't force my hand."
1151121221111212112.title: Impa isn't the only one after the thieves...

choices: The spies are forced into talking about their mission
Zelda decides for the spies to be fatten as a punishment
115112122111121212.content:
The desert trio prepared themselves one last time but just as they were going to leap in and surprise both Zelda and Malon the left most girl felt a quick tap on her shoulder.

Surprised she turn over to just in time to hear a foreign voice from the same shadows that surrounded them.

"Peekaboo..."

The next thing the girl heard was the popping of someone's knuckles before a mighty right hand connected with the front line of her jaw knocking the unprepared girl straight to the floor.

"What?" exclaimed the leader just before hearing the third spy grunted in pain, an armored boot had connected with her rib-cage effectively knocking the air and the balance out of her.

Down below Malon's eyes snapped open as she heard some sort of commotion come from above. Snapping up to her feet the ranch girl was just about to alert Zelda of what she had heard when a sharp yell surprised her and awoke a previously resting Zelda.

The leader of the spies had been flung forcefully off the balcony and now found herself falling through the air before landing at top of Zelda's bulk.

The princess let out a gasp as the woman sled off the Royal's girth and tumbled onto the ground with a thud.

"Uh?" wondered Malon altering her course and taking a step toward the body on the ground. But before she could get any closer a cloud of smoke and shadow appeared in front of the young woman nearly startling her to the ground.

Zelda's faithful guardian, Impa, then showed herself to the surprised redhead. In each arm she held an unconscious spy from the desert.

"Wow..." mumbled Malon in pure disbelief.

"Impa what is the meaning of this? Who are they?"

Prior to turning her attention toward the heavy-set princess Impa placed the two spies down on the ground and snapped her finger causing a shadow-like rope to bind the two desert women forcefully together.

"These three are spies from the desert, dear Zelda. I highly suspect they were sent here on orders by their Queen."

That was all Zelda needed to hear, a plotting look in her eyes.
115112122111121212.title: Impa stops the Gerudo trio from making a move

choices: Zelda orders the spies to be fatten to a notable high size
Sticking it to Nabooru the spies are fatten into blubberly blobs
1151121221111212121.content:
"Welcome back"

The leader of the spies felt her head still spin as her ears picked up on the royal tone of the princess. Something was binding her down, that something was the shadow chains Impa had crafted to keep the gerudo trio powerless and without any means of quick escape.

"As the princess stated now you will us everything about your mission." Impa demanded with a sharp glare and quick crack of her knuckles.

"I will say nothing to your lap dog." The leader spat out in anger.

"Come on do the smart thing and just answer her." Malon added in innocently.

"As if someone like me would ever listen to a simple farm girl. You know nothing you...ugh!"

To Impa's silent surprise and Zelda's vocal gasp the spy leader soon found her lips tasting the bottom of Malon's boot after the so called simple farm girl planted a firm straight kick to the woman's face."

"Well done" Impa complimented the redhead before turning her attention back to the thief. "Now speak otherwise I do much worse then the young woman did or I feed you directly to Lady Zelda."

Zelda playing her part well smiled with a quick lick of her plump lips. That was all that needed to be done to get the woman to talk...

"It appears I've gotten under Nabooru's skin." Zelda boasted proudly.

"So what are you going to do with them?" Malon asked her contempt for the leader of the thieves still very much present.

"Why fatten them right up of course. Show Nabooru I am not one to be joking."
1151121221111212121.title: Speak! Now!

choices: All of Hyrule is trying to gain weight thinking it's a little trend
Nabooru sent a note to Zelda
1151121221111212122.content:
Zelda ironically thought of the spies that came from a very fat woman, to see another fat woman, and they were women themselves."Lets just give them more proof of my fattening. O.K., if they fatten up the queen of the dessert will know I've grown big, if the letter hadn't been enough proof. Fatten them up and don't stop til' they're half the size of me, then try and send them back to the dessert where from they came, but after you give me the clothes.", Zelda told Impa as she replied with a,"Yes your majesty!", and gave her the xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxl clothes she needed, and they fit. Then they sent the spies to the kitchen and got out all of there most fattening foods and started stuffing. After just a few hours already the spies were half the size of their queen.
Meanwhile the princess had her clothes put on, and Malon as her feet sunk into the yard thick fat she poured the special fattening lon lon milk that was about a gallon into her mouth. Then started giving her normal food, mostly a lot of bread to soak up the milk and expand. "Wow, Malon, that milk and food seem to already be affecting me!", the extremely obese princess of hy"belly"(giggle) gained about 750 pounds,"That was pretty fattening stuff you gave me, huh?" Malon replied with a smile with an "ugh..." and a sigh. Malon walked back to the farm as she needed to go make more milk and Zelda noticed that Malon gained about 50 pounds since last seen and Impa came over to Zelda to talk about some problems with Hyrule.
1151121221111212122.title: Fatty trispy

choices: Nabooru is half the size of Zelda
Nabooru is @#$%ing huge!
11511212211112121222.content: A mere 30 minutes after our last chapter, a Hylian Soilder approached Zelda and her massive girth with a letter, and it said,
11511212211112121222.title: Nabooru sent a note to Zelda

choices: Just over a thousand pounds!
A ton of blubber if not more!!!
115112122111122.content:
Nabooru sat, as usual as it was for her nowadays, on her reinforced throne as she slurped down a chain of greasy cheese-filled sausages her tongue traveling around her slightly bloated lips sucking up any cheese filling that had spilled upon them.

The first month of constant weight gaining had passed and the blubbery desert queen was rather pleased with the turnout. Nearing half a ton Nabooru ordered for more food and additional wine.

But before her requests could be granted a messenger girl came running into the queen's room. Nabooru welcomed the slightly plump girl expecting to be gifted with yet another recipe but not this time...

"What the hell is this?!" Nabooru shouted, causing her form to jiggle for a few minutes time.

"It is as it says my queen, the Zora have gotten word of the challenge between you and Lady Zelda and wish to partake in it's outcome..."

The messenger girl could feel her voice begin to crack as she ended her words and could only imagine the response from Nabooru.

Preparing for the worst the young woman found herself surprised when she heard the hearty laugh from her queen.

"So the Zoras wish to jump into our little bet then? Hah so be it...I will still be ten-times bigger then their representative."

If one word could sum up her demeanor it was "confidence", the desert ruler's smirked seem to be the type that would require surgery to remove but before her win could be set in stone the messenger woman spoke up once more.

"Um...with all due respect milady...you might want to continue reading."

Curious Nabooru did just that...

After a sharp gasp a rather awkward silence was formed as the queen's jaw fell and seem ready to disconnect itself from mouth. A moment or two passed before her outburst would seem to rattle the entire room's foundation.

"Princess Ruto is the Rep? And she already weights...!"
115112122111122.title: The Zoras step up to the challenge

choices: Nothing to do, just keep eating!
Hatch a plan.
1151121221111222.content:
The last time Nabooru had seen Princess Ruto, she was already immense, a small hill of impossibly smooth, wet skin. She was well on her way to being more whale than fish!

Zoras, as far as Nabooru could tell, had a natural affinity for piling on untold pounds...it was only their constant swimming which kept most of them so sleek and thin. But Ruto, who had grown decadently lazy and insatiable, had blown up like a big blue balloon. And that was without even trying!

Nabooru struggled to keep her left eye from twitching.

After a few moments, she regained her calm, and closed her eyes, almost meditatively. She was still certain that she could beat Zelda...THAT woman had accepted the challenge out of anger, but no doubt she would run out of steam long before Nabooru, who determination and appetite were made of sterner stuff. But Ruto? Now, there was a princess to worry about. If Ruto had grown so corpulent just through being a fatass at heart, Nabooru dreaded what the Zora would be capable of with actual motivation...because fish-girl was arrogant and stubborn enough to treat this challenge as seriously as all-out war.

What to do?
1151121221111222.title: Big Blue

choices: Meanwhile, with the hungry, husky,  hulking, humongous, hefty, hedonist Nabooru

choices: "We, of the Gerudo Tribe, will gladly accept your offer."
"Would you mind staying for a while so we can talk this over a bit more?"
"It's just too bad there are way too many flaws with your plan."
11512.content:
Well, this was a surprise. Princess Zelda herself was paying the Gerudo a visit? Nabooru was a tad shocked, since no arrangements were made beforehand. This meant one of two things: either there was some sort of emergency, or the Hylian princess just decided a surprise visit was the best course of action to take when meeting with a fellow ruler. If the latter were true, maybe it was a way to create a more casual air?

"Let her in," Nabooru said.

The guard nodded and ran back to the door as fast as her pudgy frame would allow. By the time she got all the way over, she was huffing and wheezing as though she'd taken a jog around four different corridors. With a gront, she pulled the door open and signaled for the new guest to come in.

Upon seeing Zelda enter the throne room, Nabooru was able to tell the latter assumption was correct, thank the gods. She was walking in a dignified way, her posture upright and without slouch, yet her slow pace indicated she had nothing of urgency to talk about. Relieved at figuring out the true nature of the visit, the Gerudo matriarch took stock of the Hylian.

Zelda was all the woman she had been during the fight against Ganondorf. Even after the past year of rebuilding and stress, it was clear she hadn't lost a single bit of toned physique. Her flat stomach didn't make a single bulge in her dress, a sight no Gerudo had seen for months now. The blonde's chest was also smaller than the average tribe member's, but for a woman of her stature, it was sizable enough. While it couldn't be seen under her dress, the lack of a rear presence through the skirt indicated that it was also small and firm.

Looking further up, it seemed as though Zelda had even developed a bit of visible muscle in her arms. Not enough, to be immediately obvious, but her biceps and triceps were somewhat visible now. Her face was also still as sharp and thin as one would expect from the leader of a country. While she had never seen Princess Zelda mad before, Nabooru got the feeling her smooth, yet still angular visage would do well in intimidating foes.

Upon arriving just before the foot of the throne, Princess Zelda kneeled and bowed her head, the ultimate show of respect from one ruler to another. Nabooru nearly whistled at the act. It took a great deal of maturity and devotion towards diplomacy to do something like that. For what other reason could Zelda be here for?

"Queen Nabooru," the blonde began. "Have you been well?"

"Yes, I have. Thank you for asking, but, please lift your head up." Zelda complied, and the former thief smiled. "There we go. It just felt a little weird, seeing you do something so humbling. But enough of that. Tell me, Princess, what brings you all the way out to such a remote region?" Using formalities was still something the young queen was getting used to, but it was getting easier and easier the more she did it.

Zelda went from kneeling to standing in an instant, thanks to her lithe figure (which Nabooru couldn't help but note with just a touch of envy). Judging from the smile on the young woman's face, and the brightness in those azure eyes,it was clear she was glad the Gerudo queen was being so cordial. She chose a very good time to arrive.

"Well, Your Highness, as you know, in the eyes of most of the world, Hyrule has lost its standing as a benevolent territory. Even with Ganondorf's rule deposed, many other nations still view us as being a corrupt place that may invade them at any given moment. They greatly overestimate the number of Ganondorf sympathizers, and it's gotten to a point where trade relations and diplomacy could crumble apart," Zelda explained.

"That does sound like quite the predicament," Nabooru said, leaning back in her chair. Her flabby gut was only made more obvious as its full, un-constrained expanse was revealed to the world. "You think there's something the Gerudo can do to help?"

"Yes, I believe so," the Hylian nodded. "I'm sorry if this sounds rude at all, but many have been astounded by your people's ability to completely change their society into one that no longer relies on...unorthodox methods of gaining wealth."

"Oh, you flatter me, Princess!" Nabooru's belly jostled as she let out a booming laugh at the sentiment. "Don't worry, you don't have to dance around the fact we were a bunch of thieves."

"Y-yes, sorry, Your Highness. But it's a major turning point for your nation, and I would like to propose a deal, if you'd be willing to hear it."

"Please save your breath, Princess. I think I understand what this deal you're talking about is: you want to provide aid to our nation in order to help with our recovery. It'll show the Hylian people are willing to support former enemies that are willing to reform, and as a result, will help to boost the overall opinion of your country from other leaders. Which will inevitably help with trade negotiations and lessening the likelihood of war. Have I gotten the basic gist of this?"

While Zelda hadn't changed her largely stoic expression, her face was red as a tomato, causing Nabooru to smirk. Even as a relatively new ruler, she understood how embarrassing it could be to have someone see through you so easily. Resting her flabby chin on her pudgy hand, the Gerudo matriarch leaned on the arm of the throne as she pondered her answer.

"Princess Zelda, I must commend you on your devotion to your plan. You've trekked through the desert, taken time out of your busy schedule, and have bared yourself to me in complete honesty. I appreciate your willingness to be upfront with all this, for sure."
11512.title: Princess Zelda's Visit

choices: Zelda makes an order even larger than Nabooru's! Can't look weak.
Zelda orders something much smaller. The obesity rate around here...
Their prospective meal gets interrupted!
115122.content:
"Huh? O-oh, yes, of course," Zelda said with a nod. "I would never ask you to make a decision right away. You haven't even heard the terms. Of course I'd be happy to be in your company."

"Please, Princess, there's no need to get so flustered," Nabooru heaved her hefty body off the throne, with no small amount of effort, and began walking over to her guest. Her dark stomach and chest jiggled with every step she took. "I''m not offended. After getting past all the trouble our former idiotic King put you through, it's expected that everyone'll make a few mistakes. So please, be a bit more cheerful, okay?"

Zelda gave a genuine smile to the overweight queen, her happiness evident. Seeing that face re-ignited Nabooru's respect for the Hylian. So non-judgmental, so eager to help her people. And, from what she said earlier, the Gerudo as well. How could Nabooru not listen to a proposal from someone who was willing to help two nations at once? While there was the obvious benefit Hyrule would gain as a result, it was an idea most people would balk at, especially when there was no official alliance in place.

"I think politics can wait a bit, though." Nabooru said. "After all, your journey must've been a hard one. You traveled from Hyrule through the Gerudo Desert to see me, no way you're in good condition now. And I'm not the type of person who'd ignore that in my guests."

"Queen Nabooru, don't worry. I was well-cared for during my trip, it's not like-"

Gurrrgle

A large, thunderous noise emanated from the blonde's gut and filled the room. For a moment, the Gerudo had no idea where it came from, but upon looking at Zelda's smoldering red face, they had their answer. Nabooru clicked her tongue.

"Princess Zelda, you're starving, aren't you? I bet you haven't eaten a thing all day!'

Zelda shuffled her feet, obviously mortified at such an improper bodily function.

"W-well, no, I haven't, but it was just because there were more important things on my mind. Food-"

"Is one of the most important aspects of life! Without it, we'd all keel over and turn to dust. I've made it my mission to make sure no one in my kingdom goes hungry, and as long as you're here, you're on that list. We need to get you fed, fast!"

Nabooru grabbed one of Zelda's slender arms, pulling her along into the hallway, the dining hall set firmly in her mind's eye. The Hylian, for her part, could only gawk in surprise by the sheer determination the queen was exhibiting in her self-imposed race. Was not eating anything for a while a problem? She'd been planning on having dinner, but there was really no time to have breakfast or lunch, being in a wagon for most of the day, and all.

Then again, while Zelda was hoping politics would be the first order of discussion, it wasn't as though having a meal with the leader of the country she was trying to curry favor with would be a bad thing. If anything, thinking about it a bit more, it might actually be advantageous. After all, eating with others almost always led to socialization, and warming Nabooru up a bit with some small talk would help to bring a more amicable air to things. It wasn't as though she was going to make any alternate suggestions; not showing respect to other figures of authority and seeming like you knew better with something as trivial as "when to eat" didn't send a good message.

Within another minute, the two young women arrived in front of a large set of oaken door. Upon Nabooru's signal, the two guards stationed in front went up and pushed them open, revealing the massive hall inside. The matriarch of the Gerudo tribe smiled with satisfaction as she saw Zelda's jaw drop the moment her eyes took in the sights.

In the past, it was an old part of the castle that had been renovated under Nabooru's orders, a storage room that housed abandoned pieces of furniture and other things. Now, however, it was a sprawling area that could host a hundred people. The long, white-clothed table in the center dominated the view, but there were plenty of decorations littered about, like golden plates on the walls, a crystal chandelier hanging from the roof, a brown carpet that looked to be made of a woolen material, and a few paintings here and there of past influential Gerudo.

"Impressed, huh?" Nabooru said with a laugh. "I spent a couple months overseeing this place's development, you know. A queen and her subjects can't eat in anything less. And before you ask, no, all this gold and jewelry did not come from me confiscating it from the Gerudo that stole it from your people. Not a single carrot."

"O-of course, yes. It's wonderfully furnished," Zelda agreed, regaining her composure (and ignoring the poorly-made lie). "Your effort really payed off."

Nabooru strode over to the nearest chair, the one right at the head of the southernmost end of the table. Plopping her tonnage down into it, a loud creaking noise could be heard, indicating the thing had gone through a lot of unprecedented strain as of late. Paying it no heed, Zelda walked over and took the nearest seat to the side, getting her herself comfortable as well.

"Don't worry about what you order, by the way. Anything you wish, my servants can grant...I mean, as long as you avoid stuff like greens or vegetables in general, really," Nabooru amended. "Those have been falling out of style lately."

"What? How come?" Zelda asked, raising a brow.

"Eh, I dunno, probably because they're just not really tasty. Stuff like that, a lot of fruit, on their own without desserts, it's not exactly a party for your mouth. So, we really only use them as ingredients: apples for pie, potatoes for this new recipe one of my cooks made where you make this crunchy shell for it, cherries for-"

"Uh, sorry, but none of that's available just to eat? You know, without something special being added, like sugary things?"

Nabooru shook her head, her tits belatedly following suit.

"I'm sorry, no. Is that a change from your normal diet?"

Zelda didn't know whether or not to tell the truth. It was, but not wanting to eat the food presented to her and forcing special accommodations to be made wasn't something she felt would go over well with her host. While she always refrained from eating "luxurious" types of food for fear of what it could do to her figure, surely a day or two of having it wouldn't mean much. And she knew plenty of exercises, so even if the Gerudo diet was lacking, she could pick up the slack.

Much as she didn't want to have these thoughts, the Hylian couldn't help it. Most of the people in this desert were overweight, plenty outright obese, and Nabooru just revealed a damning piece of evidence as to why. Nutritious food was apparently out of fashion here, instead in the process of being replaced with junk. Zelda knew the Gerudo were becoming a more peaceful people, but for them to throw away their admiration of physical fitness and healthy living was something she just couldn't grasp.

"It's not a big deal at all," Zelda said resolutely. "What would you recommend?"

Nabooru placed a finger on one of her double-chins, contemplating the question. A chubby waitress showed up, garbed in a slightly more exposed garb than most other Gerudo, her flabby legs and thighs exposed on top her potbelly, chest and arms. After a few moments of sorting through her various meals, Nabooru decided to make her order on top of the suggestion.

"Well, I was going to get the grilled Octorok, with lemon on the side and an order of crispy potatoes, along with another dish of three steak and cheese sandwiches." As the waitress scribbled it all down, Nabooru gave Zelda a smile. "That's my favorite combo. And you?"

1152.content:
During the reign of Ganondorf, Nabooru was second-in-command of the other Gerudo. Ganondorf wanted to marry Nabooru, but she wasn't going to marry someone as evil as Ganondorf. As punishment for refusing to wed him, Ganondorf sent Kotake and Koume--the two Gerudo witches--to punish Nabooru in any way they saw fit. The two sisters quickly came up with a punishment for Nabooru; They would place a curse on her that made her eat every bit of food that was placed in front of her. She still eats every bit of food that's placed in front of her...and she can't stop herself from eating...no matter how hard she tries.

"Good morning!" Din slowly rubbed the sleep out of her eyes and sat up in her bed to find the members of her musical troupe standing at the entrance to her room.

"Hello." She said, grinning. "What's up?"

"Oh, nothing much!" Said the guitarist, smiling. "We just wanted to wake you up early so that you don't miss the wonderful breakfast we had prepared you!"

"We just wanted to show our appreciation for you!" The flautist added, also smiling.

"Oh, there's no need to, you guys are the ones that do all of the hard work!" Din said, scratching her back.

"No need to be modest!" The drummer said, with the same grin on his face as the others.

"Well, if you insist..." Din, in a feat of acrobatics, leapt out of the bed and made her way out of her room, her band following her. When she exited her room, she was taken aback when she saw three tables lined together, covered in food! "Well, you guys weren't kidding when you said you made me a wonderful breakfast!" Din shrugged her shoulders, before sitting down at chair in front of the table.

"Thanks..." Din said, somewhat irked by her troupe's odd behavior. "Well, I might as well take advantage of the situation..."

With Sabrina in the state that she was, Tetra would be able to convince her of doing almost anything for her, as long as it served to make her more sexy.

It worked. Sabrina began to drool over her visions of a Tetra, looming over her at a mountainous god-like size, all to herself. All around, Tetra was being worshiped by everyone in sight, if not the whole world.

"Well? What do you think" The pirate girl asked.

Snapping out of her paradise, Sabrina pulled herself together. "O-Of course! I'll do it!"

Mentally, Tetra smiled. Her plan seemed to be working. There was nobody else living on this island, and her crew anchored nearby was nowhere near enough to satisfy the amount of people Sabrina had in mind. The only option that Sabrina could take was to somehow use her powers to take her to some kind civilization where she could escape or get help.

"I've never tried anything like this before..." she started, "...but if it's all for you, I'll make it happen no matter what!" Sabrina clenched her fists and began to concentrate, twisting her mysterious powers in ways unintended. She struggled as she put all her strength into this fond wish of hers.

Even Tetra was surprised at how much effort she was putting in all for her. Her abilities didn't seem to be meant for such a purpose, yet she's trying so hard. In fact, Sabrina's personality didn't seem as... greedy as before. She wondered why...perhaps because she had some company?

Her train of thought was interrupted as Sabrina's power struggle began to manifest as a bright light. Still, Sabrina continued to bend her powers to the sole goal of making Tetra a divine being. Her let out a scream as her mental battle reached it's zenith and enveloped the room in a bright light. It was almost blinding as Tetra had to shield her eyes from the reality-bending wave of energy was released.

Eyes still closed, Tetra heard Sabrina say, "I... I think I did it!" She slowly opened her eyes, hoping to see a town of some kind like she planned.

To her dismay, she was in the same room as before. Maybe Sabrina failed after all? But as she glanced over to examine her, Sabrina had satisfied look on her face. Tetra was confused.

If she did "succeed," then what happened...?

Tetra had known that she wasn't exactly the skinny piratess she once was, but what she saw in the mirror was beyond anything she could’ve imagined. She had assumed that she had gained quite a bit of weight from what she saw earlier of her stomach and breasts, but what she saw in the mirror was beyond anything she could have imagined. Her outfit was splattered with the remains of her forced gorging, her breasts and butt cheeks looked more like blimps than actual body parts and her stomach … Oh man that was crazy huge. Maybe even to huge to describe, but needless to say, it was pretty big. Whether it was the weight gain formula still causing her to grow or a late reaction from eating so many sweets, she couldn’t be sure. 13111121.content:
It was her stomach. "Oh HELL!" thought Tetra, "I'm practically a whale of flab here and I'm STILL hungry?!" Her stomach then growled even louder, but this time pain was added to the mix. With amazing willpower, she ignored it and tried to do jumping jacks to keep her mind off the hunger.

Well, as you can imagine, the whole exercising thing didn't work out to well. It's not that she was too big to move her arms and legs (though she was getting close with that mountain of a stomach), it was that she was too big to even jump a millimeter off the ground. And the VERY tiny distance she did jump, when she went down she was sweating a river and couldn't even attempt to do another one. With that and her unbearable hunger added to the mix, she wasn't going to lose any weight anytime soon. Actually she wouldn't lose it ANY time, period.

"Well" thought Tetra, "Since I can't get rid of the weight and I can't seem to be able to stop myself from gaining more, why resist anymore? It can't be all bad right? Might as well get to be as heavy as I can be!" And with that thought, she knocked over the pile and started chowing down in the sea of sweets as fast as she could.

A few hours later (and several dozen gas attacks) she somehow managed to get through every last sweet in the room. She was now completely immobile and was at least in the 5-digit weight range and was pretty close to the 6 digits. Her shirt and shorts had now burst leaving her nude, but with no one to see her, at least as far as she knew thus far, she didn't really care.

"UUURRRPPPPPPP!!!" belched Tetra "Man that was some great eating there! I never thought I would or could ever pig out like that in my life, but yet that was the most fun I’ve ever had, I love being big!” That’s when her stomach growled for one seemed like the umpteenth time that day. “Aw darn! I thought I’d finally satisfied it too! But, this room is completely empty! I wish there was more to eat around here!” Suddenly there was a big “POOF!” and suddenly there was…

131111212.content:
Twice as many sweets as before! And this time, each piece seemed even larger and messier than last time. “Oooooooh, that’s fantastic! This girl’s gonna pig out like no tomorrow!” By now, Tetra’s mass took up the entire room; only a few metres from the wall were free from her oozing body, so most of this candy reappeared right around her mouth and well in flabby arm’s reach. Taking a handful of melting caramel, she already starts to moan at the taste as it flows down her stomach. So she mawed down even more furiously than last time at her greased up food, thrilled at how godly her body’s about to become.

Not even a third of the way through, and Tetra finally becomes aware of something; the cave has slowly dissolved away during her titanic binge, and now all that remains is a large tropical island with her gigantic body stretched across its shores. While normally her curiosity would pipe up as to why this had happened, she was too pre-occupied with indulging her self to insane proportions. “Well, I guess it’ll give passer-by’s something to drool over” She giglged to herself, before quickly chewing down on a triple choc layered cake, only pausing to let out a large burp.

By now, there was little doubt about it; Tetra was in the hundred thousands of pounds. Each breast was the size of a small house, her butt stretched across nearly half of the beach and her stomach was creeping steadily into the ocean, which wouldn’t of been as impressive if the tide wasn’t 20 yards away from where she was sitting. Her belly button could’ve easily fit several people; heck, her stomach was soft enough that simply touching it would drag half your body into her beautiful tanned lard.

Yet despite the huge space her body pre-occupied, she felt a strange sense of movement amongst her flesh. Unable to do much about it due to her obvious immobility, she could only wait as this unidentified object made its way to her head. As it finally made its way to her head, with a small snorkel emerging from Tetra’s layers of fat only JUST high enough to avoid being drowned in flab, a girl suddenly hopes out and hugs Tetra around her stuffed and bewildered face!

It’s…

1311112121.content:
"Tetra! You have NO idea how much I've been waiting for somebody to show up here!" She let go and started to lie down next to her, her body quickly sinking in so only her head was left. "So, how's it been?" Tetra was to say the least, a bit shell shocked. "Waitwaitwait... How'd you even wind up here? Heck, why so calm about me being so huge?" Yet the young Ruto simply giggled. "Oh, it's a long and pretty boring story... We're... Both kind of stuck on this island though, that's the gist of it. And I kind of knew you'd get so huge... While you were probably locked up in some weird dungeon getting force fed, I was stuck in some other weird dungeon and after some weird stuff happened there, I eventually woke up on this desert island."

She started to roll around in her flab while giving a soft purr. "Man... You're so lucky; while I had a whole bunch of crazy stuff chase me and stuff, you got to stuff you face. I nearly get killed, you get spoilt to death..." She lightened up and brought her face back to Tetra's. "So, what'd you wanna do?"

Tetra was more than a bit confused, but after all she'd gone through it didn't seem far-fetched that somebody else would wind up in this mess. "Well, I can't really do ANYTHING; I weigh several hundred tons!" Medli grinned. "If you managed to stuff your face so much, you *might* be able to move. Try!" Tetra was about to retort, yet found that, despite her legs and feet being submerged by several metres of flab... She could walk. Really, really easily! "That... Is really, really weird!" Tetra tried running, and found that as if by some unseen force, her waves of fat were held up, giving her legs enough room to move. With each step, the entire island shook; Medli laughed and clapped her hands with each. "That's hilarious! Well Tetra, now is there anything you wanna do?"

"Well, let's see..."

"How about we go for a swim?"

"What's so funny?" asked the immense Tetra.

"...Oh nothing, just now that you mention it I'm wondering if you can float? I mean you proved you can walk and run, Tetra, but can your bulk float in the sea?"

Another set of giggles took a hold of the young bird-girl as she rolled around near Tetra's shoulder flab.

"I'm sure I can swim just fine. My fat floats, heck look at me if I float out at sea might as well call me "The Island of Tetra"!"

A bit of a smirk played on the pirate girl's plump lips as she as began moving toward the ocean, her immeasurable amount of blubber swaying in every direction as her massive legs came crashing down on the island's surface.

Picking up speed Tetra launched herself into the ocean in front of her, Medli already taking precautions by hugging own body to as much of Tetra's flab as she could.

"Cannonball!" yelled the near mountain of a girl as her vastness made direct contact with the ocean's surface causing a tidal wave to spill in and around her.

Laughing proudly Tetra realized she was right and her fat did in fact float rather well in water. A few moments later Medli popped right out of Tetra's flab and shook herself dry as best she could.

"Awesome!" was all the bird-girl said as she leaped into the air before plopping back down onto Tetra's comfy fat.

While she couldn't exactly turn her neck to see her friend, Tetra smiled nonetheless as she started to swim around.

1312.title: A New Course.

choices: "Tell me where the kitchens are!"

13121.content:
As Tetra's ship laid anchor, Tetra finally emerged from the kitchen, patting her still taut stomach and letting out a small burp. "Well? Did we finally find somewhere?" She looked up and noticed a large shadow was cast over their entire ship. Looking closer, she realized that their ship had been absolutely dwarfed in size by another ship, decked with several anchors and hundreds of portholes per row. Their ship's length barely made up a fifth of this colossal ship's. When she squinted, she could *just* make out the silhouette of a happy couple, or a rotund man or portly woman feasting. "Heh."

Tetra quickly gathered her crew into a huddle. "Right men, we've hit the jackpot, but we've gotta think this assault through." Thinking over it, she realized there wasn't actually that much thinking required. "... Which more or less consists of you holding the lobby and every subsequent room hostage while I personally walk in and grab the spoils." A mischievous grin was plastered across her face. A rookie pirate piped in. "Including the kitchens?"

"ESPECIALLY the kitchens..." She quickly sensed the confused expressions at her last line. "Eh, you know how much those fancy chiefs get paid? More than double what we normally make."

"We normally don't make anything."

"Shut up. Right then, mooooove out!" As team after team of pirates clambered up the gigantic side of the floating restaurant, Tetra's mouth started to water at the tantalizing prospect at what all those kitchens held in store for her. After waiting a few moments, she starts to climb up herself, and after making touchdown on the main deck, strolls into the main lobby, already finding every occupant tied up and a neck's length away from drawn swords.

With an impish look, she strolled up to the crowd, while snatching and stuffing into her anxious maw a few dozen complimentary chocolates from the counter. With the brown ooze still lining her mouth, she approached who looked the most likely to be the cashier and asked, fellow pirates in the room awaiting what she had to say...

Medli found herself grasping an ancient looking treasure map.

The script was in a strange and unintelligle script but Medli had heard enough tales about treasure maps to know what to look for, and sure enough there it was.

A large 'X' marked a particular spot on the map.

Medli was so attracted to the prospect of adventure she decided to set out at once, taking off immediately with only a small note left behind saying she had gone for a morning flight.

Medli had roamed the sea all morning and afternoon when she finally spotted an Island that matched the shape of the one on the map, though upon landing she discovered the features on the map were completely wrong, most were gone altogether and the map did not include the large and foreboding fortress standing in the middle of the Island.

Medli stood up and dusted herself off, the interior seemed well-lit, as if there were people living there, though no one was in sight.

'Hello, could anyone er... lend me a shovel?' she shouted

Suddenly a pair of large hands grasped her from behind, she felt a painful blow to the back of her head and everything went black.

A few hours later, Medli regained conciousness and rubbed the back of her sore head. Trying the fortress had obviously been a huge mistake, where could she possibly be now?

The room appeared to be warm and lavishly decorated, she was lying on a very soft and comfortable bed and the floor was carpeted with a soft material. A very long table streched down the middle of the room covered in plates that were piled high with delicious... yet fattening looking dishes.

Despite all the expense, the strong iron bars blocking her escape confirmed that it was in fact a prison cell.

A group of moblins were drooling at her from behind the bars, the biggest and ugliest in the group came up to the bars and sneered

'Ha, you fell for it, Hook, Line and sinker, did you actually believe there was buried treasure on this dump of an island? We'll be having roast Rito for dinner soon enough, the plumper they are the tastier!'

'What are you talking about, there isn't enough meat on me to fill all of you up!' Medli whimpered

'Ah, but that's what the feast is for!' said the Moblin, gesturing to the large table 'You'll be plump enough for five soon enough!'

Medli considered her options, she could get a free meal, then try and escape- she could outsmart a bunch of stupid Moblins any day of the week, or she could refuse to eat altogether
132212.title: No Shovels here.

'I refuse to eat, i'm not going to be dinner for a bunch of stupid Moblins' Medli said defiantly and crossed her arms.

She expected to see the Moblin grow angry but instead his grin only spread wider.

'We thought you might not be a cooperative meal, so that's why we poured that Extra-Strength hunger potion down your throat after we knocked you out! You should be feeling the effects about ah... now.'

Medli's stomach began to rumble loudly, and the food piled up next to her started to look very appealing.

'No! I'm not giving in!' she thought 'Ok, Medli, try and take your mind off food, think of how to get out, it'll be easy to escape this bunch and then you can be back home in time for dinner, a big delicous dinner with tons of food, tasty food, tasty, delicous food...'

Something snapped.

Medli ran over to the feast table and started stuffing food into her mouth at lightning pace, barely stopping to chew.

A few hours later, Medli's had reached her limit and fell back onto the floor panting, her belly was stretched to it's very limit with fattening food and was nearly spherical, protruding 3 feet in front of her. Medli burped softly and rubbed her bloated belly to alleviate some of the pressure.

She was so stuffed she couldn't get up so she decided to snooze where she was lying, with her stuffed belly sticking in the air.

The guards, who had been watching her, licked their lips and argued about what sauce would compliment her best.

Medli awoke to a shock, the fattening food she had digested through the night had done a number in her figure, she must have gained-
1322122.title: Medli snaps

13221222.content:
-300 lbs! Indeed, three hundred pounds had been added to her small frame by all of the food that she ate. With her short size taken into consideration, she looked even larger than a taller person of 400 or so pounds would have.

Her wobbly belly hung precariously close to the ground, shaking to the left and right as she paced about her prison cell. The fact that her knees and thighs were slapping against her belly with each step simply added to the jiggle. On the subject of thighs, they had definitely thickened up due to her meal. This change had helped to transform her walk into a clumsy waddle; she was still testing out her new body, after all. And of course thick thighs bring about larger rears, and Medli's was so strained against her dress that it almost showed off every curve. Medli sighed, as part of her was wishing that this room didn't have a mirror.

Medli considered her larger chest to be a sort of silver lining to this dark cloud. As she thought of this, a bright look came across her rounded face, which was now the home to chubby cherup cheeks and a double chin. Unfrotunately, she wouldn't be able to benefit from her enlarged chest if she became dinner to the Moblins. Like something rolled around in a pigsty, eventually died and whose corpse farted constantly ever since.

"Please don't come any closer PLEASE don't come any closer oh please..." Muttering underneath her breath, Medli prayed he just checked she was still suck in her cell and walk off. Her mind racing, there was little else she could think to do. With a deep breath, she called out. "Oh guaaaaard~!" He turned around, yet the dank lighting made it hard to make out his expression. Medli strolled up to the bars and waited, mentally making a note not to breath through her nose. When he was finally up close and personal, she started up again, trying her best to keep a straight face. "I've been waiting for company for AGES and you just stroll off?" All it took for her to get on the other side was a few side steps.

After slamming the door, she turned and grinned. "Maybe if you took a bath once in a while.... Naaaw." She ran to the closest door and looked out towards a small pier in front of her. "Fantastic! A docking area!"

Sneaking up (or as much as she could at her plumps size), she boarded it, the vessel slightly rocking with the sudden increase in weight. “Heh… Guess I’m a weee bit bigger than I thought I was.” Setting up a sail that had luckily been left on board, she sailed out into the night, the sea air brushing against her outstretched stomach as the fortress behind her faded over the horizon.

It was only a few moments later when she realized she had no map. ‘… Crap.’ She thought to herself, realizing that for what could potentially be hundreds of miles around her was nothing but vast, empty ocean. She decided the best plan was to follow the wind; surely THAT would somehow lead her to land, and a way back to Dragon Roost island.

And it worked… Eventually. The next morning, Medli falling asleep rather soon after committing herself to sailing home, woke up to find the ship shattered next to her on a beach. She got herself up, brushed herself off and looked around. There was essentially nothing; just a bit of shoreline and a cluster of trees in the middle of this small mass of land; she could even see the other side of the island from where she stood. Pigs. Pretty large ones too, which would’ve made Medli feel better about her own change if she wasn’t… Well, roughly the same size, and probably slightly heavier than them. She walked up to them and looked around to see if there was anybody else around; there wasn’t, and it became apparent that the island was far too small for anybody to consider living on. Annoyed, she lay down on her stomach and started to mope. After her treatment by Moblins she wasn’t anywhere near the depressed state she was in earlier.

Actually, when she stopped and thought about it, Medli wasn’t depressed or worried about her predicament at all. She was just really, really damn hungry. Before she could act on this, she felt a nudge against her backside. Then another one. Then one closer to her bubbly butt. Jumping up, she turned around to see a startled pig dash off. Just then, an idea formulated in her idea.

Slowly crawling her way up to the group of pigs, she spied around for what they could possibly be feeding on if the island was seemingly deserted. Then she saw it, and was surprised she didn’t earlier; a large, almost-water tower like structure, with a small valve under neath it, with a trough leading off underneath it. Every so often, the valve would undo and a gush of mush would flow out, before automatically closing up again.

In any other situation, she’d of been grossed out. However, in the context of being stuck on a desert island with no way back home, it was some kind of blessing. A blessing that’d force her to demean herself immensely, but she was only among pigs anyway. Rushing up to the trough, she wedged herself in-between a pair of incredibly round pigs and started to shovel the food in her large mouth.

Wet, soggy and rotten, was the taste Medli was expecting. Warm, creamy and sugary was what she actually did taste. With a large butt thrust either end to send the nearyby pigs waddling away, she dug in, slurping up as much as she possibly could, almost entirely forgetting where she was or her situation. Instead, her mind was filled with visions of gorging on this weird, mysterious food for as long as she could possibly fathom.

A good six hours later…

With her morning over and her wise awake, she decided it was about time her her to have a really good look around. There must be a way off the island, after all. So she began to look around everywhere. Truth be told, there wasn't much to see. One one end was the pig's trough, that got filled with foodstuff from the water tower, and the pool a short ways away. In the island's centre, there were a few trees. The island was small and fairly flat, though the edges were rather rocky. Despite that, though, at her weight, Medli found she got winded walking from one end to the other.

She reached the trough and sat down in a huff. She reflected on her situation. There seemed to be little she could use here. She looked at the water tower feeding the pigs, and suddenly it occurred to her that someone probably owns the island. Perhaps they're raising pigs here? Surely they would come back if she could only wait a week or so. Someone has to give the pigs food, or check up on them. So, she decided, if she just stays put, she will surely be found eventually!

Suddenly the pump opened, and filled the trough with that sweet milky substance she loved. She eyed it, licking her lips. She has food, she has water, and the pigs could keep her company... Everything for a reasonably comfortable existence. Besides, it'll make a good vacation from her regular duties for a while. Yeah, she thought, she could grow to like it here. Her mind pondered over this thought, and she was lost inside her head.
