141121.content:
"Thank you for staying with us!" Anju said with a courteous bow as another customer checked out that morning.

A month had passed since the Carnival of Time. It was thought to be the last one Termina would ever see but, by a miracle, the moon stopped and faded during the wee hours of the that day and a new day came.

In the wake of such a disaster, Anju and Kafei had finally married. While he had been cursed prior, she had thankfully seen him as she always remembered the day they were married. It seemed that her relief, coupled with her habits of bringing meals to her grandmother, had rubbed off on her. Since that day, she had started to put on weight. She admittedly had been dieting to be assured she would fit inside of her wedding dress, but she never thought of herself as this gluttonous. She had put on a hundred pounds in all since her wedding day and still her waistline expanded with each meal. Kafei seemed to shyly dismiss any questions she shot him regarding her weight and she could swear as she dined, he would steal glances at her belly. Her breasts had become fuller and rounder as well, leading to a generous view of creamy cleavage which she didn't doubt brought in new customers and even her long, sensible skirt did little to hide her full and round plump ass with hips that would even make Hylian royalty green with envy.

As a customer passed by the counter, the plump Anju waved him down.

"Ah, e-excuse me sirt but you didn't pay your rent! You took out a reservation for a-"

The man, wearing a magenta robe and cowl and wearing a sizable traveling backpack, turned around. His eyes had a pale glimmer to them under the shade of his hood, not unlike that of a Poe and his skin looked pale, but not sickly.

"Oh, how unfavorable of me." He said in a surprisingly courteous and timid voice that wavered slightly like a nervous schoolboy. "I'm sorry, I don't know if this will cover the bill but please, take this as my payment instead."

The man reached into a pocket in his pack and presented a glass bottle to Anju. It wasn't empty however; it's contents consisted of a navy blue colored slime inside. It seemed to be Chu-Chu jelly, but before she could press any further about what it was exactly or what it did, the man had already walked out the door. Anju tried to call for him, but it was a futile gesture. She only sat back and looked at the bottle longingly. Her stomach began to growl looking at it. Anju guiltily looked down and rubbed her stomach.

"Well...I suppose a drink on the job won't hurt. Chu-Chu jelly is oddly non-toxic, so I guess this can't hurt much..." Anju pondered aloud to herself.

Pinching her nose after uncorking the bottle, Anju swallowed the sticky, oddly sweet substance within a single gulp. She sighed as she felt it stick to her throat while it traveled down into her stomach. She nodded her head to the side as she found herself surprised that it actually tasted that good. Her stomach began to rumble as she felt her belly with her right hand. It wasn't hunger it was...something else. Whatever the case, it was almost three now and it was as good a time as any for a break. She decided it would be best to check up on Cremia and little Romani now that their...creature problem was taken care of.

On the way to the ranch, Anju felt her gut continue to growl and shake as she began to feel hotter and more tired. She actually started to pant and sweat like she'd just run after Cuckoos to throw them back in their pen, but she still pressed on. Luckily for her, as she passed the gate to the ranch, Cremia was standing near one of the ranch's famous cows with a bucket of milk sat next to her and a crate of glass bottles.

"Oho~ If it isn't one of Clock Town's latest brides too be? How do you feel, Ms. Kafei?" Cremia playfully teased.

"Fine tha-Uuurrrrpp!!"

Anju accidentally belched just as Cremia started getting close to her, causing her rancher friend to back up a bit.

"S-sorry must have been something I...IIIIIUUUUUUAAARRRRPPPP!!!!"

As Anju belched her belly shook violently, her body beginning to bloat forward. Cremia was only taken further aback as she backed away from her friend's rapidly expanding body, which seemed to explode with fat. In an instant, she already became a round blob who stood naked, her decency covered by her full, swelling fat belly as her breasts swelled forward atop it and her butt bubbled and ballooned out behind her. She quickly began to spread across the ground like a massive blob as the innkeeper could only belch near-constantly as her bulk expanded outwards. Cremia found herself swept up in her friend's expanding bulbous body and cows began to disappear within her belly and large, deep folds. Anju began to moan in what sounded to Cremia like an erotic fashion as she grew and belched and even hiccuped as her body began to envelop over half the fields.
141121.title: Moderate (80 - 100 with the potential for more)

choices: Cook up a storm and fool Anju's mother.
Wait until breakfast, someone might just come in...
141122.content:
It had nearly been six months since Clock Town celebrated the Carnival of Time, and as expected during this time of year, business at the Stock Pot Inn had dried up completely when the festivities came to a close.
While Anju was still tasked with standing at the front counter to greet visitors, she wasn't nearly as active as she had been tending to the guests upstairs a few months previous - add to the fact that the delicious smells from the kitchen directly behind would travel through the hollowed halls put the once trim maiden in an uncomfortable position.
Putting it bluntly, Anju had put on a lot of weight standing in the same spot day after day with only the wonderful meals to look forward to; her once svelte curves had become soft, her hips had widened to accommodate her more-than modest belly and she had begun to develop a double chin through her snacking.

Today began like any other day for the clerk; she had gotten dressed in the Employee bedroom up the stairs, descended into the main hallway, checked in with her mother and waited eagerly at the front till, anticipating an arrival that wouldn't come. Taking advantage of the opportunity, Anju would use the countertop to rest her stomach as it nearly spilled over on the opposite end, resting her hand on the soft flab and massaging it every so often.
She had only just begun her routine and already she couldn't wait for lunch.
Anju had been in charge of cooking up meals for anyone who stayed in the Inn, and with the climax of the Carnival she was used to cooking up a meal for every patron. While the Inn had died down, Anju's portions had not, which meant that she was still cooking for dozens when it was just herself and her mother to feed - and her mother didn't have a large appetite...
Growing ever impatient at the front desk, Anju wondered if she could possibly hold out until breakfast which was still hours away. Perhaps she could abandon her post and whip off to the kitchen to cook, her senile mother probably wouldn't question the time...
As her stomach grumbled persistently she bit her lower lip, she knew she should wait and stand at her post, but she couldn't shy away from thoughts of rich soups and heavy pastries...
141122.title: Heavy Set (150 - 300 with the potential for more)

choices: It's the wisecracking Clocktown Juggling Twins!
It's Anjus mother-in-law, Madame Aroma!
1411221.content:
Caving in, Anju turned on the spot and made a beeline for the kitchen - the weathered floor protesting with every step en route to the stove.
Bending over with great effort, Anju began searching through the cupboards for ingredients for her Stockpot Soup of the Day.
"Whew, let's see," Anju breathed as her thick arm brushed aside empty jars and heavy bags, "Deku nuts for flavor, and Cucco broth for sure..."
Making a pile of collected jars and bottles beside herself as she recounted the recipe, Anju nearly cleared the cupboard bare, but still something was missing...
"Something... filling", Anju said aloud as she massaged her growling stomach, stuck in deep thought.
Suddenly, an epiphany dawned!
"Ooh, Chateau Romani! Of course!", she grunted as she rose to her feet. Anju wasn't the only one who found herself unprepared for the inevitable end of the Carnival of Time, which found Mr. Barten left over with a few dozen crates of Romani Ranch milk - especially the incredibly think and creamy Chateau Romani which was too rich in flavor and price for most tourists. Cutting his loses, he had donated a few dozen crates of Chateau Romani to the Stock Pot Inn as a gesture of good will - and also to allow himself some space to move behind his counter once more.

Stopping just short of the massive crate decorated with a cows face, Anju pried open the front to reveal rows of delicious creamy Chateau Romani.
"Mmm... perhaps two servings will do..." Anju pondered, bringing the full bottles to her chest, "Will it be enough? Perhaps three, err...four..."
Licking her lips, the stout clerk returned to the stove with ingredients in hand - a slow simmer had made the broth just warm enough to begin cooking.
One by one the ingredients were dropped into the wide bowl as Anju took to stirring the mixture fervently, her raven hair becoming disheveled as the rising steam met her brow.
Breathing heavily, the cook found herself competing with the stirring in her stomach, the bubbling froth rising to the surface in both cases.
"Nearly there, just need to... add some texture..." Anju noted, unscrewing the top of the bottle and dumping the rich liquid into her soup which turned a dull white.
While this would suit a normal dish, Anju couldn't resist adding a second bottle of heavy milk into the mix, turning the concoction remarkably white.
Beaming at her delicious dish, Anju stopped stirring and began to scoop a heavy spoonful into her mouth for a taste test.
"Mmm... Oooh...", Anju swallowed, relishing the flavors and patting her restless belly. "Too good. But it could use ..another.. serving..."
She peered across the counter at the remaining bottles and gathered them up in her arms before dashing them into the soup.
Sniffing the air she moaned in ecstasy, the rich smell was simply overpowering, she had to see how it tasted now...
Dipping the spoon into the soup, Anju brought a second spoonful to her mouth, followed by a third for good measure.
"Mmmph, just perfect..." Anju gurgled through mouthfuls, "So rich and creamy...."
Perhaps a fifth spoonful would be even better than the last, Anju was having difficulty making up a proper excuse for digging into her clearly perfected mix.
Closing her eyes and taste testing like clockwork, she left just enough time to swallow before filling up her cheeks once more.
Slowing her pace as she began reaching deeper into the bowl, she had sated her hunger pangs but kept eating anyway - it wasn't long before she was stirred from bliss with a sharp mechanical 'PANG!'

Opening her eyes, Anju starred down at her spoon which now scraped the bottom of an empty soup bowl.
Her eyes widened with shock. Had she really finished off the entire soup bowl? That was meant to feed a family of least ten Inn guests...
Anju massaged her taut tummy while she leaned back in her chair, she had gone beyond comfortable and her sloshing stomach was enough evidence of that.
Before the clerk could begin to relax however, the familiar sound of the irreparable squeaky door sounded at the front of the Inn as a pair of shuffling boots soon followed.
Customers! They would meander into the Inn right this second, too. Anju rose from her chair, brushing her dress off and fixing her hair before making her way to the counter.
1411221.title: Cook up a storm and fool Anju's mother.

choices: Back to the kitchen
Show the brothers to their room
14112211.content:
Preoccupied with fixing her dress, Anju stared towards the floor as she made her way to the familiar front desk.
"Welcome to the Stock Pot Inn," Anju began out of reflex, "Will you be staying.. the night?"
Glancing up towards the patrons, she noticed that it was the Clocktown Juggling Twins dressed in matching outfits.
"Oh ho ho ho, shall we stay IN the INN, or go withOUT?" the brother in red chortled, turning to his blue counterpart.
"Hoo hoo, in a pinch this INN will OUT! Better IN than OUT " the blue brother returned.

Anju bowed graciously and continued her pitch, feeling a few bubbles rising in her throat , "Err...good. Your room is our 'Knife Chamber' on -BRAAP"
Her speech had been cut short by her own obnoxious belch, turning a brilliant shade of red she took a step back covering her mouth with both hands.
"Err... that, I'm sorry it's..." she began, fumbling over her own words.
"Oh ho ho ho, don't apologize gracious host, as we always say...", the red brother turned to the blue. "Hoo hoo, ...better OUT than IN!"
The two men nodded and grinned simultaneously, which provided some comfort to Anju as she giggled in spite of herself.
"The 'Knife Chamber' is on the second floor," she continued, "it's almost time for breakfast, so I'll bring your soup to you when you check in to your room."
"Hoo hoo, might we ask for seconds?..." the blue brother turned to the red, "...our girlfriends, the Rosa Sisters, may join us," finished red.
"Of course," Anju bowed, "If you have any further inquiries, please don't hesitate to ask."
"Thank you," the brothers answered in unison as they climbed the stairs.
14112211.title: It's the wisecracking Clocktown Juggling Tw...

choices: Bloated Breakfast
Something else?
141122111.content:
Starting afresh, Anju filled the pot with her readied ingredients and began to stir as the mix simmered.
"And a touch, *hic* of Chateau Romani" Anju noted, dumping an entire bottles worth into the soup and stirred vigorously.
As the aroma filled the air, Anju couldn't help give the dish another taste test, though she restrained herself from draining another Stock Pot.
"Mmmm... just *hic* perfect", Anju sighed patting her tummy, perhaps she could finish what was left after delivering the soup to the Jugglers...
Loading the soup on a tray, Anju rounded the corner and began to ascend the great staircase that led to the Knife Chamber and beyond.

Even when she was quite slender, these stairs were quite a lengthy trek, so it was a mammoth task at her current weight, which sent her breathing heavily as she reached the midway mark. Resting her hand against the wall, Anju steadied the tray, each creak and groan from the Innkeeper was replicated by the stairs underneath her.
"Just a...*huff* ...little more..." she reassured herself, taking the final steps that would find her in front of the Knife Chamber door.
Using her remaining strength to knock on the door, Anju could only breathe an exhausted "...Soup" before nearly dropping the tray.
As the door opened, Anju worked her way inside the Knife Chamber and rested the tray on the bedside table, panting as she stood up fully.
"Breakfast *huff*... is served", Anju bowed slowly as her hair became disheveled, "Please, relax". The Stock Pot Inn mantra, now repeating in her own mind.
"A brilliant idea, that is..." began the blue shirt, turning to his red counterpart in precognitive fashion, "...why don't you join us for breakfast and relax for a while up here?"
Anju smirked and sighed at her guests hospitality, "Thank you, that sounds wonderful."
As she plopped herself down on the nearest bed it began to buckle in the middle, groaning in protest and then halting; the twins didn't even take notice as they moved the soups from the tray.
Anju watched as they laid a single bowl of soup for themselves and then laid the remaining two in front of her, the sweet aroma rising up from the steaming bowls and into her nostrils. The red shirt handed her a spoon which she almost dunked into the bowl out of reflex. Nearly getting lost in Romani bliss once more, Anju snapped back in time and looked down towards the bowls in confusion.
"Wait, aren't these for your girlfriends? I shouldn't..." Anju pointed towards the twin bowls.
As if on command, the blue shirt withdrew a letter and laid it on the table, it was Priority Mail.
"It arrived this morning," began the red shirt. "we decided to open it when we checked in to your Inn."
"It turns out," said blue shirt picking the letter back up, "that they won't be arriving until tomorrow morning."
"Sometimes it all just seems to be one cruel joke doesn't it, hoo hoo!" red shirt opined.
"Oh ho ho ho, don't forget that the last laugh will always be on you." blue shirt added.

The brothers began to dig into their soups, complimenting Anjus cooking - something she wasn't used to hearing from her mother, and inviting her to join them.
How could she refuse?
141122111.title: Back to the kitchen

choices: Grin and bear it, finish the second bowl of soup.
May I be excused? Tend to Anju's mother.
1411221111.content:
Although Anju was still really quite full, she thought it would be in poor taste to decline the invitation, especially after the Clocktown Jugglers had been so accommodating. Resting a hand on her painfully overloaded paunch, Anju began to eat her share of soup as the Clocktown Jugglers regaled her with stories outside of Clocktown.
"When the Carnival leaves town, we must go along with it!", red shirt began.
"Outside of these walls, any performer can find an audience!" blue shirt finished.
Anju smiled warmly as they told her of their traveling troupe, exploring the edges of Termina with the Rosa sisters and sharing their act with anyone they could find. She began to become lost in the story, hardly paying attention to the gradually thinning bowl in her hands, or her protesting stomach just underneath.
"Our act was a splash in Great Bay..." blue shirt delivered, glancing to his counterpart for a punchline.
"... but in Ikana Valley, we died on our feet!" red shirt concluded with a smirk.
Sniggering, Anju took a moment to regain composure before clearing her throat and continuing onto her soup - she had nearly finished her first bowl in minutes!
"Ahh, but we should tell our gracious hostess about what we found at Romani Ranch..." red shirt exclaimed as he raised his finger.
Romani Ranch... Anju became suddenly lost in thought, savoring the creamy texture of Chateau Romani that had been thickly laden into her soup.
The rich flavor had overwhelmed her senses, she closed her eyes and licked her lips, searching the corners of her mouth for any trace of the delicious mixture.
When she opened her eyes she found the Clocktown Jugglers staring, first at her in expectation, and then at each other in confusion.
"I don't think she got the joke...", blue shirt began in a half-whisper.
"Perhaps if you say it again," red shirt nodded, "With feeling!"
The Clocktown Jugglers turned their gaze back to the innkeeper, with blue shirt inhaling for his delivery.
"Complete instability!" blue shirt added with vigor.
Anju smirked, bowing into her bowl of soup as her spoon scrapped along the bottom - without hesitation the empty bowl was swapped out by red shirt and replaced with a full bowl from blue shirt.
"Oh ho ho ho, I don't think that joke was worth telling twice..." blue shirt exclaimed as he shook his head.
Hoo hoo, it wasn't even worth telling once..." red shirt retorted with a sting.
Anju had become fixed on the now-replenished bowl underneath her, suddenly becoming aware of how much she had eaten in a single morning. There wasn't any means to soften the blow - Anju was absolutely, unapologetically, stuffed. She dipped her spoon into the soup, twirling the thick mixture around as another hand was soon preoccupied with slowly rubbing her hardened stomach, which bubbled dully beneath her blouse.
Wincing slightly, the full innkeeper turned towards her guests, noticing that both of their bowls had hardly been touched from their banter.
In the same instance, Anju also noticed that she had completely lost track of time, and her mother would be expecting to be served as well.
It would be terrible manners to leave her own bowl unfinished before leaving, especially since she had cooked the meal herself - a strict upbringing had assured that notion. On the other hand she would need to see to her own mother, who would try anything to resist Anju's meals, especially if she had brought it late...
1411221111.title: Bloated Breakfast

choices: Anju's not finished yet...
14112211111.content:
How could she even think about leaving her guests now? It was nearly as unthinkable as...
finishing this soup...
Her eyes trailed the spoon as she swirled the interior of the bowl, which seemed impossibly deep, filled to the brim with creamy Chateau Romani...
"I think we are starting to bore our host..." red shirt broke the silence.
"Don't look at me, this is all your material!" chuckled blue shirt.

"N-no!" Anju blurted, "You're not *hic* boring me! Please...*huff* continue..."
The Clocktown Jugglers had resumed their witty banter as Anju sized up the bowl below, inhaling deeply as she tried to soothe her overtaxed stomach, the aroma of Chateau Romani overwhelming her once again. Wincing, Anju brought up a spoonful of soup, and swallowed the contents just as quickly.
Just a bit more... she reassured herself as the mixture hit her stomach heavily. Just a few more spoonfuls, and it would be finished, hopefully before she was.

"...but the carnival does leave Clocktown in quite a state" red shirt concluded.
"Indeed, what does our hostess do to pass the time these days?" blue shirt questioned.

"Oh, *hic* well just..." Eating. Her mind finished the sentence for her, and it was true as well - ever since the Carnival of Time had ended she had spent more time in the kitchen than at the counter, tasting every recipe personally, feeling the threads on her wardrobe strain, feeling heavier with every bite...
"...cooking. Mostly." Anju finished, taking in another spoonful as the twins nodded in unison.

"Quite masterfully as well, this soup is delicious." red shirt added as he drank three quick spoonfuls.
"I think you'll find it's actually Cucco Chateau Romani," blue shirt jabbed, "but it tastes good all the same!"
The twins exchanged knowing glances before breaking into laughter and eating their portions of soup.
Anju exhaled and looked down towards her own bowl, which looked nearly as full, if not more so, than it had seconds before.
Her stomach felt as though it was writhing in protest, which she tried to calm rather unsuccessfully with a massage before bringing another spoonful to her mouth.
She was going to burst like a Deku bubble if she kept this up, she noted. Another spoonful had found its way to her lips in the meantime.
Now it was starting to get painful, she had reached her physical limit some time ago, and every ounce of her was telling her to stop eating.
Another spoonful. Then another.
A low rumble had started in her stomach, rising in pitch as the innkeeper tried to control herself. Just a few more, don't explode... A few more...
Anju's cheeks had become flushed with red, matching her crimson hair which had become disheveled from the heat. Panting dully, Anju forced another spoonful onto herself, the thick mixture dripping down her chin.
Pressing against the fabric of her blouse, her taut stomach seemed to expand an inch every time Anju swallowed a drop of Cucco Chateau Romani.
Another spoonful as she thought of Romani Ranch, the aroma was nearly intoxicating now. She imagined herself stretched out in cool high grass of Cremia's pasture, basking in the sun. Just keep eating... Another spoonful...
Think of the pasture, in the grass, in the grass like...
Her stomach rumbled again.
Like a cow.
Anju was likely filled with more Chateau Romani than any cow could hope to produce on the ranch anyways - if she did live with Romani and Cremia it would be as their prized heifer. Appropriate, since she felt like she had already filled four stomachs.
Another spoonful and Anju winced.
Perhaps she more suited as a prized pig, growing larger with each passing day.
Anju opened her eyes, she had already made that a reality.
Her soup was nearly finished, and she was sure at least that there was more soup inside of her than left in the bowl, the crowning glory of Stock Hog Inn.
Anju had to gulp as she felt hot soup rise in her throat, threatening to come out - she was too full, but she wasn't about to ruin the floor of the Knife Chamber.
The innkeeper cradled her stomach as she felt the packed dome through her fabric. Please, please, just a little more...
She could now see the bottom of the bowl, it was possible, but she couldn't suffer through this any longer.
Five spoonfuls, that's all. If you do it quick enough, you won't even notice...
Anju panted as she dipped her spoon in the reservoir of soup, naturally the thickest bits had sunk to the bottom.
Quick enough... won't even notice...
In a flash Anju had brought the creamy mixture to her lips, before she had even swallowed, a second spoonful was ready.
On the third spoonful, Anju swallowed with relish and prepared for her forth when a powerful and painful throb started at her stomach and worked its way through her entire body. She winced as her stomach protested, resisting the urge to massage in case it all went north to Snowhead.
What was she doing? She was completely stuffed and yet she continued eating, faster than she had all morning!
Moaning softly, Anju gathered up her composure and another spoonful, draining it into her mouth. Before she could swallow she brought the final bit of soup to her lips, collecting both in her cheeks.
The Clocktown Jugglers had finished talking ages ago, and were on the final spoonfuls of their own bowls. Luckily they hadn't noticed the frankly overstuffed moaning sow of an innkeeper sharing their room, or if they did, they weren't about to make it known.
Closing her eyes, Anju prepared to swallow - if she didn't explode in a flash like a Deku nut it would be nothing short of a miracle.
She felt the creamy texture travel down her throat as she gulped, not unlike a grimacing Moon heading towards Clock Tower - with equally cataclysmic results.
As the mixture hit her stomach, she could feel the hot soup rise in her throat again. No!
"BRRAP!" Anju belched, turning a brilliant shade of scarlet as she covered her mouth too late.

"Oh ho ho ho! Compliments to the chef!" red shirt chortled at ease before burping himself.
"Hoo hoo, and compliments to a fine hostess as well!" blue shirt added, exhaling a burp to match.

Grimacing, Anju bowed in favor of her guests, a sharp pain digging into her as she bent too low.
The bed creaked back into form as the innkeeper rose to collect the empty bowls from the twins, adding her own as well.

"Thanks again for the soup," blue shirt called out as Anju plodded out of the Knife Chamber.
"Yes, we're absolutely stuffed." red shirt giggled as Anju bowed and shut the door behind her and losing all composure.

Exhaling deeply, Anju backed herself against the wall, resting the bowls on the floor and placing her hands on her nearly spherical stomach.

"You don't *hic* know the half of it..."
14112211111.title: Grin and bear it, finish the second bowl of soup.

choices: A long, filling journey ahead...
Anju is unable to make it up the stairs...
141122111111.content:
Descending the staircase of the Stock Pot Inn had nearly become as difficult as climbing it, as every step served to remind Anju just how overloaded she had made herself. She was swimming in soup, she decided - an entire days worth of rich Chateau Romani had taken its toll on her figure in a few short hours.
Her blouse had become so strained that it threatened to burst off any minute, months ago the white fabric served only to reach the peak of her dress and join the base of her top, but now it was pulled tightly across her round stomach like a drum, thudding in dull pain.
Her dress was hardly faring any better; while its length had remain consistent, the seams had been stressed and several stitches had already broken from the hem, especially, as Anju had noted, around her growing posterior...

"Oh...oh..." Anju cooed to herself as she rested against the wall. A journey of stairs stretch ahead still, but she was already hot in the face.
"Oooh...", the Hostess groaned as she lowered herself onto the steps. Perhaps she would sit here until she caught her breath, just for a little while...

Anju looked skyward, wheezing on the staircase, her wandering hands had found their way to her stomach, cradling, massaging, coasting along to the ebb and flow that would quell the beast in her stomach. She debated undoing the first few buttons of her blouse after needling her stomach and noticing how strained they felt - but soon thought better of it. What if she couldn't do them back up?
The fabric stretched with every breath, she could probably pop the button off if she held her breath, but she wasn't about to try...
With a few more spoonfuls of soup she might explode along with it, she noted, exploring her middle.
"Mmmmm..." Anju moaned, closing her eyes and rubbing her stomach gently, her fingers grazing the thin layers of her blouse. Underneath, the raging turmoil against Chateau Romani continued, with each gurgle, tremor and growl sending the poor Innkeeper reeling. Anything more than a light touch would cause a protest, so she traced light deliberate circles with the tips of her fingers.
Just keep grazing... she thought. That was something she had been doing particularly well in the past months, gorging herself hedonistically in the kitchen, or munching on a little snack in the lobby. She had tended to her guests in the same manner as always, but had admittingly tended to herself first when it came to cooking - and the results were obvious.
Anju opened her eyes and craned her neck to get a better view of her burgeoning belly. She was enormous, bigger than she had been in her entire life, and worse still, there was no signs of slowing down...
Somewhere along the way greed and relish had won favor, and she had been paying for it with every pound.

Taking a few labored breaths, Anju strengthened her resolve to continue down the staircase. Wincing, she began to rise to her feet, feeling out to the wall for support. With one hand firmly placed on her stomach, and the other grasping at the railing, the Innkeeper soon found herself standing upright, albeit more out of breath than before.
Her cheeks had become flushed, and her bangs swept over her eyes and each lungful of air send a sharp pain to her middle. She began to descend, each step sending a tremor up to her stomach, each creak on the weathered step reminding just how much she had grown - it was nearly unbearable.
Finally she had arrived at the base of the steps with a sharp exhale that sent her stomach growling. Resting a hand on her stuffed tummy, Anju leaned against the wall until she could think straight once again.

"Back to the... kitchen...", she panted aloud, massaging herself, "wash the bowls... and then..."
Suddenly a chill had been sent up her spine, Anju's eyes went wide as she spun about to collect the bowls of finished soup, but found that there was none.

All four bowls had been stacked neatly atop each other, exactly where Anju had left them outside of the Knife Chamber. The room found at the top of the stairs...

Sighing in disbelief, Anju grabbed the railing and steadied herself, her hair falling back into her eyes once more...

This was the start of a long day for the overfed Innkeeper...
141122111111.title: Anju's not finished yet...

choices: Lunch at the Stock Pot Inn - Anju delivers her mothers food and gets a mouthful.
1411221111112.content:
This must be what climbing Snowhead Mountain is like... Anju thought to herself she she took the first few steps.
The top of the stairs seemed impossibly far away, and while she had managed to ascend them before entering the Knife Chamber, her return trip was made under the heavy burden of two thick bowls of Chateau Romani.
She definitely felt heavier, each creaking step threatening to give way at a moments notice, a wanning echo throughout the Stock Pot Inn.
Anju continued onward, underneath her stuffed belly was audibly sloshing, each step sending creamy liquid to stir around in her massive cauldron.
Anju was already painfully full, and this trek wasn't helping in the slightest, in fact, what she needed more than anything else was to retire to her quarters and sleep off her massive meal...
She brushed the crimson hair out of her eyes as she took another step. The Employees-Only room that served as her sanctuary was also at the top of the stairs, perhaps she could collect the dishes and bring them inside with her - a short nap and she could find the strength to keep working...
How lazy!, her mothers voice echoed in her mind. How could she think about sleeping the day away when someone had to tend to the Inn, and all of its occupants?
Perhaps she could nap in the lobby, resting her head against the top of the counter and keeping a groggy watch on the door...
"Oooh..." Anju exhaled, resting a hand on her stomach. This was just too much, it was too far and even if she did make it to the top, she wasn't sure she could gather the will to descend the stairs a second time.
"Let me just..." Anju shifted her weight, stepping to the side. Her stomach thrashed in protest. "Oooh, oh...*hic* please..."
If Anju had drank all of the Great Bay, she assumed that she would feel exactly as she did now - inside the tide seemed to rush the shore, sloshing the
contents about in a choppy mix. Steadying herself on the railing, Anju took a few short painful breaths, but it did nothing to alleviate the situation.
A wandering hand reached down to massage her stomach, tracing circles around her belly button. Soon she found herself spiraling inward like a drain, a single finger leading the kneading expedition as she traveled inside.
Anju was genuinely shocked at how deep her navel had become - years ago on the Eve of the Carnival, she had worn a revealing crop top that showed off her midriff, and even in the moonlight you could see how trim and svelte she kept herself, with a toned stomach like a washboard.
Now, her stomach had grown round and soft, her navel becoming deeper with each added pound. If she wore the same dress on the Eve of this years Carnival, the townspeople might mistake her for the Moon...

She explored her body, moving southward, it wasn't long until she found her fingers caving inward as they traveled along the underside of her stomach.
Anju wasn't as shocked at this revelation, as her toned belly had turned into a paunch she soon grew used to it, by the time it had grown noticeably round, she was using the lobby counter to rest it against. A second hand joined its partner, massaging underneath until Anju decided to see if she could still lift it...
With a groan, Anju tried to shift her stomach, but it was simply too full of Chateau Romani.

"I've gotten...so *hic* big..." Anju whispered to herself. "So... heavy..."

Anju attempted to take another step but was soon bolstered by a sharp growl and slosh of her stomach. She winced and rubbed her swollen belly while panting. Three bowls of soup, the Innkeeper thought to herself, enough to keep someone well-fed for an entire day, and she had finished them off one after another. Her cheeks flushed. She was more than well-fed, she had passed that apex a long time ago, she was overfed in every sense of the word.
A small burp escaped her lips.
She was completely stuffed to her limit before, and yet she managed to somehow continue eating regardless -

Anju's foot dangled above the next step as an overwhelming gurgle echoed within her. She was paying for it now. Winching and bearing her teeth, Anju found abandoned the climb and felt out for the next step below, finding it in teary eyes and quickly finishing the descent at the base of the stairs.

Breathing heavily, the Innkeeper clutched her stomach with both hands as the sloshing tyranny continued. This was a stomachache, and the strongest one that Anju had ever felt in her life.

"N-no more..." she said exhausted, "No more food today... *hic*... Ooohh..."
The Innkeeper slid her back up against the wall, drawing ragged breaths and waiting out the storm.
She had given up on the stairs entirely, she would return later perhaps and collect the dishes, but right now she wanted to do nothing more than sleep...

Anju's breathing slowed as she closed her eyes, still wincing every few moments as she tried to rest, sitting in front of the stairwell.

She was just about to drift off when the Stock Pot Inn was suddenly filled with a cacophony of clanging bells which extended outside to the grandiose Clock Tower with its heavy bells. The Hostess turned her head to face the wall, finding the clock chiming there.

It was 12:00 - Lunch Time.

Anju groaned.
1411221111112.title: Anju is unable to make it up the stairs...

choices: Deliver the Soup anyways - perhaps her mother won't notice.
Anju is a perfectionist, she has to get this right!
14112211111121.content:
After much effort, Anju rose to her feet and made her way to the kitchen. She dreaded serving her mother, nearly blind and forgetful at best, she always declined any meal that Anju cooked for her.

Now Anju had wisdom beyond her years, she could sympathize with declining a meal, any meal now. She didn't want to see another bowl of Chateau Romani soup for the rest of the year, and here was cooking a fresh batch for her mother.

Years ago, the inexperienced Innkeeper could readily admit her lack of concentration in the culinary arts, 'never trust a skinny chef' was often whispered behind her back. But now Anju's skill had grown nearly as quickly as she had, every dish that passed her lips was a refined masterpiece. She personally sampled everything she cooked for flaws, and when her guests wanted seconds or thirds she was obliged to make sure that it would taste exactly as it did before. She was a perfectionist that way, she thought.

Anju brushed the crimson hair out from her eyes as the stovetop bubbled and frothed, boiling a thick mix of Chateau Romani that was nearly as full as she was. The innkeeper sighed and added the ingredients, leaning in close to sniff. She massaged her overfed stomach gently as she stirred vigorously, the steam rising from the mixture
The familiar scent of Chateau Romani filled the kitchen as Anju groaned and licked her lips, it should have sent her reeling with painful memories, but somehow the potent smell was still incredibly enticing.

Not to say that Anju couldn't resist, she was still painfully aware of how much she had overstuffed herself already, and had already resolved to deliver the soup to her mother, and then take a long nap at the counter.

But...

Even still, as incredibly over-filled as Anju was feeling at the moment, she knew that the perfectionist inside her wouldn't let her deliver the soup without a... taste test.

The color flushed from her face as she continued stirring, just one quick spoonful and that was it...

A large groan escaped both Anju as well as her stomach as she contemplated bringing the spoon to her lips.
She massaged her throbbing stomach as she pictured the scene, bringing the rich mix to her lips and swallowing hard.
A button on her blouse would ricochet off a nearby pan, her dress would tear down the side completely leaving her in threadbare seams.
And her spoonful would follow another, and then another...
Another button would find itself released as she gave way to ecstasy, Anju would lift the entire pot to her lips, desperately lapping up the soup as the intoxicating aroma of Chateau Romani took her over completely.
She would keep drinking and drinking, her cheeks filling with impossibly rich soup as she swallowed hard and fast.
Her stomach would send her reeling in sharp pain, completely stuffed to the brim and she would find herself unable to stop.
She would moan in pain and pleasure, draining the soup and trying to pull away, but finding herself unable to do so.
Until finally...
Anju would drop the pot, clutching her stomach as the rest of the mix clattered to the floor.
Four thick rich basins of Chateau Romani inside of her, stretching the limits of her completely spherical stomach.
She would fall to the floor, creating a tremendous tremor through all of the Stock Pot Inn when her eye would catch one last spoonful of soup.
Anju would wince, grasping the spoon under labored breaths...

"Just...*hic* one...little... taste..." she breathed huskily, bringing the final spoonful to her lips.

It would fill her cheeks as she struggled to keep the mix down, her quaking stomach would slosh and growl, and she would swallow hard.
She would burst at the seams like her dress, pop like a button from her blouse, explode like a Powder Keg! KA-BOOM!

...


Anju snapped back to the kitchen, lost in thought she had continued mixing. Blinking, she looked down at the mixture of Chateau Romani - it looked prepared, but there was only one way to tell if it were truly ready.
Breathing deeply, Anju brought the spoonful to her trembling lips and with her eyes closed she downed the spoonful in a single swallow.

Anju didn't burst like a Deku Bubble, nor did she find herself trapped in a ravenous frenzy of Chateau Romani.

It was worse than that - lost in her thought, Anju hadn't cooked the soup properly, and her mother would surely notice!
14112211111121.title: Lunch at the Stock Pot Inn - Anju delivers her ...

choices: Just...one more bite...
141122111111211.content:
Anju bit her lip, glancing around the kitchen for something to mask her mistake.
On the middle shelf sat a lonely jar of Chateau Romani that Anju was hoping to save for later.
Uncorking the jar, she began to pour the mixture into the pot.
She could already smell the aroma begin to mask her mistakes, just a little more...
Anju kept pouring, the scent of Chateau Romani filling the kitchen once again until at last, the jar was empty and the deed was done.

One pot of Chateau Romani Soup, Extra Rich that looked and smelled divine, but did it taste just as heavenly?
Anju's stomach gurgled, responding to the latest spoonful and thought of another, sending a wave of sickness through her - she would have to go by her instincts, because there was no way she could drink even another drop...

Sighing heavily, Anju poured the mix into a bowl and prepared a tray, loading up her meal she made her way towards her grandmothers room on the far end of the hall. Inhaling sharply, Anju knocked once on the door and entered the room with lunch in tow.

...

Her Grandmother hadn't even noticed Anju come into the room, and only seemed to notice when the Innkeeper placed the heavy tray on her table.
Looking up from her thick tome, Anju's Grandmother turned her vision from the steaming soup, then to the considerably plump Anju and back to her reading.

"Oh, Tortus." she announced with a frail voice, "Have you been cooking again?"

Anju's face fell as she prepared herself into the same argument that she had had a dozen times with her Grandmother.

"Grandmother, I am Anju!", she insisted, "Tortus was my dad, and yes, I have been cooking; I've made you some soup - it's delicious."

From across the room, Anju's Grandmother squinted, first at the soup and then at Anju. Memories of the Innkeepers less-than-edible meals weren't lost on Anju's Grandmother.

"I'm not hungry Tortus, please keep practicing your cooking." She turned back to her reading once more.

"Grandmother..." Anju began exasperated, "I've been getting better - a lot better - all of ClockTown has been noticing..."

Anju was suddenly aware that she could have said 'bigger' instead of 'better' and it would still be a true statement.

"Please, just try my soup." Anju pleaded, "I've made it special just for you - and it's really good, honest!"

Anju's Grandmother wheeled herself over to Anju and her tray, craning her neck to sniff the aroma of Chateau Romani before turning back to her Granddaughter.

"It's really good, Tortus?" There was a hint of skepticism in the old womans voice.

"Oh, yes! It's probably one of my best dishes. Cooked to perfection!" Anju was never a good liar, and although she tried to sound as genuine as possible, her face betrayed her entirely, which the spry woman spotted immediately.

"Hmmm..." She wheeled closer, stirring the spoon into the soup, the thick aroma of Chateau Romani filling the study, "would you like some, Tortus?"

"Huh? Oh, no! I couldn't poss-" Anju caught herself, now it definitely looked like she was trying to pass off a bad recipe to her Grandmother, and a slight smirk flashed on the senile womans face.

"Hmmm... I thought as much Tortus. Not confident in your own cooking..." Anju's Grandmother began to wheel herself back to the hearth.

"Wait!" Anju cried, grabbing the tray and rested it on top of her stuffed stomach, which gurgled in protest, perhaps in expectation on what was to come.

This was it, just one more spoonful, just to prove that the soup was edible so her grandmother wouldn't go without lunch...
The Innkeeper stirred the soup slowly, gathering a spoonful and reluctantly raising it to her lips. Anju's grandmother watched with uncertainty.

Anju filled her cheeks with Extra Rich Chateau Romani, tonging the noticeably thicker mixture, before swallowing, hard.

Immediately the Innkeeper felt a wave of illness and regret ebb through her stomach - too full, too stuffed, not another bite!

"Oohh..." she groaned as she stifled a burp, she was going to pop, any second now, she knew it.

Across the room, Anju's grandmother chuckled, "Is there something wrong with the soup, Tortus? You look positively green."

"N-nothing..." Anju tried to continue but was cut off as a large tremor worked its way through her stomach, her face betraying her once again.
It definitely didn't help matters that there was an extra bottle of Extra Rich Chateau Romani added to the mix, she noted, slowly massaging her stomach which seemed to be straining against her blouse.

"It... *hic* really is... oooh... delicious..." Anju tried to save face, but it was obvious that her Grandmother wasn't having any of it.

"Really Tortus? You don't sound so sure... Why don't you have some more?"
141122111111211.title: Deliver the Soup anyways - perhaps her mother w...

choices: It's Kafei!
It's Cremia!
1411221111112111.content:
Anju realized how insane this was. Her stomach was practically screaming in protest at the idea of downing another spoonful of her soup that wasn’t even as good as the previous bowls she had eaten that day, but she felt that she still had to take one more bite. Her grandmother was watching her intently, and any hesitation to eat just one more spoonful would be a sign that the soup hadn’t turned out well.

Anju tentatively took one more sip of the soup, holding back a groan as it went down her esophagus and into the frothing mass that was her stomach. She nearly threw up, but fought it down with incredible determination.

“I-I’m *urp* telling the truth,” Anju said meekly. “The soup really is good!”

Anju’s grandmother, for her part, was still skeptical. Yet she was starting to pity “Tortus” a bit. “He” looked like he was about to pass out at any moment, and while she didn’t like eating mediocre food, she decided that she’d make an exception this one time.

“Alright, Tortus, that’s enough,” the elderly woman said, somewhat dismissively. “I’ll eat your soup. It’s not like there are that many alternative eateries around here, anyways. A shame, but it’s a reality we have to live with.”

“Th-thank you, Grandmother,” Anju said, too busy massaging her stomach to care about the erroneous name. “Please en-*URRRP* joy.”

After her grandmother began eating, the obese innkeeper made her way out of the room, moaning and massaging her stomach all the while. Oh, what she wouldn’t give for a nap right now. She didn’t want to eat anything for the rest of the day, and maybe tomorrow, too.
Just then, she heard the front door to the inn open, and she turned around to see…
1411221111112111.title: A New Visitor Arrives!

choices: Shocked at her weight
Even deeper in love with a fatter Anju
14112211111121111.title: It's Kafei!

choices: Created a Huge Dinner for Cremia (Plenty of Chateau Romani!)
Made a Normal-Sized Meal for Cremia
14112211111121112.content:
“Hi, Anju!” the friendly voice of Cremia greeted her, the woman herself standing a few feet inside the inn from the doorway.

“Oh, hi, Cremia,” Anju said, trying to be friendly, but a wince still came to her face due to the pain of her massive binge. She hoped Cremia wouldn’t mistake that as being her fault in any way. “How are you today?”

“Oh, I’m fine. Buisness over at the ranch isn’t as great as it was during the Carnival, but we’re still making enough. How ‘bout you?”

“Just *huff* peachy.”

Cremia wasn’t surprised by Anju’s weight, since she had seen her several times over the past few months, and each time the innkeeper looked bigger and bigger. Truth be told, the ranch girl was starting to get a little nervous about her friend’s rising obesity. There was no way Anju’s sedentary and calorie-filled lifestyle was doing any favors for her health. Anju was getting out of breath easier these days, and her clothes looked like they were going to tear at the seams.

However, her friend had been through a lot during the last Carnival, so she certainly deserved a break. That was the major reason as to why Cremia hadn’t brought the issue up; no need to poke the elephant in the room quite yet.

Anju also had thoughts of weight on the brain, but of a different nature. She was looking at Cremia’s body, lamenting the fact that she used to possess a similar physique that had given way to greed and gluttony, one that would probably never return. Yet her friend remaining so thin made her feel even worse; it only highlighted how hedonistic Anju had become these last several months.

Of course, the innkeeper would never bring this up to Cremia upfront. It wasn’t her fault she sparked just the tiniest bit of envy in Anju at seeing her trim waist and nearly washboard stomach.

“So, does the chef have any specials on the menu today?”Cremia asked, rubbing her belly.

It was then that Anju…
14112211111121112.title: It's Cremia!

choices: Eat All of It!
Eat Some, But Leave the Rest for Anju!
141122111111211121.content:
Anju definitely did not want to eat another meal for the rest of the day, that was a fact that would not be altered. However, that didn’t mean she wasn’t willing to create a dish for Cremia instead. And so she decided to make the same soup dish she had created the entire day, adding just as much milk as she had before.

Cremia sat over at the table, looking around absent-mindedly as Anju began preparing the ingredients. She noticed that Anju was having a bit of difficulty today even moving around the kitchen, and she swore she heard several growls and gurgles from the depths of her friend’s stomach, but she didn’t make any comments. It was obvious that Anju was well aware of her indigestion- might as well not bring it up and embarrass her.

“Alright, Cremia! I’m making *huff* some amazing soup using *huff* some of your Chateau Romani!” Anju proclaimed proudly, though a bit red-faced from exhaustion.

“Ooh, sounds delicious, Anju!” Cremia complimented, a big smile on her face.

A few minutes later, Anju put the bowl in front of her friend, Cremia’s eyes going a bit wide. The bowl was huge! It looked like it could easily serve ten people, yet here Anju was, giving it to her and expecting her to finish it! Did she really expect that? If these were the portions the innkeeper was eating all the time, then it was no wonder she had gained so much weight!

Tentatively putting a spoon into the bowl, Cremia brought the soup up to her lips and gulped it down. She had to admit, it did taste delicious…

“So, what do you think?” Anju asked.

“Mmmmm… Anju, your cooking skills have gotten amazing!” Cremia cooed. “I love this!”

The ranch girl looked up to see Anju’s expecting face beaming at her with pride. It was then that Cremia remembered how Anju probably wanted her to eat all of it. After all, it would be rude not to.

So, Cremia decided to…
141122111111211121.title: Created a Huge Dinner for Cremia (Plenty of Cha...

choices: She was going to visit Kafei today!
She needed to visit the Bar!
1411221111112111211.content:
“Uuugh…” Cremia moaned, rubbing her taut and round belly, giving a small belch.

Anju’s cooking tasted good, but boy, was it filling. Cremia had no idea how many calories she had injested, but if she had to guess, she’d say a lot. It wasn’t as if Cremia was unaccustomed to big meals, but this one was just so creamy, thick, and rich that she felt she would burst if she ate anymore.

But yet… in a way, it kind of felt good. The firmness of her gut, the gurgling of her stomach as it attempted to digest all that soup…

Is this what Anju feels all the time? Cremia mused, rubbing her belly. This is what comes with her weight? I have to admit, it’s not quite as bad as I thought…

“So, Cremia, I see you really enjoyed my soup, huh?” Anju said. “You know, I make all this on a daily basis, so if you want, you can come over and order some anytime you like. And guess what? Since you’re my friend, you’ll get to eat it all for free!”

“Wait, *urp* really Anju?” Cremia said. “I couldn’t possibly-“

“Oh, nonsense!” the innkeeper said, giving her own gut a subconscious rub, still feeling a bit of the aftereffects of her own much bigger binge. “I know things aren’t exactly booming over at the ranch, and again, you’re my friend. What friends don’t do favors for each other every once in a while? It’s not like you’d be making in our income, or anything.”

“Well, when you put it like that…” the ranch girl said, warming up to the idea.

“Come on, don’t feel guilty,” Anju said.

She walked up to her friend and looked down at her, suddenly realizing just how big Cremia’s stomach looked. It used to be unnoticeable underneath her dress, but now it was bulging out ever-so-slightly. Anju gave it a light rub; she knew how well those worked for her when she was feeling indigestion, so they’d definitely work for Cremia, someone who was much less used to the feeling. Her rub was rewarded with another belch from Cremia.

“Well, okay Anju,” Cremia said. “If you’re willing to do it, then I’m willing to go along.”

“Great!” the innkeeper exclaimed. “I’m glad to hear that, Cremia! But wow, can you believe it? I’m the one inviting you over for my cooking. Who ever thought that’d be the case, huh?”

“Anju, you’re too hard on yourself. Even the best chefs in the world need to start from somewhere.”

After a bit more conversation, Anju waved Cremia good-bye from the Stock Pot Inn. Her bloated friend returned the gesture and started her trek back to her cart that would lead her back home.

Then Anju remembered…
1411221111112111211.title: A Big Bloat

choices: Anju ventures out into Clock Town...
Something prevents Anju from leaving so quickly...
14112211111121112111.content:
As the innkeeper glanced at the large tome she kept at the front desk, she noticed a scrawled memo in between the margins:

"Kafei - Lunch Break 1:00 PM"

She had completely forgotten about her date with Kafei, but how could she miss such a prominent message written with red ink? As she approached the desk she soon found her answer, as her stomach soon loomed over the pages obscuring the passage completely.
Anju turned to the great clock next to her desk to make a note of the time - she had mere minutes to spare.
Brushing her scarlett locks away from her forehead, she closed the appointment book and turned on her heel away from the front desk.
14112211111121112111.title: She was going to visit Kafei today!

choices: Anju's exhausting journey to South Clock Town.
Anju arrives at the Laundry Pool without issue.
141122111111211121111.content:
East Clock Town had once been the bustling entertainment district during the Carnival of Time, but in its absence, the region was silent enough to make Anju's footsteps echo as she made her way to the Mayor's Residence.
In the past, the journey from the Stock Pot Inn could be made quite easily - but in Anju's current state, the ascending staircase might as well have been a mountain.
With one hand reaching out for the railing, and the other gently rubbing her stomach, the innkeeper began to climb upwards and onwards, stopping to catch her breath only twice.
"Oooh boy..." Anju whispered under her breath.
She swore she could feel the Chateau Romani sloshing, while her earlier morning antics had faded in memory, the same couldn't be said for the tautness she could feel now.
Breathing a sigh of relief as she crested the top of the steps, Anju followed the nearest wall before clutching onto the post box that had been placed here years prior.
"Just... need to... rest..." the Innkeeper sighed as her form became draped over the mailing station, practically causing it to buckle inward.
Anju took a few more deep breaths inward. "It's going to be... *ugh* a long day..."
If Anju had closed her eyes she might have fallen asleep on the spot, though she wouldn't find it so easily today...

"Erm... excuse me, miss..."

Anju blinked, turning towards the voice. Jogging on the spot was Clock Town's Postman.

"... you're blocking the postbox."

"Oh, I'm sorry!" Anju gasped, heaving herself away from the postbox and steadying herself. It was no easy feat.

"If I'm to remain on schedule," the Postman began, "I must have access to the postbox."

Withdrawing a small key, the Postman unlocked the base of the postbox and collected the letters inside, taking great care to arrange them in a neat pile. After he had finished, he turned his attention back to the Innkeeper.

"You are... Anju?" he questioned.

Anju practically froze on the spot. Did the Postman just realize that the once-svelte clerk of Stock Pot Inn now more closely resembled the bell on its rooftop?
Did she look anything like her old self, or perhaps the Postman thought that she was her own mother for months at a time?
Blushing, she turned her gaze to the Postman.

"Yes. I am Anju" She tried to smile, but found it wavering.

"I have a letter for you from the postbox!" The Postman exclaimed jubilantly, selecting a white envelope and handing it off.

Anju sighed inwardly - it was all just a misunderstanding in formality. She should have guessed after all, the Postman would likely question a mirror if he ever received mail for himself. He hoped that was all it was, anyways...

She turned the letter over in her hands - it was from Kafei!
Opening the envelope revealed a note written in blue ink:


"Anju, my love,

Please meet me at the Laundry Pool in South Clock Town,

Forever yours,

Kafei."

Anju returned the letter into its envelope as the Postman carried on down the stairs to make his rounds.
Anju wondered what surprises Kafei had in store for her. She wondered if he had kept Kafei waiting at the Laundry Pool.
Most importantly, she wondered how she would manage to get all the way across Clock Town if a single stairway had winded her.
141122111111211121111.title: Anju ventures out into Clock Town...

choices: Anju continues into South Clock Town...
1411221111112111211111.content:
Descending the steps towards the Stock Pot Inn, Anju decided that her best course of action would be to follow East Clock Town to its end and enter South Clock Town at the lowest gate. At least with this route everything would be downhill...

Before Anju could make it too far however, the door to the Treasure Chest Shop across from the Inn had opened from the inside, revealing the proprietor with brilliant purple hair leaving for her break. Still garbed in pink, the waifish girl hadn't changed in the slightest since the Carnival of Time had ended - it made Anju feel envious, guilty and ultimately conflicted all at once.

Perhaps she wouldn't notice if Anju slinked past the Inn and into South Clock Town through the alternate route...

"Oh! Hey Anju!"

So much for that...

Having locked the Treasure Chest Shop, the girl came dotting towards Anju, hips swaying and feathered hair bounding with every step, her green eyes glistening like Rupees as they met Anjus.

"Heya Gal." Anju returned, managing to muster a smile that didn't seem too forced.

"Sooooo...." The shop owner cooed, her eyes faltering from Anju's gaze to explore her body up and down. ".... how's it going?"

'She doesn't want to talk,' Anju thought to herself, 'She just wants to see how much bigger the girl from the Inn has gotten...'

"Oh, you know," Anju sighed, "It's business as usual - guests to serve and rooms to fill."

Anju looked up to see Gal was once again staring at her stomach, which had been pressing up tightly against the fabric that covered her midrift - she seemed distracted.

"Gal?" Anju tried to break the trance.

"Hm?" She said blinking, "Oh. Yeah. I'll bet the rooms are... really full...."

As if on command, Anju's stomach growled loudly, turning the Innkeeper an interesting shade of red.

"Um, how's the Treasure Chest Shop?" Anju offered, hoping to save face. Gal seemed to light up in response.

"Fantastic! I thought business would have died down after the Carnival of Time had ended, but since I put in that new mini-game maze I seem to keep getting return customers! It's designed so that you can never take the same path twice, but there's always a pattern that you can use to find your way!" Gal was beaming emphatically, "You just have to go up, up, down, down, left, right, left, ri-"

Anju's stomach growled once again as Gal's eyes went wide, as they met with Anju's she looked away nervously.

"I um... haven't had lunch yet..." Anju lied - her stomach was still painfully full with Chateau Romani.

"Really? Erm, I mean... that's uh..." Gal was practically tripping over her words as she turned to face Anju. "We could go for some now, if you..."

"Oh, I'm actually going out with Kafei right now, but maybe later..."

Anju gave an unconvincing smile, hoping with everything that her stomach didn't rumble again...

"Awww, you guys are so cute together!" Gal was melting with sweetness, "If you ever want to try out my new maze it's on the house!"

"Thanks, Gal."

And with that the two women parted ways - Anju traveled to South Clock Town while Gal took the Stockpot route through for easy access to West Clock Town.
Gal did steal one last parting glance at Anju however, as the Innkeeper heaved her way down the steps.

'Whao,' Gal thought to herself, 'I can't believe how much she's put on... two Silver Rupees, at least...'
1411221111112111211111.title: Anju's exhausting journey to South Clock To...

choices: The path to North Clock Town...
14112211111121112111111.content:
As Anju made her way into South Clock Town, she knew immediately that something was wrong - a number of carpenters had gathered, shouting orders at eachother as a large pile of debris trailed off towards the Clock Tower. The short-tempered leader, Mutoh, was closest to Anju, rallying a few workers to begin reconstructing the central plinth tower.

"Erm, excuse me sir..." Anju began, "What's happened?"

Mutoh glanced briefly towards Anju as he continued to direct his workers.

"Tower had no support on its north end, came down like that Moon did! Crash! Nearly fell on top of my workers, lucky nobody was hurt..."

Anju watched as the workers sifted through the rubble - South Clock Town had been effectively cut in two.

"You needed to get through to West Clock Town?" Mutoh questioned, turning his attention back to Anju.

"The Laundry Pool, actually..."

"Ah..." Mutoh scratched his head, surveying the damage. "It's the same way - you'll have to go through East Clock Town, then North, then through the West to get there."

"Oh. Thanks." Anju sighed before turning on her heel back to East Clock Town.
14112211111121112111111.title: Anju continues into South Clock Town...

choices: Into North Clock Town
141122111111211121111111.content:
'Surely these steps hadn't been so long before...' Anju thought to herself as she crested the first set of steps to East Clock Town.
Still sloshing with Chateau Romani, the heavy Innkeeper made her way through towards the Stock Pot Inn and briefly considered going in to rest, before realizing that the journey would require conquering yet another set of difficult stares en-route to the Employee Lounge.

'No, Kafei is waiting,' Anju thought. 'I can't give up now...'

The next set of stairs were decidedly steeper than Anju remembered, each heavy footfall bringing her closer to the top, while at the same time making her breath run ragged. Anju was on shaky footing as she finally made it to the top, finding solace once more in the postbox that served as a safe haven.

As Anju leaned on the postbox, panting heavily, she heard a voice...

"Excuse me, miss..."

Oh no. Not again.

Anju looked up, but was surprised to see that the Postman hadn't returned, but that the voice belonged to a small boy wearing a yellow bandana.

"Are you okay?"

Anju heaved herself from the postbox, standing up with some difficult as she focused on the boy below - she had seen him around Clock Town before, guarding the small alcove that she couldn't hope to squeeze through.

"I belong to the Bomber's Secret Society of Justice," The boy started, "If anyone has trouble in Clock Town my friends and I sort it out!"

Anju smirked. He was definitely getting brownie points for cuteness.

"Do you want some water lady?" The Bomber bounced on the spot, "You look like you need some water."

Anju sighed with relief, "Some water sounds lovely. Thank you"

The boy raced off into the alcove and within seconds had returned with a bottle filled to the brim with Spring Water.

Lacking a bench, Anju had improvised, sitting squarely atop the postbox - it was a little awkward but served its purpose. As the Bomber closed in, Anju gratiously took the water from his hands and brought it to her lips. Oath to Order! It was the most refreshing thing Anju had ever drank.
Tilting the glass upwards, Anju gulped down the Spring Water with restored vigor and after a few long seconds had managed to drink the entire bottle.
Breathing a sigh of relief, the Innkeeper handed the bottle back to the Bomber who turned up to her with expectation.

"More?" He offered.

"Please..."

And with that the Bomber had darted off towards his hideout, and had returned within seconds with a second bottle of water.
Once again, Anju raised the bottle of water to her lips and gulped it down fervently.
The Bomber watched as the large woman emptied the bottle, the postbox underneath seeming to creak in protest as drank without restraint.

"Ohhh...*hic* Thank you so much..." Anju handed the bottle back to the Bomber as he took out a notebook and began to scrawl a note within its pages.

As Anju returned to her feet her curiosity was piqued. "Erm, what are you writing in there?"

"This is my Bombers' Notebook," the boy explained, "When I help someone in town with a problem, I make an entry about it, here."

The Bomber turned the Notebook to face Anju, where the entry read:

~Helped nice lady get water~

Anju giggled in spite of herself - it was just so cute!

"Well thank you very much for the water - if you come to the Inn later on I might have some candy as a reward for you."

"Thanks lady," The bomber began, "But a good deed is a reward itself."

The boy marched back to his post as Anju turned to enter North Clock Town.

Back at the postbox, the wood had begun to noticeably splinter...
141122111111211121111111.title: The path to North Clock Town...

choices: Water in West Clock Town...
1411221111112111211111111.content:
Taking her first steps into North Clock Town, Anju's footfalls had grown heavy, positively aching.
Sighing deeply she managed to spot a granite slide that provided an ideal resting spot.
Stretching out on the slide, Anju laid back and soon found that her hands were caressing her stomach.
The mixture of Chateau Romani and Spring Water had caused a bit of bloating and the sound of dull gurgling could be heard within.
"Oooh..." Anju sighed to herself, drawing circles with her fingers around her distended middle.
As she went to sit up however, her gaze was met by a similar looking boy, this time in a red bandana.

"Oh my!" Anju gasped, slightly taken back before regaining composure. "Hello there."

"My name is Jim, I'm the leader of the Bombers." he announced triumphantly, "Are you the water lady?"

Anju sniggered, "Well, yes. I suppose I am."

"Good!" Jim said beaming, "I brought you some water!"

"Oh," Anju gulped, trying not to lose her smile as Jim offered her a bottle of Spring Water. "Thank you very much."

She looked down at the Bomber boy, eyebrows raised in anticipation as he waited for her to drink, and feeling guilty she brought it to her lips.

Tipping the bottle up once more, Anju managed to swallow all of the water, resting one hand on her stomach trying to quell the feeling of fullness. What's more, she felt as though she needed to use the bathroom. Perhaps when she returned to the Stock Pot Inn she would make a stop before tending to the front counter.
She passed the bottle back to Jim who had already began writing in his Bomber's Notebook.

"Helped. Water. Lady." he read aloud, "The Bomber Secret Society of Justice Forever!"

Anju smiled as she watched Jim march off, taking a deep breath, she reached down and pushed herself from the slide. The Innkeeper found herself very full now, and her stomach seemed to weigh her down, bobbing like a pendulum as she attempted to waddle forward.
She couldn't wait to see Kafei, and made her way into West Clock Town.
1411221111112111211111111.title: Into North Clock Town

choices: It can't wait! Use the Curiosity Shop facilities...
Seek out Kafei in the Laundry Pool...
14112211111121112111111111.content:
The Carnival of Time had a profound effect on much of West Clock Town, as many shops were forced to close their doors when the flow of customers from out of town had dried up. Only the Clock Town Bank had managed to stay open, after it managed to profit from the boy who had gone off to a strange land called, "Hyrule", leaving the many Rupees in trust with the Bank - never to return.
For Anju, she was pleased that West Clock Town was entirely downhill, no more stairs to climb, no uphill battles; just a gentle descending coast towards the Laundry Pool...

She tried to keep her mind off of the babbling brook within the Pool however, as it reminded her of her own churning and frothing mixture of Spring Water inside.

As Anju crossed the front door of the defunct Bomb Shop, she felt a tugging at her dress.
Confused, she spun about to find another boy with a blue bandana at her heels. Anju could feel her stomach drop.

"Erm, hello there." She squeaked, her own voice dying a little in her throat.

"Hello nice lady, I'm a member of the Bombers Secret Society of Justice and I have some water for you - Jim says that the Bombers Society of..."

The Bomber Boys words had been lost on Anju, who in a dazed state seemed only focused on the bottle of Spring Water, filled to the absolute brim, as she felt now.

Perhaps she would be able to let the boy down softly...

Anju began to kneel to get at the boys eye level, prepared to ease him into a bout of 'thanks, but no thanks', but as Anju bent forward over her stomach a bolt of pain shot through her body. Too full!

"Oooh..." Anju shivered, "I'm sorry but I..."

She turned to look at the Bomber, who had a look of sadness across his face.

"If I helped you, I would have finished my Bomber's Notebook - I've been waiting a whole month for this last entry..."

Anju bit her lip as the Boy turned the pages revealing a mostly complete directory of every Clock Town citizen, save for herself, of course.
Surely one bottle of Spring Water wouldn't hurt, would it? She looked into the pouting face of the Bomber boy and sighed, defeated.

"I'm sorry," she began, "I'd love to have a bottle of Spring Water..."

The boy was overjoyed, handing over the bottle of water with shaking hands as he returned to his Notebook and began scrawling, and stopped to watch Anju enjoy his offering.

Clutching her stomach, Anju brought the bottle of Spring Water to her lips, pouring its contents as she took laboured gulps. She was so full, and worse, she had to use the bathroom as well. Anju felt as thought she were inflating on the spot, she could feel her stomach pressing against the light fabric tied around her waist - if she wasn't careful she was sure that it would burst away, revealing her bare midrift to any wanton eye in Clock Town.
Crossing her legs beneath her dress, Anju finished the last drops of Spring Water as she wiped her lips, completely and utterly stuffed.

"Thank *hic* you," Anju blurted, "I'm full now..."

The Bomber boy took back the empty Bottle, scrawling the final passage into his Notebook and reading his entry aloud...

"Helped. Water. Lady. Get. Full."

Anju rose to her feet with much shuffling. "You sure... did..."

"Jim'll make me the Captain now!" the Bomber boy exclaimed, "Thanks Water Lady!"

The boy took off towards North Clock Town with his Notebook in tow, as Anju made her way to the front gate of West Clock Town, steadying herself at the Bank.
Unfortunately for Anju, the doorway was blocked by yet another Bomber boy...

"Um, hello." The boy began.

Anju noticed that her lips were quivering, her stomach was so full that it ached and she felt ready to explode if she didn't use the bathroom immediately!
The sloshing in her belly had grown to a veritable tsunami and it had begun growling under the immense pressure. Still, Anju pressed on.

"Hi." Was all that Anju could offer, in the tiniest voice imaginable.

"You're the lady who likes water right? Jim says that I have to give you this..." Anju winced as the boy brought forth another bottle of Spring Water - it too was filled to the absolute brim...

"Hey... listen...." Anju began. "I'm actually um..."

"I haven't helped anyone this month," the Bomber Boy offered in a deflated tone, "Jim says that I'm kicked outta the Bombers if I don't help somebody today..."

Anju was still wincing, "Well...*hic* I don't..."

"Nobody ever needs my help," he sulked, "I'm gonna get kicked out of the Bombers for sure..."

Anju watched as tears began to fill his eyes. She bit her bottom lip and clenched her fists. Her stomach was so full and she needed to go so badly that she had begun hopping subtely on the spot which sent ebbing pain through her body.

"Holdonholdonholdon!" Anju winced, "I'll-drink-your-water...Ooh..."

The boy was suddenly filled with newfound energy as he bolted over to Anju, beaming.

"Really?" He whispered, eyes wide with excitement.

Anju tried to smile, but her lower jaw was shaking. "Mmmhmm..." was all she could muster.

As Anju took the bottle of Spring Water from the Bomber boy, a particularly violent jolt shot through her body, leaving the Innkeeper briefly cross-eyed as she nearly doubled over.

"Oooh...wow..."

A series of deep and growling gurgles soon followed, with Anju was relegated to cradling her stomach in one hand and trying not to lose grip of the bottle with the other. This was it, she had reached her physical limit - another drop of Spring Water or Chateau Romani and she was going to pop like a Deku Bubble!
Anju had started to falter on the spot, clenching her teeth, but out of compulsion she had managed to raise the Spring Water to her lips once more.
Gulp after gulp the bottle began to empty. The Bomber boy watched on as the shivering Anju tiled the bottle skyward, as the water soon vanished from view.

"Ow! Nomorenomorenomore...." Anju whimpered, seething in pain.

She had managed to drop the bottle, though it remained unscathed as it rolled towards the final Bomber.

Looking towards the bottle, and then to Anju, the Bomber confirmed, "No more?"

"Please... No more." Anju whined through clenched teeth as she sat on the steps of the Curiosity Shop.

"So I..." the Bomber looked on concerned, "I helped you, right?"

Anju was now rocking, both hands firmly caressing her roiling stomach. "Oh yeah. Yep. You did! No more now please!"

A look of satisfaction came over the oblivious Bomber as he withdrew his Notebook and began scrawling his entry.

"Helped. Water. Lady. And. Baby." He read aloud.

"Huh?" Anju blurted between deep breaths.

The Bomber looked at his Notebook, then to Anju, then to her massive belly, then back to his Notebook.

"But..." He started, conflicted. "Your belly is... Oh... Okay..."

The Bomber erased the addition to his entry and shut his Notebook with confidence, then stood in a faux-salute.

"The Bomber's Seek-red Suc-i-ally of Judge-stice Forn-ever!"

As the Bomber darted away back to East Clock Town, Anju sat as her stomach rumbled, filled to the absolute brim with water.
'This must be what it feels like to be a Blue Chuchu...' she thought to herself.
14112211111121112111111111.title: Water in West Clock Town...

14122.content:
"No, that won't do!" Evan, the pianist, exclaimed dissatisfied. "Your voice gets too thin. You sound like a newly hatched bird."

"I'm sorry, but that note is among the top of my vocal register! It's not easy to get it that rich... besides.. that chord sounds so out of place" Lulu replied being a little tired.

She was jamming some newly written lyrics together with Evan, the pianist and main composer for their popular all-Zora band, The Indigo-Gos.

She knew Evan didn't mean to be so nit-picky. He was very passionate about his work, and she never doubted his songwriting skills, but his low patience and perfectionism, didn't always go hand in hand.

"trust me, Lulu, this will be a hit! Just wait until I've finished the arrangements for the other instruments... but meanwhile... is there no way you could thicken your tone a little. Make it a little richer and less sharp?"

"I honestly have no idea how to" Lulu said giving a sigh.

"Well... what if you go visit your old vocal-instructor? Maybe she has a few advices"

141221.content:
The next afternoon, Lulu was sitting in her old voice-instructors room. She explained her problem.

Her former teacher gave a short laugh. "Young lady, nothing is wrong with your voice! Quite the contrary. Your band mates heart lies with his music, but I doubt he has any ideas on how a vocal-chord functions. No, the sound he requests is usually sung by singers with a bit of more girth than you, dear"

"You say I should some weight?" Lulu asked skeptically.

"No, that is your own choice, dear. But might I say, that you are not the first who would do that. Many singers through time has done that. And we are not talking about much, don't worry" her teacher said comforting.

"hmmm" Lulu was hesitant. She wasn't sure if Mikau would like her the same way if she gained weight. Then again, the two would often talk about how they always wanted to walk through fire and water to reach the musical vision their band shared. Maybe if she just gained a little, Mikau would understand.

After a week of extra eating and no exorcise...

Lulu walked into her manager, the stout toto's office. There Toto sat eating a piece of fish, he caught glance of Lulu and put his meal aside.

"Well Toto, not to good, you see Evan needs me to thicken my voice for our new musical approach." said Lulu depressingly.
