"With my special oil, you see Lulu, ever since the humans made settlement east of us, tons of oil and other magical liquids have mixed together in a treated sewage line and made into a special oil that will thicken your voice and make you gain weight too!" he finished
Lulu looked enthusiastic and grabbed Toto's small fins.
"When can we get started!?" she said
"As Soon as you want!" he said

141312.content:
About a week has passed since the terror of the evil looking moon has been taken care of by a mysterious green clothed boy. This boy apparently helped and saved so many people in Termina including the current owner of Romani Ranch, Cremia when she was able to successfully deliver milk to the Milk Bar in Clock Town due to the boy helping and defending her from some shady hooded characters on the 2nd day before the Carnival of Time started.

"That boy, I really wish I could've known him more." Cremia tells to herself as she prepares for her next milk delivery.

"Romani wants to come with you!" Her younger sister calls out as she sees her running to her before climbing on the milk carriage.

"Romani, you know you have to stay here and watch the ranch and cows, I will be back soon." Cremia says to her sister.

"Yes sister." Romani sighs as she watches her sister then command the mules to start moving on the path to Clock Town. "Grasshopper, if your out there, please keep Cremia safe." She prays as she recalls the green clothed boy helping her fend off the ghost creatures on the 1st Night.

"This sure feels like Deja vu." Cremia softly says as she sees the road and still remembering that night, before she could advance to Termina Field though, she saw someone that forced her to make a complete stop, as she couldn't believe her eyes.

Cremia chooses to go back to the ranch in the meantime.
1413121.content:
"It...Its him." Cremia couldn't believe it, but the strange boy that had helped both her and Romani was sleeping by one of the mysterious owl statues.

"So the rumors weren't true after all." She smiles softly as she slowly decends down to take a closer look at him. He felt so pure and innocent but somehow she knew he had the instinct of a heroic warrior in him as he was holding his long Gilded Sword and creepy looking Mirror Shield as a means of defending himself in case for monsters that try to ambush him.

"Anju said you disappeared after the Carnival of Time started, but your still here." Cremia then proceeds to hold and then carry him on her shoulders, she however noticed that one of his eyes slowly opens but then closes back as he lets out a snore that makes her giggle.

"Relax now, you don't want to catch a cold." She then places him in the carriage's back area and places a blanket around him while placing his sword and shield by him.

"After this delivery, I'm sure Romani will be happy to see her "Little Hero" again. She then resumes her delivery as she makes it to Clock Town's Milk Bar without any casualties. After delivering the milk successfully, she then returns to the carriage to find that the boy was still sleeping in it.

"He must be exhausted, poor thing, I wonder if I should let Anju know that I found him before I head back to the ranch." Cremia thinks if she really should involve her longtime friend about her discovery since Anju was worried about his safety too.

"I'll come back another time, I'm sure Anju can wait." Cremia then climbs back onto the carriage and proceeds to return back to the ranch. She forgot how peaceful it's been around Termina since the mysterious moon disappeared as she makes it back to Romani Ranch with little effort.

"I'm finally back home." Cremia lets out a soft smile as she starts to smell the familiar scent of haystacks and there precious cows as she then stops right by her house, climbs down and checks the back to see if the boy was still there, and thankfully he was as he is still sleeping. The sight of his long sleep made Cremia smile as she then slowly picks him up and holds him in her arms.

Morning soon arrives as the sun shines on the boy as he finally wakes up, his blue eyes shining as the sunlight touches them while he yawns and rubs his eyes.

"Good morning." A female voice calls out to him as it instantly wakes him up and turns his head to be greeted by a familiar looking person.

"Good morning Grasshopper!" A familiar looking girl greets the boy as his memories from Hyrule suddenly flow his brain.

"Malon?" He quietly asks her which just makes her shake her head.

"Malon? No, it's Romani. Romani is happy to see you again!" She then hugs him which makes him hug back.

"Oh, I see your awake." A older and familiar looking woman then appears by the door with a bottle of milk. "I found you sleeping by Milk Road, what were you doing out there by yourself?" The woman asks him as she hands him the bottle in which he politely accepts.

"I...I was searching for my friend after I couldn't go back home." He answers her as he then drinks the milk, Cremia however looks at him with concern from what he just said.

"You couldn't return home? Where are your parents?" Cremia asks him in which he puts the bottle down and looks at both her and Romani.

"I never met my mother, my father is dead." He answers referring to the Great Deku Tree as he was the only father figure he has ever known in his life.

"You don't know your parents? Well, you are welcome to stay here as long as you need to." Cremia then leads the boy to the family table that had what was probably the most delicious food that he had ever saw. There was pancakes, milk, and what is considered to be meat as he recalls only eating fruit and nuts most of his life.

"If I may ask, what is your name?" Cremia asks as she makes her, Romani, and the boy's share and hands him his.

"It's Link." He answers as he then eats some of the pancakes which makes Romani giggle from hearing his name.

"Can Romani still call you Grasshopper?" She asks as she then eats her fill.

"Yeah, you can." Link quietly answers her as he finishes up his food and wolfs it down with some milk. Even though he didn't admit, he actually thought the milk was actually quite tasty, possibly even better than Lon Lon Ranch's.

"Yay! Thank you Grasshopper!" Romani then hugs him in which he responds by looking at her, which makes Cremia smile.

"Link, if you don't mind, will you go outside and play with Romani? She's been wanting to play with you since yesterday." Cremia kindly asks Link as she starts to clean up the dishes so Romani can have a nice time with her "Little Hero."

"Well..." Link looks at both of the girls to rethink his thoughts.

"Ok Sister." Romani replies as she decides to help Cremia with the rest of the plates. Link on the other hand walks by the crate where he first met Romani and smiles as he's glad that he no longer has to travel back in time so he can be more comfortable in Termina, but deep down, he really misses Hyrule and his friends.

"Zelda, Saria, Malon, Navi." Link quietly mutters as he sits on the crate and pulls the Ocarina of Time out from his bag, the only possession from Hyrule he has with him made him feel nostalgic as he then decides to play a song with it to help him relax.
1413121222.title: He declines telling them he needs time to be al...

choices: The warmth goes to her chest.
The warmth goes to her belly.
14132.content:
Roman's stomach growled as she brought up a hand to clutch it. She was hungry from playing outside all day, but dinner was still a few hours away, and Cremia always hated when Romani snacked before dinner. She thought for a moment, closing her eyes and placing her hand on her chin. Her face suddenly perked up and she grinned as she thought of plan. Cremia had just finished milking some fresh Chateau Romani earlier today, and left it in shack where the cows stayed. Romani planned to sneak into the shack, not only would she satisfy her hunger, she'd finally be able to try the special milk of her namesake.
Romani carefully creeped up behind the cow's shack, even if Cremia was busy with other farm work, it was still broad daylight. so Romani decided to be extra careful. She look around before squeezing herself into a small hole in the back of the shack. After crawling inside and dusting herself off, she took a look around the room. It didn't take her long to spy the large kegs of the Chateau Romani. Just her luck, it seemed Cremia had left a keg unsealed. The milk seemed to radiate a strange purple glow, but Romani figured that maybe it was supposed to look like that. She approached the open and keg, and carefully lowered her face to the placid surface of the milk. She started at it with huge eyes full of excitement, barely able to contain herself she lowered her lips to the surface, and began taking deep gulps.
The special milk was the best she had ever tasted. It was rich, creamy, and slightly thick. It even tingled a bit on her lips and on the way down to her stomach. After many moments and even more gulps, Romani raised her head, wiped the milk from her mouth with one swift motion from her arm, and let out a hearty sigh. Her stomach bulged slightly from all the milk she had drank. Romani rubbed her belly, causing a tiny burp to well up from within her. She blushed and slightly covered her mouth, despite her only company being cows.
Romani suddenly felt very warm. She blushed hard as her groin lit up in excitement, not knowing what to do, she pressed both of her hands against her crotch as she slowly fell to the ground. She began to pant and sweat slightly. The warmth seemed to be spreading, but was still concentrated in her groin.
"Oooooh," she moaned, "What's happening to me... I feel so funny..."
The intense heat in her groin suddenly seemed to begin moving.
14132.title: Cursed Chateau Romani

choices: Cremia walk in on Malon.
The warmth returns to her body.
141322.content:
Romani tossed and turned on the ground. rubbing her belly as it surged with the strange warmth. Her stomach gurgled, causing Romani to burp loudly. Her face managed to flush a deeper red, as she realized her once full belly now felt disappointingly empty. Romani was quickly distracted from this thought as she felt her fingers begin to sink into her belly. Hearing chains clicking against one another, Ilia saw a cart pulled by two boars outside. On the cart, there was a person, who had a sack thrown over their head.

She pulled a barrel closer and stuffed a handful into her mouth. She moaned. It was much, much nicer than the goblins pudding. She could taste different kinds of fruit, each one distinctive.

Stuffing handful after handful into her mouth, Ilia stopped occasionally to rub her belly, which was growing bigger with each handful.
"So... Good!" She moaned, clearly addicted to the pudding. "Want... more. Need... more!"
Polishing off the first barrel, Ilia lent back on her throne. Her breasts had almost doubled in size, approaching the size of watermelons. They sat heavily on top of her globular belly. It was now much bigger than her father's belly, something she felt a bit of pride over. Beneath her, the two chairs groaned under the weight of Ilia's ass, which leaked over the edges of the chairs. Her thighs were thicker than tree trunks by this point, and were incredibly heavy. Ilia wasn't immobile, it would just be very hard to move, considering she hadn't moved once since she received her throne room.

Leaning forward again, Ilia started on the second barrel. As her body grew once again, her mind started to alter. What the woman didn't mention was who had payed for the delivery. Hyrule had been liberated from the Twilight, but its current ruler was still alive. While he couldn't reintroduce the Twilight while a hero roamed the lands, he could bring the town's under his control through other methods. Specifically, pudding that was addressed to the leaders of each town. This pudding had been cursed to make whoever ate it cruel, and greedy, much like Zant and his Master.
As Ilia finished the second barrel, she lifted one of her arms and swatted the barrel aside. She grinned evilly. Her eyes, once a bright hazel, had taken on a reddish hue. Her fair skin had darkened ever so slightly.
Leaning back again, Ilia clapped twice. A goblin ran into her room.
"I want more of this," Ilia said. "I don't care how you get it. Get it all, and bring it to me!"
Nodding, the goblin ran out.
Smiling, Ilia started on the third barrel.

"Is this the last of it?"
A woman, clad in a purple and white dress, inspected a number of barrels.
"I'm sorry, Princess. Three barrels, bound for Ordon Village, just... disappeared", one of her servants said.
Zelda shook her head. Prince Ralis had alerted her to the blue substance. Almost instantly, she ordered a hunt for the barrels. However, three had gone missing.
"Keep an eye open for them. I shall head for Ordon Village, and see if I can't lend my aid to the search", Zelda said, heading towards the door.
"Your Highness, Zant is still out there. If he were to capture you...".
"He will do nothing. While the Light rules Hyrule, Zant's powers are greatly diminished. And besides, Link is out there. While Link roams Hyrule, Zant will keep to his realm," Zelda said, grabbing her cloak and wrapping it over her shoulders.

14211211222112122121.title: Strength of Cruelty

choices: "Help you..."

142112112221121221211.content:
Looking up, Zelda groaned.
"Damn goblins... They've been aggressive lately. I should've known that they'd be watching Hyrule Field".
Spying a couple of goblins charging towards her on boars, Zelda summoned her bow. As the holder of the Triforce of Wisdom, she could summon weapons at will. She wasn't as experienced as Link with a sword or a bow, but she could hold her own, especially considering that the goblins only form of attack was 'Charge at enemy'.

Nocking at arrow, Zelda took aim at the lead goblin. She let the arrow fly, striking him squarely in the chest. He fell off, landing in the path of one of his comrades. The boar tripped over its body before it burst into a cloud of twilight particles. A green rupee dropped from the cloud, causing a small smile to cross the Princess's face.
Turning her attention to the final goblin, Zelda nocked a second arrow and hit him in the head, instantly causing him to burst into particles.

Hearing a second horn from behind her, Zelda turned around. These goblins were much closer and without any mounts. Dismounting her own, she dismissed her bow and summoned a rapier. A goblin swung for her. Parrying it, she stabbed him. Dodging to the side, she slashed a second before stabbing a third. Turning the face the last two, she was met with confusion as they ran away. Sheathing her rapier, Zelda turned around and saw the reason for running.

A boar was bearing down on her. She jumped to the side, narrowly avoiding its tusks. Standing up, she watched as the boar turned to face her again.
"Even without a rider...?" Zelda asked herself. Normally, boars would just give up without its rider, but this one was unusually persistent.
As it charged again, Zelda tried to dodged again. However, she made a mistake, one she hadn't made in all her years.
As she started moving sideways, her foot caught her dress, causing her to trip. Her eyes widened as the boar approached...
It stopped.
Looking up, Zelda saw a bigger goblin leering down at her. She didn't have time to call out before he knocked her out cold.

"Wake her!"
Feeling cold water thrown on her face, Zelda awoke with a start. Wet hair hung down into her vision, however she couldn't move her arms to brushing aside. Looking at her arms, she found them tied Beijing her back. She couldn't see her legs, but she felt ropes binding them together.
Her head was yanked back roughly, her hair falling out of her vision, revealing a very overweight female wearing nothing. Her belly was coated with grease from previous meals, and hung in between her immense thighs. Her breasts sat heavily on her belly.

"Look at me when I'm speaking to you!" She spat angrily.
Looking at her face, Zelda saw a pair of red eyes glaring at her.
"The Princess of Hyrule will not..." Zelda began to say, but stopped when a goblin hit her.
"Speak only when spoke to, 'Princess'!" The Girl shouted.
Looking at her, Zelda kept quiet.
"Good girl. Now, I seek something. You will help me find it, or else!"
"And what would that be?" Zelda asked.
A grin spread across the girls round face.
"Barrels of a blue pudding. Help me find them, and I will release you. Fail to help me, and we'll see how long Hyrule will last against my army," she said, leaning back.

Zelda briefly considered her options. She knew what the blue substance did, and knew enough to know that the girl before her had eaten it. Helping her would, technically, get rid of the stuff, but Hyrule already faced danger from Zant and the Twilight Realm. Unless Link could fight on two fronts, then Hyrule would be in even greater danger.
Or she could do it.
Zelda had grown up hearing stories of how the Hero had saved Hyrule time and time again, while the Princess was locked up somewhere and needed rescuing. She could save Hyrule from the goblin menace, while Link saved it from the Twilight!
But then again, if the girl didn't keep her word and let her go, Hyrule wouldn't last long. The army wasn't that good. They wouldn't last long against a flock of cucco, let alone goblins...

"Well? What's your answer?!" The Girl asked, her red eyes still glaring at Zelda.
"I will..."
142112112221121221211.title: Taken hostage... again

choices: "Then we'll make you eat!"
"Then starve. Take her back!"
1421121122211212212112.content:
"You think I'd even consider your proposal?! I will not help you!" Zelda said defiantly, looking straight into the girl's red eyes.
Initially, she was surprised. She was so used to the goblins taking her word as law that refusal... stunned her. However, she recovered quickly, a look of pure anger replacing the surprise.
"So be it. Throw her with the other prisoner. And bring me more food!" She ordered.
The goblins stood still for a moment before moving.
"I'm sorry, did I stutter?! Throw her in the prison and bring me food! NOW!"
They quickly got to work. A burly goblin who stood next to the girl moved towards Zelda, while the two that flanked the door hurried out.

"Let go off me!"
Zelda was thrown into a prison cell. The burly goblin pushed up against a wall while another cut her bindings. Before she could attack them, or even resist, a chain was clamped around her ankle. As they left, the burly one leered at her. Zelda ignored him.
Sitting against the wall, she tried to communicate Link with the Triforce. However, she couldn't reach him.
"Must be in the Twilight Realm. Or in the middle of something..." Zelda said out loud. In response, a chain clinked in the corner opposite her.

"P-Princess Zelda?" A voice asked. The room she was locked in was incredibly dark, the only light sources being the cracks around the door, and a small crack in the wall.
"Yes. Who are you?" Zelda asked. Chains clinked as someone started moving. Squinting, Zelda recalled a power that her mother had used while she had possessed the Triforce of Wisdom. Concentrating, she summoned a ball of light.
Opposite her, a woman was huddled up against the wall. She wore a white dress with a leather coat over it. She was covered in dirt, while her red hair was all over the place.
"I'm Anise, a travelling merchant who does deliveries. I was payed to deliver supplies to Ordon Village, but these goblins..." She began to tear up.
"It'll be okay. They won't harm you, not while I'm here", Zelda assured her. She would console her better, but the chain around her ankle restricted her movement.
"You said your name was Anise?" Zelda asked. She definitely knew that name...
"Yes... You once travelled with us, while your mother was still alive. Your servant at the time kept us separate, so we never spoke", Anise explained.

Zelda would have spoken further, but the door opened. A goblin bearing two bowls entered, along with a note. He handed the note to Zelda, along with a bowl. Anise took the other.
"Don't eat it!" Zelda said quickly as the goblin left. "This stuff... It corrupts your mind".
Anise dropped the bowl.
"Why? Who would make it like that?" She asked, a hint of fear in her voice.
Zelda didn't answer. She knew who would, but the people of Hyrule didn't need to know that. It would just cause panic in the streets. Instead, she read the note.

Princess Zelda,
As the Goddess of this tribe, I would like to invite you to a feast. I would also like to apologize for the way my subjects have treated you. Rest assured, they will be punished. A goblin will be along shortly to escort you to my chambers.
The Goddess, Ilia

"Ilia..." Zelda thought for a second, before it hit her. "Ilia, daughter of the mayor of Ordon! Link mentioned that she had been captured, but... A goddess?"
Hearing a knock, two burly goblins entered. As they headed towards Zelda, she initially thought of escaping. However, fighting against a stronghold of goblins... The odds were definitely not in her favour. She allowed them to tie her arms behind her back. However, she struggled when a sack hood was produced.
"I refuse to wear it!" She protested, however she was ignored. It was forced over her head.

After being marched through the stronghold, she heard Ilia's voice.
"There. Now, take the hood off, and leave us".
The hood was ripped off her head, revealing a massive table laden down with food. Ilia, who was still on her 'Throne', sat at one end while Zelda sat at the other. Her arms were untied, although a rope was tied around her waist, binding her to the chair.
"From one leader to another, allow me to apologize in person. You should have been treated in a manner that suits you, not like a common piece of meat", Ilia said, pulling an entire Roast Cucco closer to her. "Please, help yourself".

Zelda touched nothing.
"So, Ilia... May I call you that?" Zelda asked cautiously. She wanted information, and inadvertently insulting her would just result in being thrown back into prison.
"Of course, Zelda. Now, shall we get down to business?" Ilia asked, tearing a wing of the cucco.
"And what business would that be?"
"The barrels of pudding. You want them gone, and I want them. You know where they are, so tell me and I'll... dispose of them," Ilia offered, taking a bite of the cucco wing.
"And if I refuse again?"
"Then you'll go back to the cell and stay there for the rest of your life. Accept my offer, on the other hand, and you'll be free to go. As long as you tell me where the barrels are".

Zelda, still unwilling, pretended to think. She was taking note of the room, who was in it and where...
Two goblins by the door, two big ones by her...
"Thoughts of escape will not be tolerated. It's a simple yes or no question," Ilia said, glaring at Zelda.
"My answer stands. I will not help you, Ilia!" Zelda told her.
Nodding, Ilia leaned back, her chairs creaking. She rubbed one of her breasts, letting out a quiet moan.
"I noticed you didn't eat anything?" She asked.
Narrowing her eyes, Zelda answered, "I am not hungry".
Her stomach betrayed her, letting out a rumble.
"Your body states otherwise", Ilia smiled evilly. "If you won't eat..."

"Perhaps I should... stay. I mean, it would be rude of me to not sample some of your food", Zelda said slowly. She returned to her seat, where a goblin pushed a plate of roast boar in front of her.
"I think you'll be pleasantly surprised by the food. My subjects may be complete idiots who can't handle the simplest tasks, such as finding something important to their Goddess, but they do know how to cook", Ilia explained, pulling a second plate of cucco towards her.

As Zelda looked around the table, she noticed a lack of cutlery.
"I don't suppose you have any knives and forks handy?" She asked. Having been raised in the castle, she had grown accustomed to having utensils to eat.

Hearing her stomach rumble again, Zelda shifted uncomfortably. Pulling her gloves off, she hung the over the back of her chair and carefully picked up a slice of boar. It was dripping with fat and gravy. Shaking some off, she took a bite.

One bite was all it took to sway the hungry princess. Not completely forgetting her manners, Zelda devoured the slice she was holding. Gravy covered her hands, dripping onto the table. Picking up a second slice, Zelda continued.
From the other side of the table, Ilia watched her eat an entire plate of boar with glee on her face. She leaned back, rubbing her round belly.
"I told you, didn't I? Very good food..." Ilia said to Zelda, who nodded in response.

As the hostage group watched, a conversation struck up between the children from Ordon.
"She looks like Ilia, don't you think?" The one in red said.
"Don't be silly, Beth," The one with a stick said. "Ilia doesn't look like that!"
"Yeah, she isn't that fat..." The smallest said.
"But still... What do you think, Colin?"
Colin shook his head.
"I agree with Talo. Link is looking for Ilia, and he found us! He'll find her!"
They were shushed by a goblin, who chartered angrily at them.

As Ilia was shouting at the goblins, one of her scouts quietly approached her wagon. He handed her a note, which she snatched from his hand. As she read it, a smile appeared on her fat face. She stopped shouting.
"At least one of you is competent... Everybody, head for the Desert!" She ordered. As the goblins hurried about getting everything ready, Ilia smiled. If this information was correct, she would soon have as much of the substance as she could ever want...
142112112221121221211211111221212.title: Raid on Kakariko

choices: His Triforce piece resonating?
Renaldo approaching him.
1421121122211212212112111112212121.content:
As the goblins readied their own mounts and Ilia's wagon, Ilia was busy eating. Behind her wagon was a second, filled to the brim with food. Ilia was busy munching through a Cucco wing when she heard a horse whinny. She stopped eating, and brushed grease from her belly.
"Prepare for..." She started to order, but an explosion cut her off. Three goblins burst into particles. As she watched, another two were struck by arrows.

By this point, the goblins were on full alert, pointing at an approaching horse. Ilia glared in the direction of it. The rider looked awfully familiar...
As the duo approached, the hostages began to cheer.
"Yay, Link!"
"I knew he'd come for us!"
"He kinda had to..."
A young man, clad in green and holding a bow, backflipped off the horse. He shoot an arrow into a goblins head. As the goblins neared him, he sheathed the bow and pulled out a sword. It had a blue hilt with a yellow diamond inset. The blade glowed with an otherworldly glow. Even Ilia, who was raised outside of Hyrule, recognised the blade of evil's bane...
"The Master Sword..." She cursed her luck. Having been corrupted by the substance, she was considered an evil being by the blade. For the first time since becoming a Goddess, she felt... fear.
Even the sight of it caused the goblins to stop. Ilia's blood boiled as she watched him effortlessly cut through an entire group of goblins.

"Damn it... Everybody, retreat! Back to the stronghold!" She ordered.
The remaining goblins stumbled over each other in order to get a mount. Some of them charged Link, hoping to overwhelm him with simultaneous attacks. In response, he spun with the sword held out. The goblins flew back.
As Ilia's wagon left Kakariko, Link pulled his bow out. He took aim at the retreating wagon...
"Hold your arrow!"
He paused as Renaldo touched his shoulder.
"Would you fire upon your friend?" He asked quietly.
Link looked at him, confusion in his eyes.
"That is the missing child... Ilia. She has been corrupted by the one who caused twilight to cover this land", he explained.

A shadow appeared next to Link.
"So, Zant actually used it?!" Midna asked, worry and amazement in her voice. "I though he didn't have it in him..."
Link took note of what Midna said before being overwhelmed by the Ordon children.
"Yeah, you showed them!"
"Did you get a new sword?"
Link smiled. He was just glad that the postman had reached him in time. He had been heading towards Snowpeak when he had reached Renaldo's letter alerting him to an attack on Kakriko.

"Link, that stuff that she ate? It was a Twilight creation, meant for ingestion by the Twili people. It's meant to help the weak, kinda like those potions you drink. However, it uses ingredients found in my realm. It corrupts Hylians and Humans, basically anything that isn't born in the Twilight", Midna explained. "It holds true that Hylian potions do the same to us, which is why I hate handling your potions. Even one drop could prove fatal".
Link nodded. He was sitting on top of an abandoned house, looking at the sunset. Midna was explaining the Corruption Essence, as she called it.
"There is a cure, though. If you release the power of the Triforce of Courage in their presence, then the evil will manifest as a... boss fight, kind of like the end of a temple. But with the Master Sword, it should be trivial!"

Nodding, Link stood up and brushed dust off his tunic.
"That girl, Ilia... She mentioned a stronghold. If we find it, we can help her!" Midna said. "But, I've no idea of any strongholds other than the one in the Gerudo Desert, which you cleared out. Maybe gather information before you leave?"
As she disappeared back into Links shadow, Link jumped off the roof and was alerted by...
1421121122211212212112111112212121.title: The Hero of Twilight

choices: Link breaks free from the ambush.
A goblin snatches Midna off Links back.
14211211222112122121121111122121212.content:
"Link, regarding the girl... I have heard rumours of raids in Faron Woods. A couple of merchants have gone missing while on trips to Ordon Village. It may be unrelated to Ilia, however, the raids were carried out by goblins", Renaldo explained.
Link nodded and headed towards Epona. Before he reached her, he was approached by Beth.
"Link, was that Ilia?" She asked curiously.
After a moment's hesitation, he shook his head. It probably wasn't the best idea to tell Ilia's friends that she was now evil and fat. Beth didn't believe him.
"Are you sure? Cause she looked a lot like Ilia if she was, you know... really fat".
Shaking his head, Link walked away from Beth and mounted Epona.

"Curse him!"
Ilia, her ass planted back upon her throne, was fuming. Not only did she not find the traitorous Princess, she now knew that she was being hunted by Link. If he found her, she would go back to being a normal girl who lived in the country side, and not a Goddess.
"If only there was a way to weaken him!" She mused. Hearing a stick gently tap the ground, she looked up to see Shaman approaching her throne.
"It's only you... What do you want?" She asked roughly, annoyed about the interruption.
In response, he reached into his pouch. Pulling out a red liquid sealed in a bottle, he pointed at the bottle.
"What's a red potion supposed to achieve? I want him out of the way, not stronger!"
Shaking his head, he pointed at it again.
"I swear... What is it meant to do?!" Ilia asked angrily. This language barrier hadn't really annoyed her until now...

Reaching into his pouch again, he pulled out a piece of paper and a bit of charcoal. He started drawing.
Ilia rubbed her greasy belly impatiently. He was taking his sweet time...
After a couple of minutes, he showed the picture to Ilia. It was a rough sketch of some sort of imp. It wore a weird helmet, which revealed a single eye.
"What is that?" Ilia demanded, confused.
Shaking his head, both parties were now annoyed with one another. Ilia had no idea what the red potion and the imp had to do with each other, while Shaman was annoyed by Ilia's lack of understanding. After a moment's silence, Ilia spoke.
"Do what you need to. If you think it will weaken him, then you have my permission to command a small group of goblins. However, if you fail, know that your punishment will be very severe," Ilia warned.
He nodded and wandered off.

Discounting Epona, Link looked at his surroundings, not that they differed much. He was basically surrounded by trees...
"Maybe Wolfie would have better luck?" Midna suggested, her shadow appearing next to him. "Sniff her out, you know? We Twili have a much better sense of smell than you Hylians, and there was a definite aura around her".
Nodding, Link transformed into his wolf form. Midna leapt onto his furry back, causing him to snarl at her with annoyance. Midna giggled. She did it every time, and he never did anything about it.
Sniffing, Link picked up a scent. It smelt of sweat and grease and general meat... It was not pleasant, causing him to whimper.
"Hey, we're both suffering here!" Midna said, pinching her nose. "The quicker you find her, the quicker we don't have to smell this stench anymore".

As the duo padded off, a goblin watched them from afar. He ran after them, taking care to not make any noise.
As Link followed his noise, he heard a number of different noises. Birds chirping in the trees, bugs chattering to each other, the breathing of Midna as he ran through the undergrowth...
He stopped abruptly, causing Midna to yelp.
"Don't stop so quickly!" She scolded. "You know I hate it!"
Sniffing, both picked up the scent of Ilia, but also a new one...
"Move!" Midna yelled.
As Link jumped back, a club smashed into the ground where he was. Snarling, he launched himself at his attacker, knocking them off their feet.

"We're surrounded!" Midna said to Link, who growled. All around them, goblins appeared from the trees. As they neared the duo...
14211211222112122121121111122121212.title: Follow your nose

choices: The Resistance arrives at the Village.
What happened with Zelda?
142112112221121221211211111221212121.content:
Midna's hair spring to life, quickly forming a massive orange hand. The goblins surrounding them stopped briefly, unsure of this action.
"Now!"
Link leapt from goblin to goblin, hitting them with his full body weight. A couple of seconds later, they all burst into particles.
"That was too close... Good thing I'm such a fast thinker!" Midna complimented herself. Link snarled before reverting back to his human form.
"What's wrong? Can't handle a couple of goblins?" Midna teased, her shade floating around Link.
He shook his head, concern in his eyes.
"I get what you're trying to say. They're smarter than other goblins... Looks like your friend has taught them some tricks. We need help if we want to break through," Midna said. "Lets see if Princess Zelda would lend us some soldiers".

"What do you mean, a wolf wiped out a group of goblins!?"
Ilia was busy shouting at one of her scouts, who had been following a wolf with their new target on its back. He had seen the pair wipe out the group and ran to tell his Goddess. He now regretted it.
"Here's what's going to happen. You find either that wolf, or that accursed hero, and you bring them to me! If you don't, I'll find out how Goblins taste!" Ilia yelled, clenching her fat fist. Her shouting had caused her body to ripple madly.
As he ran off, she growled.
"Useless... All of them! Can't even beat a bloody wolf..."

Walking into Castle Town, Link headed straight for the Hyrule Castle. However, he was stopped by Midna.
"Forgetting something?" She asked, wagging her finger at him. "The Castle has a barrier around it. Why would you even think that Zelda could help? She's trapped in there!" Link opened his mouth to protest, after all, it was Midna's idea to go ask Zelda. He closed it quickly. Arguments with Midna could last for quite a long time.
"Lets try the Resistance. You know, at Telmas Bar?" Midna suggested, morphing back into Links shadow.

He headed towards the bar, however, a scuffle at the gate behind him caused him to stop. Turning, he saw a couple of goblins attacking the guards, and winning, much to his surprise.
Drawing the Master Sword, he leapt at one of the goblins. Bringing the Master Sword down, the goblin fell back. Swinging it to the left, another fell to his blade. The final goblin tried to run, but tripped over his own feet. Jumping skyward, Link brought his blade down through the goblins torso. Backflipping away, he sheathed the Master Sword.
"T-Thank you!" The guard stuttered. He was clearly new, or very inexperienced. He clutched his spear close to his body.
Nodding, Link headed for the bar.

"Again?! I guess I shouldn't be surprised. He does wield that blade, after all..."
Receiving the news that yet another group of goblins had been wiped out, Ilia was beginning to lose her patience. Losing a group to Link was fine, he was an experienced swordsman. But she was still fuming over the wolf.
"While they're in Castle Town, they cannot be touched. Wait until they leave. Follow them, but do not engage. Once they are isolated, send in the Moblins," Ilia ordered. Her group only had a few moblins, all of which cheered when she gave the order. They grabbed their massive clubs and immediately set out.

"So, you need our help infiltrating a goblin stronghold?" Telma asked.
Link nodded.
"Well, it doesn't sound too difficult. Definitely within our power. I'll send word to the Resistance. Get them to meet you in Ordon Village," Telma said, leaning on her counter. "They're out looking for some sort of ancient temple at the moment. I'll make sure it's a priority mission. You head out there now, they'll be there".
Nodding again, Link left the bar.
"That sword of his... Looks like he already found that temple," Telma mused, watching the door swing shut behind him.

As Link rode in Hyrule Field, he couldn't shake the feeling that he was being followed. In response to his concern, Midna appeared.
"I can sense them... Moblins. They're following you. Be careful, okay?" She said, before disappearing.
Riding on, Link kept one hand on Epona's reins, and the other on the Master Sword.
As the sun set, Link reached Ordon Village. He didn't dare leave Epona unattended at his house, so he rode her into town. Almost immediately, the mayor appeared.
"Link! Have you found her?" He asked quickly.
Link hesitated. Did he really want to tell him that his daughter was now very fat and very evil?
He finally shook his head. No sense worrying him anymore than he already was.
"Oh... Well, I'm sure she's out there. Just... keep an eye out for her," he said, walking away.

Link decided to rest in the centre of town. He didn't really fancy using his house, due to the Moblins stalking him. At least in the village, someone would notice them and raise the alarm. He could handle Moblins, no problem.
Leaning back against the massive tree decorating a corner of the Village, he fell asleep.
142112112221121221211211111221212121.title: Retreat and Regroup

choices: The old Temple of Time.
Somewhere in Gerudo Desert.
1421121122211212212112111112212121212.content:
-Meanwhile-

Zelda yawned and scratched her huge ass. She had fallen asleep while the goblins were stomping around outside. She had awoken briefly when she had heard a familiar sounding "Hyahh!" from outside. She had also felt discomfort and... fear? She couldn't remember.
Standing up, Zelda scratched her gargantuan belly and brushed her black hair back over her shoulders. Fixing her tiara, she looked up at the tiny hatch in the ceiling.
"No hope of fitting through there," she said, annoyed. She lifted her belly, cradling her fat in her arms. Looking around the room for some sort of weakness, she sighed. It was built too well.

"Just my luck... I'm trapped in this godforsaken room, with no food!" She complained, falling backwards. The impact caused every part of her body to jiggle madly. A glow on her hand drew her attention.
Three triangles had appeared, causing Zelda to smile.
"Of course... The Triforce!"
Raising her right arm, she concentrated. A golden glow surrounded her body. She disappeared from the room.

"This hits the spot, brother".
"That it is does. I'm glad that that Link was able to calm Darbus".
Two Gorons were relaxing in the hot springs. They had just had a sumo match, and were unwinding when an slightly splash startled them.
"What was that?!" One of them yelled, jumping to his feet. He clumsily walked over to the source of the splash, the water impeding his movement. As he reached the source, he saw a huge person with dark grey skin and black hair stand up. They were huge, almost the same size as Darbus.
"Hmmm, a hot spring... Must be Death Mountain", came a female voice.
"Excuse me? Are you alright?" Asked the Goron, surprised at both the size of the girl and how she had actually gotten there.

Turning, Zelda eyed the Goron. Compared to her body, he was tiny! Even her belly, which hung down past her knees, was the same size as him!
"Where is your leader?" Zelda demanded.
"Up at the top of that rock," he said, pointing up at the massive rock next to them.
"Damn, I was a bit off..." Zelda muttered, clenching her fist. The Triforce glowed brightly, causing her to disappear.
"What was it, brother?" Asked the second Goron, who had just caught up.
"I... don't know? But it looked like Princess Zelda!"
"Don't be silly. Why would the Princess come up here? She hates the heat!" He laughed.

"So, we don't know what it is?" Gor Coron asked, scratching his face. He was looking at a barrel of glowing blue goop. Darbus, who had brought the barrels up the Mountain after a merchant had brought them to the Gorons, shook his head.
"Merchants left them for us. A barrel for each of us leaders. But, it isn't rocks. So we won't eat them," he said, popping a rock in his mouth. He crunched it loudly.
"Hmm... I sense some sort of... evil from it..." Gor Coron mused. The Gorons were always cautious, especially when strangers sent gifts to them. "Get rid..."

"Hold it!"
A female voice interrupted them. Both Gorons turned to face their interrupter and saw a huge female. Her breasts were huge, three times the size of her head. Her doughy belly was was hanging down in front of her knees. Her thick thighs supported an ass which was almost as big as small boulders. Her face was adorned with three chins, and was busy forming a fourth. But her face was still somewhat recognizable...
"Princess Zelda?" Gor Coron asked, amazed at the sheer size of Zelda.
"Correct. I seek those barrels. They pose a danger to Hyrule, and I am looking to... destroy them," she explained.
"And your body?" Darbus asked.
"A curse that the Twilight had inflicted upon me," Zelda lied again. "Until the King of Twilight has been defeated, I look like this".

"Very well. Hopefully Link is on the case. In the meantime, take these barrels from here. I sense something from them. It makes me... uncomfortable," Gor Coron said. "Where should we take them?"
Zelda, unable to fit in her old basement, thought about it for a moment. She needed somewhere where she could eat them without being disturbed by that fake 'Goddess'...
Somewhere like...
1421121122211212212112111112212121212.title: Zelda's Quest for Hugeness

choices: It was a quick fight, but Ashei successfully escaped
Ashei fought well, impressing Zelda. Perhaps she could ude a competent servant?
14211211222112122121121111122121212121.content:
"The Temple of Time... No one would look here mow that the Master Sword is already taken. Especially Ilia and her Goblins"
Zelda held the barrels as tightly in her arms as possible, her extra girth however did most of the work. She searched for a place to hide them, but she realized that it probably wasn't necessary considering no one would possobly think of loo-

"I just got a message from Telma"

Zelda hid behind a door, caught off gruard by the two men on the otherside
"Shit"
she listened in on their conversation

"It's a priority mission, she wants us to assist link in breaking through the Goblin Stronghold."

"Odd, one woukd think someone of his skills and talents would be more than capable of doing so on their own. Perhaps the rumors are true...?"

"Either way, we should probably do as she says. Seems someone already took what we came here for anyways"

The massive princess gave a sigh of relief. Even when he wasn't trying, Link continued to save her, she didn't need to dirty her thick hands.

"What about Ashei?"

"She said she was going to give the place one last go around, in case we missed something, she'll catch up shortly."

As she heard them walk away, Zelda smirked. even with horrible timing, it seemed luck was on her very wide side...

"P... princess!?"

"Shit..."
Zelda could no doubt trick her as easily as the rest, but outside of the fact she grew tired of her act, if the swordswoman was allowed to leave, she might let slip her whereabouts.

"Ashei, was it...? I'm afraid you can not be allowed to leave this place alive."
the black haired girl in armor nervously drew her weapon as she saw a rapier materialize in the corrupted Princess' hand.

"I can see your concern... let me put your mind at ease by assuring you that nothing is wrong with me. In fact, i am better than I have ever been."
as she let out a wicked laugh, Ashei took a step back, shivering at the sight of every inch of the darkened flesh vibrate wildly...
14211211222112122121121111122121212121.title: Ashei of the Resistance

choices: Zelda admires the results, and grants her new soldier dark powers.
Zelda finds the results humorous, and sends Ashei out as is
142112112221121221211211111221212121212.content:
Zelda was almost surprised by her own speed, with such a massive body, one would expect a bit of trouble. She soon told herself it was just perfection at work, as her rapier collided with Ashei's.

This pride was soon overwhelmed by annoyance, as the massive princess soon realized that all her blows had been deflected, though it seemed in doing so, Ashei could barely keep a grip on her weapon as she struggled to keep at Zelda's quick pace.

The lady rebel was at a loss of what to do, not wanting to strike, lest she injure the princess, but Zelda was slowly backing her into a corner.

However, her back never had the chance to meet the temple wall, as Zelda eventually charged her blade with the corrupted Triforce's dark power, before the next strike shattered the opposing steel.

Ashei felt the tip of Zelda's rapier pressing against her chest, as well as the darkness radiating around it.

"I'll admit it, I was so used to dominating hordes of goblins or my own soldiers, that I had actually forgotten what it is like to be faced with a real challenge."

Zelda lowered her weapon. She could tell the defeated girl was fully aware there was no escape.

"Ashei, was it? That is the name that was mentioned by your comrades"
Ashei nodded, too nervous to utter a single word.
"You have earned a reward... In exchange for your life, you will serve me, without question, and without fail."

Finally finding the courage to speak, she felt the rapier press against her neck before she could finish even a single word.

"I can already tell you wish to defy me, stay loyal to your companions... I desire that loyalty."
She knew given enough time, she could probably develop a means of brainwashing people into doing her bidding with her Triforce of wisdom, but that would take time to master, and valuable time wasted on that is time gained by Ilia in her search for pudding that was not rightfully her's.
"Take a barrel and consume it's contents. do NOT make me repeat myself"

Daring not to speak, Ashei simply nodded, and did as she was told. As she opened one of the barrels, she removed her gloves and used her hands to take a large scoop of the glowing blue substance. as she hesitantly put it in her mouth, she could feel it... the sensation of flavor, the feeling of hunger, the desire for more.

Zelda gave a corrupted smirk as she saw her plan at work...
142112112221121221211211111221212121212.title: Darkened Steel of a Princess

choices: What is Ilia up to?
Where is Ashei headed?
1421121122211212212112111112212121212121.content:
"I must say, I'm impressed at how fine a body you're developing" Ashei had plumped up nicely, the stitching around her belly already starting to tear, the armor surrounding it had been removed in order to stay breathing.

Her pants had split apart entirely however, having been hugging her lower body to begin with, they never stood a chance against her new cucco sized rear. She only had panties keeping her from being exposed, but they were more like sting now.

Her breasts had grown to small D cup, leaving multiple tears as they struggled to break free.

A small second chin was already on the verge of forming while her cheeks puffed up, meanwhile her arms and legs formed a thin layer of fat all around.

"Fine body!? Are you blind!? I look like a pig! I look like a smaller version of... of..."
she paused, realizing she was about to insult the princess of Hyrule, who had proven more than capable of taking her down single handedly

"Like me? What's wrong with that?"

"Huh...?"

the corrupted Zelda laughed, adding to the girl's confusion

"Never mind, you'll understand soon enough. But for now, a fine body deserves fine strength to match." Zelda's triforce radiated on her hand as she held an open palm out to her new servant. a dark glow surrounded Ashei as she felt a strange power flow through her... it felt... wonderful.

"Now, here's what you're going to do..."
1421121122211212212112111112212121212121.title: Dark Warrior Ashei

choices: the kitchen
the dining hall
14211212.content: Next to her was a big rock which she uses to break the chains. She makes a run for the door. She manage to get out but the goblins find and chase her. After much running she loses the goblins and hides in a room she found. As she turns around, she sees it's...
14211212.title: Ilia finds a way out

choices: Cast off!
Next Choice
1421122.content: How about Hena, the fishing instructor?
1421122.title: Hena?

choices: Through normal eating methods
Through magic
14211221.content:
Going with the cute fishing instructor, alright just one question before we begin.

How will Hena gain?
14211221.title: How does Hena gain?

choices: ...a fish.
...some sort of artifact.
142112212.content:
Hena felt a light breeze rustle past her as she sat in her boat, fishing the day away. For her, fishing was not only how she made her livelihood, but a way of life in its entirety. She was one of those rare, lucky people who was able to make a living out of the activity they loved most.

Life, Hena concluded, was good.

And while it would remain good, it was about to be shaken up by a rather amazing new development. For, as she felt her line tug on something, she gave a pull, and emerging from the shimmering water was...
142112212.title: Lake of Possibilities

choices: Believe him.
Don't believe him.
1421122121.content:
It was a fish. But...a kind that in all her years of experience, she had never seen.

"Hiya, toots." it said.

Huh. A talking fish. Alright, then.

"Hello, yourself, Mr. Fish." she replied, not one to be startled easily.

"I am a talking fish, of the magical variety. And what with you catching me and all, it is my duty to let y'know that I gotta grant ya three wishes. Congrats, and all that."

"Three wishes?...hey, these wouldn't happen to be the kind of wishes that end up backfiring, because you take every little thing I say out of context and use them to punish me in ironic ways, are they? Because if they are, I swear, I'll fry you. I mean it. I've got recipes."

"No need to worry, no need at all. I'm the good kind of wish-granter. You wish to have a ton of gold, I promise, you'd get a ton of gold to appear beside ya, not appear above ya, only to have it fall down and crush ya. Nothing like that. No tricks."
1421122121.title: Magical, Talking Fish?

choices: -my choice-
-your choice-
14211221211.content: Hmmm...what to wish for first, Hena wondered? How about...
14211221211.title: What wish to make?

choices: The next morning...
142112212111.content:
"Alright then, let's see..." said Hena "...well, I like having privacy and everything with my li'l business, but at the same time, I'd love to have more customers, to have people buy my books on the subject of fishing, to be able to pass on my techniques...and also, just to get my family's name in the limelight, y'know? So...I want fame, I want recognition! I wish I was the biggest fisher in the world!"

"Alright, consider it done, lady. Mind you, a wish like that takes time. Fair enough?"

"...are you actually magical?"

"Whaddya mean?"

"I mean, I know you can talk, and that's great, but I make a wish, and no flash of light, no immediate sign it did or will come true, you just tell me, hey, later on, it'll happen? For all I know, I could become famous, and it would have nothing to do with you, it could all just be thanks to my own hard work!"

"Wait, you didn't wish for fame."

"Yes, I did!"

"You wished to be the biggest fisher in the world."

"Right. And?"

"...I...thought you meant literally."

"WHAT?!? Didn't you listen to what I was saying???"

"You were kinda boring! I only really started paying attention after I heard the word 'wish!"

"So what's going to happen?"

"I dunno, I already worked my voodoo, so it's out of my hands! All I know is that you will literally become the biggest fisher in the world! Whatever that means!"

"Well, can I take it back?"

"Too late. No way to undo a wish. You can't even cancel one wish out with a second one. You're gonna be the biggest fisher in the world."

"I don't even know what that means..."

"We'll see. Um...wanna make your second wish?"

"No way! Not after you pulled that Monkey's Paw crap on me!"

"I didn't mean to! I was just careless, not evil! Please don't eat me!"

"I'm not gonna eat you, I'm just...angry! And I definitely want to think long and hard about what my next wish should be. And I also gotta see how my first one turns out...and as for you, you're coming with me. You'll be on vacation in one of aquariums for awhile."

"Fine, fair enough...I can't believe it, my first time in a hundred years to grant a wish, and I screw up..."

And so it was that Hena set the magical fish up in one of her tanks, and went to bed, tossing and turning, worried about what it would mean for her to literally be the biggest fisher in the world.
142112212111.title: Bad choice of words

choices: Later...
Much later...
1421122121111.content:
The next morning, the magical fish woke up to find Hena looking at him furiously. It kind of startled him.

"What...what's up?" he asked, nervously.

"I'm out of food."

"What do you mean?"

"I mean what I said, I'm out of food. I ate all the food in my house, starting right at the crack of dawn. And y'know what? I'm still hungry."

"That's, uh, weird."

"No, it would be weird if I didn't know why. But I DO know why. Because of your stupid wish-granting! I'm going to be the biggest fisher in the world, and now, I've got an insatiable appetite! Don't you get it? I'm gonna be FAT! REALLY, REALLY, REALLY FAT!"

There were lights, music, colour, and practically everybody of any sort of significance was invited; it was the place to be. As each couple started to dance, in their own distinct way, you couldn't help but watch in amazement. They were all decked out in their finest attire, glittering almost as if made of a rich gold material. Even as the guest numbers started to reach into the thousands, the host of this grand event was hardly phased at managing the location.

It was only her house for starters.

Agitha sighed as she saw couple after couple of exotic insects flitter, crawl and jump together. It'd taken awhile, but after (someone else's) hard work, she'd finally managed to hold her ball afterall. She strolled around, minding not to tread on any of her esteemed guests, and eyed each one. She even occasionally stopped to ask each couple if they were enjoying themselves; taking a simple nod of the small bug's head as answer enough.

She was aware that few of these bugs had much hope of surviving out in the real world (or making it out of the market before getting swatted or stomped on), so she took it upon herself to keep them in her 'castle'. Tiring a bit after so much dancing (by herself), she opened one of her favorite books; the Encyclopedia on Insects. Opening on a random page, she was greeted with a beautiful illustration of a butterfly, its wings made of a rich jade and black pattern. Sighing at its beauty, she suddenly realized that this insect was at her ball right now. She started to daze off distantly as she saw it flutter around gracefully, only snapping out of it when she realized she'd only looked at the sketch.

"Let's see what it says here..." She mused to herself. When there were any scientific facts she only half-understood, she simply flicked back to a funny picture. This butterfly in particular was from a rather round and stout caterpillar. She giggled at its appearance, and started to read on how it evolved into such a beautiful creature. Some common mention of a caccoon, its habitat... Yet what truely got her attention was its diet. "... It increases its weight by 5,000 times before going into that caccoon?" She looked up and wondered. Agitha was definitely 'out there', but she wasn't stupid.

Merely disadvantaged due to a lack of a proper education. "Oh... That's... Interesting." Quickly standing up, she dashes to her chest of draws and opens one, meeting the glitter of several million Rupees. Nobody was really sure where she'd gotten them from, but it explained her eccentric and indulgent lifestyle.

As she started to leave, she called out to the thousand or so bugs. "Everyone! I'm off to the market! Soon I'll be able to play as one of you!" She giggled, and shut the door before strolling off into the open air of Hylrue Market.

"Though what to try first..."
14211222221.title: Agitha decides to 'become a butterfly'

choices: She starts the sweet feast!
She double checks the store...
142112222212.content:
"... Well, candy's always a good start. Not exactly a caterpillar's diet buuuuut, I have a sweet tooth." A passing kid turned his head to see who she was talking to, albeit found no one else.

She strode into the long aisle of food stalls her umbrella keeping the midday sun's harsh rays off her richly coloured dress. The smell of roasting meat and fresh produce was in the air, and Agitha's mouth started to water just a bit; but she knew what she really wanted, and felt that she'd be all the better for it than binging on what was healthy, yet perhaps not in the army-sized servings she had in mind. She strode out of the other side and into the main plaza. Energy efficient stuff like meat and vegetables wasn't going to help her increase her weigh 5,000 times fold after all! Or atleast, not as much as what she was about to get her maws into.

Turning into an alleyway and sliding along the narrow brick walls that encapsulated it, she found a small doorway. She snuck in without another soul to see her, and found herself in a dusty store room. Though she knew very well where she was. Sliding along side the walls until she made her way to the slightly open door, she peeked out. Not a soul in the store, and she could clearly make out a padlock on the front door.

The best thing about sneaking into Hylrue's largest confectionery store on today of all days?

There wouldn't be anybody to discover her for at least another three days due to the long weekend, and even then the owner of the store had a reputation for rarely opening. It was the perfect spot for Agitha to... Erm, bloom into a 'butterfly'.
142112222212.title: Sneaking Mission

choices: Soon...
...Later
1421122222121.content:
She traced her fingers lightly along shelf after shelf of candy, Delicious, life-giving, butterfly-fueling candy. She gave a nod of dignified approval to the store in general, as she delicately lifted up a small round chocolate, unwrapped it with a great sense of ceremony, and placed it daintily in her mouth. She chewed it slowly, lovingly, with great care. Then, once the wonderful taste had fully saturated her taste buds, she swallowed it, and then exhaled a little sigh of enjoyment.

That chocolate was the last piece of candy that day to be given anywhere near that level of attention.

After her little opening event, she danced around the store like a dervish, strewing empty wrappers and boxes around like rubble from a tornado. Cookie after mint after jellybean after caramel apple after candy cane was grabbed with a theatrical whirl, and brought with haste to Agitha's mouth. She skipped off towards the rock candy, she leaped, ballet-like, to the taffy. She had no prejudice, every sweet treat one more little piece of her dream, all being brought together inside her. She ate the cotton candy like it was made of magical clouds, she ate the gingerbread men like a monster attacking a village.

And, of course, the chocolate. The chocolate. The chocolate! Oh, my, the chocolate! Every shape, every size, ever variety, every possible filling! She was deliriously, ecstatically lost in a sugary heaven of tasty delights.
1421122222121.title: Agitha and the Candy

choices: Somebody walks in.
She starts to formulate the rest of her plan.
14211222221211.content:
It wasn't long before Agitha had already started to more than strain the seams on her dress; prancing like a graceful ballerina, within an hour she'd already eaten more than she'd normally eat in a week. Yet damn if she wasn't enjoying herself.

With a large hand-full of oozing cookie dough shoved into her mouth, a small rip could be heard; part of her dress started to tear under the pressure of her rapidly growing boobs. At what seemed more like a mad lunge than what was meant to be a leap to a pile of milky marshmallows, her socks started to split at her thunderous thighs outwards thrust. And with flat out giving up the pseudo-Swan Princess act, she shoved her mouth into tub after tub of ice cream, each one fashioned after the calorific candy she'd just been gorging on. Her belly pratically exploded out of her top like a dam bursting with blubbery goodness.

For the first time, she hesitated and looked down at her self. There was no way she was 'pudgy'... Agitha was flat out fat, her legs taking the brunt of the gain. With a twirl, she watched as her legs jiggled away with the slightest amount of movement, parts of her clothing continuing to give way as her body continued to go full-steam ahead with its gain.

To say the least in her eyes, she was doing pretty well for only starting a couple hours ago. Revving up her digestive engines, she went back into destroying everything in sight with her unsatisfiable mouth, pausing only to admire her own handwork on her body. 'Heh, caterpillars don't even look half this good before the cacoon process!' she thought to herself in-between shoving entire rolls of liquorice swirls into her mouth.

One would think that after a few hours and a few hundred pounds, somebody like Agitha would've already lost patience at how slow it was taking to... Well, multiply her weight several thousand times over. Yet as Agitha started to draw near the end of her candy binge...
14211222221211.title: Soon...

choices: swallow him whole XD
buy the store
142112222212111.content:
Suddenly the front door to the store slowly creaked open. Agitha was so surprised she slipped and fell straight on her bottom, causing her jelly legs and candy filled belly to jiggle and wobble around uncontrollably.

Agitha saw that the owner of the store was standing at the door staring at her in disbelief. The owner of store was usually a jolly man and was very fat. But Agitha saw that he was very angry at the moment. "What have you done to my store!!!" he shouted.

Agitha just sat on the floor, speechless. "Oh boy, I'm in trouble!" she thought. She started to think of a plan FAST. She rubbed her stuffed belly thoughtfully when suddenly she got an idea!

She decided she would . . .
142112222212111.title: Somebody walks in.

choices: Soon, in town square, Agitha eats her treat...
1421122222121112.content:
"I admit..." she began, not even sure what she was about to say "...that what I've done may seem a little...somewhat...slightly...perhaps..."

"ILLEGAL." he said, deciding to help her along.

"Ah. Yes. That. Illegal. Right." she nodded agreeably "But only if this were your store, yes?"

"Hm?"

"That is to say, it wouldn't be illegal if it were my store...yes?"

"Where you going with this, girl?"

"I would like to buy this store from you."

"Ha! Haha! Oh, really! Nah. Not gonna happen. I don't care if you offered me a million rupees..."

"I'll offer you two million."

Somewhere, there was the sound of a cash register.

"Two million, you say?" the owner whispered.

"If you need more then how about three million?"

"You can actually afford that!?"

"Oh, yes. I'm quite well off."

"Three million..." the owner repeated.

"If I need to make it four mi--"

"NO! I feel bad enough taking three million. I--...look, I don't want to fleece you. There's no reason for you to buy my store. It's not exactly booming these days. You need to pay me back for how much you ate, mind you, but really, I advise against buying this place."

"Oh, I don't want to buy the store to make money. I already have that. I simply want to make sure that I have a steady and reliable candy supply."

The owner looked at Agitha...specifically, he looked at how much Agitha there was.

"No offense, girl, but I don't know if you need that much more candy."

"Oh, but I do! I need much, much more! I'm nowhere near big enough yet."

"Y'mean...you want to get fat?"

"Oh, yes. To become a butterfly."

"...I won't pretend to understand what you mean by that, but listen. I really have no idea whether I should be telling you this, but...well, I've got something that might interest you. Y'see, these days, candy's just made either the old-fashioned way, by hand, or the new way, with machines. But for awhile, there was what we in the business call...The Golden Age of Candy."

"The Golden Age of Candy!" Agitha repeated, entranced.

"...yeah. That. It was called that because some truly bold new attempts at candy-making were being attempted. Some folks even hired wizards, witches, and magicians to add some special mojo to their goods. What resulted were the most delicious...but also most unstable...candies ever made. Some were so delicious that no other taste would ever even register for the rest of the eater's life. Many had a taste so powerful that the flavor linger in mouths months, sometimes years after the candy was eaten. But these candies also came with risks and side-effects. And among the havoc that some of these forbidden candies caused was...well, they made people really, really fat."

Agitha's eyes widened, and her smile grew.

"You see, girl, just as these candies held more flavor than one could expect to experience in an entire lifetime of normal eating, they also held more calories, too. People ballooned into blobs of flab in the course of a single snack. And, of course, most people thought that the taste just wasn't worth that, so candy-making began to kick the magic elements out. But many still research and collect samples from those crazy times, and I myself am one such historian. I have, in my collection, one of those enchanted sweets."

"May I habftiankf--... Agitha's sentence deteriorated as the saliva her mouth had been building up throughout the man's story came pouring out.

"Ahem..." she began again "...may I have it?"

"You may." the owner said dramatically "One two conditions. One, you pay me for all the candy you ate. Two, you promise to eat this away from my store."

"Of course. But why?"

"Well, girl, there's a good chance you'd outgrow the building."

Agitha did a heavy little dance of excitement. She would soon be well on her way to butterfly-hood!
1421122222121112.title: The Blessed Candy

choices: "I'll talk to this blob think mono to mono!" She yells as she teleports away.
"I'll... LET YOU GUYS DEAL WITH IT!" She yells as she darts away for refuge.
14211222221211121.content:
Agitha walked out onto the main square of Hylrue Town, looking into a small paper bag, which contained a candy which seemed to pratically radiate its sweetness, with giddy excitement. This was going to be her special day, where she finally placed a foot firmly towards achieving ultimate beauty, wisdom and the freedom of flight which all butterflies were entitled to. She wasn't exactly sure of the science behind her idea, but she knew in her feeling that something BIG was going to happen.

And if it didn't, she'd swiped several handfuls more of the stuff behind the old owner's back just in case the maths didn't add up.

After building up the suspense for herself, which amounted to madly giggling as onlookers questioned the sanity of the brightly colored girl, she took a single candy with great anticipation and placed it on her tongue to savor the taste.

There wasn't any taste. She licked around for a bit, tried chewing a bit, tried taking it out and eying it a bit, but no-matter what she did, the only thing noteworthy about it was how UN-noteworthy it was. Well, it was a bit weird that it literally didn't have a taste, but other than that, Agitha felt gipped.

"What? Why isn't anything happening? Should I try another?"

She quickly shoved another few in her mouth and waited, only to find the same result. Pouting and stomping her feet, Agitha stormed back into the candy store.

"Sir?! You're candy isn't making me a buuuutterfly yet!" She yelled angrily, before the owner came rushing to the front with an expression of panic. "Oh dear, I forgot to tell you kid; it takes a few minutes to work. You haven't... A-hem, you haven't eaten anymore than one, have you?" Agitha gave him a blank expression. "Oh. Excuse me just quickly."

Quickly darting back out of the store, she rushed back to the middle of the square to cause a minimal amount of property damage as possible.

She barely made it half-way.

As she was quickly running, she suddenly felt her legs unable to move; she looked down and with a cute smile witnessed them shoot outwards, quickly forcing down her stockings until they outright burst through them sans near her shoes, her feet submerged in a sea of pillow-y white flab. While her leg's continued to widen, Agitha looked behind herself to witness her butt quickly growing, to the point where her dress was hitched up and didn't even cover a tenth of the massive crack which had been formed by Agitha's mountainous rump, which quivered and jiggled at the slightest provocation. Amidst all this her thighs were quickly taking over half of the square, the normal towns folk running for dear life from the all-consuming bug girl.

As she grinned at the developments in the lower sections of her body, she craned her neck to see her stomach oozing outwards for meters on end, forcibly separating the tree-trunks she had for legs and rushing in-between them like a gushing river of flesh-colored ChuChu. It already draped over her tremendous legs, yet the slight amount of stocking material covering her legs helped anybody who cared enough to differentiate the two bodies from one another.

Lying on top of this erupting stomach were a pair of continuously ballooning breasts, which while forcing her entire dress up to her neck (which was by now entirely consumed by a dozen chins and shoulder flab) were completely and utterly exposed, her huge nipples exposed for anybody who again felt like looking at the mountain of jiggly flesh which was quickly enveloping the center of town in its own girth. Agitha's arms had virtually no mobility; she was free to wiggle her plump hands and fingers, yet they too lay deep within the confines of her bloated arm fat. At the top of all this like the cherry on top was Agitha's bloated, beaming face.

"Ooooh, this feels absolutely wonderful! No wonder caterpillars always seem so eager to plump-up before their cocoon stage!" She lightly giggled to herself, slightly purring as she felt street lamps and the fountain crumble beneath the vast ocean of her body.

Meanwhile, from the (relative) safety of the castle...

"Are we being attacked!?!" Zelda demanded, rushing over to the nearest guard to amass what the heck was going on outside. "Is the Twilight back!? Is the kingdom on fire!? ARE WE IN A STATE OF EMERGENCY!?!" Zelda screamed, displaying what few members of the public got to see; complete and total incompetency. The guard she was raving at quickly jumped back at the princess' confrontation. "No! Well, maybe... Eh... We don't exactly know what it is yet. But it's... Big."

The princess calmed herself a bit and sat back on the throne. "Oh, well that's good then. If whatever it is hasn't made a declaration of war yet then somebody else try and snag a peace treaty out of it. God wars are complicated."

This particular descendant didn't exactly get the significance of the Triforce of Wisdom, and promptly hocked it out of her system and sold it to the highest paying bidder to buy herself a new luxurious bedroom and play room. More likely Ganondorf's possession of her included forcing her to sell her single greatest weapon for the dumbest of reasons to ensure the mindless-ness in the princess, but whatever the reason this Zelda had gone from wisest of the land to completely and utterly shallow. And fairly air-headed to boot.

"Your highness, we don't even know if this thing is human... Even if it doesn't mean any harm, it's going to trap us under its weight the minute we approach it!"

"Bah. I'll handle it while you go prepare some lunch; I'll show you how a diplomat handles a crisis!" She strolled off with an aura of superiority (which came across to everyone else as misguided arrogance), and approached the towering castle doors... Only to be sent flying backwards across the velvet carpet as part of the pasty blob slithered through the door.

"Ewww... Right then, there's only one thing I can do in a situation like this people!" Zelda boldy exclaimed as lifted a sword into the air to strike a dramatic pose.
14211222221211121.title: Attack of Agitha!

choices: Start pulling things off the shelves at random
Look for the most delicious candy in the store
1421122222122.content:
Agitha did a quick scan of the store again. The blinds were closed, the padlock secure, and not a living creature was in sight.

Having confirmed that she was alone, Agitha exited the back room. She lit a lamp on the front desk, and her jaw dropped when the contents of the store were brought to light. The ceiling was a good eleven feet high, and the walls were covered in shelves that reached all the way to the top. Each level was stuffed with a wide variety of boxes, containers and miscellaneous baggies full of various goodies. On the floor there was were several large chilled vats wider and taller than Agitha herself that probably contained ice cream. She realized she was beginning to drool, and shook herself. She had all of the long weekend to try everything out, so there was no need to go overboard all at once. Besides that, might make her sick, and then she couldn't complete her metamorphosis into a beautiful butterfly.

She walked to the center of the store and turned around a couple times. There was just so much to choose from! Her stomach growled and she bit her lip. What should she try first?
1421122222122.title: She double checks the store...

choices: Agitha decides to eat the ice cream
Agitha decides to hurry the metamorphosis up
14211222221221.content:
Now is not the time to be picky!

Agitha's stomach gave a rumble once more, and she dashed off to one of the shelves. She began scooping up boxes of chocolate and when her arms were full, she sat down on her knees right where she was and began to tear the first one open. It contained 36 Deluxe Choco-Caramel Bars, which gave off such an alluring scent Agitha ripped open the first and began munching on it without a second thought. Once she had eaten through three of the bars, she realized she had eaten them too fast to even really taste the chocolate. She carefully unwrapped the fourth and considered it briefly. She lifted it up to her mouth and gave it a tentative lick. The chocolate was so sweet on her tongue. . . She licked it again. And again. She began to suck on the candy bar, letting the rich chocolate melt in her mouth. Agitha caressed the chocolate with her tongue softly, her eyes closed in bliss. She gave it another tender suck when the inner caramel was revealed. When the taste of the caramel hit Agitha's tastebuds, her eyes flew open. It was better than anything she had ever tasted! Instantly she shoved the rest of the bar into her mouth, but forced herself to chew it slowly and savor all the wonderful flavors.

When she had finished, she paused momentarily. Agitha then methodically began to unwrap each and every candy bar from every box she had gather up. She stacked them neatly in several groups and then regarded them silently. This is butterfly material, she thought, This is what will change me.

She proceeded to stuff her face with the candy.

In a matter of minutes, the chocolate bars were all gone. She rose to her feet, feeling a buzz of energy. She swooped along the shelves, grabbing everything that looked good. . . Which was to say, everything. She spun and swayed as the satisfying candy dropped into her eagerly awaiting mouth. Music from the town outside could be heard ever so faintly as Agitha danced around with her arms and mouth full of candies.

Delicious candy fruit oranges fell on her tongue, sour pieces of chewy bits were practically drunk straight out of their container, and chocolate peanut butter balls rolled into her mouth. She spun over to a crate full of huge chocolate blocks, each weighing at least two pounds and picked up three, one of which was devoured in route over to a ladder which she scaled to the top of a shelf. Agitha shoved another block in her mouth as she picked up a bag full of warm liquid caramel. She slid down the ladder, swallowed the last bit off the chocolate block and began to guzzle the soft substance out of the bag. Suppressing a petite burp, she danced over to the center of the room, where she had accumulated a rather large pile of empty wrappers and boxes, along with a mound of candy waiting to be eaten.

She crammed the third chocolate block in her mouth, chewed it up a bit, then poured the rest of the liquid caramel in after. Her tummy rumbled and she rubbed it, looking longingly at the rest of the candy. Even though she had been eating for several hours, she had barely made a dent in the supplies of the store. Smiling, she patted her stomach and considered her next move. As engaged as she was with her decision process, she did not notice how tight her dress had become.

Agitha was happily well on her way to becoming a butterfly.
