142222221.title: Method of Sue-Belle's gain?

choices: Sue-Belle tries to find some way to get back in touch with the Great Fairy.
She suddenly starts to randomly grow again?!
1422222212.content:
It was yet another lovely day on Outset Island, as a young woman with purple hair and a red dress stepped out of her small hut, stretching and enjoying the cool ocean breeze. Sue-Belle and the rest of her fellow island-dwellers had lived a peaceful existence in the days since Link, a heroic young boy of their tribe, had left on his journey to find a new land beyond the sea. It seemed as though he had just returned from his quest to defeat Ganon and save the world, but even with the King of Evil vanquished, it seemed that his work was still unfinished...his former neighbours certainly missed him, but life went on all the same.

Presently, Sue-Belle was heading out on her daily task of fetching water for her grandfather Sturgeon from the creek at the top of the island, which she carried through the novel method of balancing water-filled jars on her head. Hoping to slightly increase her carrying capacity, she had ordered some special extra-large jars from her friend on Windfall Island, capable of carrying at least twice as much water. Walking up the hill was easy enough; she waved hello to Old Man Ho Ho, who was busy staring out to see as usual, and filled two jars, placing one atop her head and carrying the other under her arm. However, she quickly found the jars to be a tad heavier than she was used to; understandable, given their capacity, but inconvenient all the same.

"Ugh...this might be a little tougher than I thought," she muttered to herself, straining to keep the jar on her head aloft. "But no matter...it's for Grandpa; I'll make it work somehow!" That proved easier said than done, however, and just walking forward a few feet was was quite a chore. She had made it to about halfway down the hill overlooking the village when the predictable finally happened, and the poor girl fell flat on her face, her two jars shattering against the ground. "No! I can't believe this," she lamented, gazing wistfully at the puddle and assorted glass shards that used to be her two vases. "Great, just great...now I'm gonna have to all the way back to the house, fetch two more pots, run back up the hill, grab more water...ugh, there has to be an easier way to do this!"

As she finished her rant, though, an idea for a solution suddenly popped into her head. The girl's eyes drifted toward the Forest of Fairies, across the bridge at the top of the hill. She recalled the stories of the mysterious Great Fairy of Fortune who resided within said forest...she herself had always thought it a myth, but seeing as Link made his way over there at the height of the Ganon crisis and came back down with a real, live fairy, there simply had to be something to the rumours. 'My better judgment tells me otherwise,' she thought, making her way toward the bridge, 'But I have to at least try...for Grandpa's sake!'

In no time, Sue-Belle headed over to the forest, wandering around for a while before finding a very large and obvious hole in the ground, surrounded by a multitude of crushed, burnt rocks that suggested the use of a Bomb to destroy some kind of obstruction in the past. Next to it was a sign indicating the Great Fairy's presence, along with a message encouraging visitors to "increase their fortune".

'This must be the place,' she thought, staring down the deep, dark hole in front of her. 'This can't be safe...but, oh well, here goes!' Jumping down the hole, she found herself not crushed against a rocky floor many feet below, as she had feared, but instead gently floating to the ground in a large, well-lit chamber, dominated by a shining fountain. A lone fairy floating above the water spun around and seemed to explode in a cloud of coloured smoke, transforming into a radiant, four-armed Great Fairy.

"Welcome, traveler!" she exclaimed, laughing heartily. "Have you come here to increase your fortune? I shall be happy to--"

"Um, no, not exactly..."

At this, the Great Fairy raised an eyebrow, immediately dropping her grandiose facade and asking, "Uh, wait...really? That's weird...most folks come by here asking to be able to carry more Rupees or something...well, in that case, what do you want?"

Sue-Belle looked down at her feet for a moment, deep in thought. "Well," she began, sounding rather uneasy, "I came here because I needed help with my daily chores, specifically carrying water down the hill..." The Great Fairy looked even more confused, scratching her head with one of her upper arms. "You see, it's become difficult for me to carry as much as I want, so I was hoping you could use your magic to make it easier..."

The Great Fairy raised one hand, stopping her speech momentarily. "Okay, look, kid," she said, taking on an informal tone. "Lemme give it to ya straight...I'm a very specialised kind of Fairy, you dig? I deal primarily with monetary wishes-- unless you're asking for more Rupees so you can hire off-island workers to carry your water or something, I'm not sure how much I can help..."

The water-bearing girl was disheartened at this. "But, sure, you must be able to do something for me! You're...you're magic! You can do anything, right?"

She nodded half-heartedly. "In...theory, yes..."

Feeling slightly encouraged by this, Sue-Belle turned to the Great Fairy and spoke with renewed conviction, saying, "Okay, then! In that case, I wish...to be, uh...bigger! Yes, just a little bigger so I'll be strong enough to carry heavier pots of water. Can you do that, great one?"

"Uh...well...again, in theory; Fairy magic can do a whole lot of stuff, but it can also be very fickle, especially when its user doesn't really know what they're doing...but, okay, if you insist!" Holding her inner pair of hands together, the Great Fairy materialised a glowing flower in her inner pair of hands, blowing on it and sending a cloud of shining petals toward Sue-Belle. "Okay! That, er, should do it...if I'm right, it should be a gradual effect, so check back with me in the morning if it works. See ya!" An excited Sue-Belle made her way up and out of the cave, running home as fast as she could. As she went to bed, she thought excitedly about how much easier her favourite task would be the next morning, when she was bigger...

----

Sue-Belle awoke the next day...to find that getting out of bed seemed unusually difficult for some reason. With her eyes still closed, she attempted to roll over, becoming aware of a pronounced creaking sound coming from her bed frame. "That's weird..." she said aloud. Before she could do anything else, the frame suddenly snapped, sending her mattress clattering loudly to the ground. "Ouch! What in blazes is happening to--" The young woman trailed off in the middle of her sentence upon opening her eyes and seeing what had become of her body; it seemed that in the night, the Great Fairy's magic had caused her to grow incredibly fat!

Weighing at least a good 300-400 lbs., Sue-Belle's body was now dominated by a massive, round belly, split into several rolls, with two equally enormous breasts sitting atop its shelf of flab. Both her arms and legs had bloated up thick with fat, with even her fingers and toes now resembling little sausages, and her face's 3 new chins squashed together as she tried to crane her nearly-nonexistent neck forward to survey the damage. Obviously, her dress had been annihilated by this point, leaving every part of her fattened form visible for all to see. "What...what happened?!" she cried to no one in particular, feeling all over her new body to see if it was real and not some twisted nightmare. Before she could think of anything, though, the girl was suddenly overtaken by a powerful sensation, and she found herself rising up slightly as her fat rear end seemed to inflate even bigger, soon followed by the rest of her body. Multiplying rapidly in weight, she caused the floor of her room to break, at which point she dropped down onto the centre of Orca's dojo with a loud thud.

Neither Orca nor Sturgeon was around, which proved a momentary relief...which quickly evapourated as soon as Sue-Belle realised she was still getting fatter! "I-I have to get out of here!" she exclaimed, miraculously hoisting herself onto her feet before attempting to labouriously waddle her way to the front door...which proved easier said than done, as dozens more pounds of fat packed onto her body by the second. She just managed to reach the door, and quickly pulled it open before attempting to squeeze her rapidly-widening form through it, only to end up stuck! After several seconds of struggling, though, that problem managed to "solve" itself, as her flab quickly grew too huge for the flimsy doorway and split it apart, allowing Sue-Belle to fall forward and land on her belly, at which point her gain finally slowed to a halt.

Having expanded to about 1500 lbs., give or take, Sue-Belle lay on the ground, panting heavily and praying to the goddesses that no one was around to see her massive, nude form sprawled out on the beach. The only thought besides that running through her head was, 'That damn fairy's got some explaining to do...'

"Careful Link, you may get stuck in there one day! *giggle*" Climbing out from her deep crevasses, Link showed the big girl his fairy. "Saria look, I got a fairy now!" Link said cheerfully watching the obese fairy flutter around him and Saria, dipping up and down in her flight. Wow! A fairy!! Finally, a fairy came to you, Link! Wow! That's great news! I'm so happy for you! Now you're a true Kokiri, Link! ...I didn't think fairies could that fat though..." Saria said eying the blue blubbery creature before her. "Yeah she is...quite big isn't she?" Link said now being able to finally get a good look at his new companion. Navi, wanting to hurry on to the Great Deku Tree, interjected... "Yes, I am very fat, now come on Link we've got to go and meet with the Great Deku Tree!" she said as she pulled on his hat. "Oh yeah, see ya later Saria we have to meet the Great Deku Tree."

Is that right? The Great Deku Tree has summoned you? It's quite an honor to talk to the Great Deku Tree! I'll wait for you here. Go see the Great Deku Tree Link!" Saria then took to picking some flowers near the area. "Alright see ya Saria!" Link said as he ran off. ".....Okay now where is his stash of food?" Saria said, once she was sure the boy was gone, she went to look around for a his secret stash of food he told her about once, she had to have some of it...or all of it. Saria heaved her gut around to try and push through the bushes for some kind of possible alcove.

As the boy and his fairy made their way to the pathway that would lead to the Deku Tree's meadow, they were stopped by the annoying Mido. "Hey stop! Where do you think you're going Mr. No Fairy?!" the bully Mido said, somehow blocking the way to the Great Deku Tree from Link, despite Link being more fit and agile. "Aw come on Mido get out of the way, I've got to see the Great Deku Tree!" Link said, trying his best to get past the kid, with no success. "What's your business with the Great Deku Tree? Without a fairy, you're not even a real man!" Upon hearing this Link smirked slightly, "Well too bad for you Mido casue now I do have a fairy!" "What?! You've got a fairy?!" Navi then flew into the Kokiri's face, her fat ridden belly brushing against his nose. "Yeah, now move it, Mido! The Great Deku Tree summoned Link here, now let us through!". Letting this all sink in for a second, Mido burst with surprise. "Say what? The Great Deku Tree actually summoned you? Whaaaaaaat?! Why would he summon you and not the great Mido? This isn't funny..." Mido then muttered to himself wondering how he wasn't picked for this thing. Mido grumbled as he continued his dispute over the subject. " Hmmprh! I don't believe it! You aren't even fully equipped yet! How do you think you're going to help the Great Deku Tree without both a sword and shield ready?" the boy said, holding his nose up high. Both Link and Navi crossed their arms at this statement. "But you don't have your equipment either Mido." Link said, looking rather irritated and puzzled at his peer. "Ehhh well yeah...You're right. I don't have my equipment ready, but... If you want you pass through here, you should at least equip a sword and shield! Sheesh!" Navi grew quite irritated, seeing as she couldn't let her guardian down because of such trivial matters. "Oh come on Mido, stop being a brat and let us see him!" "....Hmmprh." Mido simply grunted and tilted his head as to say "no" to the fatty fairy. "Errrgghh...*sigh* come on Link let's go and find a Deku shield, one of my friends said there was one in stock at the store..." "Alright, I'll be back Mido!" Link said with frustration growing in his voice. But before the two could get too far Navi stopped Link and flew back to Mido and let out a massive fart in his face. "Hmmph, that'll show you...", the blue fairy said slapping her jiggly behind at him. Mido began to tear up and cough from the smell. " *cough cough* haack urrrhaaa! W-what was that for?" Mido shouted as he rubbed his irritated eyes.

As the duo made their way to the shop they noticed something odd...
142222222112.title: "Wow a fairy, quite a fat one isn't she?"

choices: Saria can move
Saria is immobile, AND hungry
1422222221121.content:
Before Link and his flabby fairy companion could get to the village shop, their attention was drawn to Link’s house. A large roll of fat was stuck fast in Link’s doorstep. While Navi didn’t know what this meant, Link instantly knew what had happened. As he climbed the ladder to his house Navi heard him muttering about how he knew this would happen. When he got to the large roll he just gave it a firm push. There was a loud popping sound as he saw Saria tumble to the ground after being unstuck.

Saria was almost twice as big as when the two had seen her two hours ago. When Link checked the secret tunnel he kept his food in she appeared to have eaten about half of Link’s private stash of food. Of course, it hadn’t been so much of a stash rather then a stockpile for Armageddon.

Saria had gorged herself until she weighed twice her original weight, so now her weight was 1670 pounds of fat. Her dress had been ripped to shreds, and she sat naked in Link’s bedroom. Each of her breasts was about the size of Link’s bed and her ass cheeks were the same size. Her arms and legs were now about 50 inches thick, and her belly covered the entire floor. She smiled up at Link with cheeks that looked like they were stuffed with basketballs and about twenty chins. This still didn’t mar her pretty face, so she tried to give Link the most innocent look she could.

“Saria, what am I going to do with you?” asked Link, “You know that food was mine and look what happened, You’re too big to get out of my house. So I ask again, what will I do with you?”

“Feed me some more?” Saria asked hopefully.

“Now why would I-“ Link was interrupted midsentence by the sounds of gorging. He raced down the secret tunnel and saw his new fairy happily munching on a rather large cake. He picked Navi up and brought her back to his bedroom where Saria was.

The obese fairy now weighed about 900 grams, and was only that small because Link had interrupted her feast before she could really get going. She started screaming at Link in a rather pissed voice.

“What the heck was that for?” she yelled, “I was enjoying that cake and you had to go and take it away from me! How are we going to get out of here with this silly girl stuck in your house-Ooomph!”

Navi’s rant had been cut short by a slap from Saria’s hand. Amazingly Saria stood up without any visible strain.
“I’ll have you know that I’m not stuck at all!” Saria said calmly. “I just pretended to be so I could talk to Link. I heard Mido telling Link to get a sword and shield before he could go see the Great Deku Tree. There is a Kokori Sword through a small hole near the Know-It-All Brothers’ house. As for a shield, I’ve got a spare right here.”

Saria lifted one of her many flab rolls and a Deku shield fell to the ground.

“Go get the sword and meet me at the Great Deku Tree when you are ready,” Saria said.

Link nodded and jumped down from his tree house. He started walking over to the house he had been told to go to, when one of the Know-It-All brothers stopped him and gave him a long explanation about dungeon maps. Then the second brother started talking to him about equipment. Finally, the third brother started a well-rehearsed speech about buying items. This explanation was so pointless that Link just charged past the brothers and dived into the hole in their garden wall. Halfway through the hole Link realized that he had left his two obese female friends in his house with his food stores still exposed. He groaned, as Saria was liable to really be stuck since the food got more fattening as the tunnel went on. Navi was also bound to make a pig out of herself, and at least double her size.

Link decided he would get the sword and return to his house to survey the damage. He spent a few wild minutes avoiding boulders, until he reached the chest with the sword in it. He quickly took the sword and rushed back to his house as fast as he could. He reached his house, dashed up the ladder and entered his room. He looked to the center of the room and saw exactly what he had expected. The room was empty but the entrance to his tunnel was open. Link climbed down the hole and began the half mile walk to the back of it.

When he reached the end of the tunnel, Link saw that as he had expected, all of his food was gone. In its place was a gently sleeping Saria. Saria ‘s flabby body was covering the floor, hiding it from view. In addition there was a small ball of flesh resting on her belly that was emmiting a pale blue glow. Link picked up the ball, which he knew to be Navi, and gave her a slight squeeze. Navi didn’t wake up, but she did turn in her sleep and snuggle closer to Link. Navi had doubled in size and was now a 2lb ball of flesh. She was still too small to make out any real details of her body though.

Now Link looked back to Saria and took in her body. Saria had more than tripled in size and was now weighing in at about 5000lbs. Her belly was a 10 foot long and 10 foot wide apron of flesh, starting out rolly beneath her breasts and becoming an expanse of soft, smooth, flab after that. Each of Saria’s breasts were the size of one of the pehats Link had seen in the sky sometimes. They rested lazily on her belly, and rose and fell seductivly with Saria’s breathing. Her ass cheeks were also each as big as a pehat, and were supporting the flabby girl in her sleep. Her arms and legs were each 70 inches thick, and ended in feet or hands nearly covered by fat. Her face was overwhelmed by pudge, but was still quite cute. Her cheecks looked like they had Deku Baba heads inside them and she had over 30 flab filled chins.

Link would have been content to watch his massive friends sleep, but he remembered that he had somewhere to be. He shook each girl awake and waved a dropped cookie in front of their faces to grab their attention. Navi immediately flew up to his face and munched on the cookie, but Saria didn’t move.

“Saria, can you move?” Link asked, “If you can it’s time for us to go meet the Great Deku Tree.”
1422222221121.title: Saria is Stuck in Link's house

choices: Link tries to push but instead starts sinking into Saria's flab!
Saria suggests that she'd force her way out by eating some more
14222222211211.content:
"Aw five more minutes, Link." Saria whined in a playful fashion, her chins swaying as she did so.

"Five more minutes and you'll be the size of the Great Deku Tree..."

The sound of his best friend's giggle made Link roll his eyes for a moment before he flashed her a quick smile.

"Come on we have to go already."

"Okay just give me a moment."

Amazingly Link was rather surprised that despite weighting in at two and a half tons Saria was able to effortlessly lift herself off the ground. However her belly nearly collided with Link had he not sided aside a second sooner.

"Opps sorry Link."

"Just be careful with that thing, okay."

The two shared a laugh afterwards Link had to stop Navi from continuing to feast.

"What am I going to do with you two?!"

He sighed with a partial grin as he overheard Saria's chuckle behind him...

Later after having exited the tunnel, again Saria amazing Link with how well adjusted she was to her new bulk, a thought from earlier sudden came storming back to Link.

"How the heck am I going to get you out of here?!"

"Oh don't be that way, Link, I'm sure I can get out..."

Before he could protest Saria attempted to move her extra-wide girth out the door, the entire home seemingly shaking with each of her footfalls. As expected however this was one thing that Saria couldn't surprise Link with, despite her best efforts she was indeed stuck in the doorway and just as it was earlier only a portion of her fat had made it through.

"Don't you say anything, Link." Saria stressed trying to keep her dear friend from saying "I told you so".

Instead the boy simply sighed doing his best to come up with a way to get Saria free.

"Hey listen! You can try pushing her out like last time."

The bloated fairy's suggestion did seem to be the most obvious but would it work, after all Saria was much plushier now then she was the first time around. succeeds
14222222211211.title: Leaving the tunnel is easy the doorway however...

choices: A group of Deku Scrubs, who opened fire
A massive feast
142222222112111.content:
Link positioned himself next to Saria, and began to push inward on her giant frame, hoping to give Saria enough room to get the rest of her massive body out the door. A flaw appeared in his plan almost immediately. Saria was so soft and so fat, that instead of pushing her, Link was just sinking into her flab. Link continued to push anyway, hoping to find some muscle or bone to get a good purchase on. Finally he hit muscle, and with a mighty push, Saria's torso moved. Saria stepped forward, and with a loud pop she shot out the door and smashed through the house's railing, taking Link over the side with her.
Luckily, it was only a 15 foot drop, so Saria's enormous breasts and belly cushioned her fall. Link was also lucky, and fell onto Saria's titanic ass. This made the obese, green haired girl give a small moan, as her sensitivity had increased greatly, along with the rest of her.
"Hey Link," Navi said from the top of the house, "You enjoying yourself down there?"
This comment made both Link and Saria blush, and Link jumped down to the ground as Saria stood up and dusted herself off. Navi flew down and began to hover aside Link.
"C'mon you two," Navi said, " The Great Deku Tree is waiting for us."
The trio headed off towards the Tree's clearing, but were soon stopped by Mido.
"So you got a sword and shield, huh," Mido said, " It doesn't matter, I'm still not letting you past."
"Mido, get out of our way," Saria said, " The Great Deku Tree wanted to see us, and he said it was urgent."
"Make me, fat-ass," said Mido, "Why would he want to talk to a whale like you anyway? You look like you can barely walk. Maybe you should fix that by stuffing your face like you usually do."
Link saw Saria's face become almost red with rage. With a swing of one of her blubbery arms, Saria sent Mido crashing into a wall with a sickening thud. Then she started down the path to the Tree's grove, and the others followed her. After a mile or so, link started to hear sobs coming from Saria. After a few more steps, he spoke up.
"Saria, you don't need to pay any attention to what Mido said," Link said, "You've always been pretty, and today you look better than ever. Besides, I know you like being fat, why else would you have eaten all of my food?"
Suddenly, Saria swept Link up in her arms and kissed him.
"Thank you Link, She said with a tear, "You always say the nicest things to me."
Then she hugged him tightly, and lowered him to the ground.
"I wished I could hug people like that," Navi thought to herself, "Honestly, I really wish I was human instead of a tiny fairy."
When they turned around the corner, they finally saw the Great Deku Tree. The Tree saw them and spoke to them.
"About time you kids got here," he said, "I don't have much time, so I'll make this quick. Some jerk cursed me so I need you to go to my deepest roots, and kill the embodiment of that curse."
With that, the Tree opened its mouth and the trio rushed inside. After slaying some Deku Babas, they scurried up a ladder and opened the first door of the dungeon. Inside they found...
142222222112111.title: Getting out of the house, and meeting the Tree

choices: Go get the Great Deku Tree
Eat all the food
14222222211212.content:
"I can't really move anymore."

Link just looked at her in shock. Not only was Saria fat, naked, and in his house, she was completely incapable of movement. In short, she was Link's new permanent roommate. Link was hoping this was just a dream, and that he would wake up to his normal life. (Un)fortunately, this was all very real.

"Well, I'll go talk to Great Deku Tree about this, and I'm sure he'll know how to get you out."

Just as Link started to walk out of his house, Saria's massive gut let out a tremendous growl. Saria could do nothing but blush. "Uhm, Link, I'm still kinda hungry..." Now it was Navi's turn to flip.

"And leave nothing for me to eat?! No way sister! You aren't getting anything as long as I'm here! Let's go Link! L-Link?!"

While Navi was ranting about Saria's food obsession, Link had fetched more food for Saria, and was feeding her the delectables. Navi was in utter shock. She flew her 900 gram body over to Link and did what she did best (Besides eating of course.). She pounded her ass upon his head. However, this oddly did nothing to Link, other than give him some bumps on his head. He just continued feeding Saria while Navi fumed at him.

Navi realized she had two choices.

1. Go talk to the Great Deku Tree and get him to help in any way he could.

2. Eat al the food Link was feeding Saria so that she won't get any.
14222222211212.title: Well, you see...

choices: Link and Navi get to the Great Deku Tree, and he tells them what they must do.
Link and Navi go to the Deku Tree only for Saria to catch up to them.
1422222221122.content:
"Hey Link!" Navi then stopped in mid-flight, proceeding to tug on Link's ear. "Wuuaaahhh!" Link screamed as the fat fairy pulled on his earlobe. As Link rubbed his ear, he looked at what Navi was pointing to. To the side of the shop's entrance was a sign. "ATTENTION!!:Deku Sheild now back in stock! price: 60 rupees. "60 rupees?! That's ridiculous!" Navi exclaimed fluttering about in a crazed fashion. "Hmmph, well I guess you'll have to use up most the rupees in your wallet..." Navi sighed, placing her hands on her hips. "Actually...I don't have any rupees...at all." "What? How can not have any rupees?!" Link merely shrugged his shoulders, up until this point never having nor needing any rupees in his possession. "*sigh* "Well I guess we got go around and find some...Can't believe the kid chosen by The Deku Tree doesn't even have a rupee to his name." Navi said flying towards the many bushes about the Kokiri Forest.

After about 20 minutes of Link searching through the bushes and grass for rupees and Navi committing to eating well...all the bushes and grassy roots Link went through, they had amasses a total of 30 rupees and were currently working through the Kokiri Training Grounds. "Uurrrp, so why are there so many rupees in these bushes anyway?" Navi belched after eating yet another uprooted bush Link had thrown. "I've heard rumors of them being placed there by tiny forest beings..." "What? That's crazy, that doesn't make any sense at all, anyway are we done yet?" "We would be close if you hadn't eaten that red rupee stuck in that bush earlier." Link said with a faint annoyance at the fairy's surplus appetite. "Hey! It looked like big fruit from my viewpoint, besides we only lost 20 rupees worth from it." the light blue obese fairy said as she bobbed repeatedly into Kokiri child's body. A few minutes later after uprooting a bush at the south wall, the two found a small tunnel. "Hey what's through here?" Link said crouching to peer through. Getting on his knees he began to crawl through the small opening. "Hey!" Navi yelled, following him inward. Once Link had made his way to the other side he got and walked into a clearing. "Woah...what kind of area is this?" Navi said flying in from behind. Link looked around, taking note of the high walls and straight paths. "It kinda looks like a maze don't....hmmm?" At that moment the boy heard a loud rumbling coming from behind him. The two turned around to see a huge boulder rolling towards them. "Ahhhhh!" Link and Navi screamed, in an instant the two of them dove into an alcove, just barely getting run over by the large rock. "That was close..." Navi said as she laid on Link's stomach, her belly heaving up and down from her sudden increase of stress. Link, taking a moment to get his thoughts clear again peered his head around the corner only to see the exact same boulder come right at him. "Aghhh!" At that point Navi got an idea. "Hey Link, let's follow it, that way it won't surprise us anymore." Link nodded in agreement and began to run up to the rolling rock, making sure to be close enough to not lose track of it, but far enough to not get hit by it. Oddly enough, instead of crashing into the wall whenever the boulder came up to one it just turned into the path of grass, like a living creature would. As Link and Navi followed the boulder they found several blue rupees making their total a grand 70 rupees.

"Alright finally! We got enough to buy that damn shield! and even a little extra!" Navi bounced in the air, happy she could finally get on with her duty. Navi then noticed something off to the left in another alcove. "Hey look over there Link!" "Hmm?" Upon looking inwards into the alcove the boy saw a rather large chest at the end of it. "Ooohh let's see whats in it, maybe there's some food in it!" Navi drooled at her benign assumption, Link just rolled his eyes,ignoring the insatiable winged glutton flying next to him. Reaching up to open it, Link's eyes gleamed with a great fascination towards what he saw. Picking it up he thrust it above his head. "Yeah! I found the Kokiri Sword!" "Hey look there's a note!" Navi said flying inside and picked it up. "This is the hidden sword of the Kokiri, you can borrow it for awhile. Be sure to practice with it before you fight....Well now that we got both a sword and a shield let's go tell Mido to get out of our way!" Navi said pumping her fist into the air and flew off rather quickly for a fairy her size back to the tunnel. "Hey wait up!" Link said following her back.

Upon making their way back out from the grounds, down below next to Link's house they saw Saria, only she seemed to be covered in a large amounts of food, and her dress was now the bare minimum of modesty. "Saria!" Link said jumping down, landing near the possibly half ton Kokiri girl. "*chew* *munch* BBBUUURRRRPPP!!!!...Oh hi Link, I....didn't expect you to come back here so quickly, hehe but oh well...I found your secret stash of food!" Saria said somewhat ashamed of herself but nonetheless overjoyed at getting to fill her gargantuan belly up with more food. "WHAT?!" Navi screamed, "You mean you had a whole stash of food, and you didn't tell me about it?!" Navi was furious, disappointed her companion had kept what had to have been a large amount of food given how Saria seemed to have gained an extra 200 pounds from it all. Bewildered, Link responded rather angrily. "It wasn't for you! I was saving that for special occasions, and I kept it secret cause I knew Saria would try and search for it...*sigh* Well, at least you're happy...and you look even better than before. "Uuurrppp. Thanks Link, and for what it's worth I'm sorry for pigging out on your food, oh hey you got a sword!" Saria cheerfully said, pointing a thick finger at the boy's new equipment.

"Heh, yeah had to get it to because of Mido." Link said pointing his thumb over to where the "boss" of the Kokiri was standing. "Oh that bum! I don't know why he's always so mean to everyone! Look you go on and talk to the Great Deku Tree...I'll deal with him." Saria said as she smirked about her plans on how to deal with the bratty Kokiri. "Alright see ya later, come on Link let's get that shield!" "Ok, bye Saria!" Link waved back to his friend, as he ran off to the shop once again. "Ok, now to get back that baked Baba head in my fifth chin." Saria murmured as she dug her fingers into her flabby chin folds for more food to munch upon.

"So Link,..." Navi asked innocently. "You got any more food?" "Believe me, if I had any left from what Saria ate, YOU wouldn't get it." "Ugghh you're so unfair." Navi said puffing her cheeks and crossing her arms, just as they made their way into the Kokiri Shop. Link then made his way to the counter. "Hey welcome to the Kokiri Shop." the shopkeeper said in slightly bored tone, due to the slow activity the shop had been having recently. Looking at the current stock, Link and Navi could see that the store was selling Deku Nuts in bulk of five and ten for 15 and 30 each, arrows 10 and 30 for 20 and 60 rupees each, which was odd considering no one in Kokiri Forest even owned a bow currently. They also saw Deku seeds, Deku sticks, the shield they needed, and these moderately sized hearts for 10 rupees. "I'll have that shield. Link said to the shopkeep. "60 rupees..." the shopkeep responded "Anything else?" Hmm...." Link surveyed the ware, he only had 10 rupees left, should he save for later or buy something else? "Oh oh! buy a heart Link!" Navi pointed at the heart shaped thing. Link was a bit weary in buying it, but...Navi seemed to want it so why not, it's not like he needed anything else from this store. "Alright give me one those hearts." "10 rupees" Link gave the shopkeep the last of his rupees and grasped the nearly head-sized item in his hands.

"What is this thing?" Link said. "I don't know but I'm gonna find out!" Navi then shot towards Link, grabbed it from out of his hands, and chomped down the whole thing in one bite. "Hey!, you greedy fairy! Maybe I wanted a taste!" "BBBBUUUUURRRRRPPPPP!!!!! Ah that was delicious...ohhhh!" At that moment Navi plumped up from the contents of the edible heart. "What the..." Link said surprised by what just happened. By the looks of it that one heart had made the fat fairy gain an immediate 50 or so fairy pounds. She now had a noticeable increase in the amount of fat in her belly and breasts, her breasts were about the size of one of Link's eyes, and her belly spilled out even further now, being a fourth the size of Link's head. She now had an extra 5th chin and her arms, legs and ass had filled out considerably. The blue fairy probably weighed about 600 fairy pounds (that's 600 grams for you normal folks) now. "Oh man, we need to get those more often, I love what they do for me!" Navi cheerfully exclaimed flying around in a frenzied manner, her flabby rolls jiggling about. "Yeah, yeah come on you fat blue ball, let's go see Mido and finally get to the Deku Tree." "Right!" Navi shouted as she flew forward.

"Hey Link I already told you, if you want you pass through here, you should at least equip a sword and shield!" "Hmmph well I do have one!" Link said turning around to show the jerk his newly acquired shield. "Eh, what's that? Oh, you have a Deku Shield, and what's that? Is that the Kokiri Sword?! Good grief! Well,... even with all that stuff, a wimp is still a wimp, huh? I, the great Mido, will never accept you as one of us!" Mido said scowling in defiance. "Whatever, see you Mido!" Link said running off, laughing to himself. "Shoot! How did you get to be the favorite of Saria and the Great Deku Tree?" Mido grumbled under his breath. He then saw Saria coming up to him, looking at him rather... creepily.
1422222221122.title: 60 rupees?! That's ridiculous!

choices: Getting into the room they are attacked by a Deku Scrub!
Getting into the room, the three oddly find....a huge pile of food?!
14222222211222.content:
Running past a small group of Deku Babas, swiftly dodging their meek attempts of snapping at the two, Link and Navi made their into the grove of the Great Deku Tree, where Saria was waiting alongside him. "Hey Link!" the young Kokiri girl waved at the boy, smiling delightfully as her 800+lb body was sprawled out on the grass.
"Wha? Saria how'd you get here before us?" Link said as he approached the giant tree. Rather perplexed how a 800lb girl had somehow gotten here before him, he knew he had seen her only minutes ago just before the two had talked with Mido, completely indulged in eating the rest of her food, so it just seemed impossible.
"Oh I'll tell ya later, right now you must listen to the Great Deku Tree." Looking up at the wise guardian, the tree told the boy his words...
"Link... Welcome... Listen carefully to what I, the Deku Tree, am about to tell thee... Thy slumber these past moons must have been restless, and full of nightmares..."
"Why does he always speak like that?" Link whispered over to Saria.
"I think it was the proper way of speech when he was young."
"As the servants of evil gain strength, a vile climate pervades the land and causes nightmares to those sensitive to it... Verily, thou hast felt it... Link... The time has come to test thy courage... I have been cursed... I need you to break the curse with your wisdom and courage. Dost thou have courage enough to undertake this task?" Navi grew surprised upon hearing the Deku Tree had been cursed.
"Cursed?! But how?" the fairy questioned fluttering about haphazardly.
"That is not of importance as of now, thou must relinquish the curse inside me before I can give you such information." Deku Tree bellowed. "Now Link, dost you have courage to venture inside me and vanquish the evil that lay within?" Without a moment of hesitation, Link answered back with full confidence.
"Yes Great Deku Tree, I'm ready." the boy immediately drew out his sword and shield." The Great Deku Tree then let out a loud rumbling sound as the lower portion of his body opened up, resembling a mouth.
"Then enter, brave Link, and thou too, Navi and Saria, the boy has never ventured inside and it would be best if you two helped him along..." the two nodded in a determined manner, their multitude of chins smushing into each other as they did. As the trio ventured into the depths of the tree, the 600g fairy then suddenly flew backwards, flying up to the great tree's hoard of leaves. Plucking several of them off of the branches.
"Gotta keep my strength up." Navi said justifying her gluttonous action. Link rolled his eyes, while Saria merely stifled a giggle, finding amusement in the fairy's obsession with the Great Deku Tree's leaves.


Making his way into first chamber of the tree Link noticed the odd structure of the inner dwellings of the Great Deku Tree. "What's with this place?" the Kokiri boy questioned, taking notice of the large webbing on the floor and number of ladders placed throughout the layers of floors.
"A lot of the stuff in here was added by Kokiris long ago, though pretty much all the ones who did this work have become Skull Kids since then..." Saria answered looking around with a sort of melancholic look on her face. Waddling over to the huge webbing in the middle of the floor, Saria got down onto her knees, pushed her jutting belly inward as much as she could to get it out of her view, and peered down it's holes. "Well....we don't want to fall down this thing, we're gonna have to find some way to burn this stuff or something to get down there." Link then nodded, then he suddenly realized something.
"Hey Saria....where's your fairy, she's not lost in your fat again is she?" Saria blushed remembering a number of times where due to Sermilla liking to take a nap in the girl's fatty rolls, she often ended up getting stuck in there, needing to be dug out with help from the Kokiris holding up Saria's folds.
"Oh no, I left her at my house, I didn't think it would be necessary to bring her along." crossing her arms she sighed. "I guess I can't really go back now to get her, not that it would be necessary anyway..."
"Hey! Are you two gonna stand here talking or we actually going to get something done?!" Navi shouted, reminding the two kids of just what was important. Running over to the ladder that was snared deep into the bark of the wall to ensure it keeping strength, Link climbed up, running up the winding pathway until realizing Saria, at her weight might need help. "Uh...need any help?" Link called down to his friend, still on the bottom floor.
"No, I may be big and full of flab, but I can still move around like you Link." Chuckling to herself, Saria grasped the rungs and heaved herself upward, slowly but surely pulling herself up each rung. Straining herself slightly Saria let out a light fart upon making it to the top, after relaxing her muscles. Amazingly, despite weighing nearly half a ton the girl barely showed signs of sweat on her body. Link and Navi could only stare on in amazement and admiration.

"How are you capable of that?" Navi said flying up next to the girl, her fat grazing Saria's chins as she looked into the girl's blue eyes.
"Hmmph." the girl grunted, taking pride in her athletic prowess. "You may not know this, cause you have wings and Link over there has never been fat, but we Kokiri are pretty fit, even with a belly like this..." she said giving the thick layer of blubber a hard slap, a slap which resonated a sound that bounced all around the circular walls of the tree. Continuing up the spiraling pathway, the trio came across a large chest. Opening it up they found that it was a map, oddly named "Dungeon Map of the Deku Tree". Perplexed, Link asked Saria if she knew why. "...Must be some sort of playful name done by whoever drew this... look at this thing Link, whoever drew this map must've been really determined, they've got every nook and cranny of the Deku Tree written on here."
"Well this should really helpful!" Navi shouted as she fluttered about the piece of parchment. "Though...I don't suppose you two have any way to keep track of where we go?" the fat fairy said nibbling on one of her leaves as she asked. Link merely shrugged, unable to come up with a way to do such a task. Saria thought for a bit then remembered she had something in her that just might work.
"I think I have an idea, Link can you reach around in that roll right there on the left side of my belly?" Puzzled, and admittedly happy to do so, Link pushed his hand deep into the recesses of fat on Saria's stomach, feeling around he felt a soft, liquidity feel on his fingers, taking hold of whatever it was he pulled out and found several blueberries, that somehow weren't crushed by the girl's tremendous fat.
"These?"
"Yeah, now Navi... give me one of your leaves." Hearing this Navi flew up above Saria's head and held dearly to the piece of flora. "What?! No, get your own! These are mine to eat!" Huffing at the fairy's hunger tracked mind, Saria gave her response.
"Not to eat you winged nut, I just need one for these berries." Quickly swiping a single leaf from the determined, albeit weak grasp of the fairy, Saria crushed a few of the berries between her thick fingers, and smeared the resulting liquid and bits onto the leaf. Finding the area marked "floor 1" on the map, she brushed the leaf over the large circle on the areas with the blue juices. "There...now since we know this part of the "dungeon" has already been trespassed by us three, we know which rooms we've been to and which ones we haven't, all we got to do is check our surroundings to make sure we don't color in the wrong room."
"Boy aren't we lucky you tagged along Saria? Link would've been stuck here without you."
"Hey!" Link angrily shouted, swatting the fairy to the side, annoyed and embarrassed by her comment. Giggling at the two's odd bond, as even Mido had a better relation with his fairy, Saria injected. "Oh I'm sure Link can do just fine without me, it's not like marking this map is vital to us getting around in here."
"Well whatever, ok Link, onward!" Navi said, flying towards the vine wall, near a pair of Skulltulas.
"Uh Navi..." Link said pointing a fact out to the fairy, "We can't climb up there with those spiders there, they'll knock us down."
"Well...yeah you're right, I would just eat 'em for ya, but... I ate one of their babies once, and it didn't agree with me all too well, I'm not risking eating an adult one, maybe we can find something to knock 'em down."
Making their way to the top part of the pathway, the three found what looked like a door in the wall, however it didn't seem to have any way of opening, due to it being flat and bare.
"How do we open this?" Saria asked.
"Oh! Link put some pressure on it with your and hands and push upwards!" Navi exclaimed excitedly. Wondering just how the fairy figured this out, the two took the fairy's word and followed her order. Placing his hands on the door he put his weight inward onto the door's surface then shifted his strength upwards, and suddenly and surprisingly, it slid up into a small alcove above it. Walking over to it Saria looked up into where it went, wondering just how it worked.
"How did you know that Navi?" Saria asked. Scratching her belly, Navi responded cheekily.
"Hehe fairy's intuition." Suddenly the door came shooting down, though given Saria's great girth and huge amount of fat it was stopped in it's decent rather quickly. Belching from the sudden pressure, Saria told to them to hurry through. "BBBUUURRRPPP!!! Link come on, get in here!"
14222222211222.title: Wait, how did you get here before us?!

choices: it's Gohma's larvae, finally something Saria and Navi can snack on!
oddly it's some skullkids...what business do they have here?
142222222112221.content:
Looking ahead, the three saw in the very box-like was nothing. "Huh?" Navi said floating about. What's the point of making a room like this with nothing in it?" Link slowly walked forward, looking for anything suspicious, the boy then stepped onto a small bush, doing so it quivered suddenly. "Huh? Peering down to get a better look at the plant, Link was then suddenly blasted into the air, knocked off his feet by the bush rising up from the ground. "A Deku Scrub!" Saria exclaimed, taking note of the wooden being. "Whats a Deku Scrub?" Link rubbed his head, getting himself off the ground. "You don't know?" Saria rested her palm on the side of her head. these scrubs are natives of the Lost Woods and some of them take residence inside the Great Deku Tee, like this one here." "The--Ahhh!" Saria yelped as a fist sized nut hit her in the face, leaving a large red mark across the middle of her face and nose. The scrub chuckled at it's successful attack "Hey!" Link ran up, sword ready, the scrub realizing danger plummeted back into the earth. Trying to stab the sword into the top of the scrub, Link found it useless as the sword was simply to small and dull to pierce the Deku's upper layer of leaves. "Hmmph...stupid weed!" Link barked at the cowardly plant being, kicking it's leaves with his foot. "Are you alright Saria?" Navi said, flying over, having watched everything from up above. "Yeah...I'm fine, but why is that Deku Scrub attacking us? Most of them are quite non aggressive..." The scrub then popped out again, and fired a nut at Link who was walking back to Saria. "Link!" Navi and Saria both yelled as it hit him in the back, but as it was the nut rebounded off his shield and flew back into the scrub, knocking it out of it's nest. "Link on its back, look!" Saria pointed to the thing latched onto the scrub's back, a small purple bulge of sorts was leeching off the scrub. Link drew his sword and dashed at the scrub, and after a few good slashes, the bulge burst, leaving the scrub free.

Shaking in a frightened manner the scrub did a small bow and hopped hurriedly back to it's nest and burrowed deep into the ground. "What was that "thing"?" Saria questioned, disturbed by the image of such a horrid object controlling a scrub like that. "I don't know...but it's probably due to whatever's cursing the Deku Tree." Link repsonded as he walked to the door. Making their way into the room Link saw a large chest on a ledge with a large, gray floating platform in front. Finally a room without danger, alright let's go." Saria said hopping onto the platform nearly taking up the stone's space with her whole body. As she tried to jump again, Saria felt an odd rumbling... "Hmm, hold on you two, I think I'm about to.." but then the platform fell out of the air, and into the floor, crumbling into dust instantaneously. "Uwa!" Link gasped at Saria's fall and the sudden change of gravity on the platform. "Heh, nevermind." Saria said, pushing her bulbous 800lb self up, grasping the ivy wall she began to climb upwards. "Well, what are you two waiting for? Link and Navi nodded and jumped down onto the opposite ivy wall. Opening the chest Link took out a slingshot, inscribed on it was "Fairy Slingshot" "Hmm..." Link pondered at the name. "Wait a minute how we get back?!" Navi screamed, realizing there was no way to get back the door. "Look." Link said, pointing up to a ladder covered in webbing. "Alright Link, now here use--" Saria said, taking a small pouch out from the chest before seeing Link had other ideas. Link then grabbed Navi, squeezing her flabby 600g body and placing it into the pouch of the slingshot. "W-wait Link what are you--Ahhhhhh!" Navi screamed once more as the boy sent her shooting into the ladder. "Ooof!" Navi groaned as she pushed into the ladder, falling along with it to the floor. Saria merely looked on in amazement at how Link could do something so...ignorant. "Uhh Link?" Saria tapped his shoulder and showed him a small parchment and a pouch in her hand. "You found our slingshot! Handcrafted by fairies of old from the wood of the Deku Tree himself, this slingshot has helped many a Kokiri in need for ages. NOTE: Despite being called the "Fairy Slingshot" it does not shoot fairies." "Ohh..hehe" Link muttered in embarrassment as Saria dropped the pouch into his hand, giving him a sort of motherly look of disappointment. "Uhhh... oh man... LINK!!!" Navi shouted bashing her blubber into his face, pounding into him in furious anger. "What the hell was that for?! You could've killed me!" "S-sorry, it said "Fairy Slingshot " I thought that's what it meant...and hey you got the ladder down!" "Hmmph..." Navi merely turned her head, refusing to talk to him for the time being. As the three made their way into more sections of the tree, they found a compass which was useless, and then found themselves at the top of the tree.

"Well...there's nothing else up here..." Navi said, fluttering about Saria's head. "Looks like we've got to go down past that webbing." Saria noted on her knees, peering down from an outward ledge, taking care to keep as much of her heavy fat on the floor as possible. "All the way down?! It took forever just to get up here...maybe we can jump down..." Link said, hoping he wouldn't have to go the long way down. "Jump?! Link I can barely see the bottom from here, I don't think I could survive that, and I've got all this stuff..." Saria then took hold of her large belly folds, letting them drop onto her lower side flab with a resounding slap. "...to cushion my fall." "Aw come on Saria, we'll have the web itself to slow us down, besides I think I see some water down there, that should also help." "Well...alright grab hold of me Link, I want to make sure you survive this, you too Navi." "Why? Unlike you two I can fly." the fairy said matter of factly, flapping her wings extra fast for a few moments to emphasize them. "Oh just get in here." Saria said pointing to her bellybutton. "Fine..." Navi nudged her way into the Kokiri's girl cavernous navel, making the girl giggle from the ticklish sensation. "Hahalright...*gulp*...1....2........3! "Waaaaaaahhhhh!!" Link and Saria yelled as they fell onto the webbing Navi , it stretching immensely from the massive amount of weight and velocity of the two children. *SPLASH!!!* Nearly blasting out almost a foot's height of water out of the entire pool, the two Kokiri were drenched in water, Saria's blubbery crevasses and folds holding in 20lbs worth of water alone. "Well...I must say that wasn't as bad as I thought it would, it was kind of exciting." Saria admitted as she squeezed her fat all over, getting rid of the water that laid in it. "Yeah..." Link said stopping as he noticed how Saria's clothes being wet draped over her body, clinging to her form, her heavy deku scrub sized breasts just barely fully covered by her top. Her bight green hair clung to her head, now a fair bit darker from absorbing water. She looked...different, Link had felt this before about Saria, but this time it really stuck in his mind how good she looked being so fat. "Hey! Whatcha staring at Link?" Navi asked to the boy, floating in front of his view. "Wuh nothing nothing, c-come on let's keep going." Link said quickly as her twisted some water of his hat.

Making their way into the next room,they saw a rather odd large iron spiked bar spinning across the entire room, with a platform floating across the water to the other side. "What?! Okay, who designed this?! How did someone even put this in here?!" Navi raged over the ridiculousness of the room's environment. "It looks like some kind of puzzle...." Saria said surveying the room. "You think you can swim over there Saria, we could float on top of your body." "I don't know Link...those spikes look pretty sharp, I'll get messed up real bad going under those things, my smooth belly will get all scratched and infected, hey wait...I see some kind of switch down there Link." "Hmm so there's a switch and a platform here..." Link said as he thought over how to do this. "Alright here goes. Hup!" Link jumped into the pool, swimming down to press the switch which then opened up hidden holes at the bottom, draining the water enough for the platform to pass under the spikes with generous space between them. Quickly the boy swam back, got onto the platform as Saria jumped into the water, too big to get on with him, swimming underwater to the other side. Crouching as he passed under the spikes, Link then jumped off onto the other side of the room, with Saria climbing out alongside him and Navi simply flying over. Taking out the giant skulltula, Link and Saria pushed the block up to the ledge above, climbed atop, and then made their way into a circular room with a Deku Baba. After killing it and taking the stick from it's remains, Link wondered what to do. "Hmm..."*twang!* Well these bars on the door aren't going anywhere. "Maybe we've got to light these other torches using the lit one here." Navi said, basking in the fire's warmth. "How would that work?" Saria said perplexed by such a concept. "It makes as much sense as the rest of everything in this place...Waitaminute who puts a LIT TORCH inside the GREAT DEKU TREE?!" Navi raged again as she realized the stupidity of having fire inside a tree. "Well whatever... let's try it." Link responded, taking out a stick from Saria's flab, lighting it, then using it to light the other torches, then immediately the door's bars lifted up. "Huh....it worked." Saria said astounded, scratching her torso. Making their way into the next room, they stopped as they heard loud rustling from above. *boomp* *boomp* boomp* suddenly the three were surrounded by some very odd looking creatures.
142222222112221.title: The first real enemy has been found!

choices: It does damage! Link continues his assault on the monster!
N-nothing happens...is this the end for the boy and his friends?
1422222221122211.content:
The three then found themselves surrounded by fairly large, one eyed arachnoid creatures. "N-navi what are these things?!" Saria asked in fear upon looking at the menacing things. "I remember hearing about these from the the other fairies, they're the larvae of...uhhh some tektite like monster, I don't remember the name of it right now, watch out Link!" Navi shouted to her companion as one of the larvae charged at the boy, it's eye turning into a reddish color as it narrowly missed the Kokiri boy. "Ha take this!" Grabbing his slingshot, Link took aim and shot a seed at the creature right as it turned back towards him. "Kreeeeee!" the monster screeched as the nut shot into it's large eye. It's eyelids blinking rapidly in horrid pain, it then called out to the other two larva. The other two, currently focusing on the large Kokiri girl and the fat fairy shifted their attention to the boy. Launching themselves at him, they wrapped their bodies around his arms, bringing Link down to the ground. "Ugah Hey! Get-get off of me you little bastards!" Link struggled as the arachnids held him down, keeping him from slashing at them with the Kokiri Sword. As the two continued to assault the boy, the other one readied to charge at the boy. "Erggh..." Link grunted as he braced for the impact.

But then suddenly, Link heard the horrid screeching of the two larvae who had held him down, seeing his friend Saria and his companion Navi fiercely chomping down on the two arachnids. "Kraaaaaaaah!" the two beasts shrieked in pain as the Kokiri girl and obese, blue fairy gulped down their bodies. Link quickly got up, blocked the incoming attack from the charging larva, and asked his partners just what inclined them to do such a thing. "We mmhad to get hem boff you sommmehow Link!" Saria blathered as she chewed through a thick portion of the beast's leg, now torn off from it's body. Navi, at first tried to reply but found herself too busy gnawing away at the remains of the other monster to attempt speech at the moment. Enraged at the sight of it's fallen siblings, the final larva charged once again at Link, only to be devoured in one gulp by a now horridly gargantuan fairy. "CHOMP!", Navi belched with tremendous gusto as her now 5lb blubbery self floated in mid air albeit, it took a tiny more effort then she was used to. "BBBUUUURRRRRRPPPPPPP!!!!!! Oh yeah that thing really filled me up." Saria giggled as she wiped her lips of some left over juices from the remnants of the creature. "Well... come on let's keep going." Link motioned to the two girls. After some more torch lighting and web burning the group found a small hole in the wall of which to crawl through. "Huh, wonder where this leads to. Link kneeled down looking through the small hole. Crawling through more than halfway he turned back looking past Navi who was right behind him, he could see Saria standing there, not moving. "Hey Saria, aren't you gonna come with us?" "Sorry but I don't think thats gonna be possible Link." she said slapping her gut, it wobbled for a few seconds, letting the boy know why she could not follow with him. "Oh right... well stay safe then Saria." Link then crawled out from the hole, coming out into a room that looked rather familiar.

"What'd ya find?" Saria called out from the other side. "Its the higher area from the room we first fell into awhile ago....you know come to think of it we could've just climbed up to this part of the room using you as a stepladder of sorts." "Oh yeah, hey wait for me will you Link? I'll get back to the room in a bit." After a bit of waiting and taking time to push down the block to the lower area, Saria appeared from the door on the lower area, using the block to get herself up more easily due to her weight. "Well...now that you're here we can go down this hole." Grabbing a deku stick from Saria's folds, he then lit it from the nearby torch, and burned the webbing casing the hole in the floor. "Is it safe?" Navi said. Link, peering over the edge looked down below. "I think I see a pool of water down there, it looks....wait, can't you just fly down there to check for us?" Link questioned, wondering why his flying companion was nervous about falling. "Well yeah...but there might be dangerous creatures down there, I'd have no way to defend myself." Navi turned around crossing her arms. "You're gluttonous mouth is more then enough of a defense if you ask me." "What?!" Navi shouted in response to the boy's comment on her appetite." "Now, now come on let's just do like we did before." Saria grabbed Link and Navi and fell into the hole.

"SPLASH!" Upon making impact in the pool, the three...mostly Saria had once again become drenched in water, much of the water was now either in Saria's and Navi's folds are up on the floor of the room. "Ugh, and I just got my hair dry after our first fall." Saria groaned irritated as she lifted and pulled on her flab, letting water run and fall out from her body."Sheesh, how far down does the Great Deku Tree go and where is this curse he has anyway?" Link said in slight amazement at just how deep in the ground the insides of the ancient tree went. "Well it can't be much farther till we find it's source, we've already been in every other area of his insides, this is the only place left." Saria stated as she waddled out onto the floor, shaking loose several pot's worth of water from herself. As the three made their way to the center of the room, walking towards the single door, from the edges of the room popped out three Deku Scrubs. "You will not get to Queen Gomha!" the scrubs shouted simultaneously as they attacked the trio. Dodging the attack, Link retorted "And just who is that?!" skillfully hitting one of them with a reflected nut with his shield. "The queen has freed us from the horrid Great Deku Tree!" "Yes, she has freed all of us!" the scrubs cried out in defiance to their ruler. "So this "queen" is the one responsible for the Deku Tree's pain?!" Navi, enraged flew at one of them using her weight to bash into it and knock it down, giving Link time to slash at the purplish almost egg like thing on it's back like the other scrub before. "How dare you attack our brother!" The other two scrubs shot a volley of nuts at the boy, blocking both nuts back the scrubs, the two were put into a daze, again Link destroyed the purple eggs on their backs. "There, now you're truly free." Saria said, glad the scrubs were back to normal. Bringing themselves up, they bowed to their saviors. "Th-thank for saving us from those parasites!" "Yes, but how did you know of their secret code to defeat them?" "Secret code?!" Navi questioned in disbelief at the ridiculous statement. "Did you not know? It had been set up that only if we were defeated in a certain order that we would truly be taken down, 2...3....1 see?" the scrub motioned to their nests on the edge of the wall. "That makes no sense at all..." Link muttered at the impossibility of such a "code" "Well, no matter, up in that room is the dreaded Queen Gomha, please you three defeat her and save the GREAT DEKU TREE!!! May the goddesses bless you!" the three scrubs then hopped back to their nests and burrowed deep underground.

Walking up to the door, Link touched the wooden door and looked back at his companions. "Well...this is it, are you two ready for whatever it is in there?" "After all this? No point in going back now." Navi responded. "For the Great Deku Tree, I'm ready to face anything." "Alright then guys...let's go." Making their way into the dark, large chamber, the three realized that it was strangely....empty. "I don't understand, those scrubs told us the queen was in here." Link said as he walked slowly, sword and shield ready for any surprise attacks. "Ahhh! Link up there!" Saria screamed in horror, pointing up to the ceiling. Looking up Link saw a horrifying creature. "Krraaaaaahhhhh!" the monstrous arachnid dropped down onto ground, shaking the three violently. Queen Gomha was a terrifying monster, with 6 long blackish legs with splotches of red and green throughout them each adorned with long yellow, sharp claws. Two of them dangled above her head, with two red horns atop her head. In her head layed a single large, yellow eye with a green sclera and a red horizontal line with two red dots above and below it acting as her pupil. Scared, but determined to win, Link fired off shot after shot of Deku Seeds, but alas, Gohma closed her eye every time, showing off incredible reflexes the boy simply could not get past. Jabbing her lengthy appendages at the group. Saria's blubber though thick, was not enough to shield her from the monster's attacks, and due to her weight was unable to dodge fast enough, resulting in her getting a rather deep gouge in her stomach. "Aarrrrggggghhhhh!!" Saria shouted in immense pain, blood running from her wound as she grasped it in her hand. "SARIA!" Navi and Link both said as they moved about the room dodging more attacks.


As Gomha continued her attacks, Link made a great effort to keep Gomha's attention on him, away from Saria, who was slowly making her way to the door, away from the danger and to rest. "Link, look, her eye is turning red, just like her larvae, maybe she's vulnerable just like them right before she attacks!" Navi shouted to Link as she saw Gomha reering back her legs to attack the two. As Link took aim with his slingshot, Navi took to distracting the beast by flying near her eye, her glow being rather irritating to the arachnid. Firing a seed at the beast's red eye, Link made a direct hit, stunning the beast, it's eye turning blue, and her body becoming limp. "Now Link!" Saria screamed to the boy, still holding her bleeding fold of fat, her hand now covered in the red liquid. Link struck at the beast with his sword.
1422222221122211.title: The curse has been lifted!

choices: Before them all the other Kokiris, having found out about the Deku Tree's curse.
The Deku Tree is perfectly fine, no longer cursed and back to normal.
14222222211222111.content:
Link made a direct hit, stunning the beast, its eye turning blue, and her body becoming limp. "Now Link!" Saria screamed to the boy, still holding her bleeding fold of fat, her hand now covered in the red liquid. Link struck at the beast with his sword. Gomha then screeched out in pain, green blood fired out from her eye. “Kreeeeeeaahhh Yrraaaaaaggggghhhh!!!” Gomha then suddenly pushed Link and Navi away, knocking the boy and the fairy down to the ground. Crawling back to the ceiling, the arachnid then did something truly bizarre and shot out the same purplish eggs the three had seen before. Crashing to the ground, the eggs shattered, revealing the larvae from before, but bigger looking, more developed. Dropping around eight, Link and Navi found themselves surrounded by the arachnid larvae. Doing the same strategy from before to Link but in far greater number, the boy found himself completely held to the ground by five of the larvae, the other three charged at the boy repeatedly, bashing into the him, crying in pain as he felt a few bones in his ribs cracking. Unable to fight back and unable to move Link was helpless.

“Hold on Link!” Navi, desperate to save her companion…no her friend from death, she did the unthinkable and flew straight at the group of larvae using all her jaw strength to devour them all one by one. Consuming the first, she alerted the attention of the others, as they threw themselves at the fairy in a vain attempt to take her down, she continued biting and eating away at them. In a mere minute or so only one larva was left, Navi, belching out a leg or two, she charged at the last one, opening her mouth to an impossible degree, got most of it’s head into her maw, the creature screeched and shrieked in terror as it was chomped to bits by the now massive 13 pound fairy. “Alright Link, are you okay, can you still fight?” she said flying over to the boy who was clutching his side. “Y-yeah, just go and check on Saria, we’ve still got to deal with the queen here.” Link growled as he got up, putting aside the pain in his chest to continue fighting the queen arachnid. Enraged at the gruesome death of her children, Gomha fell down from the ceiling, reeled her legs at Link and struck the ground near him, using his shield to block the attack, Link again shot at her red eye, now more green from all the blood from his previous attack. Hitting it again, the beasts cried out in pain, taking this moment, Link slashed with all his might into Gomha’s eye. “Haaaahh Haaaaah Yaaaaaaaaah!” Link slashed and stabbed, getting the beasts’ blood all over him self and the famed Kokiri Sword. With a final jumping slash attack, Link drove his sword deep through the beast’s whole eye, crying out one final time, Gomha rose up for a second and then crumpled to the ground finally, her body then burst into a blue like energy, and disintegrated into bits of bluish flame.

“Finally… hey Navi how’s Saria handling?!” Link shouted over to the fairy, who was checking up on the Kokiri’s stability. “She’s not looking too good Link, this wound she got from Gomha looks really deep, and it’s still bleeding. “Damn, come on Navi help me bring her up…can you still walk Saria?” Saria, a little woozy from the blood loss, replied slowly. “Y-yeah…huaaah *cough!* Eeehhhhh!” as Link turned back to where the remains of Gomha, he noticed there were some things there that surprised him. A shining circle of blue light was rising from the ground, and near it was a large heart shaped thing, with a silver lining casing the red crystal that made up its structure. “Hey Navi, you know what that is?” With wide eyes, Navi smiled in relief as she realized what was before them. “*GASP!* Link, that’s a rare Heart Container, I’ve heard from the Deku Tree that they have incredible healing properties, come on bring Saria and yourself over to it.” Limping over to the heart, the two Kokiri grabbed the large, silver lined heart, and pressed it to their bodies, immediately, the boy and girl felt a grand surge of energy flow through them, in mere seconds all the blood Saria had lost and all the beginning bruises and bone damage Link had suffered was instantly recovered and back to normal. “Oh by the goddesses, it’s as if we never got hurt in the first place!” Saria said, amazed at how her body was fully healed, she made small jumps in response, her belly jiggling in her glee. “Okay, okay, gimme that! I gotta see how this tastes!” Navi greedily flew by them and snatched the container from their hands, eating the whole thing, an immense taste of sweetness and cherry-like flavor poured throughout her taste buds.

“Oh…BBBBBBBBUUUUUUUUURRRRRRRRRRRPPPPPPPPPPP!!!!!!!!!!!!! Amazing!” Navi burped tremendously as she then expanded outward in an explosion of blubbery fat, going from her already grand 13 pound body, the blue fairy shot up to 20 whole pounds, now larger then Link’s head, it was a sight to see that she was still capable of flight, and even then, showed no signs of effort or stress, perhaps the heart container had a play in that. “Well…now what?” Link noted as they stood in the deepest part of the Deku Tree. “I think we should go into that ring of light.” Saria responded, feeling as if the ring was something good. “Are you sure?” “Yeah, besides, I’d hate to make the Great Deku Tree wait any longer for us, now that we’ve saved him.” “Okay then let’s go guys.” Navi said cheerfully as they went into the ring. As they did the light enveloped their bodies, wrapping around them, they found themselves lifted off the ground, and thrust into a blinding light. The three then found themselves being sent down in front of the Deku Tree.
14222222211222111.title: Damage dealt! Continue the assault!

choices: Were then swarmed by the Kokiri who heard that the Deku Tree just died.
Managed to go to the exit of the Kokiri Forest.
142222222112221112.content:
The trio found themselves in front of the Great Deku Tree, who now appeared to be no longer cursed and is back to normal.

"Well done, Link... Thou hast verily demonstrated thy courage... I knew that thou wouldst be able to carry out my wishes, lifting thy curse, and preserving thy safety of Saria..." The Deku Tree spoke to Link.

"You're welcome, Great Deku Tree," Link answered back, albeit knowing that the last part isn't entirely true.

"Now, I have yet more to tell ye, wouldst thou listen before I perish..." The Deku Tree spoke again.

"Perish? But I thought we removed the curse and turned you back to normal!" Saria exclaimed, aghast at the sudden reveal that the Deku Tree is going to die.

"Thou may have lifted the curse from me, but the curse had sapped far too much power from me to continue to live," the Deku Tree explained, "Thou must know my time is short, so thou must listen carefully... Especially you, Navi, unless your gluttony is more important than thy tale..."

The 20-pound Navi, who was munching on the Great Deku's leaves, suddenly stopped to listen after the Deku Tree demanded her to. "Oh, sorry," Navi said as she gulped down the remaining leaves in her mouth.

"Now...listen carefully... A wicked man of the desert cast this dreadful curse upon me..."

The Great Deku Tree then told the tale to Link, Navi, and Saria about how the man from the desert casted the curse on him. About how the man from the desert used his evil powers to search for the Sacred Realm and the Triforce. About how the three goddesses created Hyrule. About how the desert man should not have his hands on the Triforce. Link and Saria were invested in the Great Deku Tree's tale, although Navi appeared to be struggling with holding in her hunger.

"... Though your valiant efforts to break the curse were successful, I was doomed before you started... Yes, I will pass away soon... But do not grieve for me... I have been able to tell you of these important matters... This is Hyrule's final hope... Link... Go now to Hyrule Castle... There, thou will surely meet the Princess of Destiny..." The Great Deku Tree spoke to Link as he handed Link the Kokiri's Emerald, "...Take this stone with you. The stone that man wanted to much, that he cast the curse on me... The future depends upon thee, Link... Thou art courageous..."

"I won't let you down, Great Deku Tree," Link answered, "I will stop whoever is going after the Triforce, even if my life is at stake,"

"Good. Saria, a great responsibility has also fallen into your hands..." the Great Deku Tree spoke to Saria, "... Protect the Kokiri Forest as I have watched over the Kokiri..."

"I will follow your word, Great Deku Tree," Saria answered.

"Navi the fairy... I beg of you...Help Link to carry out my will... I entreat ye... Navi... Good...bye..." and just then, the Great Deku Tree begins to whither, his leaves falling out of his branches.

"I can't believe it. The Deku Tree is dead," Saria finally spoke after what seems like forever for her.

"It is a sad day, Saria, but we have to stay strong," Link comforted the near half-ton Kokiri, "We have to stay strong for the sake of--Navi wha are you doing?"

Link and Saria then saw Navi gathering and eating as much of the Great Deku's leaves as she can, "What? I'm just getting whatever I can to remember the Great Deku Tree by! BUUUUUUUUUUUURRRRRRRP!"

Link and Saria were not convinced at all by Navi's excuse.

"Well, let's go to Hyrule Castle, Link!! We can't let the man from the desert get his hands on the Triforce!" Navi exclaimed as she pressured Link and Saria to exit the meadow of the Great Deku Tree.

Link, Navi, and Saria:
142222222112221112.title: The Deku Tree is perfectly fine, no lon

choices: Link just stared silently.
Link asked who she is.
14222222212.content:
At the southeast corner of Hyrule, there thrived the lush forest that was the home of children known as the Kokiri. These children were watched over by the Great Deku Tree... who, to be honest, I never understood. He's a tree. A big tree, but still a tree. How is he supposed to protect anyone? Oh well, let's get to the point.

Although the Great Deku Tree could not do much, he could provide knowledge. Within his forest, there was a boy who he would have to inform of the threat that loomed overhead at that very moment, as that boy was the only one who could stop it. But the boy would surely suffer crippling stress if he were alone, so the Great Deku Tree called upon a young fairy girl to be the boy's companion.

"Navi... Navi, where art thou? Come hither..."

Navi quickly fluttered her small fairy wings once she heard the Great Deku Tree call for her. She flew as fast as she could towards the glade where the Great Deku Tree resided.

Upon arriving, the Great Deku Tree spoke of the evil presence that threatens Hyrule, "Dost thou sense it? The climate of evil descending upon this realm..." He went on about how he was powerless to stop it, but there was someone who could, "It seems the time has come for the boy without a fairy to begin his journey... The youth whose destiny it is to lead Hyrule to the path of justice and truth..." Navi intently listened to the Great Deku Tree, as there was no doubt a reason why he was confiding this information to her specifically.

Suddenly, the Great Deku Tree shocked Navi by giving her an order, "Navi... go now! Find our young friend and guide him to me... I do not have much time left." Navi was surprised she was suddenly given such an important task over any of the other fairies, considering how she was... considerably more plump than the others. It wasn't noticeable by the Kokiri, as the light her body emits blocks sight of her form, but fairies, including herself, could see her doughy belly. But her self-reflection was interrupted by the Great Deku Tree, "Fly, Navi, fly! The fate of the forest, nay, the world, depends upon thee!"

Navi immediately darted off to find the boy the Great Deku Tree spoke of. She spotted Mido standing at the entryway of the clearing, acting like he's important, which he isn't. Navi flew between Mido's legs to startle him, which caused him to jump.

Navi looked around Kokiri Forest, trying to locate the boy who didn't have a fairy with him. All of the Kokiri she saw while circling the village had a fairy, so once Navi reached the edge of the village, she turned back around and headed straight towards the boy's house, as it was unlikely he went somewhere else so early in the morning. Navi aimed herself up with the gap in the gate she had to pass through in order to reach the boy's home, and rushed to it. She aimed too low though, and her belly got caught on the bottom of the gap, flinging her back, "A-Ah! Did I really gain that much weight?" Navi muttered to herself as she grabbed her fleshy gut and shook it to see the damage.

After passing through the gate, Navi entered the hollowed out tree, and saw the young boy on a rather small bed, appearing to not be sleeping well. The Great Deku Tree needed to see the boy, so Navi had no other option but to wake him up, "Hello, Link! Wake up! The Great Deku Tree wants to talk to you!" Link just continued struggle in his sleep, so Navi talked louder, "Link, get up! Hey! C'mon! Can Hyrule's destiny really depend on such a lazy boy?" Finally, Navi heard Link yawn as he sat up, meaning she managed to wake him. Link looked up at the fairy, and...
14222222212.title: Living up to my Pen Name

choices: Link was as mute as a silent protagonist. Navi has to act as his mouthpiece.
Link was in shock that he finally has a fairy now, albeit a 'curvy' one.
142222222121.content:
