"Ah! You finally woke up! I'm Navi the fairy! The Great Deku Tree asked me to be your partner from now on! Nice to meet you!" Navi greeted as Link woke up, being close to his face enough for one to tell her form from the light she emitted. Navi was expecting Link to respond after being woken up, but Link just stared silently at her. Not even a single word came from him for a while.

"Hey, Link! The Great Deku Tree has summoned you! So let's get going, right now!" Navi said to Link. Link still said nothing in return. Navi was confused by this. The destined hero should be springing into action, not stare into supposed nothingness.

"Uh, Link? Aren't you going to say or do something? You're just staring at me awkwardly," Navi spoke, waiting for a response from Link. Link still stared at the chubby fairy, not answering Navi's question. Navi was starting to get worried about Link, as the matter with the Great Deku Tree is urgent and Link appeared to be doing nothing. However, as it turns out:
142222222121.title: Link just stared silently.

choices: tripped over his feet. A clumsy,and inexperienced Hero of Time it is.
walked determinedly to the entrance. A stubborn and adamant Hero for this.
1422222221211.content: The emerald-clad child blinked owlishly, waving his hand in a short wave. The azure butterball sighed, putting her hands on her thick hips."You...you do undertand me right, right?"Link nodded quickly, the tail-like end of his long cap bobbing wildly. The fairy gave a little grin, emphasized by her cherubic features. She flew quickly to the door, waving the boy through the door. The impatient fatty beckoned him over, eager to munch on various fruits of the forest, and getting tired from actually exerting herself. The young Kokiri stood up, a courageous look alighting in his eyes, and...
1422222221211.title: Silence speaks volumes.

choices: Use Navi as the slingshot ammo
Nah, she'd probably get angry, just use the fruit
14222222212112.content:
From atop the balcony hanging off of the tree that Link called home, all of Kokiri Forest could be seen. Well, that was due to it being rather small for a forest, but whatever. Navi then saw Link's friend Saria running towards them. Once spotting Link, Saria looked up to greet him, "Yahoo! Hi, Link!"

After climbing down his ladder, Link walked over to Saria, whom he greeted with a handshake. Saria went on about how happy she was to see that Link now has a Fairy for a little bit before they parted ways, waving each other goodbye.

Complications arose due to one of Nature's biggest mistakes, but Link was better prepared because of this, having retrieved the Kokiri Sword. Link was eventually able to meet with the Great Deku Tree, who told Link about an evil curse placed upon him. Some monotonous exposition later, and he opens his mouth to give Link entry to the first dungeon he will have to explore: inside the Great Deku Tree himself!


-------------------------------------------------------------------- --------------------------------


It certainly felt odd for them, seeing the Great Deku Tree from the inside. They took in their new surroundings of bark & foliage clinging to the walls. Navi fluttered about, scouting out the area, but Link had his eyes focused on the large spider web below them, noting the hole in the floor covered by it. Navi flew back to Link, "Do you think that's where we have to go?" Link responded with a simple nod.

Link tried to cut the silk with his sword, but it was too thick, which also gave him trouble pulling it back out. Navi tried to force her way through a gap in the spider silk, but the result was the exact same as when she tried to squeeze through the fence earlier; Navi was flung back up, gravity then pulling her back down, causing the web to stretch upon impact. Navi sighed, "At this rate, we won't be getting anywhere..." But Link formed a grin on his face, casting his eyesight upwards, spotting some wood jutting out from the wall much higher up.

Navi followed Link as he climbed some vines up to a higher level. They crossed a wooden path jutting from the wall over to some more vines that led to the highest part of the Great Deku Tree's interior, but these ones wouldn't be so easy, as several highly aggressive Skulltulas were crawling around at the moment, "They will definitely attack you if you get near..." But while Navi was talking, Link had already come with an idea to fix the problem; he picked up a Deku Stick that was lying on the ground and attached a rubber band that was in his pocket around the pronged side, creating a slingshot on the fly. However, a slingshot is of no use on its own.

Link looked around for anything that could be used as slingshot ammo. Eventually, he spotted a cluster of peculiar pitch black fruits growing off some vines on the wall. They were small and perfectly round, so they seemed to be just what he was looking for. As he got up to go grab some, Navi noticed them as well, and flew over to take a closer look. They were incredibly alluring to her for some reason; she wanted to try one, but there was the risk of them being poisonous. While Navi's willpower was trying to stop her from taking such a huge gamble, Link stopped, and thought to himself... Navi was about the size of a rock, so maybe...
14222222212112.title: Getting Down to Business!

choices: Pierce the Skulltula, defeating it.  Navi was proven wrong.
Splatted onto the Skulltula, doing nothing.  Navi was proven right.
142222222121122.content:
Link thought about using Navi as slingshot ammo, but he pushed the idea out of his head. Navi would surely be angry if he slingshots her into an enemy, even if she was about the size of a rock. Link then decided to use the black fruit growing off the vines instead.

Link reached out to pluck one of the black fruits, but Navi suddenly got in between Link and the fruits.

"Wait Link, don't touch those!" The chubby fairy exclaimed, trying to think of an excuse to not use the fruit as slingshot ammo, "Uh... the fruit looks too soft to pierce the Skulltulas' backs. I doubt they would be enough to defeat them."

Link shrugged in response, and he plucked one of the fruits from the vines, making Navi's efforts to keep the fruit alone for her in vain. He was fairly certain Navi wanted to eat the fruit for herself, anyways. Link loaded the fruit onto the makeshift slingshot, pulled back, and aimed at the lowest Skulltula on the vines. Link then released the slingshot, causing the fruit to shoot through the air and:
142222222121122.title: Fruitshot

choices: Navi was suddenly absolutely starving; she needed more of those berries...
Navi's body began to puff up with fat; not a whole lot, but it was noticeable...
1422222221211221.content:
Being something she came up with on the fly, Navi's excuse held no water. Once the Skulltula was struck, it let out a low shriek as it fell to the ground. Link snatched several more berries and fired them upwards at the remaining enemies. Navi attempted to grab one of the berries for herself, but Link suddenly grabbed all of the remaining ones as well and stuffed them in his pocket, along with the slingshot for later use. Before Navi could even react, he ran back to the vines and began to climb them.

Flustered, Navi flew after Link to get her berries back. While she was directly below him though, one of the berries in Link's pocket fell out, causing Navi to gasp, allowing it to drop down directly into her mouth. She began to choke on it momentarily, but thankfully she managed to swallow it quickly. Letting out a sigh of relief, Navi took a moment to breath so her heart rate could slow down. Although, once she stopped and thought about it, she felt something odd in her gut, presumably the berry she just consumed. Her belly began to rumble loudly...
1422222221211221.title: Choking Hazard

choices: Suddenly spotted berries growing on another vine, to her relief.
Dove right into Link's pocket for the berries.
14222222212112211.content:
Navi caressed her soft tummy, the source where the rumbling came from and where the swallowed berry sat. As Navi held onto her belly, she felt her abdomen getting less and less distended. Navi also saw that her belly is becoming less rounded, meaning that her stomach is digesting the berry, although faster than usual. She wondered if that was the effect of the berry or the higher metabolism of tiny creatures such as herself. Her pondering ended abruptly when she felt the walls of her stomach grind against each other; she digested the berry so quickly that she was already starving.

Oh, I just had that berry! I shouldn't be that hungry right now! Navi thought to herself, Stay strong, Navi. You can wait until Link fixes the Great Deku Tree's curse. Just give him hints and help him focus on the monsters as usual.

Navi thought she could make it through the inside of the Great Deku Tree without any food, but she soon realized it would take longer than she thought. Link insisted to check every room in the base once he found the dungeon map, and through his room-searching he found an item-tracking compass and a slightly better Fairy Slingshot (which made his makeshift slingshot pointless) as well as a bunch of Deku Seeds as ammo. Navi was hoping that Link would throw away the berries in favor of the Deku Seeds since they appeared to be tougher and far more numerous than the berries, but that thought didn't come across Link's mind as he kept both the berries and the seeds, to Navi's dismay.

Navi's hunger was reaching its breaking point, and Link barely went through his first major obstacle. The Skulltula web covering the giant pit in the main room was supposed to be broken by dropping down onto the middle from the highest point, yet every time Link dived into the web from the highest platform, he was off by a few feet, causing the web to trampoline him back to the floor. Navi's patience was wearing thin, and her hunger feels like it was killing her. When Link failed to break through the web again, Navi finally snapped, her hunger for the berries overtook her thoughts, and she:
14222222212112211.title: Berry-Induced Hunger

choices: Take a moment to examine Navi
There's no time; follow Link
142222222121122111.content:
After reaching the top of the Great Deku Tree yet again, Navi noticed something was different compared to every other time. She had almost missed it, only just barely catching it out of the corner of her eye, but she was thankful that she did. On the opposite side was another vine covered in the same black berries she had been craving for. While Link continued to attempt breaking through the webbing down below, Navi darted for the fruits and began to devour as many as she could, indulging herself in the heavenly juicy flavor.

Navi eventually heard a snapping noise come from below her, and realized that Link must have finally succeeded in breaking the web. She attempted to lift herself up to go follow him down the hole, but was having slightly a harder time then usual. Navi blushed upon noticing that the reason for this was that she had plumped up considerably from those berries she had just consumed. But she didn't have time to focus on that, she was told to stay by Link's side. After a few seconds of struggling, Navi finally managed to get up, but was distracted again upon seeing how much it caused her belly to slosh about; it was absolutely hypnotizing...
142222222121122111.title: Suddenly spotted berries growing on another vin...

choices: Doesn't notice Navi's gained weight
Feels that something was off about Navi
1422222221211221111.content:
Navi couldn't help but to look at how much she had gained, considering that the wobbling of her body fat was hard to ignore. She reluctantly looked down and was stunned at what she saw. She had considerably grown from her plump figure, her gaining a couple of units to her BMI. Her belly had grown noticably rounder and is beginning to show some sag and love handles. Her breasts appeared fuller, gaining a few cup sizes. Her thickened thighs rubbed against each other more often, and her posterior was more pronounced. To say Navi was embarrassed was an underststement.

Oh no, I can't believe I let myself go this much! I can't let Link see me like this! Navi thought to herself, Wait, Link! I'm supposed to guide him through the Great Deku Tree!

Navi then flew down the pit, noticing she is going down faster than usual, probably because of her added weight going against her resistance to gravity. As soon as she went down to the bottom room, she halted her downward momentum, gaining control of her flight back as soon as she touched the surface of the water. Navi then flew above the water, looking around to see where Link was. She then spotted Link carrying a burning stick across the water and swinging it at a large cobweb, burning it down. Navi then flew up to Link, making sure she keeps a good enough distance so that Link doesn't notice her widened figure.

"Hey! Link! I finally caught up to you!" Navi shouted, "Looks like you found a way to get to the next room!"

Link:
1422222221211221111.title: Take a moment to examine Navi

choices: Time for Gohma!
14222222212112211111.content:
Hearing Navi calling for him, Link turned to her, and nodded to confirm the assertion she had made, not that it was necessary. Behind the burning cobweb was revealed to be a door that would lead them even deeper into the Great Deku Tree. They passed through and continued to search for the source of the curse that was placed on the Great Deku Tree. Eventually, Link opened another door, only to be met with the room where they started. Unfortunately, it turned out that the path they were following was actually just leading them in one big circle.

Navi let out a massive sigh, "Oh come on... Now what?" She halted her wings and dropped down onto a thick vine, causing it to droop from her weight, "Flying is way too tiring to keep going like this any longer... I'm going to rest over here for now, if that's alright with you." There were no objections from Link, not that she was expecting any at this point, so Navi laid back and began to rub her large belly. It had ballooned an incredible amount in such a short time frame, and it would certainly grow even more if she kept eating at the same rate as earlier.

While she was relaxing, Navi was starting to feel tired from all the moving around she had done. She stretched out her arms and yawned, her mouth wide open, allowing for a repeat of last time. Suddenly, another berry like the ones from earlier dropped down into her mouth from seemingly out of nowhere. Navi's eyes shot open, after swallowing the tasty fruit of course, and looked up to find the cause, that being a smaller vine she somehow hadn't noticed. It was growing even more of the small juicy berries than the last one, and the sight of so many was causing Navi's mouth to water.

Berries continuously dropped down from the vine above into Navi's mouth at a consistent rate, giving her plenty of time to chew and swallow each one. While she had learned that they were incredibly fattening, they were too delicious to pass up. Besides, they probably wouldn't be coming back to Kokiri Forest anytime soon, so she might as well enjoy them while she has the opportunity, right? As to be expected, Navi's body grew slightly with each berry she consumed, with her belly as the most prominent example, slowly beginning to spread over her thighs.

Events seemed to keep recurring, as Navi once again heard a snapping sound just like that of when Link broke through the giant cobweb before. Upon looking up again, she noticed that he indeed found another cobweb to break through, and did just that, falling down even further into the depths of the Great Deku Tree. Navi followed him down the hole once more, this time ending up in a much more straightforward room; all that was there was a single door. Navi gulped, having a bad feeling about what would be on the other side. Link didn't concern himself with that though, and entered regardless, giving Navi no choice but to follow him in.
14222222212112211111.title: Going 'Round, Growing Round

choices: Kept the Z-Target up, and Gohma's eye was shot!
Was suddenly struggling to hold up, causing the shot to miss by a few inches.
142222222121122111111.content:
Link and Navi went into the room where 'Queen Gohma' is supposed to dwell according to one of the Deku Scrubs Link defeated. The spaceous room was dark and musty from the decaying roots of the Great Deku Tree, most certainly caused by the curse from this Gohma. As Link and Navi entered the room, they suddenly heard something shut behind them! They turned around to see that the entrance was now sealed shut, trapping the green-clad hero and the plumped-up fairy inside.

"Uwah! We're stuck inside!" Navi shrieked in panic. Link, however, remained adamant and looked around to find where the Gohma was. Link looked up at the ceiling, only to be greeted by a lone yellow eye staring back at him. The eye dropped from the ceiling in front of Link and Navi, surprising them and giving them a closer look at the one-eyed being. The creature resembled a gigantic four-or-five-legged spider, except covered with armor plating and obviously having a single giant yellow eye on its abdomen.

Parasitic Armored Arachnid

GOHMA

Link and Navi finally found Queen Gohma, the source of the curse that was draining the Great Deku Tree. Link was ready to defeat the creature, while Navi was a bit cautious yet still determined to help Link. Queen Gohma crawled up to the ceiling of the room, spawning Gohma larva to attack Link. Link, in return, slashed away the larva.

"It's one of the parasitic monsters inside the Deku Tree! Its eye is vulnerable when it's red!" Navi instinctively spoke out, not knowing where this information come from or why she blurred that out. Link, however, got an idea. He pulled out the Fairy Slingshot, and motioned to Navi to go near Queen Gohma's eye. Navi reluctantly obliged, feeling a bit nervous to go up close to the monstrous bug, but she knows that she has to perform some well-deserved Z-Targeting for Link. Apparently, one of the many magical functions of a fairy is to use their magic to help their user greatly focus on an opponent, not only improving the user's dodging and swordfighting, but also making projectiles impossible to miss their focused target.

Navi flew her fat body up to the ceiling near Queen Gohma's eyeball. Navi suddenly emitted a yellow glow, and four yellow triangles circled Gohma's eye, indicating the Z-Target was established. Navi was a bit nervous being near the boss arachnid, as the distorted pupil of Gohma's eye was ominously following Navi. The pressure, along with Navi's body weight, was beginning to disorient Navi with keeping up the Z-Target, but Navi soon saw Gohma's eye turn red.

"Link! Her eye is red! You can shoot her now!" Navi shouted at Link. Link then pulled back his loaded slingshot towards Gohma's red eye and released, sending the projectile flying at high speed.

Navi:
142222222121122111111.title: Parasitic Armored Arachnid

choices: They both start their trek back out to give the good news
Suddenly, a large heart shaped gem shows up where Gohma's corpse was
1422222221211221111112.content:
Although Navi needed to keep herself together right now more than ever, she was so uneasy that her abilities weren't stable. Because of this, Link's shot ended up hitting Navi instead, sending her plummeting to the ground below. Gohma then took the opportunity to lunge at the distracted Link, gripping him with it sharp claws, causing him quite a bit of pain. Despite this though, Link withdrew his sword and drove it into the arachnid's single eye, causing it to screech in pain, as well as the muscles in its claws releasing Link. Navi was left speechless at how calm and brave Link was despite how much danger and pain he was in... She realized she couldn't let some spider have its way with her!

From then on, the tables had turned, and Navi's abilities no longer failed them at any point during the battle. Gohma fled to the ceiling once more, but Navi chased after it, determined to not make the same mistake twice. She fluttered around Gohma's eye and waited for it to turn red before giving the signal. Link once again fired a seed into Gohma's eye, but this time striking directly thanks to Navi managing to stay calm this time. Gohma fell to the ground, and Link ran towards the giant parasite to deliver the finishing blow. Jumping up to where the eye was, he unsheathed his sword once more, gruesomely stabbing his sword deep inside the eye cavity, causing Gohma to wail out in pain once last time.

After a few moments, Gohma's body suddenly began to turn pitch black. Link jumped down from the insect corpse before it suddenly burned away into ashes in a display of blue flames. That had to have been the source of the curse on the Great Deku Tree so mission accomplished! Link and Navi both turned to each with a look of satisfaction on their faces!
1422222221211221111112.title: This doesn't bode well...

choices: He was greeted by Saria.
Skip to when Link and Navi meet the Great Deku Tree, after Navi got sidetracked.
142222222122.content:
"Uh, who are you?" Link groggily asked, the effect of being woken up suddenly being apparent in his tone of voice.

"Oh, I forgot to introduce myself!" Navi exclaimed as she fluttered wildly in front of Link's face, "I'm Navi the fairy! The Great Deku Tree asked me to be your partner from now on! Nice to meet you, Link!"

"Navi, huh? And you know my name?" Link asked the fairy. "Are you supposed to be my fairy? You look a bit big for a fairy," Link skeptically noted as he observed that Navi looked pudgier than most fairies. Although fairies emit light that obscure their forms, Navi was close enough to Link for him to tell what she looked like, and Link could see that Navi had a noticeably chubby belly.

"H-hey! I-it's not nice to tell a lady about her weight!" Navi exclaimed at Link, nervously blushing from Link's observation on her size, "B-besides, it's not my fault that I tend to eat more than most fairies!"

"Right. So you said something about the Great Deku Tree wanting to see me?" Link asked, changing the subject from Navi's weight to more important matters.

"Oh, right! The Great Deku Tree has summoned you for something really important! So let's get going, right now!" Navi declared, motioning Link to go out the exit of his treehouse by repeatedly flying into his back.

As Link exited his home:
142222222122.title: Link asked who she is.

choices: Yes!
Uh, back to specific girls, since we're out of games!
1422222222.content:
Yes, folks, it's finally out, and like any other Zelda game, it comes with its own variety of new girls to fatten up.

So how about it?
1422222222.title: New game choice: Skyward Sword!

142222222211.title: Now, the real question.....

choices: A tree with fruit on it.
A small black creature with a bush on its back.
1422222222111.content:
Zelda awoke with a start.
The last thing she remembered was flying alongside Link. He and his Loftwing had just won the Wing Ceremony, despite numerous attempts at making sure he couldn't win by Groose and his cronies. Then there was that hurricane, which had caused her fall off her Loftwing...
Looking around, Zelda's eyes widened.

She was on the Ground!

Standing up and dusting off her pink dress, she took in her surroundings. There was a large structure behind her, and a large pit in front of her. Taking a few cautious steps, she peered into it. It had a long path leading to the bottom, where a pillar of some sort was lodged into the ground. It had a faint glow surrounding it. Zelda felt a dark feeling weigh on her, causing her to feel very uneasy.

"That's not your battle", a voice behind her said, causing Zelda to jump. "That is another's battle".
Turning, Zelda saw an ancient woman looking at her. She had a spiral braid swinging from side to side, and a bangle around her wrist.
"B-Battle? What do you mean? Who... Where..?" Zelda stuttered. She had so many questions to ask...
"You and another have roles to play. However, you arrived early. Too early... The forces of Darkness are moving much faster than I thought. There is only enough time to explain your role," the woman explained, walking back into the temple. Zelda quickly followed.

"You mentioned a role?" Zelda asked as the woman sat down. She sat opposite her. She didn't particularly like the cold stone floor, but she had no alternative.
"I cannot explain much," the woman said. "In this land, there are two springs, blessed by an ancient goddess. In order to prepare for your role, you must bathe in them. They will purify your body and make it ready".
"Ready for what?" Zelda inquired. This whole ordeal was really messing with her...
"I cannot divulge any more information. Knowledge of your destiny could attract the one who summoned you here. Hopefully, now that you are here, your knight won't be too far behind," the woman explained. "I can give you these, though".
She produced a white dress, matching white heels and two bangles. She handed them to Zelda, who hesitated.
"I know this may seem like an awful lot to take in, but you must stay strong. The fate of both the Sky and the Ground depend on both you, and your knight," the woman said, laying a reassuring hand on Zelda's shoulder. She nodded.

After putting on her new dress, Zelda was shown to a door.
"Follow this path. It will lead you to the first spring. And beware, for these woods hold enemies. Should you lose your way, search for the Kiwi Elder. He will help," the woman explained.
Nodding, Zelda opened the door. After a minute, she came to a small cliff with a clearing. She saw some sort of green... things that were battling a giant rock with a backpack. Now completely confused, Zelda jumped down the cliff and sprinted past the battle. Neither side noticed her. She ran through a giant gate and into a forest, where she finally stopped. Breathing heavily, she straightened up. She was still on a path, but a new problem arose...
"I'm... hungry?" She asked herself, hearing her stomach rumble. It made sense. She had skipped breakfast after hearing that Links Loftwing had gone missing.

Looking around, Zelda saw...
1422222222111.title: Arrival on the Ground

choices: She awakens during the night.
Zelda gets a goodnights sleep.
14222222221111.content:
Spying a tree with fruit hanging from its branches, Zelda hurried towards it. She didn't recognise the fruit, as Skyloft only had those weird Stamina things that made you feel you could run a marathon... for about 5 seconds. Then you immediately crashed and became tired.
"If I could only reach!" Zelda grunted, as she jumped. She couldn't even reach the lower branches. Kicking her heels off, she planted her feet on the tree. She slowly started climbing. She wasn't as experienced with climbing as the rest of her class was, but even she could climb a tree.

Reaching one of the lower branches, she gently eased her weight onto a rather thick branch. It creaked slightly, but held her. Leaning back against the trunk, Zelda reached up and plucked a fruit from above her head.
It was a bright red colour, and looked like a Stamina Fruit. Taking a cautious bite, Zelda chewed for a few seconds before swallowing.
"Oh my Goddess!" She exclaimed. "It's delicious!"
Taking a bigger bite, Zelda munched through it. Looking up, she grabbed a couple. She couldn't describe the taste, but she needed more! Plus, it wasn't a huge meal, so she would need a couple to fill her up.

Finishing off a couple more, Zelda shifted her weight, causing the branch to creak.
"Looks like it's getting dark..." She mumbled. "I should bed down for the night".
Deciding to stay in the tree, she got up. Holding onto the trunk, Zelda climbed up a bit further. Spotting a rather large branch that she could safely lie on, she climbed up to it. Compared to her bed up on Skyloft, it wasn't super comfortable... But it was acceptable.
Lying back, Zelda sighed. She hadn't imagined her day going like this...
Looking over, she spotted another branch with the new fruit growing on it. A couple more wouldn't hurt her.

Grabbing the branch, Zelda snapped it off the trunk. It had a fair amount of fruit attached to it. Taking a couple off, she balanced the branch on her legs.
"Mmm... So good!"
What Zelda didn't realise was the difference between food from the Sky and the food from the Ground. Having been raised on food solely from the Sky, like Pumpkins from that one island, and whatever the Cook rustled up. However, food from the ground was much different, made for the creatures that lived down there. In the case of the woods, it was directed towards the Kiwis, a race of small penguin like creatures that, despite being quite small, were also quite heavy.

As Zelda munched through the entire branch, her body was slowly digesting the fruit, and adding weight to her slender form. Her trim belly formed a small layer of pudge. Her breasts became fuller and softer. Her ass became rounder, causing her panties to tighten ever so slightly.
Under her increased weight, her sturdy branch let out a quiet creak, causing Zelda to freeze.
"Don't break..." She whispered fearfully. "Please, don't break..."
After a few more quiet creaks, it stopped, allowing Zelda to breathe easily. She leaned back and looked at the branch on her knees. It still had a fair amount of fruit attached to it. However, Zelda now had a second problem...

"I need to sleep..." She said, letting out a yawn. "That can be breakfast..."
Before closing her eyes, Zelda saw the sun set, light streaming through the leaves. She had never seen anything like it on Skyloft...
14222222221111.title: Different areas, different food

choices: Zelda finds somewhere to sleep.
She encounters something.
142222222211111.content:
Zelda awoke to a grumble. She initially thought it was her stomach, but a second grumble sounded. She slowly peered down the tree, and stifled a scream.
She saw three red creatures. Two were wielding crude swords, and the third had a makeshift bow. They all wore shorts made from some animal pelt, although the third had a faded blue bandana.
She quickly returned to her sitting position.
"Don't look up..." She whispered. While she could use a sword, as per part of the Knight Academy's training program, she wasn't skilled with it. She always had issues cutting through the logs in the training hall, something Link was always quick to help her with...

"Oh, Link... If only you were here..."
Unfortunately, Link didn't appear, leaving Zelda stuck up a tree with three... Goblins? She didn't know what they were. Looking around, the only things she saw were branches and fruit.
"Hmm, maybe they're hungry?" Zelda wondered, reaching out and snapping another branch off the tree. However, the snap alerted the things to her presence.
All three looked up and spotted her. It didn't help that she was wearing all white at night and in a tree. They started shouting in some sort of foreign language. However, they did nothing to get Zelda down.
Maybe they aren't hostile? Zelda though. But, that woman said there's enemies in this forest...
A rock hitting into the tree inches from her head broke Zelda away from her thoughts. She helped and leaned over, trying to hide herself. A second rock told her that it wasn't working.

"Okay, stop!" She pleaded. "I'll come down!"
They stopped.
Placing her foot on a branch, she froze when it groaned under her increased weight. She waited a moment before resuming her descent.
As she made her way down, a plan started forming in her head. If she could reason with the creatures, she might be able to get one of their swords. Sure, she wasn't very good with it, but a surprise attack might tip the scales in her favour.
As she stood on a rather flimsy branch, her luck with sturdy branches ran out. It snapped.
"No!" She yelped as she fell to the ground. She landed on her softer backside, but it still hurt. She heard the creatures snicker at her.

Now! She thought.
Jumping to her feet, which caused her enlarged breasts to bounce slightly, she reached forward and grabbed one of their swords. The creature, surprised by the agility of the creature before her, let go of the blade.
Swinging it his head, Zelda hit her mark. He flew off and bit the ground, hard. She didn't have time to celebrate, as the other two, initially stunned, were now moving to get her. The other creature with a sword moved towards her, while the one with a bow pulled out a horn.
Zelda clumsily ducked under the creatures swing and took out the horn user. She spun and finished off the final creature. Dropping the sword, she yelped as all three simultaneously burst into smoke.

"I guess... that's how they die?" Zelda said, collapsing onto her round rump. She didn't notice her softer belly, or the slight comfort her backside provided on the grassy ground. Regaining her breath, she stood up.
"I need someplace safer to sleep," Zelda said to herself. Before she headed deeper into the woods, she grabbed the branch she had dropped. It had a good amount of food field her to snack on while she looked for a better sleeping spot.
She headed onwards, munching on a fruit. She didn't notice her thighs brushing against one another, or her gradually tightening dress.
142222222211111.title: A rude awakening

choices: Zelda continues her quest.
Zelda has some breakfast.
1422222222111111.content:
Zelda arrived at a clearing. She had just finished eating all of the fruit on her branch. Rubbing her forming potbelly, she let out a contented sigh.
"Ahhh... Who knew food on the ground would be so good!" She exclaimed happily. However, a yawn reminded Zelda of her current goal.
"Somewhere to sleep... Somewhere I won't be accosted by weird creatures".
Looking around the clearing, she saw a couple of potential sleeping areas.

To her left, there was a rather tall tree that looked easy to climb. But after the last tree, Zelda wasn't feeling it. She hated the fact that she was dressed in a bright white that made her stand out against everything. Even those monsters, who didn't look too smart, spotted her!
Shaking her head, she turned her attention to a suspicious pile of rocks. They were piled up against a rock wall, and much like her dress, looked out of place. Walking up to them, she gently pulled one free. The wall crumbled slightly. Peeking into the hole, she saw a floating heart, with golden lines criss-crossing across its surface.
"What a weird place..." She mumbled, replacing the rock.
Looking to her right, there was a huge tree that had snapped in half. She saw a small opening cut into the side of it. She might be able to fit inside, if she could get up there.

Deciding on the small hole, she walked to her right. She briefly noted her thighs rubbing against each other as she walked, but forgot all about it when a couple of Keese divebombed her.
"No! Go away!" She yelled, covering her head and swatting madly. On night patrols in Skyloft, Keese and Chuchus were the only real danger. She could handle the Chuchus, but Keese? She hated the things!
She got lucky with one of her wild swings. Her hand collided with one of the Keese, which caused it to spiral to the ground. It didn't burst into smoke, much to Zeldas dismay. Instead, it weakly fluttered its wings.
Taking a chance, Zelda sprinted ahead. Her body jiggled as she did, her breasts bouncing up and down.

After sprinting up a hill and past a fancy gate with some sort of symbol on it, Zelda stopped. She planted her soft ass on a tree stump and breathed heavily.
"What's wrong... with me..?" She huffed, holding her chest. "I'm... fitter than this!"
After catching her breath, Zelda looked around. She spotted a tree with fruit growing on it, causing her to smile. She had acquired a taste for the fruit and wouldn't mind some more.
Snapping a couple of branches off the tree, Zelda ate a couple before heading down a hill. She was quickly stopped by a large gap with a single vine hanging down.
"Guess there's no other way," Zelda said before leaping and grabbing the vine. It creaked loudly, causing Zelda to worry. She swung back and forth for a few seconds before letting go and landing across the gap. She stumbled and fell onto her front. Her breasts squished against the ground.

Jumping to her feet, she brushed dirt off her dress. The massive tree was in front of her now. It had a small opening, just big enough for her. Lying on her front, Zelda crawled forward. She just about fit. Her rounder backside and softer hips brushed against the sides of the tiny tunnel.
Crawling through to the other side, Zelda stood up and brushed dirt of her dress again. The tree was completely hollow, and had a makeshift roof in the form of leaves over the opening at the top. Strangely, there was a bed of leaves on the ground, along with a campfire that was still smoking...
"Someone else must be here!" She exclaimed hopefully. "Maybe they're friendly?"
A simultaneous yawn and rumble of her stomach broke Zelda out of her thoughts. Sitting down on the bed of leaves, she ate some fruit. Her body became a little heavier. Her breasts began to feel tight within her bra, while her belly began to show against her dress. Her hips and ass raised the hem of her dress slightly. A second chin began to form.

After finishing her small snack, Zelda lay back. She was still having trouble actually believing that this was happening to her. Sure, she had always wanted to go to the ground, but not like this! She had always imagined coming down her with her class from the Academy, with Groose, and with Link...
"I know Link... He'll find me! He's always there for me!" Zelda mumbled to herself before drifting off...

-Meanwhile, in Skyloft-

"So, you're the one the legend spoke of".
The Headmaster of the Knight Academy and Zelda's father, Gaepora, inspected the boy in front of him. In his right hand, he held a short sword with a green hilt. Behind him floated some sport of spirit, clad in a blue dress.
"That sword you hold... The Goddess Blade... You are meant for great things, Link," Gaepora said, looking at the Goddess Blade. "The one meant to descend to the surface, and reunite the Sky and the Land!"

Zelda awoke with a start. Birds were chirping in the leaves above her. Normally, she awoke to either a loud knock on her door, or her Loftwing being noisy outside her window. Already, she preferred the birds.
"I should get going," Zelda said, stretching. Her stomach rumbled. "Or maybe I should eat?"
1422222222111111.title: Somewhere to rest your head, and eat your food

14222222221212.title: "What is this you call 'food', Master?"

choices: "Yes, Master Link." Fi retreated back into the blade to continue their adventure
"Master Link, I believe it would be wise to rest for a bit...more"
142222222212121.content:
A strong wind blew past Link as he traveled through the skies on his Loftwing. Having just recently met and fought against the Demon Lord Ghirahim in Skyview Temple, Link felt like going back to Skyloft to relax for a while before heading back down the surface. It was nice to be back up in the sky, his home, where Link had grown up. His first time down below the clouds was certainly breathtaking, he and everyone else had wondered what might lie beyond them. He had been able to go down to the surface to experience things no one from his home had seen, at least given what their records stated. He just wished it could've been with Zelda, unfortunately that was the whole reason he had even ventured down to the surface in the first place, to find her.

"Master." Fi spoke as she came out from Link's Sword,
"Hmm?" Link grunted as he turned his head toward the spirit flying next to him and his Loftwing.
"I would recommend we return back to the surface, With that Demon Ghirahim searching after Zelda, I believe it is imperative that you go back to continue searching for her before he finds her." Fi's voice carried a tone urgency, or at least it felt like it to Link.
"I know about that horrid Demon Fi, but...I need to relax for a bit after going through all of that. I'm going back to Skyloft to get some food.
"My calculations show that your health is at optimal levels for comba-"
"Its not about my health Fi, this is about energy, I'm a little tired and getting to relax and eat would be good, especially since I haven't eaten all day. Having a full stomach is good for going on an adventure like this, and that means making sure to keep my hunger in check." Link said to explain himself. Fi paused, still not fully understanding, but resumed herself back into her master's sword.
'There is much I still need to analyze about the master and his people...' Fi thought to herself as the two flew through the air.

Getting off of his Crimson Loftwing, the young man made his way into the town's bustling Marketplace. Known for its wide array of assortments one could buy and store there. The many residents of Skyloft that worked there had become especially familiar with Link, given his recent travelings to the surface and needing their wares far more than most Skyloftians, some of which had familiarized themselves with him seemingly more than others.
After making an order to Piper, and reminding her multiple times to actually finish it, Link sat down to enjoy a bowl of soup along with some baked bread. The rich aroma, the warmth he could feel rising from the meal, as he brought the spoon to his lips, the familiar chime of Fi rang out, bringing herself out from his sword, the blue spirit guide floated beside her master. It also seemed the general populace of the Market had yet to fully adjust to the blue floating girl popping out from Link's sword at a moment's notice, garnering a few gasps in response.

"Ohh Fi, what is it?" Link inquired as he slurped from the spoon in a manner Zelda would chastise him for.. Link had learned in the short time he had been accompanied by this spirit from the Goddess Hylia that Fi generally didn't interact much if it did not regard to her stated purpose.
Fi took a moment to respond, as if she were contemplating her answer.
"Master, I believe I feel the sensation your people call "curiosity". you said that food was required for you even when your health was not low. I believe it would good to experience food for myself. specifically over this collection of vegetables, liquid collected from various meat, and the meat itself you have. This "soup" as it is called. With how my creator formed me, I do not require nourishment to maintain my level of energy like you, however...." Fi looked away, taking a second to look down at Link's meal. "...I am curious to how your soup tastes."
Link smiled upon hearing this. "Heh, so you want try it out then?" he was a little taken back by Fi's motion to want to experience food. She hadn't shown much interest in anything that wasn't Zelda or something pertaining to their quest when he had found the Kikwis via her dousing ability.
"Yes, my analysis shows that you and others have found it to be "delicious", I...want to experience it."

Link pushed his bowl over towards his guide. Fi reached out with her limbs and "grabbed the bowl". Link for a moment tried to see if there were any arms under those elegant cape flaps of hers, he had wondered if the girl even had arms, he could never really tell. Regardless, Fi continued bringing up the bowl to her lips and gracefully let it enter her mouth to taste. A moment passed, Fi then took a few more sips and swallowed. It was then that the spirit girl had begun to realize what Link meant by filling one's self with nourishment even if you were not in critical health. The taste of the broth, the texture and taste of the contents, the feel of it all sliding down her throat into her body. It was beyond any kind of data she currently had. One might say it was delightful. She briefly exhaled as she continued to sip a few more times, taking in a reasonable amount.

"Master, having now analyzed this soup, My calculations show that its temperature is 90°C, There is an 85% probability of its quality being improved if the temperature is increased by six degrees." Fi said as she sipped more from the bowl, almost vigorously doing so.
"Is that so? Well then...Oy, Piper, another two bowls, make both of em hotter!" Link hollered out over to the cook.
Coming right up Link!...Hmm maybe a bit more pepper this time." the woman began to fervently stir in the next batches of soup.
Fi continued to sip from the bowl, tipping it up as more and more entered her mouth and less and less remained in the bowl.
"There is a 0% probability of any soup remaining in this bowl Master." Fi said as she placed the now empty bowl on the table.
"Yeah...I guess you really enjoyed it huh?" Link said with a smirk, too entertained by Fi's actions to care about having his 1st meal basically hi jacked by her. Propping his head up with a hand, he looked on with content.
"Yes, I found it to be rather delectable."
"Anything else?" the young man asked, wanting to see if Fi had any more to speak of about the soup. She paused, taking in her master's question.
"I would recommend more for a better analysis and more data on what you call "hunger"." Link let out a small chuckle at Fi's comment, it seemed her curiosity over food was bringing the girl out of her shell so to speak.


"Here's your soup, both extra-hot!" Piper cheered as she set down the bowls, making sure to carefully lie them down due to the increased heat.
To the surprise of Link and everyone else who was looking their way, Fi immediately began to down her bowl at a similar speed as she had with the first one, perhaps more so.
"H-hey Fi, slow down it's hot!" shocked by Fi's sudden action, he worried the hotter soup would cause possible trouble.
Ignoring her master's comment for a brief second, she set the bowl down after having swallowed about a fourth of its contents. Gulping down remnants in her mouth before responding.
"I am not as affected by heat as your people are, however this soup's added heat as improved its quality. The texture of the vegetables and meat together, alongside the proper heat make it quite enjoyable. As is proper by your social customs I thank you for this meal." Fi said bowing to Piper as a bit of soup dribbled from her lips.
"Ohh well you're welcome, Miss Fi was it? Uhh let me get that for you." Piper withdrew a cloth to wipe Fi's lips of the broth.
"I would recommend you consume your soup Master Link, before its quality diminishes, unless you would like to give it to me for further analysis and data..." Fi's eyes briefly shimmered with desire for more, but no one seemed to have noticed.
"I'll enjoy it for myself Fi, Thank you Piper." Link said as he went on to bite into the rest of his bread, savoring the soft fluffiness of the baked loaf.
"Ahaha no problem Link, as long as I have ingredients and you've got rupees I'll gladly serve you two as much soup as you want!" Piper beamed with joy as she walked back to her station. Fi quickly went back to finish her bowl, not wanting it lower in heat by any significant amount. Finishing up her bowl, she placed it down and for the faintest amount of time, felt a rush of air surge up through her body up into her mouth, it escaped as a faint belch that went unnoticed by Link ,and Fi herself paid it no attention, finding it unnecessary to put any focus on it.


As she floated there watching her master finish off his own bowl of the soup that had been prepared for them, Fi felt something she herself could not properly designate, something inside her being yearned for more, she wasn't fully conscious of it, but that soup was the beginning of a true hunger inside the spirit. Neither she nor Link knew it at the time, but from that moment on Skyloft, nay the world would fall into a most unexpected turn of events.
"Mmrghaahh! Link huffed as he finished off the last of his meal. Getting up he called out to Fi.
"Alright I'm done, let's go Fi. We should check up on everyone around Skyloft before heading out again." Fi turned to her master, staring at him in her stoic manner before responding...
142222222212121.title: Fi's Curiosity of Food and Hunger

choices: Once morning came, it was finally time to fly north! Red light aglow...
Since Link was up all night, he didn't have the energy. It'd have to wait.
Link realized he didn't properly prepare yet, so he should go do that first.
1422222222121211.content:
Ruby Tablet in hand, Link walked up the stairway towards the Statue of the Goddess. Once he put this in its place, he would be one step closer to finding Zelda. He stopped for a moment and looked up at the statue, remembering how she had pushed off from the top of it after he had won during the Wing Ceremony. Although she could have potentially caused him harm in the process, Link still looked back on this moment fondly, a warm smile forming on his face. He then looked back down at the entrance that led inside the statue.

Inside the Statue of the Goddess was the pedestal where the Goddess Sword that Fi resides in sits. Behind it though was a fraction of a map made out of stone, and in Link's hand, he held another piece of that map, and once he fit it together with the first piece, it would trigger a pathway to open up to where the map is leading him. He took his time fitting the Ruby Tablet into place carefully, making sure it wouldn't chip or crack, just in-case that would cause it to break. If that were to happen, Link would likely 'crack' as well. Thankfully though, no such disaster happened.

Red light suddenly flew north, out from the Statue, parting a portion of clouds. Fi then came out of the Goddess Sword to relay this information to Link, "Master, I have confirmed the location of a second opening in the cloud barrier. It is located in the skies to the northeast. This opening will allow you to access a new area on the surface. I suggest you fly there as soon as you make the necessary preparations. I also now know that it would be wise to bring a plentiful amount of 'food' in order to minimize the chances of exhaustion." Link nodded, and began to head out to stock up on supplies for the next leg of his journey.

While on his way back to the bazaar, Link overheard a woman calling out for someone, "Kukiel! Kukiel! Where could that child have gone?!" Looking towards the source of the voice, he recognized Wyrna and walked over to her, "Oh, Kukiel... Where did you go? What will I do if she's been... kidnapped?!" Link gasped without intending to, being caught off-guard by the sudden mention of a potential kidnapping. Wyrna heard this, and turned around, thankful to see him, "Oh! Link! What perfect timing! You haven't seen my Kukiel have you?"

Since he had been exploring the surface for quite awhile, Link had no way of knowing where Kukiel could have gone during that time, "Nope... I was pre-occupied with something for the past few hours, so I had no way of knowing if she was out and about..."

Wyrna's heart began to sink by the looks of things, as she hung her head down low, clutching her chest in her hands, "I... I see..." She then looked back up with desperation in her eyes, "Please, Link, won't you help me look for her? I've been looking everywhere, but I can't find her!"

Of course after Wyrna poured her heart out, begging for help to find her missing daughter, Link would have to be heartless to turn her down, "You got it. I'll be sure to check every possible part of Skyloft." He then gave her a reassuring nod, just to show that he was confident that his search would be successful, hoping that would ease Wyrna's worrying.



-------------------------------------------------------------------- --------------------------------



Daylight had faded before Link even noticed. He spent the entire day searching for Kukiel, yet he hadn't been able to find her despite checking every square inch of Skyloft. Utterly confused, he sat down against the tree in the graveyard and began to ponder what was going on, "This doesn't make any sense... I checked everywhere. She doesn't have a Loftwing yet because she's too young, so she couldn't have just left..." Link glanced around yet again, absolutely desperate. Eventually though, he was forced to let out a sigh of defeat.

Fi heard that Link was distraught, and came out from the Goddess Sword to hopefully provide assistance, "Master, if are having trouble finding the lost child, perhaps I could re-calibrate the dowsing feature to help search for her." Upon hearing this, Link immediately stood up and looked up at her, speechless, his left eye beginning to twitch. After a few moments of silence, Fi spoke up once again, "If you would prefer I not intervene for the time being, then I shall leave you be, Master."

Link then snapped back into reality and finally responded, "N-No, please help if you can! In fact, I would have preferred it if you told me this earlier..." He then let out an exasperated sigh... Once Fi had finished configuring the dowsing functionality, Link withdrew the Goddess Sword from his sheath to begin using its magic to scan. To his surprise though, it immediately got a heavy reaction from a nearby gravestone, "Wha...?"

Fi chimed in once more, "Odd... It seems the child was here recently, and left traces from her hands on this grave. None of the other graves have been touched either. According to my calculations, there is 70% chance that this is connected to her disappearance in some way." As she finished speaking though, she oddly felt some sort of unfamiliar pressure building up inside of herself...

Confused, Link placed his hands on the grave, but gasped when he suddenly felt it shifting backwards. Once it stopped, he then turned when he heard what he used to assume was an old shed opening on its own. Link stood there unsure how to even react. He couldn't just stay there forever though, and eventually, albeit reluctantly, stepped inside. At first, it seemed to be entirely empty, but upon taking another step, Link had almost tripped over the edge of a hole in the floor that led down to another platform; it was one surprise after another... Thankfully there was a ladder to get back up, so Link used it climb down and investigate even further.

As Link was carefully crossing the narrow path made up of wooden planks, the silence was suddenly broken, "EEEEEEEEEEEK!" Throwing caution to the wind, Link dashed across the rest of the planks, all of them eerily creaking underneath him. At the end of the path was an old wooden door. This rabbit hole just kept going deeper and deeper... Bursting through the door, Link braced himself for whatever horrors he would have to face on the other side...

Immediately upon entering, Link stopped when he saw a pair of giant bat-like wings blocking his view of the back. He wouldn't need to see the back though, as upon hearing Link step inside, the owner of the wings turned their head towards him with a scowl... Once the creature had fully turned around to face him, it had become apparent that this was a demon he was messing with. Said demon let out an intimidating roar, giving the impression it was about to attack.

Instinctively, Link withdrew his sword-, "Stop! Please! I beg of you... Don't hurt me! Oh goodness, I know how bad this must look to you right now, but I assure you I mean no harm! We were just playing the scream-as-loud-as-you-can game!" Link stood there utterly shocked. He turned and saw Kukiel to his left, who just waved to him with a big smile, then back to the demon who continued, "Isn't that a fun game...? Oh dear... Perhaps an explanation is in order! My name is Batreaux, and I am a monster who resides here in this humble dwelling below Skyloft. But please allow me to correct one popular misconception. While I am certainly a monster, I wouldn't dream of terrorizing the people of this town!"

Batreaux went on to express his desire to befriend the people of Skyloft, along with the hardships he faced along the way because of his demonic features. Kukiel even eventually chimed in, "He's not a bad man! He saved me one time when I almost fell over the edge! And he lets me come here and scream as loud as I want!" It was a real shame that such a nice guy was forced to be an outcast based purely on appearance.

Without warning, an enormous roar erupted from inside the room. It was so loud that the sound waves caused all the decorations to either vibrate or fall from their place entirely. All three of them covered their ears to protect their ear drums, though it ended fairly quickly. Batreaux immediately spoke up upon noticing the noise had stopped, "Goodness me, what was that? Are both of you alright?"

Link nodded, "Y-Yeah, I'm fine, are you too Kukiel...?"

Kukiel slowly got up, still clutching her ears, "Owie..."

Whatever that noise was, it was loud enough to have woken all of Skyloft. Several people went out to investigate, and found Link and Batreaux having climbed back up into the graveyard. Each of them withdrew their weapon upon noticing Batreaux, but Link ran between them, "Hey, hey! Cut that out!"

Though Link had no explanation for the noise, he did speak up over the mistreatment of Batreaux. Sadly, it took awhile to convince anyone due to their ingrained mindsets. Slowly, he was making a case that was starting to win them over, especially once he brought up Kukiel's side of the story, "Kukiel?!" Wyrna pushed past the other townsfolk in-front of her, "He saved my little Kukiel?!" Link, taking the opportunity to score Batreaux a few points, nodded hastily. Wyrna covered her mouth in shock, "Oh my goodness, how could I ever thank you!"

Oddly, Link saw some orange gems form around Wyrna. It seemed that no one else could notice them though. Batreaux turned to him and whispered, "Ah! Gratitude Crystals! Those are only produced when a human is truly happy! This is a good sign! If you don't mind, I would like to keep these ones, in honor our new friendship!" Link didn't see any problem with this and nodded.

Although, there was still one unresolved oddity. Link turned to the Goddess Sword to speak to Fi, "Still, I wonder what that strange roar was..."

Fi took a moment before uttering only a short response, "... Indeed."

14222222222212.content:
...Epona standing in the centre of the field, where she'd always been, joining Malon in a rendition of her favourite song. Link was happy to see that the horse-maiden hadn't changed at all since their adventures together. A rare anthropomorphic mare, Epona had been Link's most constant companion through his adventures in both Hyrule and Termina, fighting alongside him in battle and providing him with the occasional ride across the vast fields of both countries. Link waved, and she stopped singing, waving back and letting out a happy whinny.

"Link! It's been forever, how are you?" she called out, as Malon giggled; as much as she enjoyed having "Fairy Boy" around, Epona was always even more fond of him.

"Oh, you know me...just hanging around, not much to do with all this fate of the world stuff out of the way!" he joked, sitting down on a bale of hay opposite the two farm girls. He stopped to get a good look at Epona-- a bit taller than the average Hylian, the anthro mare wore a dress similar to Malon's, only with a brooch shaped like a carrot instead of the latter's Bowser-themed one. Her equine lips were curled into a smile, and she seemed incredibly eager to hear whatever Link had to say, involuntarily making an excited nickering sound.

"So, girls, what's going on?"

"Oh, nothing much," Malon replied, "Just more of the usual work here around the farm...you know, Epona and I have been experimenting with making some new, special milk from the cows around here-- you wanna try some?"

Link was more than happy to take their offer, having always been quite the fan of Lon Lon Ranch's famous milk. He got up and followed the two girls as they got up and walked toward the barn. Epona smiled and patted her belly, which Link had only just noticed was now a bit bigger and softer than he remembered. "Oh, you'll really like this new milk recipe, Link," she said excitedly, "Though, er, don't be surprised if you find you can't bring yourself to put it down after a couple of glasses..."

142222222222212112.content:
After 4 long days of non-stop work, Oren was finally able to do something she could only do for a few minutes at a time: sleep. She had been running back and forth throughout her kingdom, overseeing repair work, relocating Zora's whose homes were destroyed, calming the populace, and just generally being a queen. It was tiring, but Oren was finally done.

Yuga's attack had done quite a bit of damage to the Zora kingdom. The throne room was trashed, homes and businesses were ruined, and several books in the Zora archives had to be fixed. Eventually, after four days of repairing, the Zora kingdom was returning to it's original splendor.

Oren retreated to her bedroom and collapsed on her large bed. She was ready to sleep for days at this point. Before she turned in, though, she made sure to put the Smooth Stone back in it's box next to her bed. It had been critical in helping her fix the kingdom.

The Smooth Stone. Oren had always wondered where it came from. She first got it on her 20th birthday, two days before she became queen, in a package with no sender. It was always glowing a yellow light, which Oren thought was pretty, but that wasn't what made the stone odd. Whenever she had it, it always gave her as much energy as she needed: even if she were to run for 10 hours straight, she wouldn't be tired. But that energy came with one odd cost: if the stone was away from her for too long or was stolen from her, she would begin gaining weight at a rapid rate. The Zora mage who checked the gem said the weight wouldn't kill her, but if left unchecked, she could potentially crush the entire land of Hyrule. Oren didn't want that, so she kept the stone with her as much as she could. There were a few instances where it was lost, and it was stolen at one point, but both times the stone was returned before any permanent damage was done.

Oren locked the box with the stone and, for the first time in four days, laid down for a well deserved rest. But during her sleep, something happened to the stone. The non-stop use of the stone had completely burned out it's magic, causing to lose it's glow and become just an ordinary stone. Oren was about to get a nasty surprise when she woke up.

The next morning, Oren felt much better. As she opened her eye's, she tried to get up, but couldn't. Confused she took the covers of and looked at her body. To her surprise she was...
142222222222212112.title: Powerless

choices: A few hours
A day
1422222222222121122.content:
Oren couldn't believe it. Overnight, she had blown up to a huge size. Her breasts had swollen to about 4 feet in diameter. Somehow the shells she used as a bra had stayed on. Her belly was even bigger. It looked like Oren swallowed a rolled-up Goron. Her arms and legs had become thick like trees. And though she couldn't see it, she could feel that her butt had blown up as well. She could also feel that her face had puffed up a bit.

Oren couldn't figure this out. Even if she wasn't holding it, her proximity to the Smooth Stone should have kept her thin. So she reached over and unlocked the box containing the stone and grabbed the stone. She saw that it wasn't glowing. She knew that wasn't good. So she slowly got out of bed and made her way to the door. However, she got distracted by a full-length mirror, which let her actually see her butt. It had blown up to the current size of her breasts. She sighed and left her room.
---------------------------------------
Later, in the throne room, Oren was sitting in her pool while the Zora Mage looked over the Smooth Stone. She could feel that everyone was staring at her, worried, and she couldn't blame them. Something was wrong with their queen and no one knew what. They had every right to be worried.

The mage finished examining the stone and walked over to Oren. He was frowning.

"Unfortunately, my queen, it seems the Smooth Stone is completely out of power." He finally said.

"Really? I must have overworked it getting the Zora kingdom back in order." Oren replied.

"I'm afraid that we have no means of recharging the stone." The mage said. "However, there may be one person who can help."

"Who?" Oren asked.

"A sorceress. She knows all about mystic artifacts. She may be able to recharge the stone." He explained.

"Where is this sorceress?" Oren asked.

"Last I heard, she was visting Holodrum. About a 5 days trip. We'll send someone too-"

"No." Oren interrupted. "I'll go myself. The Smooth Stone is my burden after all."

"Are you sure you want to do this? In your current condition?" The mage asked.

"I don't have a choice. If we don't fix the Smooth Stone-"

Before she could finish her sentance, she felt her body rumble. Before everyone's eyes, Oren bloated up again, growing about a foot all around. She sighed.

"-I'll keep bloating until I flatten all of Hyrule." She finished.

"Very well. We'll prepare for your departure." The mage said.

"How long will that take?" Oren asked.

142222222222221111.content:
"Open your eyes…"

The words were faint and drummed inside of Link's head, echoing around but not really meaning anything. They were just words, floating in an endless abyss of black. He was warm, and could have been floating for all he knew.

In fact, he didn't know anything, just those words and the feeling of warmth.

"Open your eyes…”

The words came again, this time entering Link's mind as if from a voice, one he thought he knew. It was soft, gentle, and comfortingly familiar. He tried to think of the last time he'd heard such a voice, the last time he'd done anything. But all he felt was throbbing pain, as he tried to re-collect what had happened previously.

His eyelids opened slowly, feeling heavy and awkward, allowing him a small fraction of sight. The harshness of light entering his pupils for the first time in ages blinded him; being the force that made his eyes shut more than their lids' weight.

"Wake up, Link…"

It was that voice again, though he couldn't remember it. It frustrated him. It was so familiar, and felt so reassuring; like it was a voice he had been waiting to hear for a very long time. So why could he not figure out who it was? The more he tried to think, the more aware of himself he became, and the more he realized he'd forgotten. Where was he? How had he gotten here? Curiosity forced his eyes open again, slowly this time, letting the light in bit by bit. Gradually, the world came into focus.

It was very dark, and still he had no recollection of where he was. He didn't remember falling asleep, in fact he remembered little else than his name, and the familiarity of that voice. Those thoughts were lost to the back of his mind as he took in the pulsating blue lights above him, beating rhythmically and reassuringly. It soothed him, helping his body to loosen and eventually getting him to the point where he could sit up.

He looked from his resting place to see some sort of cavern walls. They were a strange mixture of cave-like and intentionally moulded and built upon, with some being slick and marble-like. What was this place? Carefully, he braced his hands against the bed he rested in, itself a strange rock structure filled with that pulsing blue light, forcing himself upright. Link looked back at the bed and took in the strange symbol upon it: it looked like an eye with a single tear drop. That, too, felt familiar, but he could not recall why.

Why couldn't he remember anything? And his body felt a bit off putting, as well.

The words were faint and drummed inside of Linkle's head, echoing around but not really meaning anything. They were just words, floating in an endless abyss of black. She was warm, and could have been floating for all She knew.

In fact, she didn't know anything, just those words and the feeling of warmth.

"Open your eyes…”

The words came again, this time entering Linkle's mind as if from a voice, one She thought She knew. It was soft, gentle, and comfortingly familiar. She tried to think of the last time She'd heard such a voice, the last time She'd done anything. But all She felt was throbbing pain, as She tried to re-collect what had happened previously.

Her eyelids opened slowly, feeling Heavy and awkward, allowing her a small fraction of sight. The harshness of light entering her pupils for the first time in ages blinded her; being the force that made her eyes shut more than their lids' weight.

It was that voice again, though She couldn't remember it. It frustrated her. It was so familiar, and felt so reassuring; like it was a voice She had been waiting to Shear for a very long time. Linkle looked back at the bed and took in the strange symbol upon it: it looked like an eye with a single tear drop. That, too, felt familiar, but She could not recall why.

Why couldn't She remember anything? And her body felt a bit off putting, as well.
