142222222222221221.content:
"I must say, Mipha, Zora culture is much more diverse than I originally thought".
Princess Zelda and Lady Mipha were walking through the centre of Zora's Domain, Link trailing behind them. Wherever Zelda went, her chosen knight wouldn't be too far away.
"Forgive me if I offend, Princess, but Hylians have never really understood us," Mipha said in her quiet voice. "They believe us to be less evolved versions of the Rito, which may be true. However, the Zora are a proud race, with a history dating back to the Hero of Time himself!"
Zelda nodded. She had extensive knowledge of the various incarnations of the Hero throughout time. From the Hero of the Sky who battled an ancient evil, to the Hero of Twilight who fought against both the Usurper King and the Demon King, she knew them all.

"If I may ask one thing, Mipha..." Zelda asked, stopping to peer over a railing at some Zoras swimming down below.
"The Zoras eat fish, correct? Yet it was always my belief that the Zoras were descended from fish?"
Mipha let out a quiet laugh.
"Yes, it is true. Our records don't go back quite that far, but it is believed that the first group of Zora's came into being when the Goddess Nayru took pity on a group of washed up fish that were too far from water. The reason we eat fish dates back to the Era of the Hero of Time, when the Zora race had a guardian deity," Mipha explained, joining Zelda at the railing.
"You mean Lord Jabu-Jabu?"
Nodding, Mipha continued.
"Yes. Lord Jabu-Jabu's favourite meal was actually fish, despite him being a rather large one. After he disappeared from his lake, we grieved for his loss by eating a feast in his memory. That feast consisted mainly of fish, in remembrance of his favourite food".

"I see. And it is a tradition that continues to this day, I presume?" Zelda asked, her eye drawn to a glint of light reflecting off the Master Sword's blade. Both Mipha and Zelda watched as Link showed a group of young Zoras the Blade of Evil's Bane. Mipha smiled at the "Ooo's" and "Ahh's" Link received.
"It was always believed that the Zora Princess could prepare the best fish," Mipha said after a moment of silence. "As the one who fed Lord Jabu-Jabu was Princess Ruto, the secret to his meals was passed down through Zora Royalty".
"So you could prepare something like it?" Zelda asked.
"I suppose I could. I've never really tried. After all, I was raised a Princess. Meals were cooked for me, not by me".
Thinking, Zelda finally spoke up.
"Well then, let's try it!"
Mipha looked at her, confusion on her face. Zelda never really got this excited, especially these days.

"A-Are you sure? Like I said, I've never really cooked anything..." She trailed off.
"I'm sure that between the three of us, we can work something out!" Zelda said excitedly.
"Well, okay... I guess I could try. But first, we need to deliver that report to my father," Mipha reminded Zelda, who nodded.
"Of course. We should head there now".
As the pair headed off, Link didn't notice them, too busy being mobbed by children wanting to look at the Master Sword. It wasn't until Zelda came back and grabbed him by the arm that he escaped.

After their report on the Divine Beast, Zelda, Mipha and Link headed up to the reservoir, where they had been camping.
"Right. Here's how it's going to go," Zelda said firmly. "Link, you can start on a fire. Mipha, you and I will look for fish".
Link nodded, pulling a bundle of wood out of his magic pouch. Zelda had asked on multiple occasions how he managed to fit extra clothes, spare weapons, food, materials and camping gear in there, but he could never give a proper answer.
"How about these ones?" Zelda asked, pointing to a group of blue fish.
"Armoured Carp... No, I think Hyrule Bass would do just fine. Unless you're planning on heading into battle?" Mipha asked, smiling.
"No, of course not!" Zelda replied, shaking her head. "Okay, so... Hyrule Bass look like this?"
She showed Mipha a picture of a green fish on her Sheikah Slate. She nodded.
"Pictures are all well and good, but nothing beats the real thing!"

Mipha stabbed her spear into the water and pulled it out, a green fish skewered on the end. She repeated this a couple of times, until Zelda could no longer carry all of them.
"I think that should do!" Mipha said, pleased with her catch. "Normally, they are much harder to catch".
As they reached their camp, Zelda sighed. She had just seen Link...
"Oh, have you already eaten?" Mipha asked, disappointment in her voice. She had been looking forward to cooking for Link, one the reasons she had agreed to in the first place.
Link shrugged, a sorry look on his face.
"Argh!" Zelda stamped her foot. "Mipha was all ready to prepare this nice meal, and you couldn't wait!"
Link looked away. He never really spoke, unless you really prompted him.

"Its fine, Princess. I can cook for the two of us," Mipha said, laying a hand on Zelda's shoulder. She instantly perked up. "Thank you, Mipha," she said, bowing her head in thanks. "I simply cannot wait!"
Zelda watched Mipha go through the steps of preparing their dinner. She looked on with interest as she took the bones out of the fish, before cutting it into pieces and sprinkling on a little salt.
"We give thanks to Lord Jabu-Jabu for this meal," she said quietly, before closing her eyes and concentrating.
"A silent prayer," she said to Zelda before handing her a silver plate.

"I must say, that was delicious!"
Zelda leaned back against the rock she had chosen to act as a chair. Mipha sat opposite her, a pleased expression on her face.
"Thank you, Princess. It's kind of you to say," Mipha thanked her. Behind her, Link was practicing with the Master Sword, which drew Zelda's eye.
"Do you think he's ready?" Mipha asked, hearing the blade cut through the air.
"Are any of us truly ready?" Zelda asked, worry in her voice.
"You needn't worry. With all of us working together, we'll do brilliant!" Mipha reassured her.

Nodding, Zelda fell silent. Everybody was ready... Everybody except her. She couldn't awaken her power, which was critical to the plan. Sure, Link was good with the Master Sword, but unless she could seal Ganon away, he would be battling for a very long time.
"I must return to the Domain," Mipha said, bringing Zelda out of her thoughts. "Remember that Lynel up there".
"Yes, of course. Be safe, Mipha".
As she watched Mipha go, Zelda placed her hands on her belly. She briefly thought that it felt softer, but dismissed the notion. She had just had a large dinner, after all.

"Don't stay up too late, please," she told Link, who nodded. He normally went to bed after her and woke before her. She used to believe that he never actually slept until she was woken during a storm, which Link had slept right through.
As she lay down on her sleeping bag, Zelda shifted. Her backside felt a little odd, as did her breasts...
"It's nothing," she said, drifting off to sleep.
The next day...
142222222222221221.title: The Fish of the Zora Princess

choices: Sample Links cooking.
Stick with Mipha's cooking.
1422222222222212212.content:
As Zelda slept, Link was wide awake. Despite her earlier order, he was busy keeping watch. He had one eye trained on the sky, and the other on a nearby ramp. The Lynel that Mipha had warned them about lived up that ramp, and while it didn't normally come down the ramp, Link didn't want to be held responsible for Zelda's death.
A clap of thunder caused Zelda to sit upright.
"What-What?!" She yelped, looking around. She saw Link sitting opposite her, looking over a nearby mountain. Following his gaze, she saw rain clouds coming towards them, along with some lightning.
"We can't stay here," she said to Link, who nodded. "The Master Sword is made of metal, which will attract that lightning. We should head back to the Domain".

After packing up their camp, Zelda pulled her hood up. While Link wasn't looking, she adjusted her blue top, which felt quite tight.
"Ready to go?" She asked, looking at Link. He nodded and set off ahead of her.
A few steps down the path, the pair ran into a Lizalfos, making Zelda thankful that he had gone first. Normally, she would rush ahead, confident that she would run into no danger.
Link drew the Master Sword, moon light reflecting off its blade. The Lizalfos slashed at Link with its crude weapon. Link easily parried it and hit back with his own slash. Unable to dodge, the Lizalfos fell back before bursting into smoke.
"T-Thank you," she said to Link. Even since he had saved her from the Yiga Clan, he never let her go anywhere alone. Even when she needed to go to the bathroom, he would be near.
Link nodded. He gripped the Master Sword tighter when a roar echoed from the mountain next to them.
"The Lynel... We should hurry!"

Zelda ran into Zoras Domain, water dripping off her hood. They weren't able to outrun the storm, something Zelda voiced her displeasure about.
"I hate the rain!" She complained, shaking her head and covering Link with water. He pulled his own hood down and hung it over a chair while Zelda looked around. They had ended up in the inn, which was more a coincidence than anything.
"I would like two beds please. One normal, and one water," Zelda asked the owner.
He bowed.
"Of course, your Highness. They are on the house, of course. Lady Mipha had a feeling that a storm might hit tonight, and reserved two beds".
"Thank you," Zelda said. She jumped when lightning hit the ground outside.
"I hate lightning!"

The next morning, Zelda awoke to see Mipha standing at the foot of her bed. As she sat up, the bed sloshed underneath her.
"Lady Mipha. I wasn't expecting to see you so soon. I must thank you for reserving these beds for us," Zelda said, gesturing to her bed.
"Not an issue, Princess. I took the liberty of preparing breakfast for you. After last night, I find cooking... relaxing," Mipha said, pointing to a plate on the table behind her. One plate was empty, indicating that Link was up.
"My thanks".

Zelda took a seat at the table. It wasn't the kind of breakfast she was used to, but she still devoured it.
"Ahhh... You really are an outstanding cook!" Zelda complimented, rubbing her belly.
Mipha blushed.
"You're too kind, Princess. Anyway, I hated to tell you this, but the storm caused a landslide on the path to the Domain. I'm afraid you'll be stuck here for a while," Mipha explained.
Zelda nodded.
"I'll need to inform Daruk. We were meant to inspect Vah Rudania later today," Zelda mused, tapping her chin. She didn't notice how it felt softer, her jawline less defined.
"I'll send a Zora up one of the waterfalls. They won't be able to head up to Goron City, but they should be able to get the message to a Goron".
Zelda nodded. She blushed when her stomach let out a quiet gurgle.

"Still hungry?" Mipha giggled.
"I-I... Guess so," Zelda stuttered, embarrassed by her stomach.
"There's still some food left up near the throne room. You're welcome to have it," Mipha offered. "Then again, I have heard that your knight is no slouch when it comes to cooking".
"Really?"
Zelda was surprised to hear that. She had no idea that Link could cook...
"Well, you'll be here for a while. Feel free to tour the city," Mipha said, leaving Zelda alone.

After adjusting her top, which had grown tighter around her bust, Zelda headed out into the Domain. She was still feeling hungry, and the news that Link was an accomplished chef had intrigued her. She always liked trying new things.
Then again, Mipha's cooking wasn't too bad either...
1422222222222212212.title: Stuck with the Zoras

choices: A slightly ajar door, with food behind it...
Was that a shadow?
14222222222222122121.content:
Deciding upon Link, Zelda looked around for him. Usually, he didn't go too far, but on this occasion, he was nowhere to be seen. It wasn't until she heard a number of Zoras making a fuss that she found him.
"Oh, Link! There you are!" Zelda said, relief in her voice. He was surrounded by the same group of young Zoras from yesterday, all of which were asking him to show off the Master Sword again.
Hearing them all talk, Zelda fell silent. She wanted to see if he was any closer to mastering it...

Unsheathing the blade, Link gave it a couple of practice swings, which caused the group to step back a little bit. He placed the blade on his shoulder and concentrated for a moment.
Swinging the sword horizontally, a beam of light shot out of the blade, startling the crowd of Zoras and causing Zelda to gasp.
"He's never done that before!" She said, a hint of excitement in her voice. "Maybe the spirit is beginning to trust him?"
Smiling as he was mobbed again, Zelda leaned back. She missed this sense of normalcy.

Soon, the crowd dispersed to go swimming. A couple of them voiced their disappointment that Link couldn't join them, but made no protest when Zelda approached them.
"So, Link. A rather interesting rumour has reached my ears. It seems that you are an experienced chef?" Zelda asked, raising an eyebrow.
Link hesitated before nodding. He did have experience cooking, but it was his own unique style. He had never told the Princess for a couple of reasons. One, his food was rather, well... fattening, and two, Zelda loved trying new things.
"I would like you to prepare a meal for me," Zelda said to him. He didn't dare protest. She had a bad temper when things didn't go her way.

Following Link to a cooking pot inside the entrance to the inn, Zelda sat next to the fire and warmed her hands. She watched as Link pulled out a juicy slab of meat from his pouch, her mouth almost watering...
She caught herself, just in time to see Link produced a Hyrule Herb and a Hearty Radish. He threw them into the pot and sat back, watching the ingredients simmer.
Sniffing, Zelda was amazed at how good it smelt. It was the perfect blend of smells, all combining together to create a beautiful aroma...

She jumped as the ingredients disappeared in a cloud of smoke.
"You burnt it!" She complained, looking at Link, who ignored her. He plunged his hands into the smoke and pulled out something that caused Zelda's eyes to widen.
The Gourmet Meat smelt divine. The Herb had been sprinkled atop it, while the radish had been cut apart and lay around the meat.
"How did you do that?" She asked, amazed at the presentation. She hadn't even seen him cut it...
Link shrugged. He just kind of threw ingredients into a pot, gave it a few seconds and a meal came out. He had never really thought about how it worked.

Handing a plate to Zelda, he left the Inn. Zelda didn't know where he was going, nor did she particularly care when she took a bite of the meat. She moaned as it practically fell apart in her mouth.
"So good... Mipha wasn't lying!"
Zelda dug into her meal with gusto, not noticing her body slowly growing. Her soft belly bulged outwards, pushing against her blue tunic. Her breasts, reasonably sized for her age, grew tighter within her bra. Her backside, which had been commented on by people thinking she wasn't listening when she actually was, became thicker, causing her pants to tighten.

"Ahhh... Delicious!"
Zelda leaned back and let out a quiet burp. She rubbed her belly, not noticing how soft it was now. Standing up, she wobbled slightly.
"Hmmm... Odd. Must just be light-headed".
As she headed outside, she didn't notice her thighs brushing against each other, nor her jiggling backside. Spying Link looking over a railing, she headed up to him.
"That was an excellent meal, Link. Thank you very much!" She said, bowing her head to convey her thanks. Link merely nodded. He had noticed Zelda's thicker body, her bigger breasts, her wider hips...
"Is something the matter?"
He stopped staring at her and shook his head.
"Very well then. Seeing as we are stuck here until that landslide is cleared, I suppose I could have a look around. After all, we don't stay in these places for very long. I would like you to remain here. No harm should come to me in a major city!" Zelda said, walking off.

After exploring most of the Domain, Zelda took a seat outside the Throne Room. She was breathing heavily, for reasons she couldn't understand.
"Must be... something in the air," she said, taking a deep breath. Relaxing on her bench, Zelda looked around. Down in the centre of the city, she saw Mipha and Link talking, much to her annoyance. Off to the right, she saw an elderly Zora teaching a bunch of younger ones. And to the left, she saw...
14222222222222122121.title: Links Cooking is very... filling.

choices: Zelda eats the food meant for Link
Link and Mipha walk through the door
142222222222221221212.content:
Zelda looked to the left, Ploymus Mountain towering in the distance. She had heard tales of a Lynel, a creature with the body of a horse, the torso of a human and the head of a lion, that lived there. Link and her had encountered one when they had gotten lost in the Hebra Mountains. Link had drawn the Master Sword, determined to defend her. However, one shock arrow had caused him to drop it, prompting Zelda to order a retreat. The pair had split up to lose him. Zelda made it safely to a nearby stable, but Link had gotten lost in the mountains for a couple of days. She remembered her grief at his loss, and her relief when he had staggered over a hill, sunlight reflecting off the blade of the Master Sword.

"Princess, look out!"
A shout from a Zora Guard drew her back to reality. She looked around, seeing the guard that had shouted at her pointing to the sky above her. She followed his finger. Initially, she saw nothing. Then she heard a crackling noise, the same made by shock arrows...
She was pushed from the bench, landing heavily on the ground and causing her to let out a yelp. Her breasts bounced, and her new belly rippled. She looked up at the guard that had pushed her to the ground. She opened her mouth to warn him about the approaching arrow...
She wasn't fast enough. The arrow embedded itself in the guards back, causing him to yell with pain and collapse next to her. She scrambled to her knees and tried to pull the arrow out, remembering that the Zoras really didn't like electricity of any sort. She let out her own yell as the arrow shocked her.

Feeling a hand grab her shoulder and guide her away from the guard, Zelda struggled against the grip. She only stopped when she was spun around, revealing Link with a serious expression on his face.
"Link!" She gasped. "What's happening?!"
"Princess, we must get you out of here," a quiet voice answered from behind Link. Mipha walked out of what looked like an armoury, a silver spear in her hands. "The Lynel that lives on Ploymus Mountain is attacking the Domain".
"But, why?" Zelda asked. She had done a little research into Lynels, and they normally kept their distance from populated areas.
"He knows he has an advantage over us with his shock arrows. Even touching one would render a Zora unable to attack," Mipha explained. "Link, take her to my room. Then meet me by the eastern gate".
Link nodded, grabbing Zelda's hand. She yanked it free from his grasp.
"I can find my own way there, thank you very much!" She said, annoyed. "You deal with the Lynel".
Link nodded again. He looked at Mipha before the pair ran off, leaving Zelda alone.

She briefly considered running after them, but reconsidered. She had no weapons, nor any training with weapons. Sure, she had the Sheikah Slate with bombs and stasis, but Link had told her off when she had tried to help him with bombs. Thankfully, his burn wasn't too severe and healed quickly.
Deciding to do what Link and Mipha had told her, she ran towards the throne room. She stopped halfway up a set of stairs when she heard a roar in the distance. Looking to the east, she let out a gasp.
She saw the Lynel swing his massive sword. A blue figure backflipped away before jumping forward and bringing its sword down hard, causing the Lynel to stagger backwards. A red figure then jumped over him, stabbing with their spear and forcing the Lynel backwards even further.

"Princess Zelda!"
Looking around Zelda saw the elderly Zora that was teaching earlier staring at her.
"Princess, it is much too dangerous out here for you!" He told her. A shock arrow hit the ground behind her, causing them both to jump.
"I realise that, but..." Zelda trailed off. She wanted to help, but had no means to do so. "Very well. Mipha has allowed me to remain in her room. Where about is it?"
"Follow me," the Zora said, walking off.

Sitting on Mipha's bed, which sloshed beneath her, Zelda looked around. Mipha had a nice room, with a view over the Domain. On her dresser sat a blue cloth, similar to the one sent to the four Champions. Beside it was a picture of Mipha and Link when they were younger. Link wore a goofy grin on his face, and had a large cut down his arm. Mipha, on the other hand, had a subdued smile and worry in her eyes. She hated when Link hurt himself, but was always happy to heal any injuries he had.
Zelda sighed. Every so often, she heard a distant roar, indicating that Link and Mipha were still battling the Lynel. She felt so useless, just sitting here and doing nothing.
"Princess?"
A knock at the door caused her to jump to her feet.
"Yes? Who is it?" She asked, opening the door. A couple of small Zoras carrying trays looked at her.
"We thought you might get hungry, so we brought you some food!" One of them said brightly, handing Zelda a tray.
"This one's for Link, for helping Princess Mipha fight the scary Lynel," A second one said, handing a second tray to her.
"Thank you. I'll make sure he gets it," Zelda said, bowing to show her thanks. She took the trays and set them on the bed, sitting next to them.

As she sat, her stomach let out a grumble.
"Well, I guess it is about lunchtime," Zelda said, taking the lid off her tray. A pile of Roasted Bass was revealed. She gently poked one, smiling as she felt how hot they were.
"Freshly cooked Bass... I must say, the Zora style of cooking is rather nice".
Picking one up, Zelda dug in, quickly devouring it. She smiled again, licking her lips. Zelda then worked her way through the rest of her meal, eating the next fish faster than the last, until she stuffed the last one in her mouth, chewing madly.
"URRP... Oh, excuse me!" Zelda said, embarrassed. She lay back on the bed, listening to the water slosh beneath her. Putting her hands on her belly, Zelda still didn't notice that it was much softer, her tunic tight around it. It formed a noticeable bump against it. Her bra was just as tight, her breast flesh starting to overflow the cups. Her pants were tight as well, the fabric slipping in between Zelda's much rounder ass cheeks. Her face was softer, a second chin starting to form.

Raising a chubby arm to her face, she brushed a strand of hair out of her vision. Her fingers were plumper, her hands no longer dainty. Her thighs rubbed against each other as she sat up, her belly splitting into two small rolls.
"I haven't heard anything in awhile... Is it over?" Zelda wondered. The silence in the room was broken by another rumble from her stomach, which caused her to sigh.
"I just ate!" She said to herself. "I can't seriously be hungry again!"
Looking over, she saw Links tray of fish sitting on Mipha's dresser...
142222222222221221212.title: Attack On Zoras Domain

choices: They make it to Death Mountain on time.
The pair are delayed along the way.
1422222222222212212121.content:
Looking at the tray that contained Links portion of fish, Zelda stood up. Sure, that Zora child had cooked that fish for Link, but surely Link wouldn't know about it? She walked over to the tray, her belly jiggling with each step. She picked it up and took it back to the bed, sitting down with the tray on her lap.

Link headed for the back of the wagon, where he found Zelda struggling to pull her girth up.
"A little... help, Link?" She grunted. Link let out a silent sigh. He placed his hands on Zelda's back and pushed. He let out a grunt as he pushed Zelda up.
"And done! Come on, let's go!" She said excitedly, planting her backside down and turning her backside into a soft chair. Link sat at the back of the wagon, his legs hanging out.

"And we're here! Welcome to the Ranch! It used to be called something else, but it was lost a long time ago," Malon explained, pointing to the sign over their head. Zelda could make out the word 'Ranch', but the first two words were faded and scuffed. Even with her advanced reading skills, she couldn't decipher it.
As the wagon stopped, Link jumped down and headed around to the front to help Malon. Zelda slowly lowered herself down and took a look around.
In front of her was a track, around which a couple of horses were running. In the centre was a pen, where some more horses trotted around. Next to her was a massive barn, where she could hear a number of cows.
"Ingo! Where are you?" Malon shouted, leaving Epona to Link.
"Right here, Malon," a voice answered from within the barn. A tall guy appeared. He was wearing a green shirt underneath a pair of overalls, and had a thick moustache. "What do you need?"
"Can you grab a couple of bottles of milk? We have visitors," Malon asked, gesturing to Zelda, who tried to bow. Her belly prevented her from doing so, splitting into rolls underneath her dress.
"Oh, Princess Zelda! A pleasure!" Ingo bowed, before turning back to Malon. "Normal, or..."
"Normal! That milk is not for drinking!" She sighed. The way in which she said it told Zelda that she was tired of saying it.

Ingo headed back into the barn, returning with two bottles of milk. He handed one to Zelda, who thanked him.
"Enjoy!" He said, trying not to grin.
Taking a sip, Zelda let out a sigh of approval as...
142222222222221221212111221211.title: The farmland and the Ranch

choices: Zelda visits her friends.
A messenger from the Castle appears.
1422222222222212212121112212111.content:
The milk was cold, cooling her throat as it entered her stomach.
"This is excellent, Malon!" She complimented, causing Malon to blush.
"Well, it's really thanks to the cows that it tastes good... But I'll be sure to pass your thanks on to them!" Malon replied happily.

Zelda downed the bottle, letting out a sigh. The milk was thick and creamy, sitting heavily in her stomach...
"Ohhh...." Zelda groaned, one hand drifting down to her round belly. It gurgled loudly, causing a look of concern to appear on Malon's face.
"Are you okay?" She asked, placing a hand on Zelda's shoulder.
"I... I..." Zelda stuttered. Her hand was now massaging her belly, sending waves across its surface. "Excuse me!"
Zelda pushed past Malon and Ingo and sprinted into the barn. Well, tried to. Unused to rapid movement, her thighs crashed against one another, causing her to trip. She hit the ground with a crash, causing every part of her body to jiggle madly. Lying on her large belly, Zelda let out a groan as a loud burp escaped her mouth.

"Princess!" Malon gasped, running to aid Zelda. She grabbed one of Zelda's thick arms and gestured for Ingo to grab the other. Together, they lifted the hefty Princess to her feet, where she wobbled unsteadily. Another burp escaped her mouth, causing her face to turn a bright red.
"I'm -URRP- so sorry..." Zelda said to Malon, who was staring wide eyed at her. "Please... Excuse me..."
Zelda slowly walked into the barn, sliding the door shut behind her. As soon as it shut, Link reappeared. Noticing the lack of Zelda, he looked at Malon, who pointed nervously at the barn.
"She's in there... I think it best to leave her alone..." She told Link, who nodded slowly, understanding the situation. Malon then turned on Ingo, a look of anger on her face.
"What did you do?!"

Inside the barn, Zelda sat next to a cow, who mooed at her. Ignoring it, she rubbed her large belly, which was still gurgling.
"What's -URRP- wrong with -URRP- me?" She asked herself through her burps. Feeling her stomach rumble, Zelda's face scrunched up. She really didn't want to be sick...
"I need something... to drink..." She whispered to herself. Looking around, she spotted a couple of bottles of milk. Strangely, they weren't labelled, which didn't bother her. Grabbing one, she sipped away at the milk, giving a small smile as her belly stopped gurgling. However, she could feel the milk sitting in her stomach, making her feel even more bloated and sluggish...
Her belly pushed forwards as she took another sip. Her dress, enchanted to fit Zelda's form no matter her size, grew along with it. Her breasts plumped up slightly, followed by her backside, which makes her underwear even tighter.
"Ahh... That helps!" Zelda said, downing the bottle. Her belly surged outwards, lifting the hem of her dress. Her breasts plumped up, filling with fat. Her backside pushed the back of her dress away. Her panties finally snapped, falling to the ground and leaving Zelda completely naked underneath her dress.
"Perhaps more will help my stomach?" Zelda wondered, lifting a second bottle.

"You gave her bad milk?!" Malon shouted angrily, causing Ingo to flinch.
"Well, it was sitting in the delivery batch, so I thought it was good..." Ingo tried to say, but Malon cut him off.
"I delivered today's milk! That was the batch I was going to throw out!"
Ingo shifted nervously.
"Oh..." He said, causing Malon to stamp her foot.
"I swear to Din, if she walks away and tells the King about this, we are out of business! I will hold you responsible!" She turned to Link, who had been watching their argument with interest. It actually reminded him of Zelda, the way Malon argued...
"Link, was it? Please, do not mention this to the King!" She pleaded, her eyes full of worry. "I swear, I'll punish Ingo! I'll give you free milk for life..."
Link dismissed her worries with a wave of his hand, shaking his head as he did.
"You... won't?" Malon guessed, to which he nodded. "Thank you so much! I'll make it up to you, I promise! Ummm... do you have a horse?"

Back with Zelda, she had just finished the last bottle, letting out another burp as she did.
"URRRP! I feel... refreshed!" She said, jumping to her feet and causing her breasts to bounce. "I need to apologise to Malon for my manners!"
Slowly walking towards the door, Zelda didn't realise what she had just drunk. The milk was from a new batch of cows, ones that fed on a special feed that Malon and Ingo had created. It was designed to make their milk thicker and creamier than other kinds of milk, however it hadn't been perfected, and left the milk rather fattening. Having drunk three bottles, Zelda was considerably heavier now. Her breasts now resembled medium-sized Chus, and lay atop her boulder sized belly. Each ass cheek resembled an Octorock head. Below them were her tree trunk thighs. A fifth chin was in the process of forming on her fat face.
Leaving the barn, Zelda was surprised to find that nobody was there. She had heard voices while she was drinking, but after the second bottle, they had moved away.

"And this one- No, Epona! This one was raised to be- Epona, stop it! As I was- Epona, move away!" Malon said to a brown horse, who kept sidling up to Link. The first time she did it, Link gave her an Apple. But now, it was beginning to annoy Malon.
"Please excuse Epona," she sighed. "Normally, she doesn't like strangers. She's taken a real liking to you, for some reason".
Link pet Epona's muzzle, smiling as she whinnied. She turned sideways, which caused Malon to gasp.
"She wants you to ride her!" She said, surprise in her voice. "This has never happened before!"
Link wasn't really listening. He grabbed Epona's mane and pulled himself up. Sitting on her back, he remembered a story his father had told him. A story about a legendary hero who battled something called 'The Twilight'. That hero had a horse called Epona, and this one he was riding sounded a lot like the Horse of Legend...

"That's a nice horse. It really suits you!"
Link turned, spotting Zelda leaning heavily on the fence. Malon let out a gasp and ran up to her.
"Princess Zelda! I am so, so sorry about that! I promise, Ingo will be..." Malon tried to apologise, but Zelda cut her off with a shake of her head.
"Please, don't worry! Mistakes are easy to make, and I'm sure it was just that. The milk was, truly, very delicious. Especially the bottles in the barn... Oh, I hope it was alright for me to drink them?" Zelda asked, realising that Malon may have needed them for something.
"Bottles in the... Oh, no," Malon whispered quietly, hoping Zelda didn't hear her. "Umm... Yeah, completely alright to drink! No problem at all! I can just milk more, you know?"
She gave a nervous laugh before looking away. Zelda didn't seem bigger, but she was wearing that dress that hid her body...
"I was wondering, would you mind helping us back to town?" Zelda asked. She really didn't want to walk all that distance in her dress heels, which, surprisingly, supported her girth. "It's quite difficult to walk in these shoes".
Malon nodded, still anxious about the milk.
"Town..? Yeah, l-let me get the wagon ready. Shouldn't take too long... Umm, Link? I need Epona for the wagon. The other horses hate it, and refuse to go near it".
Link dismounted Epona, which caused her to rear up on her hind legs in protest. She quickly calmed down when Malon hummed a quiet tune.
"B-be ready in a second!"

As they pulled into Central Square, Zelda jumped down from the wagon, landing heavily on the stone ground. The bustle of Castle Town was still quite strong, however people avoided the wagon and Zelda.
"Thank you for today, Malon. It was truly very delicious milk!" Zelda said to Malon, who nodded. Zelda didn't see the worry in her eyes as she responded.
"No problem, Your Highness... Hopefully, we can do this again..." Malon said before turning to Link. "Epona took a real liking to you today. If you ever need her help, just play that song I used earlier. No matter where you are in Hyrule, she will find you. Now, I must return to the Ranch and prepare tomorrows deliveries... Goodbye!"
Zelda waved at the wagon until it passed through the gates and disappeared out of her sight.
"That certainly was an adventure!" She said to Link, who nodded. "We still have quite a bit of daylight left... Perhaps I could visit my friends in town?"
1422222222222212212121112212111.title: Her stomach rumbled ominously...

choices: The kitchens. She was ravenous!
One of her secret passages.
14222222222222122121211122121111.content:
Not even waiting for an answer from Link, Zelda strode off towards eastern Castle Town. Growing up, she had discovered a couple of long forgotten passages that led out of the Castle. When she was younger, she would use these to escape. During one of these escapes, she had encountered a couple of children around her age, who she instantly bonded with. Even now, they were very close friends, and Zelda always made a point of visiting them whenever she was in Castle Town.

After wandering through the narrow backstreets, Zelda found what she was looking for. A small set of stairs that led to a heavy wooden door. Without knocking, Zelda pushed open the door, grunting as she did. Once opened, she heard a number of yells.
"Look, it's Zelda!"
"No way! She's actually here!"
"Well, certainly took you long enough to visit us again!" The bartender said, winking at her. She was a rather big woman, a little smaller than Zelda. A white cat leapt up on the counter next to her and purred.
"Sorry, Louise... I've been busy," Zelda said, giving an apologetic smile. Louise laughed, her second chin wobbling.
"Oh, don't you worry! Just glad to see you again, that's all... Oh, and who's this?" Louise asked, seeing Link enter the bar.
"This is Link, the knight appointed to protect me," Zelda said, pointing at him. He raised a hand in greeting.
"Doesn't say much, does he?" Louise joked. "Well, I won't keep you. I'm sure those two can't wait to see you again!"

Zelda headed to a table at the back, where two teenagers were sat. They both looked at Zelda.
"What took you, Zelda?" The male one asked, grinning at Zelda.
"Come on, Colin. Give her leeway, yeah?" The female one said to him, hitting his elbow.
Colin grinned again.
"Just a bit of fun, Beth. Come, pull up a seat," Colin said, kicking a chair out. Zelda sat down on it, ignoring its groans of protest. "So, how's Hyrule?"
"Hyrule is well, Colin," Zelda answered. Behind her loitered Link, who caught the attention of Beth, who beckoned Zelda forward.
"Who's the guy behind you?" She asked quietly.
Turning around, Zelda saw Link standing there, his arms crossed unhappily.
"Give me a second, would you?"

Standing, she stepped towards Link.
"I know what you want to say. Let me have some time with them, then I'll get ready for tomorrow, okay?" Zelda said, laying her hand on Link's shoulder.
Link nodded reluctantly. While she loved being in Castle Town, Link wasn't a big fan of it, preferring to be on the road traveling. He took a seat at the table behind Zelda, where he unsheathed the Master Sword and began polishing its blade.
Sitting back down, Colin leaned forwards.
"Is that the Master Sword he has?" Colin asked, a serious look on his face. Zelda nodded. She knew of Colin's obsession with different swords. On a couple of different occasions, he had asked her to get him different swords from the Castle Armoury, to which she had refused.
"Yes, it is. And no, you can't have it," Zelda said shortly. "Link has a much greater need of it than you do".
"Man..." Colin sighed and leaned back, clearly disappointed.

"Here you go, guys... Your drinks!" Louise said, placing three drinks on the table. "And each has a little... something in it. Hylia knows you probably need it, Zelda!"
"How much, Louise?" Beth asked, pulling her wallet out.
"First round is on me. Second round is when you pay," Louise said, winking again at Zelda. She walked away, stopping to ask Link if he wanted something.
Taking a sip, Zelda tasted something unfamiliar. It made her slightly off-balance, and her head slightly woozy.
"Hyrule is fine, Colin. All Divine Beasts are currently working, aside from some minor issues. I'm currently travelling around all three to fix those issues," Zelda explained, taking another sip of her drink.
"Cool... So when do we get to see these things?" Colin asked.
"We don't. They're for the Champions, idiot!" Beth said, poking him.
"Hey, had to try!"
Zelda giggled. Her head felt funny...
"Hey, you okay?" Beth asked. "You're normally all serious and stuff".
"Yeah, yeah, completely fine!" Zelda answered, smiling. She didn't even know why she was smiling...

The three sat and chatted for a good while. Colin and Beth wanted to know all about Zelda's adventures around Hyrule, which she happily told. Zelda asked about Castle Town, and how things were. Hearing that everything was fine made her smile, however her joy was short-lived...
"Link! What do you want?" Zelda asked, giggling. She had felt him tapping her shoulder, and after telling Colin about some Bokoblins that had attacked Link, she turned to face him.
Link shook his head disapprovingly. Not understanding, Zelda made to turn away, but Link grabbed her shoulder and dragged her to a corner... or tried to. Zelda was much too heavy for anyone bar a Goron to be dragging her.
"Those two get on well, don't you think?" Beth asked.
Colin nodded in agreement.
"I am completely fine, Link!" Came Zelda's voice. It sounded funny to Beth and Colin, which made them exchange worried looks. They knew what Louise had put in their drinks, but Zelda clearly didn't. It was a new kind of liquid called 'Alcohol'. When added to a drink, it had all sorts of effects. If you drank too much alcohol, or drank it too quickly like Zelda had, then you ended up 'Drunk', which basically meant that you had a hard time standing up and concentrating in general.
Zelda eventually reappeared, her face red.
"I... need to go. Link reminded me that I have somewhere to be," she said slowly, swaying on her feet. She grabbed the chair for support, which caused it to creak.
Colin and Beth nodded silently. They watched as Zelda stumbled her way towards the door, her body knocking chairs out of her way.

As Zelda reached the Castle, she was practically leaning on Link for support, who was having a tough time supporting her. It also didn't help that her soft breasts were rubbing against his arm...
"Hold there!" A guard shouted down. "We need to check you for weapons!"
A second guard appeared from within the building. Upon seeing the slightly drunk Princess, he ran over to her.
"What happened?" He asked urgently, helping Link support the hefty Princess.
"I feel fine!" Zelda said, giggling. "Just take me to my room, Link!"
Link shrugged at the guard.
"Ah, Alcohol... Best to not let the King see her like this. He'd have your head for it!" The guard warned, ushering them up the path.
Link continued his struggle, occasionally stopping to catch his breath.

Amazingly, they reached Zelda's room without her father finding them. Any guards they had run into looked away, suppressing smiles. Link dumped Zelda on her bed, causing the springs to creak.
"Link, I'm hungry!" Zelda complained, sitting up and rubbing her belly.
Link shushed her, hoping that the King was on the other side of the Castle.
"Link!" She whined, tugging on his tunic. "I want food!"
Rolling his eyes, Link ignored the childish Princess. Instead, he left the room, intent on finding Zelda some dinner. Zelda, however, had other ideas.
Standing up, she left the room and headed for...
14222222222222122121211122121111.title: Zelda visits her friends

Lana ate happily in the recently built Dining Hall of the the
Valley of Seers. It was built recently, under the sorceress Lana's desire for a better place to eat by the standing army Zelda had sent Lana and Cia to protect the Gate of Souls and Triforce of Power. Lana had always had a sweet tooth, and always ate a lot, but she had always worked off the pounds by fighting and running around the battlefields. However now that all the wars were over, she kept her sweet tooth, but lacked any way to lose the weight.
Her newly expanded breasts jiggled over her belly, which now laid enlarged in her lap. Her ass sat barely on her chair, which creaked under her weight, as she pressed her thighs together to avoid her rear hanging off the chair.

142222222222222112111.content:
Cia sighed as she walked out of the Dining Hall. No matter what she said, Lana's sweet tooth would rule over common sense with a desire for more.

Lana laid a hand on her belly. "That was really something." She said to herself. "I wonder what's for desert?" She licked her lips as she waited for the next course of her giant meal to finish.
Lana watched as Hylian Soldiers carried out her desert, an enormous cake covered with sweets. "Here you are Mistress Lana." One of the guards said. "Thanks for the meal!" Lana replied as they walked off. She took a fork, and began to dig in. Her body expanding with every bite. When she was done, she adjusted her top to compensate for her enlarged breasts. When not protecting the Gate of Souls, Lana wore her standard outfit. She found it much easier to eat with more more for her ever growing stomach. She patted her belly, as she walked off to her sleeping quarters, full of food.

Cia and Lana watched over the Gate of Souls. They were both in their typical Guardian outfits. Cia could not help but notice Lana's obvious discomfort of wearing her clothes. It looked tight on her new hefty body.

Just then, a loud horn went off. It was the signal of monsters approaching. A Hylian Captain came running up to the two woman. "We've spotted a horde of Bokoblins and Moblins heading this way! All the men are getting ready for battle." Cia pulled out her Scepter. "Then it's a battle we'll give them." She began to head down the stairs to the battlefield. Lana, pulled out her Tome, as she followed the two. Cia looked back at Lana, jiggling her way down the long flight of stairs.

Cia knew that Lana was in no condition to fight, but she would still try to. She decided to
142222222222222112111.title: When Sorceresses are left to gluttony.

1422222222222221121111.content:
Although Cia did not like it, she decided to let Lana fight. They had no time to argue for the monsters got closer every second.

As the small Hylian Army hit the monsters head on, Cia and Lana rushed through the battlefield fighting and assisting wherever they were needed... Well Cia rushed around, while Lana jogged at a steady pace in order to keep breath. Even at her slow pace, she still was out of breath as she came to a Keep. "Get ready...to fight...huff." Lana put her hands on her knees as she caught her breath. When she looked up, she saw that the Keep was full of Moblins. This is probably their main force she thought. She grabbed her Tome as she got ready to fight. Stepping out of their confusion, the Moblins began to attack Lana.

After using her Special Attack and Focus Spirit, which wiped out the Moblins and Keep Boss, she took a deep breath. She hadn't fought in quite a while and was out of shape. As Lana inhaled through her nose, she smelt something. She turned around to find many lightning cooked Moblin Flanks. While Lana had eaten (raw) Moblin Flanks in desperate situations, she usually gave then to the extremely heavy and extremely fat Spirit of the Master Sword, Fi. She had always wondered what Fi did with all the Moblin Flanks. Fi had always told her she needed them to upgrade gear at the Bazaar, before flying off, with a hungry look.
Mouth watering, Lana hurriedly collected the cooked Flanks. She put them in her magic pouch, which kept materials warm, clean, cold, or safe, or in her case, cooked. She quickly headed towards another Keep, wanting the battle to be over very soon so she could try her Moblin Flanks.
Eventually, with the combined efforts of the Hylian Army and the two Sorceresses, they defeated their Commander and defeated the monsters. Throughout the battle, Lana mainly targeted Moblins, to kill, cook, and collect their flanks. She had gathered a large amount, and more were brought to her as materials they had collected. Hurrying to the Dining Hall, Lana found that in celebration of their victory, the small army was having a feast. Lana's stomach rumbled as she saw the feast laid out through the hall. That morning, she had only had a small 3 person breakfast, and was feeling quite hungry. Lana decided that her Moblin Meal could wait, as she hurried to the celebration.

After filling her plate to the brim, and then some, Lana sat down, determined to have a good meal.

Meanwhile.

"I bet you... hic ... that Lana could eat that entire table of food over there." "That table? Try 2 tables" A group of Hylian soldiers sat around a table, discussing whatever came to their minds. They were also completely drunk. "So how much?" One of the soldiers said "120 rupees" He replied. The tension at the table rose as the two intoxicated soldiers began to bet. "140." "160." "200." "5 Lizalfos scales." "3 Gibdo bandages." The bets slowly rose as the other soldiers held their breath, waiting to see who would crack first. Eventually, the second soldier, who had had enough of betting, reached into his pouch, and brought out a small bottle of yellow liquid. "A bottle of Gohma's Acid." A gasp of air came from around the table to see if the other soldier would counter it. After a long stare down, the first soldier sighed. "Deal." He stood up as he began to get up, true to his word, to see if Lana could eat 2 whole tables of food.

Lana was about halfway through her meal when the soldier came over. She stopped to listen to see what he would say. "Hello Mistress Lana." Lana nodded "My friend over there." He gestured to his previous table. The second soldier waved. "Says that you can't eat two tables of food." His statement got Lana's attention. He was obviously drunk, and judging by the bottle of Gohma's Acid on their table, they had obviously been betting. She wanted to decline, but her stomach gave a mighty rumble as she glanced at the table full of food. She couldn't eat all that food. Could she? No, she wouldn't do it. But the food. But she couldn't. But the food.

Lana decided she would.

Lana quickly shoveled down the rest of her meal, as she prepared to eat. "What have I gotten myself into?" She muttered to herself, as she swallowed the last remnants of food.

Minutes later, a group of men moved the two tables worth of food to her table. Word had traveled quickly around the Dining Hall, as many more (possibly drunk) soldiers gathered around to see if Lana would eat that much food. When they walked in, they saw large crowd gathering around something. As they got closer, Cia heard they were chanting and cheering something on. "One more dish!" "She's gonna explode." "My money!" After eating many Moblin Flanks, and an entire feast, supporting the enormous sorceress was too much for Lana's chair, as under the weight of her, it collapsed. The crowd fell silent as they heard the loud sound of the chair snapping and watching the blubbery sorceress fall the ground. Lana was already asleep before she hit the ground.
Cia, coming to her senses again, turned around to the Hylian Captains. "Get this crowd dispersed." The Captains then began to break up the crowd. Cia pointed towards two soldiers who were nearby "You two, help me carry Lana to her sleeping quarters." "Yes Ma'am." They replied in unison. Together, the three of them managed to carry Lana to her sleeping quarters and into her bed which creaked loudly under her new weight. As they left, Cia heard Lana roll over in her sleep and mutter "So much food..."

"You know I've always kind of wondered why your family raises a couple of bulls along with cows and horses?"

Linkle questioned as she and Malon made their way over the main entrance of Thyrule's Castle, where Princess no doubt awaited inside.

"Well for one you know my family does business all over Thyrule and come on carrying all that milk and" the heavy-set redhead made a notion to her blubber "what else can we use?"

Malon laughing slightly as Linkle caught on and agreed.

"Besides not like you could use a horse either."

The ranch girl smirked as she quickly pinched a portion of the her love's tummy! The hooded girl blushing wide-eyed before smirking herself.

"Oh of course but must still be easier then carrying all THAT milk."

It took Malon a second to realize what Linkle mention and where her eyes darted to, the redhead blushing the same color as her hair before she planted a quick peck on the other girl's chubby cheek...

Once inside with Ganon's defeat things within where closer to normality however still rather hectic as the news of the fall of the king of evil spread within the castle's walls and among the populace if the guard chatter was anything to go by.

The two were soon directed to the royal chamber and were just about to enter when a guardsman came running up to the heavy pair!

"Miss Linkle I'm afraid you just missed Lady Zelda."

Surprised and rather curious the plump heroine asked where the princess had gone off to?

"I'm afraid I do not know just that she left this note for you, heroine. I'm sure it's contents must explain the whereabouts of the princess."

Handing over the sealed note the guardsman made his exit leaving the two of them to take a look and found out just where Zelda had disappeared to.
142222222222222222221122.title: Zelda is out. She left a note...

choices: "I'm starved, lets get some food"
"I rarely see Impa, let's meet up with them!"
1422222222222222222211221.content:
Putting the note into her pocket, Linkle informed Malon on the location and actions of their ruler.

"With Ganon's defeat, a lot of people are probably going to return to the Castle's town in the near future, I suppose it's smart to visit the place before the population moves." Malon considered how the people would react to their fear free lives.

Linkle nodded, before pondering for a bit.

"Well while we wait, we could visit Zelda's secret stash for a snack. She gave me permission to elp myself if she was ever absent. Unless you'd like to meet up with her at the village. It'd be nicely to see Impa after all."

Malon was given the choice of friends or food...

tis was truely a hard decision

Link and big bellied Impa, courtesy of Zelda
142222222222222222221221.content:
The sun was shining, the flowers were blooming, and the cuccos were shouting. it was time to get up...

Malon got put of her extra large bed. Her bed clothes left little to the imagination as one could see her pig sized belly due to her shirt acting more like a bra for her human sized breasts. as she drowsily scratched her beachball rear, she looked in a full body mirror, groggily playing with her belly fat with one hand and squeezing a boob with the other...

"... Could be bigger..."

giving a quick stretch, the farm girl looked out the window and admired her property. she inherited the ranch from her father after he passed away, and has been enjoying the benefits that came with it ever since. her looks increased busiess greatly, so she had to get some friends to help her out until she could hire new farmhands, her father's brother having retired. as she collected eggs from her birds for breakfast, she spotted her friends up and eager to help...
142222222222222222221221.title: Go with the fatty friendly ranch girl

choices: Malon ends up eating far more then the other two girls
The three end up sharing equal portions of the meal
1422222222222222222212211.content:
"Morning!"

The massive redheaded yelled out with a friendly wave of her tubby arm as the pear-shaped heroine Linkle and her slightly chubby best friend from childhood Saria made their way over toward the barn house. The former was the fabled savoir of the land after having defeated the king of evil himself while the latter was the sage of the forest eternally youthful yet still adorably tubby.

"Hey girls thanks for stopping by and so early in the morning too."

"It's no problem happy to help!" stated the blonde heroine as she greeted Malon with a rather squishy hug, the girl going a little light headed as she pressed against the redhead's enormous breasts! Linkle blushing a shade of crimson as Saria stared with slight envy, the green-haired girl didn't want to say she was jealous but Malon was far and away more developed then her own chub-made curves and sometimes it got to her seeing her best friend bury herself in the blubber of other thicker girls.

That said she simply ended up coughing for a moment in order to break up the moment the two girls apologizing for making things awkward.

"Sorry Saria!" Linkle stated with a cute grin and side tip of her head. The green-haired girl just rolling her eyes as she felt herself smile nonetheless, it really was hard to stay mad at the adorable heroine.

"In any case how about before anything else we have ourselves a big old breakfast!"

The girls all cheered on the idea and soon enough the three were seated and set for a enjoyable breakfast.
1422222222222222222212211.title: A pear shaped Linkle and a slightly chubby Saria

choices: Someone arrives to apply for a job while Malon is feeding Epona
Time passes and the girls are finished digesting. time to work!
14222222222222222222122112.content:
It was clear the cuccos were extremelygenerous this morning. Linkle and Saria both stared in awe as they each received an extra large mixing bowl filled to the brim with eggs, scrambled. as a bonus, Malon gave them ten strips of Bacon.

But the best part was both had received a gallon of fresh squeezed milk.

Malon soon placed her own meal in front of her, having the same helping of everything she gave her friends.

"And you thought coming early would be a drag~" Linkle teased Saria, pinching her chubby cheek, causing her to blush

"Cut it out! I admit it! I was wrong!"

Malon giggled as the youth slapped their friend's shoulder to make her stop, before the red head began thinking to herself.

"Today is going to be filled with special events, I can just feel it!'

She slammed the table with her palm to get the attention of the others.

"What are we waiting for? LET'S EAT!"

------LATER------

"So full... But so good..."

Saria rubbed her bloated belly, savoring the bloated feeling from her heavenly meal. Her race waa know for it's notoriously slow gainings, so she always made sure to enjoy a big gut whenever dhe had it.

both Linkle and Malon were equally swollen in the gut, enjoying the sounds of gurgles and sloshes as their digestive juices worked their magic, preparing to convert food into fat.

"Your meals are always so filling Malon. Great cooking, expert ranching and a soft body, you're father would certainly be proud!"

Linkle praised the ranch girl's skills, making her smile as she blushed. She hoped she was right...

"You two work on digesting, I'm going to check on the horses!"

the only response was a tiny belch from Saria and a hiccup from Linkle.
14222222222222222222122112.title: The three end up sharing equal portions of the ...

choices: It's Zelda! In casual clothing no less!
It's some other woman entirely...
142222222222222222221221121.content:
The massive redhead exited her ranch home, several pounds bigger thanks to her hefty meal, and began to make her way on over to the stables nearby. She sighed contently as the feeling of the morning sun beamed down upon her and a cool breeze ran through her fiery locks of hair and her exposed fatty flesh.

The ranch girl thankful to the goddesses above that no matter how much weight she was putting on the muscles in her body seemed to be perfectly able of carrying all that flab.

It must be the constantly working lifestyle of being a ranch girl, she thought cheerfully as she entered the stable where the horses awaited their own morning meal...

A few minutes later and without any real difficulty the tubby redhead was busy feeding her most favorite of horses, Epona, the friendly stead munching away as Malon hummed the tune named after the horse itself.

Running her tubby fingers through the Epona's mane Malon was suddenly surprised when she heard a voice call out to her! At first believing it to be Linkle or Saria...except it wasn't once she got a better look at them walking on over in her direction.

She could also overhear them mention about apply for a job but who exactly was it that was willing to give the huge redhead a hand?
142222222222222222221221121.title: Has Malon's new ranch hand arrived?

choices: Malon introduces Din to Linkle and Saria before feeding her
Malon puts Din straight to work milking cows
1422222222222222222212211212.content:
Malon was in disbelief, the outfit worn by the girl applying was by no means meant for the rancher's life. A tight pink suit suit that ended above the knees with frilly attachments and no arms to speak of, sandles without socks, ribbons at the hips, with puple triangles stacked up on each side.

She seemed to wear gold bracelets far to big for her arms, and another one around her neck, as well as one that kept her long red hair into a flowing ponytail.

her tan skinned arms and legs were still thin, but her suit did wonders to show off her sagging belly as it reached her hips two cucco's wide, with a pair of breast only just barely as big as cantaloupes.

Malon had seen her before, dancing around the castle town during milk deliveries... She heard the girl was a dancer named Din, from a land known as Holodrum. She doesn't seem the working type, but here she was, asking for a job...

"Um... hello? You okay ranch girl?"

Malon shook her head violently to bring herself back to reality, causing her soft cheeks to jiggle ever so slightly.

"S-sorry about that... Din, right? What brings you in search for work?"

"Ah, so you're familiar with me? So you know I Don't really have a job. I make enough money to scrape by from my performances, but I would rather my dances be free to enjoy. You're currently the only person who's hiring right now, so i would really appreciate the chance in return for a bed and some food..."

Malon thought about it. She wondered if the girl could handle it, but she couldn't just say no to her when she was near broke. She didn't even ask for rupees, so if she wasn't much help there wouldn't be much of a loss...

"Okay, it's a deal."

Malon held out her thick hand and shook the rathr petite one of her new employee.
1422222222222222222212211212.title: Two redheads in a world of fatties?

choices: How does Din's first work assignment go?
The girls are surprised when Linkle suddenly shows up!
14222222222222222222122112122.content:
"Alright well I hope you know that the ranch life is no easy life."

"I understand and I'll give you a hundred and ten percent!"

Malon couldn't help but smile this girl's energetic nature was rather similar to her own and even without seeing her perform she felt that Din was going to be a solid worker.

"Okay well let's get to it. First off we'll start slow and I'll teach how to milk the cows belonging to the ranch. Moo Moo Milk is our main source of income after all."

Instructing Din to follow her Malon led the smaller redhead over the nearby barn from earlier that on top of housing the horses did the same with the cows...

"And that's how you do it."

Malon stated as she finished up the demonstration of how to properly milk the cows. Malon giving the friendly animal a soft pat on the head as it responded with content.

"Now I want you to do the same but no worries I'll be right here watching in case you need any sort of help."

Din nodded as she made her way over to the cow that Malon pointed at, resting on her huge hips the redheaded girl rubbed her hands together determined to show her new boss that she had what it took to be a good ranch hand.
14222222222222222222122112122.title: Malon puts Din straight to work milking cows

choices: Din was allowed to drink both buckets as a gift for her first day.
Malon had enough eggs left over for a decent sized meal.
142222222222222222221221121221.content:
The first several attempts to squeeze didn't go well, amd sprayed in various directions, the last one somehow managing spray her face, but just as Malon was about to step in, the sound of liquid spaying into a bucket. 8 was Din's lucky number, but it took three more tries with the other hand before she could start milking with both hands with ease.

Despite a rough start, Din was milking like a champ. Once nothing else came out, Malon patted her on the back, startling her slightly.

"Nice work! Though for a moment I thought i'd have to hold your hands and guide them."

"I'm sorry about the wasted milk, it won't happen again, I swear."

Malon chuckled, not bothered in the slightest

"It's fine, it's really tricky to grip it just right. Even I slip up now and again. I'm honestly impressed you got as much as you did."

this made Din smile, it had only been a a short while and the heavy dancer had already impressed her even heavier boss

"Let's have you try a few more cows and the we'll get you something to eat. My friends are probably almost done digesting breakfast by now, so the should be able to finish the rest while you eat."

Din did as told, and started milking a few other cows. despite a few more slip ups, the girl managed to fill a couple of buckets. The cows were really god at producing milk lately, which was great for business, and greater for testing the waters with new workers it seemed.

142222222222222222222111.content:
Zelda slowly trotted up a small, but steep, hill.

"Look Link!" She exclaimed as she pulled out the Sheikah Slate. "You can see Death Mountain from here!" "And the Gerudo Highlands!" "And Hyrule Castle!" "And-" She turned around.

Link had still halfway to go up the hill.

"Urgh, why do I even bother" Zelda groaned

The duo was currently heading to Zora's Domain to check up on the Divine Beast Vah Ruta. To say they were making slow progress would be an understatement.

They were attacked by Bokoblins and Moblins and other monsters that did not end with blins, almost every hour.

Zelda then-
142222222222222222222111.title: Eating (like normal people)

choices: Make a Healthy Wild Fried Greens
Make a Hearty Meat Skewer
1422222222222222222221111.content:
Link heard none of this because he was trying to focus all his energy on restoring his stamina.

As soon as they reached the base of Crenel Peak, Zelda quickly hurried up the the small mountain hill thing.

She did not notice Link being attacked by several Bokoblins from a nearby camp.

One quick Simmered Fruit later though, was enough to keep the hero on his feet. He probably should have put in some Stamella Shrooms to restore his stamina.

"DO YOU EVEN HEAR THE VOICE IN YOUR SWORD LINK?!"

---------------------------------------------

Later that night the two set up camp at the base of Crenel Peak. Luckily Link never left home without his trusty cooking pot.

Zelda had calmed down since the incident and now was feeling quite hungry. She had not eaten since that morning because she was quite determined to get to Zora's Domain quickly and skipped lunch much to Link's dismay.

She was then distracted by a hand waving in front of her face. She was deep in thought about Vah Ruta and the Zoras that she did not notice Link asked her if she wanted to eat.

"Oh, yes I would like something." She said quickly. Link looked at his cooking pot, and then back to Zelda. He didn't know what to make.
1422222222222222222221111.title: Yelled at Link for being slow up the hill

choices: Zelda asked Link for Breakfast
Zelda hurried Link into packing up and leaving for Zora's Domain
14222222222222222222211112.content:
Link decided to make a Hearty Meat Skewer for Zelda.

Link did not make any for him because 1). He was still full from his Simmered Fruit and 2). His diet composed of 49% Simmered Fruits, 1% Other Foods, and 50% Apples.

He reached into his pouch and pulled out the following

2 Gourmet Meats
1 Big Hearty Radish
1 Hearty Truffle
And 1 Hyrule Herb

1. Gather the Big Hearty Radish, Take off the stem, Clean and cut into paper thin slices.
2. Crush the Hearty Truffle into a powdery mix. Mix with water to create a fine sauce
3.Put the Gourmet Meats on a fire based stove. Flip after brown color and inducing aroma.
4. Place the Gourmet Meats on a skewer, cover sparingly with Radish slices before adding truffle sauce.
5. Top with Hyrule Herb
6. Bone app the teeth

This cookbook seemed awfully complicated, and what the heck was an oven? Link made a mental note to store the cookbook in the Hyrule Castle kitchens.

Eventually, Link just threw in the ingredients into his cooking pot and Voila! Just like Mama taught him. Maybe even better then Mama.

Link then brought his 'masterpiece' over to Zelda, who had been waiting patiently. If only she had been this patient earlier today, Link thought to himself as he presented his dish to Zelda

"Thank you Link" Zelda said "But where is yours?'

One conversation about Link's apple based diet later.

"There sure are a lot of things I still don't know about him" Zelda thought " She looked over at Link struggling to assemble a tent Impa had given him. "And I presume many more things I will learn about him."

She was then interrupted out of thought by her stomach rumbling. It did not like the fact she had food and was neglected this long.

Zelda took a bite out of the skewer and was instantly blown away. The texture, the combination, the flavor, oh sweet goddesses the flavor. She was awestruck as how Link was able to create such a dish. Zelda wasted no time finishing the meat skewer.

Zelda was half tempted to ask Link for seconds. But Link had already descended into slumber. Zelda too, taking hint from Link, headed to bed. Her tiredness and remembrances of her dish kept her from noticing a small pooch that had made its way on her belly.

The next morning-
14222222222222222222211112.title: Make a Hearty Meat Skewer

choices: Traveled down to Zora's Domain
Were attacked by Bokoblins
142222222222222222222111121.content:
Link quickly sat up in his tent. He had slept in and if he didn't get ready in record time, Zelda would yell at him and annoy him all the way to Zora's Domain. He could probably get away since the place was very convoluted. Mipha would probably start a chat with Zelda and bring the aggro away from him. He could-----get out of bed was the right option in this situation.

Link exited his text and saw Zelda sitting there, crossed legged, smiling. "Good morning Link." She said in a cheerful tone. Link knew there was something up. He saw Zelda had already packed away her tent, so he began to do the same.

Later as Link began to make some Simmered Fruit and Baked Apples for the journey ahead, Zelda asked him something he had never heard her say before.

"Could you make me some breakfast Link?"

Zelda often skipped breakfast or ate a pre-made meal to save time. She was big on schedules, and on picture taking. Picture taking took up a lot of time and Zelda got cranky when they didn't reach an area on schedule. One thing led to another and the thing it led to was , more often then not, Link being yelled at.

Link narrowed his eyes slightly before starting a new dish. He knew Zelda did not like Simmered Fruit (See Link's Apple diet discussion), so he began work on a new dish.

He brought out his cookbook and looked up breakfast dishes. He settled on a strange dish called- 'Pancakes'. A cake was normally not a breakfast dish, but he shrugged it off, the author was more likely culinary trained then him.

Link then brought out the ingredients.

1 Bird Egg
1 Tab-

Ah whatever we've been through this


Link brought his Pan-not so-cakes to Zelda. She restrained herself not to drool, though it was hard after tasting Link's dish the earlier night. Link gave his dish to Zelda, and began to pack up camp.

She brought the pancakes up to her mouth and the same feeling the overcame her last night, overcame her. She hastily began to eat and finished off one pancake before she noticed a sauce to the side of her plate. Link later told her it was called Maple Syrup, all Zelda could call it was delicious. Zelda finished off her pancakes in record time after discovering the sweet syrup.

Link had, at that moment, finished packing up their small camp. "Thank y-" She was then interrupted by a small burp. "Excuse me, thank you Link." Link nodded, then began to pick up their packs, and started walking down the trail.

Zelda, not wanting to be left behind, followed Link, taking the lead. She couldn't shake the feeling her clothes were tighter though.

It was no feeling

The two then-
142222222222222222222111121.title: Zelda asked Link for Breakfast

choices: Go into detail of their journey to Zora's Domain
Skip to Zora's Domain
1422222222222222222221111211.content:
The duo continued down the path to Zora's Domain, crossing Thims Bridge and hiking past Zelo Pond.

As they got to Inogo Bridge, Zelda's stomach began to rumble. Zelda, being easily flustered, blushed as she stopped and let Link take the lead. Link, borrowing the Shiekah Slate, paid no attention to this as he was looking at the Lanayry map. Zelda thought to herself, "How can I be hungry?" "I had breakfast just a while back"

Her stomach took no note of this and continued to rumble. "Ugh, fine" She thought to herself as she brought out a handful of Wildberries. She picked one and ate it. "Mmmm" Zelda thought, "I didn't know Wildberries were this delicious." She quickly ate the rest. "A few more couldn't hurt, right?'

Her daydreams were cut short by a Lizalfos screaming as it drowned in the river. Apparently Link was attacked by one, and responded by pushing it into a river. Zelda took note of this interruption, and pressed onwards again. Link wondered what she was doing back there. Probably some praying or something. He quickly forgot about this.
1422222222222222222221111211.title: Traveled down to Zora's Domain

choices: A bunch of Shock Arrows rained down from the sky
Link and Zelda were escorted to their royal rooms
14222222222222222222211112112.content:
Zelda and Link eventually made it to Zora's Domain, after many setbacks and snacks (most of them eaten by Zelda). As they crossed the bridge leading to the domain, a guard spotted them. He quickly said something to his partner, who in turn, ran off somewhere.

When the two got to the end of the bridge, the guard welcomed them. "Princess Zelda, and her accompanying knight." "It is our pleasure to have you here" the guard said "Will I lead you to the Chamber Hall?". Zelda replied "Yes, thank you"

As they travelled to the hall, people gathered around to see the princess and her knight. "Is that Princess Zelda?" "I think it is her" "Who's that behind her?" "I don't know but he's hot" "I thought he was a girl." "She is awfully pretty." "You're right, he IS hot." However, more guards came, and dispersed the crowd.

After they made it to he hall, Zelda was allowed inside, while Link had to wait in a waiting area. He did catch a glimpse of Mipha however, she was looking good. In the waiting hall, there was only one other person. A small Zora child mumbling to himself. "Too young, hmmph" He looked up and saw Link. "WOW! You're Link!" he said vigorously "You''re the guy who has the Master Sword". He pointed to the mentioned Master Sword. "Can I have your autograph?"

Link, not wanting to be rude, signed the paper the Zora gave to him. He never learned how to sign his name, so he just scribbled something that resembled his name. "Ummm. Link looked up, "Can you make it out to Sidon?" asked the Zora. Link quickly wrote To Sidon on the paper before handing it back to the Zora, which he presumed to be Sidon.

Feeling awkward, Link asked Sidon what he was doing in the waiting hall. The small child made an annoyed expression, as he put his head in his hands. "They said I couldn't join the meeting because I was too young." He looked at Link "Why are you here, you have the Master Sword, shouldn't you be allowed in?" Link, mimicking Sidon, put his head in his hands, as he explained only members of a royal family could join. "Oh" Sidon expressed, as he looked around "Wanna play Stone Sheet Clippers?"

They were about halfway through their 87th game when he Chamber doors opened, and Princess Zelda and Mipha, and King Dorephan walked out. Zelda felt heavier then she had all day. While they were discussing important matters, servants walked by, with platters of food, which they offered to everyone. Zelda, not wanting to be rude, accepted every bit of food that was offered to her, a decision which he regretted. Mipha, noticing Link and Sidon, silently waved to them. Link waved back, while Sidon also waved back, but called out "Hi sis!". Link didn't know Mipha had a brother, especially one who was very good at SSC.

Just then-
14222222222222222222211112112.title: Skip to Zora's Domain

choices: A note
Link
142222222222222222222111121121.content:
A nearby shock arrow landed into a pool of water, which created a dome of water. "That blasted Lynel." yelled King Dorephan. "Lately, it has been attacking our town with it's Shock Arrows." An alarm began to ring out, and the people began moving indoors to protect themselves from the Shock Arrows. Link, spotting the Lynel, which was now just a small smudge in the distance, began to run off to Ploymus Mountain. Zelda tried to ask Link what he was doing, but he had already left.

"What is he doing now?" said a frustrated Zelda, to which Sidon replied "He's probably going off to fight the Lynel on Ploymus Mountain", he turned to Zelda "He's really cool in that way of not hesitating." Zelda sighed "It's not my fault if he goes off and gets himself killed.

Two hours later and the Arrows had stopped

3 hours later and Link came back with what Zelda presumed to be Lynel parts. As he walked into the domain, he was greeted with cheers and thanks from the residents of Zora's Domain, who had been attacked by the Lynel for weeks now. "Well then." chuckled King Dorephan, "I guess this calls for a feast in celebration of the defeat of the Lynel."
"Cool" replied Sidon

Later that night, Zelda and Link joined many people for a feast. Zelda had digested all of her food after taking a nap in her room, while Link had given the Lynel parts to the Zora chefs. He had no use for them and he heard Lynel Gut Soup was delicious. Link also gave them some apples. The duo talked and chatted throughout the night before the food came out.

When the food was brought out, everyone served themselves. Zelda didn't know which one she should try. Their were Seared Steaks, Fish plates, and Simmered Fruit (Zelda knew who was responsible for that). She however, decided to go with an orange soup in the middle of the table. She poured herself a bowl, and drank the soup.

It was delectable. It was spicy and creamy and thick and well seasoned and many other things she couldn't describe. She quickly drained her bowl and poured herself another bowl. Zelda was about to pour a third bowl when she spotted a strange seasoning in the middle of the table. It had no label, and she had never seen anything like it before. She quickly poured herself a third bowl, and put the seasoning on it. Zelda took a bite and was mesmerized for probably the 100th time in this story.

The seasoning made the already great soup better. After 6 bowls, Zelda felt like she should stop, she had already eaten a ton of stuff already. Yet she still felt hungry, which was odd. Zelda decided to turn to some of the fish based dishes. She picked out a cooked Hearty Bass, and put the seasoning on the fish. As you probably know, she finished that one off in record time, before moving to another, and another, and another and so on. Zelda just didn't feel full, she just kept feeling hungry, so she ate, and ate.

Eventually, she stoped the huge platter with Hearty Basses had run out. And coincidentally, so did the seasoning and her appetite. She looked up the feast hall, it was mostly empty except for a group of older Zora that looked like they had been drinking. Groggy and tired, Zelda went to her room, and lied down on her bed. She dreamt that the seasoning had not run out and she kept eating and eating and eating. However when she woke up, she didn't remember it at all, she looked over and saw-

14222222222222222222212121.content:
"What's this now?" Zelda brushed off some dust off of a strange machine. She began to examine it. The machine had a funnel like object on the top, and had a conveyor belt sticking out of it. "Mipha! I think you should take a look at this!." She called out.

Zelda and Link had traveled to Zora's Domain to check up on the Divine Beast, Vah Ruta. Zelda was currently examining the terminals, when she found the strange machine. "Do you have any idea of what it is?" Zelda asked Mipha. Mipha shook her head. "No, in fact, I did not remember that this machine was here at all."
"Hmmm." Zelda turned back around. She noticed a small rectangular hole. "Look! It has a slot for the Shiekah Slate!" Zelda excitedly placed the Shiekah Slate into the slot. The slate turned blue, and the slot began to spin. It then stopped, and ejected it for Zelda to grab. After she grabbed it, the machine turned a familiar shade of blue, and began to speak.

"Please insert water"

Zelda grinned as she turned to Mipha, who had a confused look. "What do you suppose it means by "Please Insert Water"?" Zelda looked at the funnel on the top of the machine. "It means we should probably pour some water into that."

Mipha then

1422222222222222222221222222211.content:
Juney sat above a lake, on a high floor in Rito Village. She was waiting impatiently for her husband to bring her another Baked Apple. Her stomach growled as she cursed silently.

Just then, a stray laser from Vah Medoh struck the small plank like structure she had been sitting on "Wha-" The wood split apart from the made structure as she was sent tumbling into the small lake below.

When she hit the water, the fall hurt her dearly as she passed out and was sent floating down the river.

When she woke up, she found that she was in a blocked off cavern. Juney tried to move the rocks out of the way, to no avail. She decided to explore the cave when she saw a humongous Apple orchard in the cave. There was an opening into he ceiling, that allowed them to grow.

Her stomach rumbled as she put 2 and 2 together. She wasn't going anywhere, the apples weren't going anywhere, and she had some flint. A grin crossed her face.




After she had eaten most of the apples in the cavern, she collapsed. She looked at herself. Her stomach was pushed outwards at least a yard, and her stomach was making some bad noises coming from her stomach. Feeling groggy and tired, she decided to go to sleep.

When she awoke.

It was old and brittle, but it could help her escape. She looked around for some way to activate it. As she scanned the room, she found a giant pressure plate. Even when she stood on top of it with tons of rocks, she couldn't push the plate down

Just then she looked down. She was much fatter then she was when she came in. If she gained enough weight, she could activate the plate. She shook her enormous belly. "Maybe gaining weight wouldn't be such a bad thing" She thought to herself. "Then again"

info.brief_description: The girls from the Zelda series start packing on the pounds.
info.description:
The girls from the Legend of Zelda series gain weight in various ways.

There are some guidelines and rules you probably should follow:

- No killing off the main characters

- Nudity and sex is allowed if you handle it properly, don't swear if you can help it.

- Don't uglify or disfigure the characters, try not to age them either. Apart from that, feel free to go wild with fetishes *-as long as-* you don't make it the main focus or make all the available choices head in that direction, then people who don't share your tastes don't have an excuse to complain.

-Try and keep the entries to about a paragraph minimum, one sentence entries are a bit lazy.

One last thing, try and keep the whole thing consistent, that means not switching randomly to a script style dialogue, I may also correct grammar and spelling for you if you don't mind.

Apart from that, just about anything you want goes, Enjoy!
info.pretty_title: Legend of Zelda: Weight Gain Interactive
